GOING OUT Guide
description: SEAPORTFOLIO Like the sea itself, the South Street Seaport is forever changing. And, with the New Year barely under way, this vital civic resource has wasted scarcely a moment in launching a new exhibition. Its title is New York. 1920.

title: 1,000 Riot in Cairo to Protest Inflation
description: CAIRO, Jan. 1More than a thousand industrial workers went on a rampage in downtown Cairo today to protest the steeply rising cost of living.

title: 6 JUDICIAL POSTS FILLED BY BEAME
description: Mayor Beame filled six city judicial vacancies yesterday, naming three judges to the Criminal Court bench, two to Family Court and one to Civil Court.

title: Boy, 2, and Sitter Slain
description: LEE'S SUMMIT, Mo., Jan. 1 (AP)The Police say a 2yearold boy and his teenage baby sitter were found beaten and fatally stabbed yesterday shortly before midnight.

title: TENANTS PROTEST EJECTION BY FIRE
description: While some New Yorkers were at housewarmings and open houses, 30 tenants of the fire ravaged apartment building at 83d Street and Broadway spent New Year's Day picketing for permission to return home.

title: 23 DIE AS BUS FALLS INTO LAKE IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Jan. 1 (UPI)A bus full of holiday skiers plunged off a winding road in the Japan Alps into a lake today, killing 23 persons.

title: Yankees Feel Hunter Can Bring Flag
description: While Jim (Catfish) Hunter, baseball's new millionaire, fled into the woods near his 113acre farm in Hertford, N.C., for the last day of the deerhunting season, his new Yankee teammates reacted enthusiastically yesterday to his acquisition.

title: U.S. FOUND LAGGING IN DINOSAUR DIG
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 1 (UPI)The United States is losing the dinosaur race to the Soviet Union.

title: MAN IS THROWN FROM A BUILDING
description: Three members of an East Harlem gang known as the Wild Aces were accused by the police of throwing a young man to his death from the roof of a 14story apartment project on New Year Eve.

title: Chess:
description: Calculation and judgment make up the polarity of chess thinking, although most nonplayers seem to be under the impression that it is only calculation that counts.

title: Opera: Festive Butterfly at the Met
description: New Year's Eve at the Metropolitan Opera has traditionally been filled with the gaiety of a Johann Strauss operetta or a fluffy Donizetti comedy.

title: Carey Clan Takes the New Life in Stride
description: ALBANY, Jan. 1The two youngestTommy, 8 years old, and Kevin, 10slept in the same bedroom with their father last night, so Governor Carey was up in plenty of time this morning.

title: 42 Held in Street Rowdyism
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 1 (UPI)The police arrested 42 persons early today and used tear gas to disperse 1,500 New Year's celebrants who poured onto the streets at Fort Lauderdale Beach and began throwing rocks, bottles and beer cans. Police Chief Leo Callahan called the incident a minor disturbance and said there were no reports of injuries or property damage.

title: Tremor Shakes Turkish City
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Jan. 1 (Reuters)  An earth tremor shook the southeastern Turkish city of Adana early today, sending people rushing into the streets. No damage or casualties were reported from the city of some 250,000 people.

title: Concern for Neediest Case's Brings $20,934 in Day
description: Scores of letters to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund illustrate the concern of donors for the less fortunate.

title: Dimming Said to Save Fuel
description: A recent article for Lighting Design and Application, the journal of the Society of Illuminating Engineers, estimated that if all America were equipped with dimmers, and dimmed down only 10 per cent, it would save 100 million barrels of oil per year, The Associated Press reports.

description: When Barry Stuart reopened the old Fillmore East as the NFE Theater on Dec. 7, almost everything went right with the stage management.

title: Distress Helps Business
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va. (UPI)The president of a direct sale firm says the present economic distress has been a boom to his busness.

description: Governor Carey, as he takes office, is confronted with substantial political obligations and exceptionally large financial debts that are likely to be factors through most of his first term as New York's first Democratic Governor in 16 years.

title: Mummers Prance in Annual Philadelphia Parade
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 1Eustacia Vye, the blas heroine of Thomas Hardy's 19thcentury novel, The Return of the Native, would have felt very much alone here today.

title: A Quiet Hello to the New Year
description: We've dried out from last night, said Eloise Rush of Columbus, Ohio, who laughingly explained that she was referring to the rain and not the champagne she and her husband, Christopher, drank on New Year's Eve.

title: ACCOUNTING UNIT SETS NEW RULES
description: The Financial Accounting Standards Board, in a flurry of yearend activity, announced this week the final form of new regulations for corporations reporting changes in the way they evaluate inventories.

description: On the political scene, 1974 was a year of transition, as the Presidency changed hands. There was an energy crisis, inflation, unemployment. The busing plan brought racial unrest to Boston. In California, a kidnapped girl turned terrorist.

title: The New Sir Charles Cancels Alpine Holiday
description: CORSIER  SUR  VEVEY, Switzerland, Jan. 1 (Reuters) Charlie Chaplin, knighted by Queen Elizabeth II in today's Honors List, spent the New Year holiday with his wife, Oona, at his home here after canceling at the last minute a trip with his children to a Swiss Alpine resort.

title: Pollution Agency Proposes A Random Check of Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 (AP) The Environmental Protection Agency has proposed to start testing the antipollution performance of automobiles selected at random from manufacturers production lines.

title: Personal Finance: Time Certificates
description: Starting 11 days ago, depositors at many savings banks and savings and loan associations have been offered the opportunity to purchase six and sevenyear time certificates paying interest at an annual rate of 7 per cent for an effective annual yield of 8.17 per cent. And thereby hangs a tale.

title: Pilot's License Is Cheaper
description: Since the development of new audiovisual techniques to teach flying, the cost of earning a private pilot license is roughly equal to that of a season of skiing, reports Piper Aircraft Corporation. Piper adds that it takes a minimum of 40 hours of flying20 hours with an instructor and 20 hours soloto qualify for a license.

title: Schoolboy Is Real McKoy
description: Wayne McKay is growing up. The 6foot9inch sophomore is no more physically impressive than he was last season as a firstyear basketball star at Long Island Lutheran in Brookville. He is growing up, however, in his ability to deal with being a celebrity.

title: Thrift and Integrity Promised by Carey
description: ALBANY, Jan. 1Amid a celebrating throng of family members and party loyalists, Hugh L. Carey began his term today as New York's 51st Governor with a pledge of an open, corruptionfree administration and a warning that the state must begin the painful, difficult, imperative process of living within its means.

title: Jackson Out of Hospital
description: TACOMA, Wash., Jan. 1 (UPI) Senator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington, a possible Presidential contender, was released from a hospital yesterday after a kidney operation.

title: Jeeves's Creator, at Home, Reflects on Title
description: REMSENBURG, L. I., Jan. 1P. G. Wodehouse, the 93year old Britishborn humorist who was named a knight by the Queen today, began his morning by touching his toes.

title: 4 Killed in West Virginia
description: BUCKHANNON, W. Va., Jan. 1 (UPI)Four persons died today when an automobile missed a curve on a road near here and fell into the Buckhannon River.

title: Funalon Captures Mile at Aqueduct
Widow, Daughter and Sister Share Jack Benny's Will
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 1 (UPI) Jack Benny, who died last Thursday at the age of 80, left the bulk of his multimilliondollar estate to his widow, his adopted daughter and his sister, according to probate records.

title: Labor Arbitrators Keeping Busy
description: When the economy slows down, professional arbitrators find they must speed up to meet the demand for their services.

title: Nixon Plans Statement On Watergate Verdicts
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 1A spokesman said today that former President Richard M. Nixon was preparing a statement, to be released tomorrow, about the verdicts in the Watergate coverup trial.

title: Two Remain Hospitalized In Cohoes Shooting Spree
description: COHOES, N.Y., Jan. 1 (AP)Two men remained hospitalized today with wounds inflicted by a gunman who killed a third man during a shooting spree yesterday in this city near Albany.

title: Article 1  No Title
2 Killed, 5 Injured by Man Invading New Year's Party
description: HOPEWELL, Va., Jan. 1 (AP) The police said that two persons had been killed and five others injured early today when an armed man invaded a New Year's Eve party in an apartment and opened fire with an automatic pistol.

title: State High Court Is Asked To Manage Aid to Schools
description: COLTS NECK, Jan. 1 (AP)A few hours after the midnight passing of a court  ordered deadline for reform of New Jersey's school financing, the State Supreme Court was asked today to step in and take control of the distribution of school aid.

title: F.B.I. TO AID FIGHT ON PRICEFIXERS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1The Justice Department's Antitrust Division has enlisted the support of the Federal Bureau of Investigation in its effort to uncover illegal pricefixing around the country.

title: BLUE OYSTERS HEAD typeCAST ROCK BILL
description: The New Year's Eve program led by Blue Oyster Cult at the Academy of Music on 14th Street, near Third Avenue, seemed to typify the state of the art over the last 12 months.

title: Let Them Eat Grass
description: MEMPHISSome Americans, in their concern about the world food crisis, have eliminated red meat from their diets. A few have begun to suggest that all Americans should discontinue eating meat, and, indeed, that the U.S. beef industry should be permanently sorapped.

title: HINT OF DECISION IN JURORS' FACES
Walton, Foot Ailing, To Try Acupuncture
description: The newest episode in the nonplaying career of Bill Walton shifted yesterday to the Los Angeles office of Richard Kroening, an acupuncture specialist. The highpriced Portland Trail Blazer rookie chose that form of treatment, rather than possible surgery, for the bone spur on the upper part of his right foot, which has kept him out of the last 16 games.

title: Traffic Toll Still Declines Despite Increased Travel

description: FAIR LAWN, Jan. 1  The year of the donkey began here today with official swearingin ceremonies for the first Democratic Mayor and fivemember Council in this borough's 50year history.

Trophy Won By Fowler In Yachting
SAUDI KING GIVING PAKISTAN VAST AID
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 1 (Reuters)King Faisal of Saudi Arabia gave $10million today for Pakistan's earthquake victims.

title: Police Access to Bank Records Curbed
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Jan. 1The California Supreme Court has unanimously ruled that law enforcement officers may not examine bank records for individuals or businesses without a warrant or a court order.

title: Market Place
description: Hazel Bishop, a financial analyst who gained fame as developer of a nonsmear lipstick and who sold the cosmetic company that bears her name, does not share the widely held view that the United States will experience relatively little growth in the future.

title: American Envoys in Athens And Ankara Called for Talks
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Jan. 1 (Reuters) The United States Ambassadors to Greece and Turkey have been summoned to Washington next weekend to discuss the Cyprus crisis with Secretary of State Kissinger, American officials said here today.

title: Beame Reports Gains of His First YearA Hard One As Mayor
description: Mayor Beame, do his first State of the City report, asserted yesterday that despite a year of merciless inflation and cruel recession in which the city was forced to defer someimportant plans into the future, the first year of his administration was one marked by the beginnings of tight managerial control of governmental operations and by closer relationships with other, levels of government.

description: New Year's Day was happy birthday for Zam, Lanvin's Toy, Heroic Commander, Brimming Over, Princess gate, Iffezheim, Famous Trial, Funalon and T's Lucky Mint at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: World Tanker Market in Sharp Slump
description: The world tanker market is going through one of the worst slumps in its volatile history, with no respite in sight.

title: U.S.C., Notre Dame Win
description: Southern California beat Ohio State in the Rose Bowl, 1817, yesterday, Notre Dame topped Alabama, 1311, in the Orange Bowl and Penn State routed Baylor in the Cotton Bowl, 4120. Page 51.

title: Man Is Found Strangled In East Side Apartment
description: The nude body of a man who apparently had been strangled with an electrical cord was found yesterday in the bedroom of his upper East Side apartment, the police reported.The viictim was identified as Kenneth Gallant, of 175 East 79th Street. He was believed to be in his middle 40s.

title: State to Expand Services As Unemployment Grows
description: TRENTON, Jan. 1 (UPI) New Jersey's swelling unemployment lines are creating jobs in the unemployment offices.

title: Chaplin and Wodehouse Are Knighted
description: LONDON, Jan. 1  Charlie Chaplin and P. G. Wodehouse were knighted by the Queen today. Both were named Knight Commander of the Order of the British Empire (K.B.E.) in the New Year's Honors List.

title: SHOP TALK
30 Are Presented at Debutante Ball
description: Aside from a change of locale, the 53d edition of the Debutante Assembly and New Year's Ball at the Plaza last night followed the pattern of its predecessors at the WaldorfAstoria.

title: Naomi Fisher Married to Dr. Bartnoff
description: Naomi Fisher, widow of Arthur B. Fisher, was married at her home in Englewood, N. J., yesterday to Dr. Shepard Bartnoff of West Orange, N. J., a widower and president of the Jersey Central Power and Light Company. Rabbi Arthur Hertzberg performed the ceremony, assisted by Rabbi Stanley Asekoff.

title: Nancy Hicks Is Remarried
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1Nancy Hicks and Robert C. Maynard were married here today.

title: NICARAGUA JOLTED BY GURRILLA RAID
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Jan. 2Nicaragua's usual political tranquillity has been abruptly shattered by the leftist guerrilla action last weekend in which a group of prominent politicians and businesssmen were kidnapped and exchanged for 14 political prisoners.

title: Pakistani Copters Find Pockets of Devastation
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 2 (Reuters)Helicopters found two more devastated areas in the Karakoram Mountains today, raising fears that the death toll in the Pakistan earthquake could reach 6,000.

title: 232 Hurt in Train Crash In Bronx
Vatican Offers Guidelines To Bolster Ties With Jews
description: A longawaited Vatican statement on ways to improve Roman CatholicJewish relations is being made available today.

title: Carey Tours Two Agencies and Vows To Improve HealthCare Monitoring
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2  While bureaucrats watched hesitantly from windows and doorways, Governor Carey began his rounds of state government today with visits to the Departments of Health and Mental Hygiene and a pledge to improve the state's monitoring and auditing of healthcare services.

title: TV: ABC Offering 3Hour Antony and Cleopatra
description: For all of its ratings problems, ABC can still bring an admirable touch of bravado to its schedule. It takes no effort to sink with weekly banalities such as Kodiak, Kolchak or Nakia. But taking a chance on Shakespeare, three hours of Shakespeare, requires at least a modicum of imagination and commitment. ABC Theater satisfies that requirement tomorrow evening at 8 with a Royal Shakespeare Company production of Antony and Cleopatra.

title: Steingut Pledges to Sever Ties to Outside Business
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2Assemblyman Stanley Steingut, who has been under some political pressure because of his business interests, promised today to devote his full time and attention to the job he said he expected to win next weekAssembly Speaker.

title: Businessman Kills Wife, Son and Sell With Gun
Books of The Times
description: I'm sorry I had time far only one reading of Maureen Howard's new novel, Before My Time. (Her earlier books were Not a Word About Nightingales and Bridgeport Bus.) For though it is most decidedly the sort of story whose action compels one's attention and whose characters spring to life on the page, it is not really until the end  when Mrs. Howard's heroine Laura Quinn, stands framed in the window of her bedroom and Like so many American heroes  fixes on the one flickering light on the horizon, her doubt like new knowledge in her heart that one begins to appreciate the complexity of the book and to see with what technical virtuosity she has made her illusion stand for so much space and time of reality.

title: 13 NURSING HOMES REPAY CITY FUNDS
description: The city recovered $510,000 from nursing homes last year following a spot check by Department of Social Services auditors of 13 of the city's 111 privately owned nursing homes.

title: Texts of Vatican Statement on JewishChristian Links and of Jewish Unit's Reply
Owner Agrees to Repair FireRavaged Apartments
Study Asked Of W.F.L. Title Money
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Jan. 2 (UPI)Jack Pardee, the new Chicago Bears' coach, called today for an investigation of his former bosses in the World Football League.

title: Market Place
description: Cancellations or deferrals of major energy projects by the electric utilities have become increasingly common in the last year or sowhich would hardly sound like a bullish factor for the industry.

title: JERSEY MAN KILLS TWO AND HIMSELF
description: MORRIS TOWNSHIP, N. J., Jan. 2Charles W. Call Jr., a prominent businessman whose fortunes reportedly were failing, shot and killed his wife and 14yearold son with a 12 gauge shotgun early today and them turned the weapon on himself, the police said.

title: Member of the Wedding Wears Well
Volkswagen and Opel Will Lay Off 100,000
description: BONN, Jan. 2 (UPI)Two West German automobile manufacturers announced today temporary layoffs affecting almost 100,000 workers following a slump in domestic and foreign markets.

title: Reynolds Metals Withdraws Challenge on Guyana Levy
description: RICHMOND, Va., Jan. 2 (Reuters)The Reynolds Metals Company said today it would withdraw its legal challenge to Guyana's 1974 $6.9million levy on metallurgical bauxite.

title: Disney Cutting Outlays
description: Walt Disney Productions in Burbank, Calif., said yesterday that its capital expenditures this year will be substantially beow its spending in fiscal 1974. The company also said that it expected to make further reductions in its outstanding debt and anticipated a reduction in interest expense this year.

title: Weds Jan Bishop
description: The bride and her husband are students at Brigham Young University. Her father is on leave from New York University, where he is professor of educational administration. Mrs. Bishop is a speech pathologist with the Riverside (Calif.) Unified School District. The bridegroom's father is a pharmacist and board president of the Victor Valley Hospital in Victorville, Calif.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE AS TRADING DROPS
Rocket Launching Delayed As Winds Freeze Motors
description: LOS ALAMOS, N.M., Jan. 2 (AP)Launching of a rocket designed to help scientists from New Mexico and Alaska to study the earth's upper atmosphere above the Arctic Circle has been postponed because icy winds froze the rocket motors.

title: Morgenthau Is Sworn In; Vows Fight on Violence
Saigon Faces Loss Of Province Capital To the Communists
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Jan. 3Communist forces appeared on the verge today of overrunning the first province capital in South Vietnam since they took Quang Tri on May 1, 1972, nine months before the signing of the Paris peace agreement.

title: Matthew Bigler Weds Jan Bishop
description: Jan Leslie Bishop, daughter of Prof. and Mrs. Lloyd K. Bishop of Claremont, Calif., was married yesterday morning to Matthew Scott Bigler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Bigler of Apple Valley, Calif. The Mormon ceremony was performed at the Los Angeles Temple of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints by Myrthus Evans, temple president.

title: Woes of Burmah Oil Trim British Stocks
description: LONDON, Jan. 2British financial markets were hit by heavy selling today following disclosure of the serious difficulties of the Burmah Oil Company, the nation's thirdlargest oil concern. Burmah, whose financial distress was disclosed late New Year's Eve, announced toplevel management changes as the stock market touched a 20year low today and the British pound weakened on foreignexchange markets.

title: Leavitt J. Pope Is Named President of WPIX, Inc.
description: Leavitt J. Pope has been named president and chief executive officer of WPIX, Inc., the broadcast subsidiary of The Daily News, whose properties include WPIXTV, (Channel 11) and WPIXFM here and WICC in Bridgeport, Conn.

title: Pakistanis Describe Terror of Quake
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan Jan. 2Kima Khan lies impassively in bed. His head is swathed in bandages. His right arm is fractured. He stares blankly at the ceiling of the ward of the military hospital here.

title: Tass Tells of Decision Without a Comment
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 2 (AP)Tass reported the Watergate convictions today without comment.

title: Hostage Escapes, Man Held
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 2 (AP) A man identified as a discharged mail carrier held a staff member of Senator Charles McC. Mathias Jr. hostage at knifepoint today before surrendering to the Capitol police. William J. Johnson of Seat Pleasant, Md., was arrested in the hallway outside the Maryland Republican Senator's office after the hostage, James B. Young escaped.

title: Judge Declines Bid to Close South Boston High Permanently
description: BOSTON, Jan. 2City attorneys moved in Federal District Court today for the permanent closing of racially troubled South Boston High School, a focal point of the desegregationthroughbusing controversy here.

title: and His Handicap
description: The one place where resources are less important than resolution is in the realm of public probity, on which Mr. Carey rightly placed special emphasis. Even as he took office, a Federal jury in Washington was bringing in its verdict of guilty in the Watergate coverup trial. The nauseating stench of political protection that hangs over scandalstained nursing homes in this city is but the latest reminder of the extent to which special interests have profited from their ties to leaders of both parties in New York State.

title: FORD'S ADVISERS REPORTED AGREED ON TAX REDUCTION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2President Ford's economic advisers have reached virtual unanimity on the need for a tax cut to fight the recession, and the President appears to be moving toward such a decision, Administration officials reported today.

title: Bargain Days in the Bronx
description: When George Steinbrenner 3d, Mike Burke 1st and others bought the Yankees for $10million they were asked whether they felt they had a bargain. We're delighted with the whole deal, Burke said, including the price paid. It's the best buy in sports today, Steinbrenner said. For. their $10million the partners got title to 40 warm bodies in chalkstriped doubleknits, all the swivel chairs, desks and filing cabinets in Yankee Stadium, a franchise with a halfcentury tradition of unparalleled success located among 15 million potential customers, and New York City's promise to renovate their playground at a cost that may reach $100million. Now, two years after their original expenditure, they are investing about onethird as much in a single player who works 38 days a year, give or take two.

title: Miss Landes Has Nuptials
description: Rosalind Reed Landes, an associate with Eastdil Realty, real estate and investment banking affiliate of Blyth Eastman Dillion, was married here last evening to William Ronald Dietz, chairman of Citicorp Business Credit, Inc., factoring and commercial finance subsidiary of Citicorp.

title: Hispanic Justice Post Filled
description: Mayor Beame yesterday appointed Federico Costales, inspector general for the Social Services Department, as the unpaid chairman of the Hispanic Criminal Justice Task Force. The Mayor said: This federally funded program has already proven its effectiveness in determining the needs, and resolving the unique problems of Hispanics in relation to the criminal justice system of our city.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: Henry Fonda is returning to Broadway for a fiveweek engagement in Clarence Darrow, the oneman show by David W. Rintels, starting March 3 at a theater to be announced. Last April, the 70yearold actor collapsed in his dressing room at the Helen Hayes Theater after what physicians called total exhaustion. The play reopened with Mr. Fonda in Los Angeles in June and was subsequently taped for presentation on NBCTV. Mike Merrick and Don Gregory are the producers.

title: A 40Year Decline Of Farms in U.S. Is Seen Near End
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI) A 40year decline in the numi ber of farms may bottom out in 1975, an Agriculture Department statistician said today.

title: Temporary Waiver Set On New Pension Rules
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 2 (AP) Two Government agencies have announced the temporary waiver of regulations go the Government can clear up interpretations of the new pension law that went into effect yesterday.

title: 20 Guests Roused As Flames Sweep Mystic's 1861 Hotel
description: MYSTIC, Conn., Jan. 2Twenty guests fled the historic Whaler's Inne early today as a fire began to sweep through the Civil War hotel and six businesses in the same complex.

title: Beame Asks a Nursing Home Inquiry
description: Continued From Page 1, Col. 1

title: Carey Asks Kolb to Head Mental Health Department
description: Dr. Lawrence C. Kolb, director of the New York State Psychiatric Institute and head of Psychiatry Service at ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center, has been asked by Governor Carey to become the State Commissioner of Mental Hygiene, and has accepted, according to mental health leaders close to both men.

title: Matthew Bigler
description: Jan Leslie Bishop, daughter of Prof. and Mrs. Lloyd K. Bishop of Claremont, Calif., was married yesterday morning to Matthew Scott Bigler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Bigler of Apple Valley, Calif. The Mormon ceremony was performed at the Los Angeles Temple of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints by Myrthus Evans, temple president.

title: Prices of Copper Continue to Drop On a Broad Scale
description: Copper prices continued downward with a host of announcements yesterday.

title: Advisory Council Expected to Urge Rise in Social Security Base to $24,000
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2An advisory council of prominent private citizens looking into the financial problems of the Social Security System has tentatively decided to recommend a big increase in the Social Security wage basethe amount subject to Social Security taxprobably to $24,000 in 1976.

title: SUIT AGAINST MOBIL IS DISMISSED BY U.S.
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Jan. 2 (UPI)  A $13billion suit against the Mobil Oil Company was dismissed but will be refiled against several oil companies charging them with antitrust conspiracy, an attorney for Nelson Bunker Hunt said to day. Mr. Hunt is a Texas oil millionaire.

title: Losers Get First 2 Goals Against New Yorkers
Cairo Students Hold Rally In Support of the Workers
description: CAIRO, Jan. 2 (UPI)Thousands of Cairo University students demonstrated on campus today in support of workers who clashed with the police yesterday in a rockthrowing melee over demands for higher pay.

title: LEVITT INDICATES CAREY IS IN ERROR ON A DEFICIT NOW
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2State Controller Arthur Levitt indicated today that, contrary to Governor Carey's expressed concern, he did not expect the current state budget to slip into deficit.

title: Stocks Up by 15.80 In a Broad Advance
description: The stock market began the new year in an ebullier manner yesterday as bargainhunting, especially in the depressed glamour and bluechip issues, enabled stocks to pos a broad advance in moderate trading. Prices on the New York Stock Exchange opened higher, continuing a rally begun Tuesday and gradually increased their gains throughout mos of the session.

title: Lisbon Aide Visits Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 2 (UPI) Foreign Minister Mario Soares of Portugal arrived today for talks with Soviet leaders aimed at cementing the warming rerations between Lisbon and Moscow. He was greeted by his Soviet counterpart, Andrei A. Gromyko, and other officials.

title: Gasoline Prices Drop 2d Month in Row Here
description: For the second consecutive month, gasoline prices dropped in the New YorkNew Jersey metropolitan area, according to the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: DR. HANS P. NEISSER, ECONOMIST, 79, DIES
description: Dr. Hans P, Neisser, professor of economics in the graduate faculty of political and social science at the New School from 1943 until his retirement in 1965, died Wednesday at a nursing home In Berkeley, Calif. He was 79 years old and formerly lived here.

title: RHODESIA BARS TRIP BY 6 BLACK LEADERS
I.B.M. Is Seeking Revision Of Xerox Consent Decree
description: ARMONK, N. Y., Dec. 2 (Reuters)The International Business Machines Corporation said today it had filed a memorandum with the Federal Trade Commission seeking modification of a Xerox Corporation consent order.

title: Safety on the Rails
description: What needs to be done to prevent commuterline accidents like the one yesterday in the Bronx?

title: College, School Results
description: BASKETBALL Colleges

title: Business Briefs
description: PARIS, Jan. 2 (Reuters)Iran is joining France in producing enriched uranium by taking a stake in the multimilliondollar Eurodif uranium enrichment project, a French government spokesman said today.

title: U.S. Says Lost Plutonium
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The Atomic Energy Commission said today that only a small amount of nuclear material that could be fashioned into a homemade nuclear bomb was now missing from an Oklahoma processing plant.

title: Final Football Poll COACHES RATINGS
description: The top 20, with points figured on a 10987654321 basis for first through 10th places (firstplace votes in parentheses) and wonlost records for season.

title: BEAME PROPOSES INQUIRY BY STATE ON NURSING HOMES
description: Mayor Beame called on Governor Carey yesterday to name a special prosecutor to investigate the nursinghome industry in order to allay any possible questions in the minds of the public. However, he emphasized that he had full faith and confidence in the integrity of State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz.

title: Oil Company Blackmail Is Alleged by Jackson
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 2 (UPI)Senator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington, accused the the Mobil Oil Corporation and a subsidiary of the Gulf Oil Corporation today of blackmailing the Defense Department by threatening to cut off certain fuel supplies unless they were exempted from some legal requirements.

title: Alcoa Layoffs Scheduled
description: MASSENA, N. Y., Jan. 2 (UPI) Seventy employes in the fabricating department of the Aluminum Company of America plant here will be laid off this weekend. Richard I. Else, operations manager, said the reduction was caused by decreased demand for aluminum and resultant cancellation of orders for wire, rod and bar products made at the plant. The 70 employes represent 2.8 per cent of the work force.

title: Chain Sales Figures Up
description: The nation's largest chain store organizations reported yesterday record dollar figures for their December sales and substantial gains over the level of sales in the corresponding month of 1973. Details on Page 44.

title: Reserve Report
description: In Billions DAILY AVERAGES

title: About New York
description: Master of steam and motor vessels of any gross tons, oceans, the Coast Guard license said, and it meant that Capt. Robert Lathrop could take a ship any place in the world. Captain Lathrop, however, was in the wheelhouse of a ferry. It was the Pvt. Joseph F. Merrell, and Captain Lathrop was taking it to Staten Island.

title: The Rev. Arthur R. McGratty Of the Retreat Movement, 65
description: The Rev. Arthur R. McGratty, who was active in the Roman Catholic retreat movement, died here yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: Proxmire Bill Would Limit Official Use of Limousines
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP) Senator William Proxmire says he will introduce legislation to lower the number of Federal officials entitled to chauffeurdriven limousines from about 800 to 27.

title: New Budget Director
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2On the eve of President Ford's conference on inflation last fall, James T. Lynn was host at a dinner for those who were to participate on his particular panels. The guests soon discovered that this was not just a social nicety. It was a dress rehearsal, and, while an aide stood by with a stop watch, Jim Lynn put startled governors and mayors and other bigwigs through their paces, barking out orders like a seasoned stage director.

title: Miss Landes Has Nuptials
description: Rosalind Reed Landes, an associate with Eastdil Realty, real estate and investment banking affiliate of Blyth Eastman Dillion, was married here last evening to William Ronald Dietz, chairman of Citicorp Business Credit, Inc., factoring and commercial finance subsidiary of Citicorp.

title: FORD'S ADVISERS REPORTED AGREED ON TAX REDUCTION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2President Ford's economic advisers have reached virtual unanimity on the need for a tax cut to fight the recession, and the President appears to be moving toward such a decision, Administration officials reported today.

title: Film: C.W. Pabst's 41 Comedians Fusty Romantic Melodrama
Hospital Efficiency and Compassion Draw Praise of Train Crash Victims
Letters to the Editor
description: A Program for Energy Conservation

title: The Governor's Promise
description: Governor Carey has set exacting goals for his four years in Albany. His inaugural address promised a revival of social concern for the needy and afflicted in the spirit of his estimable Democratic predecessorsAlfred E. Smith, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Herbert H. Lehman and Averell Harriman. But with that pledge went a stress on cutting government costs that sounded like a paraphrase of all the Republican budgetbalancers from Calvin Coolidge to Gerald Ford.

title: Reopenings and Closings Announced by Chrysler
description: DETROIT, Jan. 2  The Chrysler Corporation announced today a series of plant reopenings and closings that indicate the company has reduced some of its backlog of cars.

title: Brennan Is Slated as Envoy to Ireland
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2Presdent Ford is expected to announce soon the nomination of Secretary of Labor Peter J. Brennan to be Ambassador to Ireland, Administration sources disclosed tonight.

title: C.I.A. in 68 Gave Secret Service a Report Containing Gossip About Eartha Kitt After White House Incident
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The Central Intelligence Agency, asked by the Secret Service in 1968 about Eartha Kitt, produced an extensive report containing secondhand gossip about the entertainer but no evidence of any foreign intelligence connections, a copy of the report showed today.

title: PROSECUTION HAS MORE CASES AHEAD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The Watergate special prosecutor's office, with its most spectacular case just concluded successfully, still has significant investigations pending, including one on whether attempts were made by the White House to impede the Nixon impeachment inquiry by misrepresenting conversations in the Oval Office.

title: COURT STAYS CURB ON SHOCK THERAPY
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 2 (UPI)A Superior Court judge has suspended temporarily a new state law controlling electric shock treatments for mental patients, pending a hearing on its constitutionality.

title: Independent Sworn In As Governor of Maine
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Jan. 2 (AP)  James B. Longley, insurance man was sworn in tonight as Maine's 67th governor and the nation's only independent to hold such an office.

title: Stanley M. Friedman Sworn By Beame as Deputy Mayor
description: With the City Council chamber jammed with family members, friends and politicians, Mayor Beame swore in Stanley M. Friedman as Deputy Mayor for intergovernmental affairs, and Leonard E. Yoswein as his legislative representative in Albany.

title: Aleksandr L. Mints Dies; A Soviet Radio Engineer
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 2 (UPI) Aleksandr L. Mints, a radio engineer who built many of the largest broadcasting stations in the Soviet Union, has died in Moscow at the age of 79, Tass, the official Soviet press agency reported today.

title: R. A. Grammer Jr.
description: Vernie Iona Fuller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Claude L. Fuller of Shelter Island Heights, N.Y., was married in Rochester yesterday morning to Reynold Arthur Grammer Jr., son of Mrs. E. H. Grammer of Blue Hill Falls, Me., and the late Mr. Grammer. The ceremony in the Irondequoit United Presbyterian Church was performed by the Rev. Miles H. Hutchinson, uncle of the bride, and the Rev. Ralph J. Miller.

title: 232 Hurt in Train Crash In Bronx
description: Two hundred thirtytwo persons were injured and more than 20,000 rushhour commuters were stranded or delayed yesterday morning when a Penn Central commuter train bound for Grand Central Terminal apparently ignored a warning signal and plowed into the rear of another train just outside the Bronx Botanical Garden station.

title: Extortion Inquiry Role Denied By Two Muslims in Hearst Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 2 (AP) Two Black Muslims deny they are subjects of a police investigation into an alleged ex tortion of $100,000 from the food giveway program aimed at helping free Patricia Hearst, the kidnapped newspaper heiress.

title: Ski Buffs Not Just City Folk
description: WOODRIDGE, N. Y., Jan. 2 When skiing first came into prominence in New England's high country some four decades ago, its enthusiasts were mostly from metropolitan areas. Na fives, for the most part, shunned the sport while wondering what was attracting the strangers. In recent years, the same was true in the Southern Catskills region where posh hotels such as the Concord and Grossinger pioneered skiing by providing lifts for the guests, and subsequently artificial snow. In recent winters, however, this phase of the picture has changed dramatically, not only in the quiet New England mountain regions but also here in Sullivan County.

title: Ken Loeffler, Who Led LaSalle To Basketball Titles, Dies at 72
description: Ken Loeffler, a member of the basketball Hall of Fame who coached championship teams at LaSalle College, died Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack, in Rumson, N. J., where he lived. His age was 72.

title: W. T. Grant to Shut 66 More U.S. Stores
description: The W. T. Grant Company, the giant store chain, announced yesterday that it would close 66 more stores between February and July because they were unprofitable.

title: EXANTIPOVERTY AIDE INDICTED BY U.S. HERE
description: The indictment of Maurice Chessa, the former head of a Brooklyn antipoverty agency, on charges of illegal weapons safes, war announced yesterday by the United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York, David G. Trager.

title: Visitors Are Taken With Israeli Calm in Eye of Storm
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 2Less than an hour after a terrorist's bomb exploded last month in Ben Yehuda Street, Jerusalem's busiest thoroughfare, the shops were open again and the sidewalks crowded. The police closed off a small area to permit workmen to replace several broken store windows, but otherwise the street quickly returned to normal.

title: R. A. Grammer Jr. Weds Vernie Fuller
description: Vernie lona Fuller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Claude L. Fuller of Shelter Island Heights, N. Y., was married in Rochester yesterday morning to Reynold Arthur Grammer Jr., son of Mrs. E. H. Grammer of Blue Hill Falls, Me., and the late Mr. Grammer. The, ceremony in the Irondequoit United Presbyterian Church was performed by the Rev. Miles H. Hutchinson, uncle of the bride, and the Rev. Ralph J. Miller.

title: The Nothing Kid on La Mama Stage
description: From O'Neill through Charles Gordone, the barroom as a theatrical environment has held a fascination for the American playwright. It offers a confined, even claustrophobic, atmosphere in which a multiude of diverse characters can meet and collide.

title: SovietEgyptian Tension Seen by Moscow Diplomats
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 2Reports from Cairo that the Soviet leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, postponed his trip to the Middle East for reasons of ill health have met with widespread skepticism in foreign diplomatic circles here.

title: Notes on People
Dance:La Sylphide
description: Good acting, not just good dancing, highlighted the first performance this season of American Ballet Theater's production of La Sylphide at the City Center yesterday.

title: Wisconsin Indians Halt Negotiations Over Seized Estate
description: GRESHAM, Wis., Jan. 2 (AP)  A group of armed Menominee Indians who seized an abandoned northwoods mansion owned by a religious order broke off negotiations today with the authorities besieging the 175acre estate.

title: Guns Against Society
description: Anthony Barbaro was an honor student, respected by his peers and his teachers in Olean, N.Y. The only clue to the mysterious aberration that caused the 17year old youth to unleash a random barrage of rifle fire that killed three and wounded nine persons may be a classmate's statement: Guns, that was his whole life. Guns were prominently displayed in young Barbaro's bedroom.

title: POPE ASSAILS MAFIA AT NEW YEAR'S AGAIN
description: ROME, Jan. 2  Pope Paul VI has denounced the Mafia in a New Year's remark for the second time in two years.

title: The Energy Problem: What Is to Be Done?
description: THERE are certain diseases, called iatrogenic, in which the treatment by a specialist creates its own new and often more serious ailment, because the system is not treated in a fundamental or balanced way.

title: Nixon Deeply Anguished by Conviction of 4 ExAides
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 2Richard M. Nixon was described by an associate today as deeply anguished by the plight of four of his former White House and political aides who were convicted yesterday in the Watergate coverup case.

title: GOLD PRICES DOWN $11.50 IN LONDON
description: Gold prices plunged yesterday because of a dearth of interest by American investors and speculators.

title: FifthGrade Class Aids Times Neediest Cases
description: Pupils In the fifthgrade socialstudies class at Salome H. Long Memorial School in Saddle Brook, N.J., are busily preparing for a second annual bazaar later this month to raise money for The New York Times Neediest Gases Fund.

title: FORD SETS TALKS ON C.I.A. CHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI) President Ford, limping slightly from his strenuous Colorado skiing holiday, returned to Washington today and began preparing for a round of consultations on allegations that the Central Intelligence Agency illegally spied on thousands of American citizens.

title: DEFECT IS REPORTED IN BABY STROLLERS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI) One of the country's largest makers of baby strollers said today that up to a half million of its products may have a defect that could cause the handle to break off and the stroller to go out of control.

title: The ThreeState Area, 1974: A Look Back
description: Elections in New York and Connecticut favored Democrats. In City Hall and Trenton, money problems vexed administrations. There were fires, scandals, a setback for a former boxer, and the Met got a top executive.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: EQUUS Those who care about horses as the stuff of drama have been heading for some weeks to the Plymouth Theater to see Peter Shaffer's wellreceived play Equus. Those who prefer more fleshly steeds strutting their stuff without the symbolism and psychiatry will have an opportunity to savor simpler entertainment this weekend and next at the Felt Forum of the Madison Square Garden Center.

title: Elected City Officials Inaugurated in Washington
Growth for Inventories Of Manufacturers Slows
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The rapid growth of manufacturers' inventories slowed somewhat in November, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Stocks Up by 15.80
description: The stock market began the new year with an upturn in prices that pushed the Dow Jones industrial average ahead 15.80 points to 632.04 on reduced volume. Page 37.

title: First Woman Named A Premier in Africa
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic, Jan. 2 (Reuters) Elizabeth Domitien of the Central African Republic became Africa's first woman premier today.

title: Fischer and Karpov Get$5Million Offer for a Manila Match
description: Manila has posted the highest bid in chess history, a $5million purse, for the 1975 world championship match between Bobby Fischer and his Russian challenger, Anatoly Karpov.

title: Court to Hear Finley Plea on Hunter Today
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 2The next round in the legal battle over Jim (Catfish) Hunter will take place tomorrow in an Alameda County courtroom, in a hearing before Judge George Phillips Jr.

title: Thoroughbred for Secretariat
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 2 (AP)The first thoroughbred foal sired by Secretariat, the 1973 Triple Crown winner, has arrivedjust a few furlongs from the snot where the famed stallion., Man o War, once held court.

title: People in Sports
description: K.S. (Bud) Adams, the Houston Oilers owner, who had a verbal battle recently with Sid Gillman, his head coach and general manager, over lavish spending, yesterday criticized the coach. He chided Gilman for forcing the departure of Dan Downs, the Oilers assistant general manager. Gillman had ejected Downs from the dressing room after the team's nexttolast game and wouldn't talk to Dan about critical financial matters of the club, Adams said.

title: CLERK HERE TELLS OF POLITICAL TIES
description: If it wasn't for Jeremiah Bloom, I wouldn't be here talking with you now, Joseph C. Johnson Jr. said with some feeling just after he had completed his testimony before the state administrative judge yesterday morning.

title: The ThreeState Area,1974: A Look Back
description: Elections in New York and Connecticut favored Democrats. In City Hall and Trenton, money problems vexed administrations. There were fires, scandals, a setback for a former boxer, and the Met got a top executive.

title: REUSS WEIGHS BID TO OUST PATMAN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2Representative Henry S. Reuss, a liberal Democrat from Wisconsin, acknowledged today that he had been seeking support among House Democrats for a challenge to Representative. Wright Patman for the chairmanship of the House Banking Committee.

title: Stocks Up by 15.80
description: The stock market began the new year with an upturn in prices that pushed the Dow Jones industrial average ahead 15.80 points to 632.04 on reduced volume. Page 37.

title: Borrowing Shift to Banks In New York Is Continuing
description: Corporate borrowing continued to shift to New York City banks, according to the Federal Reserve's weekly statistics released yesterday. In addition, most interest rates rose in the week ended Wednesday, raising the possibility that the First National City Bank might increase its prime rate today. The money supply showed its slowest growth rate in at least a year and a half.

title: Hunter's Law Firm Returns to Normal
description: AHOSKIE, N.C., Jan. 2 (AP) It was back to business as usual this morning in the law office of Cherry, Cherry, Flythe and Evans.

title: CORRECTION
description: A dispatch from Moscow in The New York Times on Dec. 25 erroneously reported that a Soviet emigration official had proposed that Veniamin G. Levich, a Jewish scientist, pledge that he would not seek to join his sons if they were allowed to leave. The actual proposal, which Mr. Levich rejected, was that he not seek to join his sons on grounds of family reunification, but did not preclude his pressing his own case for emigration.

title: Weds Vernie Fuller
description: The bride graduated from Cornell University and is a counselor at the Irondequoit High School. Her father is a retired builder.

title: Holiday CeaseFire Extended 2 Weeks By I.R.A. Militants
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 2The militant Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army announced here today that it was extending until Jan. 16 the Christmas ceasefire that was to have expired in Britain and Northern Ireland at midnight tonight.

title: Watergate Jury: Persistent, Congenial
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2John A. Hoffar was foreman of the jury that decided yesterday the fate of the five men in the Watergate coverup case.

title: Cambodian Rebels Press Drive Near Phnom Penh
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Jan. 2 (Reuters)Communistled rebels pressed nearer to Phnom Penh's defense perimeter today.

title: The Watergate Trial: Decision on Fairness Hinges on Dozens of Questions
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The Watergate coverup trial is over at last; the question now is whether the trial was fair.

title: WILLIAM A. CLARKE, EDUCATOR HERE, 79
description: William A. Clarke, an educator and the first principal of John Adams High School in Ozone Park, Queens, died Wednesday in the Cleveland Clinic, Cleveland. He was 79 years old and lived at 8405 108th Street, Richmond Hill, Queens.

title: ACCUSED MURDERER WINS INSURANCE PLEA
description: A singer, who is accused along with two men of murdering her husband, a rockmusic arranger, in their Lincoln Towers apartment in October, 1973, won permission in Surrogate's Court yesterday to try to collect $80,000 insurance on his life.

title: Contract Award
description: A $400million contract for the construction of six 900foot tankers has been awarded by the Standard Oil Company (Ohio) to Avondale Shipyards, Inc., a subsidiary of the Ogden Corporation. Each of the tankers will be able to carry 1.2 million barrels of crude oil and will have draft of 55 feet and a speed of 16 knots. They are scheduled for delivery in 1977 and 1978 and will be operated by United States flag charter concerns with American crews.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Council President's Policies Awaited
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 1Ireland's energetic foreign minister, Garret FitzGerald, took over the presidency of the Common Market Council with the new year, and European officials here are watching to see how the highly respected but at times unorthodox official handles the community in this crisisridden period.

title: People and Business
description: Proxy material just sent to stockholders showed that James W. Davant, board chairman and highestpaid officer, took a cut of more than $61,000to just less than $120,000 in the fiscal year ended Sept. 30  from $181,000 a year earlier.

title: Vatican Offers Guidelines To Bolster Ties With Jews
description: A longawaited Vatican statement on ways to improve Roman CatholicJewish relations is being made available today.

title: China Oil Output Up
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 2 (Reuters)China's crude oil production in 1974 topped that of the previous year by 20 per cent, the New China News Agency reported today.

title: A Corn Resistant to Two Major Pests Is Discovered
description: Plant breeders at Cornell University, collaborating with researchers in Mexico, have discovered varieties of corn that are resistant to two of the world's major corn peststhe European corn borer and the sugar cane borer.

title: Weekly Rail Freight Traffic Off 5.2% From 1973 Level
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The Association of American Railroads has reported that freight traffic on United States railroads during the week ended Dec. 21 totaled an estimated 14.9 billion ton miles, 5.2 per cent below the corresponding week a year ago.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: No Gold Rush
description: Ever since it became legal for Americans to buy gold bullion at the start of this new year, the gold price has been falling like a stone. On Monday, gold hit a peak in London of $197.50 an ounce. It dropped on Tuesday and Wednesday, and yesterday fell $11.50 to close at $174.50.

title: Owners Worry Over Reserve Clause Suit
description: On the surface, the Jim (Catfish) Hunter case was so unusual that it set no precedent for any other legal matter in baseball. Hunter's contract was breached, he filed a grievance, he was declared a free agent and he signed with the Yankees after competitive bidding among 23 teams.

title: A New Day for Ulster?
description: Even a temporary halt in the shooting and bombing in Northern Ireland raises the hope that this time the forces of terror can be persuaded to lay down their arms for good and seek their goals by political means. The timing of conciliatory moves by Britain with the holiday ceasefire declared by the Irish Republican Army Provisionalsnow extended for two weeksmay offer a sounder basis for this hope than similar actions in the past.

title: A U.S. Navy Fighter Plane Crashes in South China Sea
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2. (AP) The Navy announced today the loss of its first operational F14 fighter plane in a crash off the Philippines.

title: DOUGLAS'S STROKE AFFECTS LEFT ARM
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The stroke that Justice William O. Douglas suffered on New Year's Eve has partially paralyzed his left arm but left the rest of his body functioning and his brain undamaged.

title: 20 Guests Roused As Flames Sweep Mystic's 1861 Hotel
Common Market and EFTA Involved
description: PARIS, Jan. 2European consumers may get some price relief from another stage of tariff cuts that became effective yesterday.

title: Bridge
description: It is perhaps surprising that in half a century of contractbridge history, nobody has written a comprehensive and practical book on defensive play. There have been some significant British books, notably by John Brown and Hugh Kelsey, but they have been of more interest to the expert than to the average player.

title: Arabs and Israel Far Apart
Watergate Jury: Persistent, Congenial
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2John A. Hoffar was foreman of the jury that decided yesterday the fate of the five men in the Watergate coverup case.

title: State Cuts Total of $68Million In Aid and Construction Funds
description: TRENTON, Jan. 2 (UPI)The administration of Governor Byrne today disclosed new cutbacks in state aid and construction designed to save a total of $68  million because of uncsrtainty over the future of the economy.

title: SALES FIGURES UP for LARGE CHAINS
description: The nation's largest chain store organizations reported yesterday record dollar figures for their December sales and substantial gains over the level of sales in the corresponding month of 1973. In some instances, however, the higher sales did not compensate for the rise in prices, indicating that unit volume was below the yearearlier level. The consumer price index in the 12 months to the end of November rose 12.1 per cent.

title: 550 MORE FACING DISMISSAL BY CITY
description: While the Budget Bureau prepared yesterday to notify 550 more provisional city employes that they would be dismissed in two weeks, three more members of the Board of Estimate said they would contribute part of their salaries to ease the city's fiscal plight. A fourth member balked.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 2 (AP)Seven of the top eight seeded players won their openinground matches today in the Grand Masters tennis tournament at Kooyong Stadium. The only one missing from the quarterfinals is Lennart Bergelin of Sweden, who withdrew. His place was taken in the firstround draw by John Crisp of Australia. Crisp, however, lost to the Kooyong professional, Don Tregonning, 60, 64.

title: I.C.I. Unit Acquires Site
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Jan. 2 (Reuters)I.C.I. United States Inc., said today it had acquired a 250acre site in the Bayport industrial development complex near Houston from a subsidiary of the Exxon Corporation for undisclosed terms.

title: BEAME PROPOSES INQUIRY BY STATE ON NURSING HOMES
description: Mayor Beame called on Governor Carey yesterday to name a special prosecutor to investigate the nursinghome industry in order to allay any possible questions in the minds of the public. However, he emphasized that he had full faith and confidence in the integrity of State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz.

title: Kissinger Speaks of Force as Last Step In the Gravest Emergency Over Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2Secretary of State Kissinger, in an interview made public today, said that he could not rule out completely the use of military force against oilproducing nations, but that such action would be considered only in the gravest emergency.

title: Youth Fatally Stabbed in Project; Police Question His Assailant
description: A 16yearold youth was famally stabbed late last night in a Brooklyn housing project. The police said that his assailant, a 55yearold man, who, like his victim, was a resident of the project, had told them the youth was one of three teenagers who were trying to mug him.

title: The Big Enchilada Escapes
description: In the thirty months since the breakin at the headquarters of the Democratic National Committee in the Watergate building, nine associates or subordinates of former President Richard M. Nixon have been convicted of various felonies committed in Mr. Nixon's service. Fifteen others have pleaded guilty to felonies or misdemeanors in the Watergate matter, or in other cases related to Mr. Nixon.

title: Prices Fall Sharply for Gold Futures; U. S. Interest Lags
description: Gold futures dropped sharply yesterday in what one analyst called almost panic liquidadon by European and LatinAmerican institutions. They had bought gold recently at quite high prices hoping to sell it at still higher prices to eager Americans after the legalization Tuesday of gold ownership in the United States.

title: The Pop Life
description: Well, gang, it's time for this year's exercise in selfrevelation. Actually, last year's. For this is a 10best list of 1974 pop records.

title: About the Islanders
description: Injured Islanders have no rest. Bob Nystrom (hairline fracture of left collarbone) did betweenperiod duty on cable television broadcast to Washington and on local radio. He appeared in a kelly green suit, his flowing blond hair freshly cropped (You must have lost five pounds, kidded the Islander statistician.)  Gerry Hart began the new year with a birthday. He turned 27 on Jan. 1 . Emile Francis, the Ranger coach, was on hand last night. (He lives in nearby Long Beach.)  The Rangers visit the Islanders tomorrow. The game has been sold out for a month.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York. N. Y. 10249, or to any of the following eight organizations that certify these cases:

title: FED PUTS FUNDS IN BANK SYSTEM
New U.S. Law to Provide 4,000 Jobs in the State
Franklin Gledhill, 76, Dies: A Pan American Official
description: Franklin Gledhill, who retired in 1965 as a vice president and director of Pan American World Airways, died yesterday in Torrington (Conn.) General Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived in New Hartford, Conn.

title: Elected City Officials Inaugurated in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2At a historic and moving ceremony, the District of Columbia inugurated today its first elected city Government since 1871.

title: Rate Rollback Ordered On Fruits and Vegetables
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission ordered yesterday a rollback of freight rate increases of up to 132 per cent that went into effect on Tuesday on fresh fruits and vegetables moving from the West to the East and South.

title: Article 2  No Title
Lebanon Says 5 Are Killed In Border Raids by Israel
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 2 Israeli troops staged several raids into southern Lebanon last night in a continuing drive to keep the border area clear of Palestinian guerrillas, and the Lebanese Defense Ministry said today that the attacks left five Lebanese dead.

title: GOLD PRICES DOWN $11,50 IN LONDON
description: Gold prices plunged yesterday because of a dearth of interest by American investors and speculators.

title: Saigon Faces Loss Of Province Capital To the Communists
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Jan. 3Communist forces appeared on the verge today of overrunning the first province capital in South Vietnam since they took Quang Tri on May 1, 1972, nine months before the signing of the Paris peace agreement.

title: 3 Employers Guilty of Violating Curbs on Child Labor Statutes
Youth Charged With Stabbing Death Of Babysitter Friend New Year's Eve
description: A 19yearold Franklin Township youth was arraigned on a charge of firstdegree murder in Pitman late yesterday in connection with the stabbing death of his 16yearold grilfriend while she was babysitting on New Year's Eve.

title: Frazier Gets 32, Keys Victory Over Suns
description: The Knicks defeated the Phoenix Suns, 117113, in overtime last night at Madison Square Garden, and the victory did wonders for Walt Frazier's morale. The Knick's captain scored 32 points, including 8 of New York's 12 points in the fiveminute extra session.

title: CORRECTION
description: A dispatch from Moscow in The New York Times on Dec, 25 erroneously reported that a Soviet emigration official had proposed that Veniamin G. Levich, a Jewish scientist, pledge that he would not seek to join his sons if they were allowed to leave. The actual proposal, which Mr. Levich rejected, was that he not seek to join his sons on grounds of family reunification, but did not preclude his pressing his own case for emigration.

title: HourLong Firing Reported Outside Eritrea's Capital
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 2 (Reuters)Artillery and automaticweapons fire and handgrenade explosions were heard for at least an hour today outside Asmara, the capital of Ethiopia's troubled northern province of Eritrea.

title: Article 1  No Title
$225Million Suit, Filed Against Gallo, Alleges Vertical Control of Market
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Jan. 2A $225million antitrust suit was filed in Federal District Court here today against the E.&J. Gallo Winery, by far the nation's largest vintner.

title: AbdulJabbar Gets 52 for Bucks
Mrs. King Gains In Mixed Doubles
description: DALLAS, Jan. 2 (AP)Billie Jean King and Owen Davidson, the defenders, defeated Andrew Pattison and Francoise Durr, 63, 64, in the opening round of the international mixed doubles championship today.

title: SovietEgyptian Tension Seen by Moscow Diplomats
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 2Reports from Cairo that the Soviet leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, postponed his trip to the Middle East for reasons of ill health have met with widespread skepticism in foreign diplomatic circles here.

title: Open Interest
Paper Suspends Edition
description: MORRISTOWN, Tenn., Jan. 2 (AP)The Morristown Daily GazetteMail has announced that it is suspending publication of its Monday edition. The newspaper said.

title: About Real Estate
description: Until 11 years ago, the Tamman family lived in Tripoli, Libya. Saul Tamman was a tailor. He and his wife, Ines, had eight childrenJoseph, Benedetto, David, Lisa, Lilliana, Rachel, Nora and Nessim. The oldest was 18 then, and the youngest was 7.

title: Seattle Woman, 101, Dies
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 2 (AP)Laura Green, wife of one of Seattle's oldest banking leaders died yesterday at the age of 101. Joshua Green, her husband of 73 years, survives. He is 105. Also surviving are a son, two daughters, five grandchildren and 21 greatgrandchildren.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Thursday, Jan. 2. 69th day. Weather clear, track good.

title: Notre Dame Hero Cites Regret
Restaurant Guide
description: Casting the eye about for a place to pick up a bit of lunch after a recent visit to the Morgan Library, I thought the entrance to Giambelli, 238 Madison Avenue between 37th and 38th, looked promising, and went in.

title: Gunman Evicted At Nathan's Kills 2 in a Shootout
News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 3, 1975

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: PROVISIONAL I.R.A CONTINUES TRUCE
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 2The militant Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army announced here today that it was extending until Jan. 16 the Christmas ceasefire that was to have expired in Britain and Northern Ireland at midnight tonight.

title: TWOHEART PATIENT REPORTED IMPROVED
description: CAPETOWN, South Africa, Jan. 2 (UPI)Dr. Christiaan N. Barnard said today that he hoped to have his second doubleheart patient out of bed within 48 hours, three or four days after the New Year's Eve operation.

title: Film Forum Program
Syncrude Canada to Limit its Tar Sands Activities
N.Y.R.A. Chief Foresees BreakEven Point
description: When the attendance figure of 15,779 was relayed to Tom FitzGerald, the president of the New York Racing Association, at Aqueduct yesterday, he smiled. That's just about what we were figuring on, FitzGerald said. It rather takes the edge off the disappointment that we felt at yesterday's [Wednesday] figures.

title: In Fort Worth, a Water Garden Is an Urban Space
description: FORT WORTH Architects and urban planners have been properly concerned recently about the dearth of useful amenities in our cities places to sit, places to snack, places to shopand as a result, great attention has been paid in many very recent projects to the inclusion of such amenities. This is all to the good; still, the concentration on such useful things often blinds us to the fact that some of the greatest urban places were never designed with function in mind at all. The plaza of the Seagram Building on Park Avenue and the Piazza San Marco in Venice, for example, were conceived far more out of a desire to create a noble expression than out of a wish to be usefulalthough useful, and joyous, these surely are.

title: Cornell to Open Hockey Festival
description: College hockey returns to New York tonight with the opening games of the Eastern College Athletic Conference Holiday Hockey Festival at Madison Square Garden. At 6:30 Cornell (with a 521 wonlosttied record) faces off against Boston College (541), and the 9 o'clock contest pits Brown (521) against St. Lawrence (26). The winners will meet at 3:30 P.M. Sunday, after the 1:30 consolation game.

title: A Professor Who Turns Nutrition Into a Multimedia Event
description: SYRACUSE  Not many professors are carried into the classroom on a surfboard, But Dr. Sarah Short, associate professor of nutrition at Syracuse University did make that kind of entrance recently. The reason for her outlandishness was that she wanted students to be excited about nutrition. If popping out of a cake or ridirg on a motorcycle will rivet her students to their seats, Dr. Short does it.

title: Agencies Unprepared for Soaring Number of Adolescents in Need
description: Adolescents, some of them with criminal records, many of them with severe behavioral problems, and educationally handicapped, are wandering the streets because, over the years, little or no notice was taken of the changing youth population pattern, and its concomitant needs, in the foster care program.

title: GROWTH REPORTED for EUROCURRENCY
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Jan. 2 (Reuters)Moderate growth in the Eurocurrency market in September appears to have continued into the final quarter of 1974, the Bank for International Settlements said today.

title: STATE BARS TWO FROM ROAD BIDS
description: TRENTON, Jan. 2The Gallo Asphalt Company and the Passaic Crushed Stone Company, two highway construction concerns that have pleaded guilty to charges of rigging road construction bids in New Jersey, were barred today by the State Department of Transportation from bidding on state contracts until October, 1976.

title: CHENGOR LOH
description: Chengor Loh, retired manager of the National Cash Register Company's operations in China and Hong Kong, died Saturday in Northern Westchester Hospital, Mount Kisco, N. Y. He was 84 years old and lived in Armonk, N. Y.

title: Maryland Victor, 9650, Over Appalachian State
Sakharov Says He Feels Threat Worse Than in 1973 Campaign
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 2Andrei D. Sakharov, the physicist, contended today that his position as a leading dissident made him more vulnerable now than he had been as the target of an official press campaign in August and September, 1973.

title: Price of Gold Continues to Slide Abroad
description: LONDON, Jan. 2The price of gold continued to slide today on the European bullion markets, reflecting widespread disappointment over the lack of enthusiasm displayed by American investors since gold ownership was legalized in the United States on Dec. 31.

title: Dr. Demartini Gets Post At Presbyterian Hospital
description: The board of trustees of Presbyterian Hospital announced yesterday the election of Dr. Felix E. Demartini as vice chairman of the board. He will be responsible for all scientific and health programs and professional staffing at the hospital.

title: BYRNE ASKS COURT TO REDISTRIBUTE STATE SCHOOL AID
description: TRENTON, Jan. 2Governor Byrne asked the State Supreme Court today to order a wholesale redistribution of $640million in state school aid, withdrawing all of it from wealthy and middleincome communities and diverting it to poorer districts in New Jersey.

title: LEVITT FORESEES NO STATE DEFICIT
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2State Controller Arthur Levitt indicated today that, contrary to Governor Carey's expressed concern, he did not expect the current state budget to slip into deficit.

title: Ogilvy & Mather Adds Fourth Vice President
description: Ogilvy & Mather, the country's 10th largest advertising agency, has just added its fourth executive vice president: William H. Weed.

title: Bomb Injury Kills India Rail Minister; 23 Are Wounded
description: NEW DELHI, Friday, Jan. 3 (AP)  The railway minister of India died today of injuries from a bomb that exploded beneath the speaker's platform at the inauguration of a new rail line, Indian news agencies reported.

title: Byrne Asks That Court Redistribute School Aid
description: TRENTON, Jan. 2Governor Byrne asked the State Supreme Court today to order a wholesale redistribution of $640million in state school aid, withdrawing all of it from wealthy and middleincome communities and diverting it to poorer districts in New Jersey.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: At this very instant, Mr. and Mrs. P. are frightened, as they have been for years. They are afraid that, if they make one mistake, utter a single complaint, the agency that 10 years ago entrusted them with an infant girl named L. will find a pretext to take her from them before they get the chance to adopt her.

title: Advertising
description: An ad that ran recently in Women's Wear Daily announced that this spring Fleet Street, a manufacturer of women's rainwear, will be launching the most aggressive advertising campaign in its history.

title: NAN M'FARLAND, 58, FEATURED ACTRESS
description: Nan McFarland, a featured actress whose last Broadway appearance was as the housekeeper in the original Sound of Music starring Mary Marlin in 1959, died Tuesday of cancer in Stamford, Conn., where she lived. Her age was 58.

title: STATE DEMOCRATS name OHRENSTEIN LEADER IN SENATE
description: State Senator Manfred Ohrenstein of Manhattan, one of the early leaders in the reform Democratic movement, was chosen yesterday as the leader of the Senate Democrats.

title: DuPont to Lay Off 450
description: DEEPWATER, Jan. 3 (AP)The DuPont Company says it will lay off 450 workers for two weeks at its chemical plant here starting Jan. 13. A company spokesman said the layoffs were a result of an inventory problem. The plant, which employs 700 workers, makes dyes used in synthetic fibers.

title: WINE TALK
description: The year just ended was a tough one for a lot of wine people around the world, what with overproduction here, a scandal there and increasingly chary customers everywhere. But it was a pretty good year for wine booksmaybe a 1967.

title: Gold Inventory Sales
description: Handy & Herman, Inc., said yesterday that the company would include in its 1974 earnings an $11million profit from sales from its gold inventory. The company, a leading refiner and processor of precious metals, announced Dec. 3 that it had changed a previously stated plan of restoring gold inventories to the level of Dec. 31, 1973.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Music: A Kipnis Debut
description: Since postholiday fatigue can dull the listening acuity of even the most devoted concertgoers, the New York Philharmonic was probably wise to settle on a mild program for its concerts this week.

title: Air Pioneer at 76: The Glamour Is Gone
description: WASHINGTON CROSSING, Pa.  Long hickory logs burned, crackling and hissing, in the fireplace of the little cabin. A trophy of some longago hunt gazed with solemn countenance across the darkening room. Virgil Kauffman finished off his baked dove, which he had bagged and cooked himself, and looked out the window at a flock of wild ducks feeding lustily in a weeded pond.

title: Rotterdam Shipping Lags
Laotian Cabinet Approves Pact With Rebel Soldiers
Milton Cross, Voice of the Met, Is Dead
description: Milton Cross, the commentator known to a nationwide broadcast audience as the voice of the Metropolitan Opera, died yesterday at his home here while preparing for the broadcast today of Rossini's I'Italiana in Algeri.

title: Air Pioneer at 76: The Glamour Is Gone
description: WASHINGTON CROSSING, Pa.  Long hickory logs burned, crackling and hissing, in the fireplace of the little cabin. A trophy of some longago hunt gazed with solemn countenance across the darkening room. Virgil Kauffman finished off his baked dove, which he had bagged and cooked himself, and  looked out the window at a flock of wild ducks feeding lustily in a weeded pond.

title: 13 Are Hurt as Ferry From Staten Island Hits Manhattan Slip
description: Twelve passengers and al deckhand were injured on a Staten Island ferry boat yesterday morning when it rammed into the vehicle ramp at the Manhattan slip.

title: President to See Helms in C.I.A. Review
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3President Ford plans to meet with Richard Helms within the next few days, White House officials said today, as part of his promised review into allegations of illegal domestic spying by the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Charges Over F.B.I.'s Tactics On Subversive Suspects Barred
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The Justice Department has decided not to prosecute anyone in connection with the Federal Bureau of Investigation's 15yearcampaign to disrupt the activities of suspected subversive organizations.

title: Power Failure Disrupts Some Penn Central Runs
description: An electrical power failure interrupted train service by the Penn Central and Amtrak out of Pennsylvania Station for nearly two hours last night as Consolidated Edison workmen searched for a burnedout power cable.

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: DR. ALLEN MARGOLD

title: F.P.C. Staff Says Outlook for Natural Gas Worsens
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The Federal Power Commission staff reported today that the outlook for natural gas supplies had worsened unexpectedly and recommended mandatory conservation measures that would affect all gas consumers, even private homes.

title: Boy, 3, Caught in Drug Raid
description: OMAHA, Jan. 3 (UPI)The parents of a 3yearold boy who knows how to roll a marijuana cigarette will be charged with child neglect.

title: Lottery News Bill Signed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (UPI) President Ford signed into law today a bill allowing newspapers and certain broadcasting stations to send information on their state lotteries through the United States mail and on interstate airwaves. The law took effect immediately.

title: OFFDUTY OFFICER KILLED IN HOLDUP
description: A 27yearold offduty police officer was shot and killed yesterday afternoon when he tried to stop a robbery by three masked men at a Chase Manhattan Bank branch near Gramercy Park.

title: Article 1  No Title
Milton Cross Dies
description: Milton Cross, the commentator known to a nationwide broadcast audience as the voice of the Metropolitan Opera, died yesterday as he was preparing for the broadcast today of L'Italiana in Algeri. He was 77 years old. Details on Page 26.

title: Prof. Harley Lutz, Economist, Foe of Federal Spending, Dies
description: Dr. Harley L. Lutz, emeritus professor of public finance at Princeton University and a vehement advocate of reducing Government spending, died yesterday in a nursing home in Montgomery, Ala. His age was 92.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: LEONA GROSS LAX

title: 2 Proposed Rules Are Issued to Cut Noise at Airports
DECLINE IS SHOWN IN GOLD FUTURES
description: Gold futures prices drifted lower yesterday, taking their cue mainly from activity in the London market.

title: Cuban Exiles Recall Domestic Spying and Picketing for C.I.A.
description: MIAMI, Jan. 3Cuban exiles, paid and directed by agents of the Central Intelligence Agency, engaged over a 10year period in a series of activities that, while related to foreign affairs, had clearly a domestic character, according to Cuban participants in these actions.

title: Chilean Foresees A Kissinger Visit In MidFebruary
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 3 (Reuters)A spokesman for the Chilean Foreign Ministry said today that Secretary of State Kissinger would visit Chile for one or two days in midFebruary.

title: 11 Oil Concerns Accused in Suit On Prices by Housing Authority
description: The New York City Housing Authority yesterday filed a $100million Federal suit in Brooklyn against 11 major American oil companies, charging them with restraint of trade and rigging of oil prices in violation of the Sherman Antitrust Act.

title: People in Sports
description: A former center on two national champion football teams was named the winner yesterday of the Theodore Roosevelt Award by the National Collegiate Athletic Association. The player? President Ford, who played for Michigan in 19323334.

title: At OTB: Florida Betting
