description: In the Roman Catholic Church of St. James in Basking Ridge, N.J., yesterday afternoon, Mary Ellen Kimmerle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George J. Kimmerle of Basking Ridge, became the bride of Robert J. Aiello, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter W. Aiello of Basking Ridge and Silverton, N.J.

title: Marva Joyce Goldstein Affianced
description: Marva Joyce Goldstein, a senior at Yeshiva University's Stern College for Women, and Abraham Rubin Freilich, a senior at Yeshiva's Albert Einstein College of Medicine, plan to marry May 18 at the Plaza.

title: Derailment Near Baltimore Disrupts Amtrak Service
description: BALTIMORE Jan. 4 (UPI)Five cars of a 105car Penn Central freight train derailed north of here today, knocking out power lines and requiring diesel locomotives to shuttle electricpowered Metroliners on their northsouth runs.

title: Food for The Birds
description: A spry and charming lady of 80 wrote to me the other day about her birds. She reported with undisguised rapture that her garden on the edge of the city of Bethlehem, Pa., was alive with 25 kinds of birds! She had every reason to be proud and happy with her winter pensioners, for it takes a heap of doing to attract and keep that many birds.

title: China as an OilExporting Nation
description: China's role in the world oil economy is changing. For a long time China was considered a country poor in oil, and oil for the lamps of china was a major import item and an attractive objective for the international oil companies. In 1958 China imported 2.5 million tons of petroleum products from the Soviet Union.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, JANUARY 5, 1975

title: Nancy Albertson to Be Bride in Boston
description: Mr. and Mrs. J. Donald Albertson of Peekskill, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nancy Albertson of Boston, to Henry Harter Fetterman Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Fetterman of Allentown, Pa. A wedding this month in Boston is planned.

title: Apartments Go Coop Outside the Law
description: Dissent is evident from outside. Despite the prominent sign offering cooperative apartments for sale, smaller signs saying, I am not coop dot windows in the blocklong, complex of buildings at 55, 65 and 75 Park Terrace East and GO and 70 Park Terrace West.

title: Art: A 20thCentury Show
description: TRENTONFive years ago, the New Jersey State Museum began to assemble a collection of early 20thcentury art. The fruits of its campaign are now assembled in its main exhibition gallery, where 37 oil paintings, water  colors, drawings and graphics by John Marin, Georgia O'Keeffe, Stuart Davis, Marsden Hartley and other pioneers of the modern American idiom are on view.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on the cost of automobile repairs that appeared in The New York Times on Dec. 8, figures provided by the Department of Transportation placed decimal points incorrectly. The estimated costspermile for repairs and maintenance on 1974 model compact cars should have read 0.75 cents in the first year, 1.43 cents in the second, 2.06 in the third, 3.10 in the fourth and 3.23 in the fifth.

title: Policeman Attacked at Bombed Home
description: One of two policemen guarding the bombed home of a black family in the predominantly white Rosedale section Queens was attacked by two assailants and clubbed over the head early yesterday while making a routine security check of the premises.

title: Auto Industry Has Plan to Heal Itself (With U.S. Help)
The Wish at the Top
The Growing Demand for Food
description: Despite recession and inflation last year, Americans (and their pets) not only gobbled up more food than in the past, but also tended to upgrade their diets.

title: Alaska's Future Gauged By Oil
description: JUNEAU, AlaskaThis state's future seems to be endlessly entwined with the oil business.

title: What's Doing in SEATTLE
Steelers Goode Bet to Top Vikings4.1 Points
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 4The Pittsburgh Steelers are 4.1 points better than the Minnesota Vikings in the Super Bowl game next Sunday, according to Bud Goode, the renowned sports computer analyst. In an interview here today, Goode pointed to several characteristics that favor the Steelers in two out of three general areas: intercepted passes, number of rushes per game, and yards per pass attempt.

title: Carroll Clancy Fissell Married At Home to Frank Fell Stetson
description: Carroll Clancy Fissell of Short Hills, N. J., widow of Dr. George McGrath Fissell, an ophthalmologist, was married yesterday morning to Frank Fell Stetson of Chatham, N. .J., a senior vice president of the Marine Midland Bank in New York. The civil ceremony was performed at the bride's home.

title: Regulatory Reform: Little but Words
description: WASHINGTONAs inflation and unemployment continue to fuel the fires of political discontent in the United States, Government officials arg placing some of the blame lot the nations troubles on an unusual scapecoat: bad Government.

title: Alison Parker, K. L. Kenway Wed in Capital
BOMBAY ATTACKS MORASS OF SLUMS
description: BOMBAY, IndiaAfter several years of proposals and talk, local authorities have begun a program of trying to clear Bombay's sprawling alums, which constitute a series of towns within this city.

title: New Hampshire's Governor Blocks Shipping of Ballots
description: CONCORD, N. H., Jan. 4Governor Meldrin Thomson Jr. has blocked the transportation of contested ballots in New Hampshire's Senate race to Washington.

title: BRIDGE
description: It is not yet clear whether the McKenney Trophy, which goes to the player winning the most masterpoints in a calendar year, went to Kerri Shuman of Los Angeles or to Mike Passell of Mission Viejo, Calif., but it certainly did not go to the perennial favorite, Hollywood producer Barry Crane.

title: Recession's Impact: A Diverse Pattern
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  The Portland Storm's football future is, well, stormy just like the present economic outlook for much of this sprawling Pacific Northwest.

title: Susan Auchincloss Whipple Fiancee of George Wanty 3d
description: George Amiel Whipple 2d and Mrs. Hope A. Whipple of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Susan Auchincloss Whipple, to George Proctor Wanty 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Wanty 2d of Grand Rapids, Mich. A wedding in June is planned.

title: New Hampshire Air Service Resumes With Guard Hiring
description: LEBANON, N. H., Jan. 4 (AP) Air service to Lebanon Regional Airport has resumed with agreement by Air New England to hire armed guards for the airport.

title: 2 Held on Charges Of Bombing House Of a Queens Black
description: A dental technician and a Board of Education accountant were arrested last night in connection with the bombing of a black family's home in the predominantly white Rosedale section of Queens early on New Year's Eve.

title: ORVAL A. WALES
description: Orval A. Wales, who retired 10 years ago as vice president of the Cellulose Sales Company, died yesterday in White Plains Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 32 Crane Road, Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Princeton's Defense No Joke to Penn
description: Pete Carril is a funny man, both on and off the basketball court. The Princeton coach answered the telephone at a friend's home yesterday by saying, Valley Forge, George Washington once slept here, for no particular reason.

title: State Reduces Ballet Theater's Grant
description: The New York State Council on the Arts, which initiated an audit of the Ballet Theater Foundation, the parent unit of American Ballet Theater, has approved a grant for 197475 to the organization but reduced the amount by $85,000.

title: I.L.O. Bids Men Aid Working Wives
description: GENEVA, Jan. 5The International Labor Organization has called on husbands to shoulder a bigger share of the household chores as one way to ease the burden carried by married women who work outside the home.

title: JERSEY EXPECTED TO TURN DOWN TAX
description: New Jersey Democratic legislative leaders reported yesterday that there was little chance the Senate would approve a state income tax when it reconvened in Trenton today.

title: TV: Superb Debut for Black Group
description: Ceremonies in Dark Old Men. a twohour production to be presented on ABC Theater this evening, provides significant television on several levels. The play, written by Lonne Elder 3d, is a marvelous blend of folk theater and universal drama. The production, impeccably cast, is superb. And the event marks the debut of a major black theater organization, the Negro Ensemble Company, on American network television.

title: Study Reports Antibiotic Prices Inflated By Limited Competition in Drug Sales
description: The limited scope of competition among drug companies in the sale of seven antibiotics costs consumers at least $180million a year, according to a study by the Council on Economic Priorities released yesterday.

title: Property Taxes in 74 Estimated at $51Billion
description: Property taxes, a major source of revenue for local governments, last year raised an estimated $51billion in the United States, according to a new study prepared by the Tax Foundation, Inc., a publicly supported, nonprofit research organization.

title: Strike Settled, Bowie to Open Today
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 5 (AP) Striking employes at Maryland's three horse race tracks voted today to ratify a new contract and will report for work tomorrow at Bowie. The settlement will allow New York's Offtrack Betting Corporation to handle bets on races at Bowie tomorrow.

title: Music: Parisians Tribute to Jolivet
description: Andre Jolivet, who recently died at the age of 70, was not only a prolific composer but also one who had been a moving force in France's modern music movement. So, it was fitting that the Paul Kuentz Chamber Orchestra of Paris should include in its program yesterday at Town Hall a commemorative work, and especially fitting that the tribute should have been written not long ago by the composer himself. Most authentic composers would probably prefer to have their own music played on such occasions.

title: OFFICIALS SWORN IN CEREMONY HERE
description: Representative Charles B. Rangel, the chairman of the Congressional Black Caucus, said yesterday that blacks, Puerto Ricans and Jews should not let the nation's economic situation divide them.

title: NASDAQ Volume Drops
description: The National Association of Securities Dealers reported that trading volume on NASDAQthe automated quotation system for unlisted securitiesfell sharply last year to an average of 4.7 million shares daily from 6.6 million shares daily a year ago. But only 2,593 issues were listed, down from 2,932 the year before. Active market makers also declined to 391 last year from 495 a year earlier, the trade group reported.

title: Leaders in Congress Say Own Hearings Will Go On
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Congressional leaders made it clear today that President Ford's appointment of a commission to investigate alleged domestic activities by the Central Intelligence Agency would not keep Congress from inquiring into the matter.

title: Study Finds Female Ph.D.'s Lag Behind Male Counterparts in Pay and Job Opportunities
description: A major national study comparing male and female recipients of doctoral degrees has found that women, having of ten subordinated their careers to family responsibilities, have consistently received lower pay, less prestigious jobs and fewer employment opportunities.

title: Books of The Times
description: Shelby Foote's monumental story of the Civil War concludes with this third volume, the longest and most compelling of all. It is a breathtaking wideangle view that delivers in prose what Winston Churchill in his A History of the EnglishSpeaking Peoples called the great American Civil War, which must upon the whole be considered the noblest and least avoidable of, all the great massconflicts of which till then there was record,

title: MOVE SLATED TO CUT SOCIAL SECURITY TAX
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI)  The chairman of the new House Social Security subcommittee pledged today that he will try to lower payroll taxes next year, using general tax revenues to make up the resulting deficit in Social Security funding.

title: A WATERGATE JUROR STRESSES NEWS BAR
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) Describing her life on the Watergate doverup jury, a member of the panel says there was no possible way for jurors to get news accounts of trialrelated events during the 11 weeks they were sequestered.

title: Philadelphia Gunman Slays Four at Private Card Game
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 5 (AP) Four men were killed and a fifth was critically wounded tonight when a gunman barged into a private card game at a home and began shooting.

title: A Tax Cut's Debit Side
City Hospitals' Legacy: Fiscal Mismanagement
description: The city's Health and Hospitals Corporation, established five years ago by the Legislature as the state's first quasiindependent municipal corporation, is in critical financial conditiondue in part to years of fiscal mismanagement, in part to a continuing tendency to be shortchanged by the governments that support it.

title: About New York
description: The news was that things were tough, that unemployment was up, that prices were, too, and that if you lived in New York you paid a lot more in taxes than someone who lived, say, in Dodge City. None of this surprised the citizens here, of course; they knew it all the time.

title: State Arts Council Speeds Funding
Israeli Party Leader Meets P.L.O. Members
description: PARIS, Jan. 5 (UPI)A highranking member of a leading Israeli political party said in an interview to be published here tomorrow that he had talked last month in Prague with representatives of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: I.L.O. Bids Men Aid Working Wives
Bucks Win 5th In Row
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 5 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks sparked by 33 points apiece by Kareen AbdulJabbar And Bob Dandridge, mounted an 11point lead with 3 minutes 37 seconds to play and held off a furious Chicago comeback for a 9695 National Basketball Association victory over the Bulls today.

title: ATTACK RENEWED ON VIETNAM TOWN
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Jan. 6North Vietnamese troops led by tanks, again attacked the embattled provincial capital of Phuoc Binh this morning during a heavy mortar barrage, the Saigon military command announced.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Governor Byrne said yesterday that he expected the state's unemployment to rise to 10 per cent before the end of January. The state's reported unemployment rate for November was 9.5 per cent, placing it among the highest in the 50 states. The Federal jobless figure for New Jersey is 8.2 per cent.

title: DEBT OFFERINGS RISING TO RECORD
Douglas Is Improving
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas showed some improvement today from a stroke, but still was listed in serious condition at Walter Reed Army Medical Center. His condition is unchanged, said Peter Esker, a spokesman for the hospital. He remains serious, but is improving. The 76yearold Justice suffered a stroke while vacationing in the Bahamas last Tuesday.

title: Jesuits Warn Italy's Top Party Of Vote Losses Over Scandals
description: ROME, Jan. 5The Jesuit order, in a severe appraisal endorsed by the Vatican, today warned Italy's Roman Catholic party, the Christian Democrats, that it may suffer landslide losses in forthcoming elections and urged it to purge itself of corruption and profiteering.

title: SLAYING OF 3 LAID TO BRIDGETON MAN
description: A 25yearold South Jersey man visiting in the city alleged ly shot and killed his commonlaw wife and her two sisters after an argument in the Bronx yesterday and turned himself in at a police station in Brooklyn several hours later, the police said.

title: Wilson of Astros Is Found Dead
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 5 (AP)A Houston Astro pitcher, Don Wilson, and his 5yearold son were found dead at their home today, authorities said. Wilson's wife and daughter were hospitalized.

title: CHICAGO BATTLES CURB ON U.S. AID
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Attorneys for the City of Chicago will argue tomorrow before Judge John Lewis Smith here for a reversal of his order halting revenuesharing payments to Chicago until the city ends discrimination in its police department.

title: Burma and Thailand Seen as Possible Rice Suppliers to Neighbors
description: BANGKOK, Thailand  When the world food crisis is discussed, the talk usually focuses on the rich nations surpluses and the poor nations deficits. Little is said about poor nations that have surpluses or about the possibility that those surpluses might be used to meet the threat of famine in neighboring countries.

title: Relief Flights Are Resumed To Pakistani Quake Victims
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 5 (Reuters)Helicopters today resumed flying relief missions to a 40mile strip along the Indus River in Pakistan devastated by an earthquake eight days ago in which 5,200 people were reported killed.

title: A Clock and a Cookie Jar Inspire Gifts to Neediest
description: The grandfather clock in the Tarrytown, N.Y., house of Helen Odell Squiers suddenly began to chime again. A cookie jar was relabeled in a Jamaica, Queens, household and overflowed with coins and bills. Both were instrumental in gifts received by the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Health Chief Requests $210.4Million Budget
description: Health Commissioner Lowell E. Bellin has asked for $210.4million as the 197576 operating budget for his department, the Comprehensive Health Planning Agency and the Medical Examiner's office.

title: Turkey and Libya Sign WideRange Economic Pact
description: ANKARA, Jan. 5. (Reuters)Turkey and Libya today signed wideranging agreements that will bring Turkey 3 million tons of Libyan crude oil this year and initiate joint military and economic projects between the two Moslem countries.

title: ExCity Labor Official Joins Collective Bargaining Office
description: The appointment of Thomas M. Laura, former assistant director of the New York City Office of Labor Relations, as deputy chairman and director of disputes of the Office of Collective Bargaining was announced yesterday by Arvid Anderson, chairman of the O.C.B.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: A Big Buffer Area Rings Montreal's New Airport
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 5Thirtyfour miles northwest of Montreal, where the gently rolling farmlands begin yielding to the Laurentian Mountains, the Government of Canada is building the largest airport in the world

title: Cornell Sextet Subdues St. Lawrence in Final, 74
description: Cornell defeated St. Lawrence, 74, yesterday and won the Eastern College Athletic Conference Holiday Hockey Festival at Madison Square Garden.

title: FORD NAMES ROCKEFELLER TO HEAD INQUIRY INTO C.I.A.; WANTS REPORT IN 90 DAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5President Ford named today an eightmember commission headed by Vice President Rockefeller to investigate allegations of domestic spying by the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Beth Neumark Wed To Yaakov Gross
description: The marriage of Beth Neumark, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin J. Neumark of New York, to Yaakov Gross, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Gross of Brooklyn, took place here at noon yesterday in the home of the bride's parents.

title: Salvage of Tanker Off Southern Chile Averts a Disaster
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 5(UPI)What could have been a major ecological disaster of the supertanker era has been averted by a spectacular salvage effort near the tip of southern Chile.

title: PURCHASING AIDES OPPOSE CONTROLS
description: Price pressures continue to ease, shortages are diminishing, inventories are being cut, and salesmen are banging at the door, the National Association of Purchasing Management said over the weekend in describing the results of its December survey of business.

title: Carey Aide Represented Nursing Home
description: Judah Gribets, who was a lawyer for one of the major figures in the nursinghome investigations, has been advising Governor Carey on how to proceed with the problem.

title: ATTACK RENEWED ON VIETNAM TOWN
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Jan. 6North Vietnamese troops led by tanks, again attacked the embattled provincial capital of Phuoc Binh this morning during a heavy mortar barrage, the Saigon milltary command announced.

title: AMAZON INDIANS KILL 3 IN ATTACK
description: BRASILIA, Jan. 4Brazil's Department of Indian Affairs has evacuated its posts in the northernmost Amazon area and is reviewing its strategy in the wake of new violence by the WaimiriAtraori tribesmen.

title: Mideast Hope
description: Leonid Brezhnev's postponement of his visit to Cairo, whether or not as a result of ill health, is less important than Egypt's decision that preceded it: to opt for another round of American stepbystep mediation instead of the Geneva conference favored by Moscow.

title: Economics Runs in the Family of Gordon, Association's New Chief
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 1 Robert Aaron Gordon, who this week assumed the presidency of the American Economics Association, did not have to hold a convention to find out what's what in the economics profession. He Could have held a family picnic instead.

title: Evacuation Cited as a Hazard in Flying
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) In a sweeping new indictment of airline emergency evacuation equipment and procedures, Federal safety experts said today that many passengers had survived aircraft accidents only to be hurt or killed trying to escape on the ground.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Steingut Plans Head Count Tomorrow
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5  Stanley Steingut will take the important unofficial head count among a caucus of his fellow Democrats Tuesday evening here in his quest to be the Speaker of the new Assembly, which convenes Wednesday. While his supporters say that the Brooklyn Democrat's selection is certain and that Governor Carey is in no position to challenge him, one legislator who will be watching closely is the former Republican Speaker, Perry B. Duryea.

title: British Football
description: By Reuttrs

title: Y RECITAL GIVEN BY RUTH LAREDO
description: Ruth Laredo's piano recital at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. on Saturday night focused on two dissimilar Russian composers born within a year of each otherRachmaninoff (1873), a conservative romantic, and Scriabin (1872), an avantgarde mystic.

title: GOV. CARTER GIVEN DATA ON 5 DEATHS
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 5  Gov. Jimmy Carter's office received today a report from the families of five black men found dead and ruled accidentally drowned in the waters off Pensacola, Fla., about a month ago.

title: 3 JAZZ GUITARISTS OFFER NEWER STYLE
description: Three guitarists who came out of the jazz world of the nineteenforties and fifties could easily fall into monochromatic repetitiousness because the influence of Charlie Christian was so prevalent then. But when the guitarists are Herb Ellis, Barney Kessel and Charlie Byrd, who appeared together at Carnegie Hall on Saturday evening, the fact adds to the interest of the differences they show today.

title: Ohrenstein's Victory Is a Major Defeat for Carey
description: The designation of State Senator Manfred H. Ohrenstein as State Senate minority leader was a major political defeat for Governor Carey and his handpicked Democratic state chairman, Patrick J. Cunningham, in one of their first efforts to exercise control over the State Democratic party and state government.

title: Too Much Heat
description: It is a measure of the public's failure to comprehend the nature of the energy crisis that excessive heat is still being squandered in businessasusual fashion in most public places and many private homes.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: 8 on the President's Panel Span Wide Range of Belief
description: The eight members of a commission named yesterday by President Ford to investigate alleged domestic activities by the Central Intelligence Agency include redoubtable spokesmen for cold war policies as well as crusaders for civil liberties.

title: Westmoreland Is Improved And Resting Comfortably
description: PALM DESERT, Calif., Jan 5 (UPI)Gen. William C. Westmoreland, former commander of United States forces in the Vietnam war, was reported improved and in good condition today after suffering a mild heart attack two days ago.

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
Du Pont Newspapers in Delaware Shaken by NewsControl Dispute
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Jan. 5In the lobby of the Hotel Du Pont, among the display cases of dresses and jewelry and chinaware, there is one case that contains cans of Du Pont Lucite enamel and spray paint and a Du Pont manufactured paint brush of the sort used by house painters.

title: Rangers Triumph, 62, Run String to 6 Games
Personal Finance: Steps for Widows
description: The death of a husband usually means that a wife, at a time of severe shock, must make financial decisions that could affect her entire future. Many determinations regarding banks, taxes, insurance and other vital considerations must be faced.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 5 (Reuters)  A band of guerrilla bombers attacked Jerusalem today with at least three explosive devices, the police said.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Eleven deteriorated East Harlem tenements will be rehabilitated with Federal aid to provide 192 apartments for lowincome and moderateincome families, the Department of Housing and Urban Development said yesterday. The rehabilitation will cost $7.2million and will be sponsored by the Upper Park Avenue Community Association, a local group that has built or renovated nearly 1,000 apartments in East Harlem. Completion is scheduled for mid1976.

title: Steven Katz Marries Ruth Zuckerman Here
description: The marriage of Ruth Zuckerman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Abraham Zuckerman of Hillside, N. J., to Steven Walters Katz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley R. Katz of Deal, N. J., took place at the Plaza last evening. Rabbi Pinchas M. Teitz performed the ceremony.

title: 5 Die as Cars Fall From Bridge Struck by a Ship in Tasmania
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Jan. 5 (AP)At least five persons were killed tonight when cars in which they had been riding plunged off a collapsed section of a bridge that had been rammed by a British freighter.

title: 2 Held on Charges Of Bombing House Of a Queens Black
Former Aide of Mrs. Gandhi To Direct Planning in India
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 4  Parmeshwar Narain Haksar, former principal secretary of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, was named head of the Planning Commission today.

title: Seiben of Rutgers Wins 6Mile Race
description: Bill Seiben of Rutgers scored a 65yard victory over Larry Trackenberg of Princeton in the Road Runners Club of New York sixmile run yesterday at Central Park. In beating a field of 407 runners, Sieben was timed in 30 minutes 3.2 seconds.

title: Divided Angolan Guerrillas Sign Accord
description: MOMBASA, Kenya, Jan. 5 (UPI)  The three Angola guerrilla movements signed a joint political agreement today paving the way for immediate talks with Lisbon and independence for Portugal's last African territory, possibly within a year.

title: For This Unemployed Man, There's a Cushion, and The Crunch Hasn't Come
description: Thomas Breckenridge, a 40yearold bachelor who had been making $25,000 a year, lost his advertising job nine months ago and has been out of work since, caught like thousands of others in the recession.

title: Pope Bids Rome Show Courtesy to Pilgrims
description: ROME, Jan. 5 (UPI)Pope Paul VI called on Romans today to put aside greed and indifference and give a courteous welcome to Holy Year pilgrims.

title: Gift to Smithsonian Tells Science History
description: One of the most extensive and important private collections of instruments, manuscripts and books documenting the history of science and technology has been deeded to the Smithsonian Institution by Bern Dibner, the manufacturer who assembled it.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: DR. SAMUEL SILVERBERG
description: Dr. Samuel Silverberg, who retired in 1952 as president of the Sterling Magnesia Company, died Friday on a visit to Tucson, Ariz. He was 88 years, old and lived at 210 East Broadway.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Loss of Western Balance of Power

title: MONGOLIA SPURS BIG MINE PROJECT
description: ULAN BATOR, MongoliaLong ago, according to Mongolian legend, a local seer predicted that whoever discovered and tapped a mysterious copper cauldron hidden beneath a remote mountain in northern Mongolia would loose a flood of riches upon his people.

title: Sabres Top Blues, 42; Robert Star
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 5 (AP)Rene Robert scored Buffalo's first two goals and set up the winning one today as the Sabres posted a 42 National Hockey League victory over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Rousing Ghost of Epiphanies Past Ends Christmas in New Canaan
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 5Sprites and scullions, lords and ladies, knights, jesters, pilgrims, shepherds, and a giant stuffed boar ended the Christmas season here tonight with a lavish recreation of the medieval celebration of the Twelfth Night.

title: PERU COPPER CORP. SETS JOINT VENTURE
description: The Southern Peru Copper Corporation, now building a $620million openpit copper mine at Cuajone, Peru, reported here yesterday that it had concluded a joint venture to operate the project with Billiton B.V. a Dutch mining subsidiary of Shell Petroleum N.V.

title: MONASTERY TRUCE BROKEN BY GUNFIRE
description: GRESHAM, Wis., Jan. 5 (UPI) Law Enforcement Officers exchanged gunfire tonight with Indians occupying a monastery near here, breaking a ceasefire agreed to earlier in the day.

title: Dance: A Rare Giselle
description: Truly great performances are rare. But this was what Natalya Makarova, so ably seconded by Ivan Nagy, offered Saturday night at the City Center when she took over the title role in American Ballet Theater's production of Giselle. It was a privilege to be there. At its most outstanding, Miss Makarova's second at is one of the world's greatest interpretations.

title: MILLIONS GIVEN BY U. S. FOR JOBS UNSPENT BY CITY
description: At a time when city employes are being laid off because of the fiscal crisis, the Beame administration has failed to fill even onethird of the jobs available under a totally Federally financed jobs program.

title: Fall Kills U. S. Ski Jumper
description: Jeff Wright of Minneapolis, a member of the United States national ski jumping team, died yesterday at the Mary Hitchcock Memorial Hospital in Hanover, N. H., following a crashlanding made during a pretournament leap at Brattleboro, Vt.

title: Back to the Swamp
description: When a Miami judge can order a developer to restore a mangrove swamp that he had devastated on his own property, Florida has clearly moved a long way from the days when it was a real estate speculator's paradise. The change in social attitude had to come, as a result of the increasingly ruinous effect of developers operations since the great land boom of the 1920's.

title: Dandi Is Best Spaniel
description: A 13monthold particolor cocker spaniel, Dreamridge Dandiman, the youngest dog in the final, gave a lesson to his elders when he was named best in a field of 609 at the 58th national specialty of the American Spaniel Club in the Statler Hilton last night.

title: MacArthur Bowl Goes to U.S.C.
description: The National Football Foundation and Hall of Fame has selected Southern California as the national champion college football team, which means the Trojans will receive the MacArthur Bowl. Usually, the MacArthur Bowl has been awarded prior to postseason bowl games. But the Foundation decided again to await the outcome of the Rose and Orange Bowls before naming either Southern California, Alabama, Ohio State or Michigan. Oklahoma, on probation, was not eligible. Since Southern Cal beat Ohio State in the Rose Bowl and Alabama lost to Notre Dame in the Orange Bowl, the Trojans were selected. Michigan did not play a postseason game.

title: National Society of Film Critics Hails Scenes From a Marriage
description: Scenes From a Marriage, written and directed by Ingmar Bergman, has been judged the best movie of 1974 in the eighth annual poll of the National Society of Film Critics.

title: The Voice of the Met
description: Without that familiar voice, saying Good afternoon, opera lovers from coast to coast, the Saturday matinee radio broadcasts of the Metropolitan Opera will never again be quite the same. For Milton Cross did more than any other individual to make the Met a national and even a North American institution, rather than merely. New York City's leading lyric theater. But Mr. Cross did much more than that.

title: City Hospitals' Legacy: Fiscal Mismanagement
description: The city's Health and Hospitals Corporation, established five years ago by the Legislature as the state's first quasiindependent municipal corporation, is in critical financial conditiondue in part to years of fiscal mismanagement, in part to a continuing tendency to be shortchanged by the governments that support it.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N. Y. 10249, or to any of the following eight organizations that certify these cases:

title: Mich. State Reinstates 10 Blacks
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Jan. 5 (AP)Ten black Michigan State basketball players were reinstated today by Coach Gus Ganakas. He had suspended them yesterday for walking out of a team meeting.

title: Teachers in Columbus, Ohio, Vote to Begin Strike Today
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 5 (UPI)  Some 5,000 Columbus public school teachers voted overwhelmingly late today to reject the latest contract offer from the school board and to go on strike at 6 A.M. tomorrow.

title: Milton Cross Funeral Today
description: Funeral services for Milton Cross, the Metropolitan Opera radio announcer, will be held today at 11:30 A.M. at All Angels Episcopal Church, 81st Street and West End Avenue. Mr. Cross died Friday at his home here at the age of 77.

title: Families Are Heartbroken and Angry As Agency Seizes Their Pet Ocelots
description: TOMS RIVER, N. J., Jan. 5 Moka, Mala and Sheena, queen of Toms River, a trio of ocelots born, bred and pampered in captivity, have suddenly become the central characters in a court case involving the illegal possession of exotic animals. The case is not without other exotic aspects.

title: Art Dealers Cite Softened Market, but Find No Cause for Alarm
description: Slump, recession, plummet, drop and doomsday are words often heard or heard too often to characterize not only the economy, but also virtually every other thing today. But these words are too extreme in their meaning to be applied to what happened in the art market last year and what will happen this year, according to experts.

title: State Department Seeks 700 for Clerical Jobs
description: A team of State Department recruiters will be in the city this week seeking applicants for 700 clerical jobs in Washington and at embassies overseas.

title: Good News Closes
description: Good News, the nostalgic musical starring Alice Faye, closed Saturday night after 16 performances at the St. James Theater. Plans are being discussed, a management spokesman said, for a possible continued road tour, summer stock performances, a Las Vegas production and an Australian company.

title: Cornwall Body Identified
description: Special to The New York Times

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Neal Said to Believe Nixon Did Not Authorize BreakIn
description: The chief prosecutor in the Watergate coverup trial does not think President Nixon knew in advance of the Watergate breakin, Time magazine says. The publication said yesterday that the prosecutor, James Neal, had stated flatly that Mr. Nixon did not authorize the bugging that occurred on June 17, 1972.

title: Bills Unpaid, Thousands Lose Heating
Rene Thomas, 47, Guitarist, With Rollins, Getz and Baker
description: LIEGE, Belgium, Jan. 5 (AP) Rene Thomas; a jazz guitarist, died of a heart attack in Santander, Spain, friends here said today. He was 47 year old.

title: Bank's Ad to Robbers Points to a Better Way
description: NEWARK, Jan. 5 (UPI)The Broad National Bank of Newark, held up last week, today made a special pitch to bank robbers  telling them to come in and take out a quick, friendly loan rather than raid the vaults.

title: Kissinger's Talk of Force Over Oil Worries Germans
description: BONN, Jan. 5Secretary of State Kissinger's reference to the possible use of force to secure Middle Eastern oil supplies for the Western world has aroused intense interest, anxiety and sharp criticism here.

title: GEN. W. E. SHAMBORA, EXARMY SURGEON, 74
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Jan. 5 (AP)Maj. Gen. William E. Shambora, U.S.A., retired, died yesterday at Brooke Army Medical Center, where he was commanding general from 1953 to 1960. His age was 74.

title: Faye Menken, Actress, Weds
description: At Temple Israel of New Rochelle, N. Y., yesterday afternoon, Faye Anne Menken, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Norman Menken of New Rochelle, was married to Roger Schneier, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Schneier of Riverdale, the Bronx. Rabbi Jacob K. Shankman performed the ceremony, assisted by Rabbi Amiel Wohl and Cantor Sumner Crockett.

title: Study Finds No Drug Abuse by Mental Hospitals
description: TRENTON, Jan. 5 (UPI)  A medical investigative team said allegations of drug abuse in four New Jersey mental hospitals were groundless.

title: Bids on Treasury Gold Will Be Opened Today
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 5 (UPI) Five men will gather around a plain, Governmentissue table tomorrow to open sealed bids on 2 million ounces of Treasury Department gold. What they find could push the precious metal's price even lower than the level it reached last week.

title: Council Votes Own Death
description: Special to The New York Times

title: ETHIOPIA APPROVES TALKS WITH REBELS
description: ADDIS ABABA, Jan. 5 (UPI) Ethiopia's military Government announced today that it had authorized community elders in Eritrea to make direct contacts on its behalf with the secessionist Eritrean Liberation Front in a move for peace in the northern province.

title: Young Shopkeepers Show Silver and Old Clothes
description: Many young shopkeepers have taken root on Atlantic Avenue in Brooklyn in the last few years opening such businesses as antiques, batik clothing and plant stores.

title: Dominica's Harsh Law Against Black Guerrillas Stirs Concern
description: ROSEAU, Dominica  The black Government of this West Indian island has taken harsh measures against a group of young blackpower guerrillas, most of them now in hiding, who are held responsible for a wave of violence against white visitors.

title: Rebels Attack Besieged Cambodia Forces
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Jan. 5 (AP)  Insurgents launched fresh assaults today against a besieged Cambodian Government force on the Mekong River two miles east of Phnom Penh in what observers said might be a prelude to an allout offensive against the capital.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JANUARY 6, 1975

title: MILLIONS GIVEN BY U. S. FOR JOBS UNSPENT BY CITY
description: At a time when city employes are being laid off because of the fiscal crisis, the Beame administration has failed to fill even onethird of the jobs available under a totally Federally financed jobs program.

title: PrimeTime Hour for Family Planned in Fall by NBC
description: The National Broadcasting Company announced yesterday a new policy for its television network, to be implemented with the fall schedule this year, under which the first hour of prime time will be devoted to programs suitable for family viewing. That would be 8 to 9 P.M. on the East and West Coasts, and an hour earlier in the central time zone.

title: For Sale: Tanks, Destroyers, Helicopters and More
description: The creed of Major Barbara's father, Undershaft, is as appropriate today as when George Bernard Shaw wrote it in 1907.

title: 1,100 at Waldorf Mark Inauguration of Carey
description: The Carey clan, together with about 1,100 dignitaries and wellwishers, celebrated the inauguration of the state's first Democratic Governor in 16 years at a $500aplate dinner dance at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel yesterday.

title: Kentucky Hospital With a Pioneer Spirit
description: HYDEN, Ky., Jan. 5Everybody in and around this tiny town was invited to the formal dedication of the new $2.7million hospital today, but Cash Browning sent his regrets.

title: Miss Winter Wed To James N. Hefty
description: Helena Winter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Winter of Forest Hills, Queens, was married yesterday morning in Los Angeles to James N. Hefty, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Hefty of Hamilton, Mont. The couple had adopted the Sikh religion, in which the bride is known as Nav Jiwan Kaur, her husband as Sattara Singh.

title: NEW WAYS URGED TO EXPLORE MARS
description: The next steps in exploring Mars, after the two Viking landing attempts next year, should be orbiting of an observation craft around the Martian poles and several small hardlanding probes, leading scientists have advised the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

title: For the Friend Who Has Everything
description: If this intelligence comes too late to help clients with their ChriStmas shopping, and it does, blame Sakowitz of Houston, a store that specializes in hardtofind goodies for Beautiful People. Sakowitz neglected to mail its holiday catalog to this address, and we might never have known what treasures were advertised therein if The BloodHorse, that informed and informative weekly on racing and breeding, had not listed some of them. Quoted prices seem a trifle steep, but perhaps they have been reduced for January clearance. It Cartier can offer reductions of 25 to 50 per cent on gold baubles and Bergdorf Goodman slash the cost of panty hose, surely Sakowitz can make concessions, too.

title: Advertising
description: Last June Callo & Carroll, a tiny agency with a long history but only $3million in billings, was catapulted into the news with a $5million assignment from Lorillard.

title: Saturday College Scores
description: BASKETBALL

title: Man Spits Out Bullet That Hit Him in Throat
description: A 52year old Brooklyn landlord who was shot in the throat by an irate tenant yesterday managed to spit the bullet out of his mouth, the police reported.

title: Net Title to Dowdeswell
description: Special to The New York Times

title: 9 OIL EXPORTERS SWELL RESERVES
description: Official reserves of nine major oil exporting countries resumed their rapid climb during November, rising by 9.8 per cent to $39.4billion, according to data released by the International Monetary Fund over the weekend.

title: Common Cause Urges Redistricting Reform
description: The New York State branch of Common Cause, the nonpartisan lobbying organization, called yesterday for an amendment to the State Constitution to require that reapportionment of the Legislature be conducted by an independent nonpartisan citizens commission.

title: Maj. Gen. James McCormack, Former Head of Comsat, Dead
description: BOSTON, Jan. 5 (AP)Maj. Gen. James McCormack, chairman of the Communications Satellite Corporation (Comsat) from 1965 to 1970, died Friday at his winter home in Hilton Head, N.C. He was 64 years old.

title: Oil Pipeline Work Set
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) Construction will begin midJanuary on the main portion of the Alaskan Oil Pipeline, the Alyeska Pipeline Service Company reported over the weekend.

title: Christ Church Welcomes Its New Pastor
description: The Rev. Dr. David James Randolph preached his first sermon yesterday as the new minister at Christ Church, Methodist, familiarly known as the cathedral of American Methodism, and got a warm welcome from parishioners.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JANUARY 6, 1975

title: Music: Powerful Artist
South Defeats North, 2822
description: TAMPA, Fla., Jan. 5 (UPI) Freddie Solomon, Tampa quarterback, threw a 26yard touchdown pass to Lee McGriff, Florida wide receiver, with 15 seconds left to lead the South to a 2822 victory over the North in the allAmerican Bowl game today.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Bob Montana, Cartoonist, Dies; Creator of Archie Strip, 54
description: MEREDITH, N.H., Jan. 5 (AP)Bob Montana, who created the Archie comic strip in 1942, died during the weekend while crosscountry skiing near his home here. He was 54 years old and apparently had suffered a heart attack yesterday afternoon

title: Jersey School Tax Given Little Chance Of Senate Passage
EXC.I.A. AIDE CITES JOHNSON AND NIXON
description: PARIS, Jan. 6 (Reuters)Victor Marchetti, a former official of the Central Intelligence Agency, said in an interview today that Presidents Johnson and Nixon had pressed the agency into domestic spying activities.

title: Beame Indicates Troy Is Safe in Council Post
description: Mayor Beame yesterday praised Councilman Matthew J. Troy of Queens, despite their recent disagreements over fiscal matters, and indicated that he would not try to remove Mr. Troy as Council Finance Chairman.

title: Judges for National Book Awards Announced
description: The 10 panels of judges for the 26th annual National Book Awards were announced yesterday by Roger L. Stevens, chairman of the Committee on Awards Policy. The prizesa $1,000 award in each of 10 categorieswill be presented April 16 at Avery Fisher Hall.

title: Explorers Club Opened To Visitors' Exploration
description: The Explorers Club opened its doors, exhibits and some of its secrets to the general public for the first time yesterday, and as visitors gawked among dinosaur eggs and stuffed rhinoceroses, a precious illusion was shattered.

title: College Heads Ponder Athletic Ethics, Costs, Title IX
Egyptians Blame Leftist Extremists for Cairo Riot
description: CAIRO, Jan. 5  The Egyptian police have arrested many leftist extremists in connection with a New Year's Day riot of more than 1,000 industrial workers in downtown Cairo in protest against soaring prices and low wages.

title: RALPH L. FRASCA
description: Ralph L. Frasca, chief engineer of the Nassau Smelting and Refining Company, Richmond Valley, S.I., died Friday of a cardiac arrest in Mountainside Hospital, Glen Ridge, N.J. He was 53 yeas old and lived at 48 Laurel Place, West Caldwell, N.J.

title: Propping Family Income
description: With welfare rolls beginning to duplicate the somber climb in unemployment rolls, it is more necessary than ever that a program for putting a guaranteed floor under family income be included in the economic recovery plan which President Ford is preparing for Congress.

title: Bridge:
description: The second stage of the Grand National team play in New York and Long Island Saturday went almost entirely according to expectations. Thirtytwo teams, survivors from an original entry of 381 teams, won two rounds of knockout play and will compete again on Feb. 22.

title: A 2d Carey Adviser Once Represented Nursing Home Here
Leaders in Congress Say Own Hearings Will Go On
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Congressional leaders made it clear today that President Ford's appointment of a commission to investigate alleged domestic activities by the Central Intelligence Agency would not keep Congress from inquiring into the matter.

title: Assassination: New Jolt for India
Sisters Slain in Bronx; Victim's Husband Seized
description: A 25yearold South Jersey man visiting in the city allegedly shot and killed his commonlaw wife and her two sisters after an argument in the Bronx yesterday and turned himself in at a police station lin Brooklyn several hours later, the mike said.

title: Suburbia Isn't What It Used to Be
description: One certain victim of our times is that previously vigorous and healthy young adult, suburbia.

title: Cholesterol: Not Just a Problem for Adults
description: Eightyearold Seth Rosenfeld and his 5yearold brother, Orin, never touch pizza. Nor do they eat hot dogs, hamburgers, eggs butter, ice cream or canned soup, and they never drink whole milk.

title: Minnesota Prelate Forbids ExBishop To Give a Homily
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 5A former Roman Catholic Bishop, Dr. James P. Shannon, was barred today from giving a homily at a Minneapolis church.

title: Niederhoffer Tops Anderson in Final
description: Special to The New York Times

title: NASDAQ Volume Drops
description: The National Association of Securities Dealers reported that trading volume on NASDAQthe automated quotation system for unlisted securitiesfell sharply last year to an average of 4.7 million shares daily from 6.6 million shares daily a year ago. But only 2,593 issues were listed, down from 2,932 the year before. Active market makers also declined to 391 last year from 495 a year earlier, the trade group reported.

title: COALITION IN BONN VIEWED AS SHAKY
description: BONN, Jan. 5As the fortunes of the West German Government coalition of Social Democrats and Free Democrats continue to decline in publicopinion polls, many voices in this introspective political town are asking how long it will hold together.

title: JACOB GINSBURG
description: Jacob Ginsburg, founder and former president of Gansbury Clothes, Inc., and an apparel manufacturer here for 50 years, died Friday in Brookdale Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 84 years old and lived at 1655 Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: Hunter Downs Yeshiva
description: Bert Lindsay scored 17 points and Guy Hunter 16 as Hunter College defeated Yeshiva, 8662, in a Knickerbocker Conference basketball game at Bowne High School in Queens yesterday. Hunter's wonlost record is 30 in the league and 74 over all.

title: Oil Doves and Hawks
description: WASHINGTON  Transfer of wealth is the euphemism for the successful economic warfare that has been waged on the nonCommunist world for the past fifteen months.

title: Bills Unpaid, Thousands Lose Heating
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 Thousands of Americans probably hundreds of thousands are losing the heat in their homes as winter and economic recession close in.

title: EDMUND M. KOWKABANY
description: Edmund Mitchell Kowkabany, vice president of Burns & Roe, Inc., consulting engineers, and president of Burns & Roe Construction Company, both of Oradell, N.J., died yesterday of a heart attack at his home in Franklin Lakes, N. J. He was 56 years old.

title: $65,000 in Jewels Stolen
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 5 (UPI) The expensive hillside home of a vacationing motion picture executive was ransacked during the weekend by burglars who went after only jewels, the police said today. Investigators said that $65,000 worth of diamonds, emeralds, necklaces and bracelets were taken while David Begelman, an executive with Columbia Pictures, was out of town.

title: Millville Expects Mass Unemployment if Gas Is Cut to Glass Plants in Area
description: MILLVILLEThis South Jersey industrial city of 21,000, heavily dependent for jobs on its big glassmaking plants, is bracing for new layoffs that are expected if a threatened reduction of naturalgas supplies occurs.

title: Aston Martin Reflects Britain's Woes
description: NEWPORT PAGNELL, England  The chill of winter is inside the factory because the heating system was switched off for the yearend holidays. Shiny metal automobile parts are scattered everywhere, waiting for workers to return and assemble them into Sleek new Aston Martin Cars.

title: Another Way: I
description: The readers of The New York Times have been kept so busy worrying about political corruption, drug addiction, environmental pollution, overpopulation and shortages of natural resources that they have probably missed the encouraging news published during recent years.

title: Publisher Named in Dallas
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Klammer Captures 3d Downhillin Row
description: GARMISCH PARTENKIRCHEN. West Germany, Jan. 5 (AP)Franz Klammer set a course record in leading Austria to the top three places today in a men's downhill race counting toward the World Cup in Alpine skiing.

title: Soviet, Citing C.I.A. Surveillance, Charges That U.S. Persecutes Dissidents
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 5The Communist party newspaper Pravda today cited the domestic surveillance scandal involving the Central Intelligence Agency in the United States in an effort to show Soviet readers that the United States was guilty of persecuting dissidents of its own.

title: S. WILLETS MEYER
description: S. Willets Meyer, an executive of the Cord Meyer Company, a familyheld real estate concern, died yesterday in the Community Hospital at Glen Cove, L. L He was 53 years old and lived on High Farms Road in Glen Head, L. I.

title: Troops Called Out in Indian TakeOver
description: SHAWANO, Wis., Jan. 6 Gov. Patrick J. Lucey of Wisconsin tonight ordered out National Guard battalion to cordon off and negotiate with armed Menominee Indians who have. occupied an abandoned Roman Catholic novitiate for a week.

title: BECKER IS JOINING WARBURGPARIBAS
description: A. G. Becker & Co., Inc., following an investment of nearly $25million in European capital, has changed its name to the Becker & WarburgParibas Group, Inc., Paul R. Judy, president and chief executive of the new holding company, reported yesterday.

title: U.S. Finds Few Gold Buyers; Accepts Bids of $153 to $185
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The Treasury put up 2 million ounces of gold for auction to. day but found acceptable bids for well under half that amount.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: PRICES RISE AGAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market rose again yesterday, continuing the trend started last Thursday.

title: A DELAY ON JOBS DENIED BY BEAM
description: mayor beanie yesterday rebutted Federal assertions that the city had been delinquent in administering an emergency jobs program and implied that if the program had been delayed, the blame might rest with the regional office of the United States Department of Labor.

title: College, School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: REDUCTIONS SET IN COPPER PRICES
description: Reductions in the price of copper were announced yesterday by several companies, two in the United States. The Bridgeport Brass Company, a division of the National Distil

title: Carey Picks a Prosecutor For Nursing Home Inquiry
description: Governor Carey will recommend Morris B. Abram, former president of Brandeis University today,. as a special prosecutor to investigate the nursing home industry, an official close to the Governor said last night

title: C.I.A. TOLD TO CURB ACTIVITIES ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The Central Intelligence Agency was, told by a Senate committee today that it must heed new legislation calling for an immediate stop to most foreign C.I.A. operations not solely aimed at the gathering of inteligence.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Jan. 6 (AP)Steve Green scored 26 points, 20 in the second half, as Indiana won its 13th consecutive game by beating Michigan, 9076, tonight in a Big Ten Conference game. The loss was the second for Michigan in 11 games.

title: Fordham Defeated. 9467
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Jan. 6 (AP)Alex English led 15thranked South Carolina to a 9467 victory tonight over Fordham, scoring 21 points and topping all rebounders with 10.

title: Ehrlichman Gains a Delay In California Perjury Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 6 (UPI) John D. Ehrlichman, a convicted Watergate conspirator, won a postpo'nement today of his perjury trial in connection with the breakin at the office of the former psychiatrist of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg.

title: State Agency in Morocco Takes Over Exxon's Unit
description: RABAT, Morocco. Jan. 6 (Reuters)Official sources said today that Esso Standard Maroc, a Moroccan subsidiary of the Exxon Corporation, had been taken over by a Governmentcontrolled agency after the company failed to comply with legislation requiring foreign distributors of oil products to turn over control to Moroccans by Dec. 31.

title: Market Place
description: A week ago in Vail, Colo., President Ford refused to sign a bill that would have put stringent new restrictions on strip minine of coal.

title: Dayton Loses to Houston
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 6 (AP)A freshman, Tony Smith, hit an eightfoot jump shot with 14 seconds remaining tonight to give Houston an 8685 victory over Dayton.

title: CAREY TO PROPOSE CAMPAIGN CREDITS
description: ALBANY Jan. 6Governor Carey, in his first message to the Legislature on Wednesday, will propose an incometax credit of up to $10 a year for political contributions as a way of stimulating public support for political campaigns.

title: Call to Westmoreland Is Promised by Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) President Ford has telephoned the wife of Gen. William C. Westmoreland and promised her he would telephone the stricken retired Army Chief of Staff when he is able to accept calls, a White House spokesman said today.

title: Ken Stabler Freed From W.F.L. Pact
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Jan. 6, (AP)A circuit court judge has released Ken Stabler from his contract with the financially troubled Birmingham Americans of the World Football League.

title: Jersey Votes for Inquiry On Nursing Home Industry
description: The New Jersey State Senate voted yesterday to set up a joint legislative committee to investigate the state's nursing home industry. Senator John J. Fay Jr., Democrat of Colonia, who sponsored the resolution, said he expected the Assembly to approve it next Tuesday.

title: Amnesty Board Plans RadioTV Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6  With the response to President Ford's conditional amnesty program for Vietnam draft evaders and deserters remaining poor and with less than four weeks left to sign up, the Presidential Clemency Board announced today a national ra) dio and television campaign to stir interest in the program.

title: END OF I.U.D. BAN VIEWED AS PERIL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6A member of the advisory committee to the Food and Drug Administration on intrauterine contraceptive devices has protested the agency's action in ending a moratorium on commercial distribution of one such product, the Dalkon Shield.

title: Expiring Amnesty Project Plans TV Plea to Eligibles
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 With the response to President Ford's conditional amnesty program for Vietnam draft evaders and deserters remaining poor and with less than four weeks left to sign up, the Presidential Clemency Board announced today a national radio and television campaign to stir interest in the program.

title: Reece to Cut Force
description: WAITHAM, Mass., Jan. 6 (AP)The Reece Corporation announced plans today to cut back production, clerical and supervisory staffs at its Waltham plant by about 125 employes during the next two months. The plant, which makes apparel manufacturing equipment, currently employs 800 people.

title: Soviet, Reversing Energy Policy, Puts Stress on Coal
description: Soviet economic planners, in a reversal of energy policy, have ordered greater use of coal in the nation's electric power plants to save more valuable oil and natural gas for conversion into petrochemicals and for export.

title: Vast Spill From Tanker Threatening Singapore
description: SINGAPORE, Tuesday, Jan. 7 A Japanese supertanker carrying 237,000 tons of crude oil from the Persian Gulf to Japan ran aground outside Singapore Harbor early yesterday and spilled oil that formed into slicks three miles wide.

title: Carey Picks a Prosecutor For Nursing Home Inquiry
description: Governor Carey will recommend Morris B. Abram, former president of Brandeis University today, as a special prosecutor to investigate the nursing home industry, an official close to the Governor said last night.

title: Expert Finds Hazards on City Roads
description: In November, 1972, Joe Linko was making one of his periodic unofficial inspection tours of the highways in New York City. Mr. Linko makes his living repairing TV sets in the Bronx.

title: ROBERT STUART SR. OF QUAKER OATS
description: Robert Douglas Stuart Sr., a former Ambassador to Canada and retired board chairman of the Quaker Oats Company, died Sunday at his home in Lake Forest, Ill. He was 88 years old.

title: POLICE KEPT FILES ION HOUSTON CITIZENS
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 6 (AP) Mayor Fred Hofheinz said today that the Houston Police Department had compiled dossiers on a substantial number of residents, including United States Representative Barbara C. Jordan, a Democratic member of the House Judiciary Committee.

title: Bias Ruling Ousts Woman Named P.S. 171 Principal
description: The State Division of Human Rights has overturned the appointment of a Puerto Rican woman as principal of an East Harlem public school and ordered her replaced by a nonPuerto Rican man who had contended he was better qualified for the job.

title: KissingerAllon Talk Is Put Off to Jan. 15
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6Foreign Minister Yigal Allon of Israel will come to Washington for further talks on the Middle East with Secretary of Statei Kissinger on Jan. 15.

title: FUTURES IN GOLD SHOW WIDE MOVES
description: Gold futures contracts went through a wide price swing yesterday. The March delivery, which closed Friday on the Commodity Exchange here at $176 an ounce, dropped as low as $167 and then rallied tol close at $175.60.

title: Ethnic Bake and Shake for Carey Draws 2,000 at $100 Apiece
description: Two thousand men and womlen ate bagels, tempura, prosciutto and tacos last night at Lincoln Center, where the Hugh L. Carey campaigndeficitreduction committee played host at its second dinner in two nights.

title: Chess:
description: In their new book, American Chess Masters from Morphy to Fischer, Arthur Blsguler and Andrew Soltis have aptly described Bisguier's playing style as classical. These days, perhaps only Boris Spassky shares Bisguier's love of the formal pawn center and the wideopen attacking play to which it can give rise.

title: Kentucky Downs Georgia
description: ATHENS, Ga., Jan. 6 (AP) Kevin Grevey scored 32 points as ninthranked Kentucky downed Georgia, 9677, tonight in the Southeastern Conference.

title: Jersey Phone Rise
description: The New Jersey Board of Public Utilities Commissioners authorized the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company yesterday to put into effect a 2.8 per cent rate increase amounting to $19.4million under a controversial costadjustment clause. The increase ranges from 13 to 20 cents a month on the basic residential rate. Page 37.

title: CHICAGO GRANTED PLEA ON U.S. AID
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The City of Chicago won a round today in its battle to restore the flow of revenuesharing funds cut off by the United States District Court here Dec. 18.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Here comes Adolfo with his skivvy, on the heels Halston with his skimp. Whatever you call it, it's very short dress. Mini, you might say. Adolfo's friends and followers, who came to see his spring and summer fashion show at the St. Regis hotel yesterday as their first foray into fashion for the new year, managed to take it in their stride. Except for Livia Weintraub who murmured, he must be joking, as the first skivvy came out on the runway. A white knitted dress, rather like a tennis dress, it had red bands at the neck and hem.

title: JERSEY'S SENATE REJECTS SURTAX
description: TRENTON, Jan. 6The State Senate rejected a state surcharge on Federal income taxes here tonight, the proposal for a 5 per cent surcharge losing by a vote of 24 to 15.

title: Municipal Hospitals Staffed 60% by Foreign Medical Graduates
description: Sixty per cent of the residents and internes of New York City's 19 municipal hospitals are graduates of foreign medical schools.

title: Nursing the Politicians
description: The nursing home scandal poses two stern tests for Governor Carey. The first is whether he can set motion an effective, credible and thorough investigation of the problem and the second is whether he can turn this wretched system around so that it serves the citizens of the State of New York rather than a tight circle of selfish, callous traders in human misery.

title: Yesterday's Pesults at Bowie
Yankees Release M'Dowell
description: Sam McDowell, whose wildness prevented him from attaining the pitching stardom many experts had predicted for him, was released by the New York Yankees yesterday.

title: Anaconda Sets Cutback
description: LOUISVILLE, Jan. 6 (Reuters) The Anaconda Company said today that due to decreased demand its aluminum division was (reducing production of primary aluminum at its Columbia Falls, Mont., plant about 10 per cent effective as soon as possible. The plant has an annual capacity of 180,000 tons. Anaconda said no personnel would be affected at this time.

title: Duauesne Beats Canisius
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan 6 (AP) Duquesne University, perfect at the freethrow line and keyed by Roland Jones's 24 points, defeated Canisius, 8474, tonight.

title: New Hampshire Ruled Out of Fight on Senate Seat
description: CONCORD, N. H., Jan 6 (AP) New Hampshire's role in deciding the disputed WymanDurkin race for the United States Senate is over and must now be left to the Senate, the State Supreme Court said today.

title: Lyle Bout Is Dropped,. All Suggests Wepner
description: Hours before Muhammad Ali was to sign a $2million deal to fight Ron Lyle, the champion's manager yesterday canceled plans for the bout scheduled for March 24 at Madison Square Garden.

title: RICHARD A. CORROON JR.
description: Richard A. Corroon Jr., board chairman of the Corroon & Black Corporation, international insurance brokers, died Sunday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 68 years old and had homes here and in Amagansett, L.I.

title: JACKSON LEADING IN CAMPAIGN GIFTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6If campaign dollars were convention delegates, Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington would be the leading candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination in 197g.

title: Hostility Dons Humorous Guise In Nancy Spanier Dances at Pace
description: Manipulative and oppressive hostility coursed through Nancy Spanier's Dance Theater of Colorado program Sunday afternoon at Pace College's Schimmel Center. It assumed a humorous guise in a pas de deux for a sweettalking pig who only wanted to make the swan maiden his dinner and a grim form in a horrid game called Mauvais Jeu.

title: Australian Chief's Paris Visit Ends Rift Over Nuclear Tests
description: PARIS, Jan. 6Prime Minister Gough Whitlam of Australia arrived on an official visit today, marking the end of strained relations between his country and France over French nuclear tests in the South Pacific.

title: Books of The Times
description: Is the very idea of civilization theatrical? Is personality? Which is a richer norm for human naturerealism or romanticism? At what point does honesty become a reductive force? Can the esthetic be divorced from the ethical? If we have no more manners and only a legal morality, how do we arrive at standards for our behavior? In The Changing of the Guard, John Ehle has managed to dramatize these questions in a very pleasing novel.

title: ELDERLY WOMAN FOUND STRANGLED
description: A 72yearold woman was found strangled with a scarf yesterday in her ransacked apartment on the 13th floor of a 21story cooperativeapartment building at 473 Franklin. D. Roosevelt Drive in the East River Houses.

title: Investor Relations Gains
description: The Conference Board said yesterday that a survey among 119 companies, indicated 39 per cent have investor relations managers, as against a finding of such managers among 2 per cent of 196 corporations surveyed in 1967.

title: Pentagon Pushes for a Radar Plane Capable of Directing Air Battles
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 6  Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger is seeking some way to justify to Congress the construction of a squadron of airborne radar command posts that would be the most expensive planes ever built by the Air Force.

title: Ray Morgan, Announcer, Dead; On `We the People, S tudio One
description: Ray Morgan, a television and radio announcer, narrator and actor, died Sunday of cancer in Englewood (N. J.) Hospital. He lived at 92 Howard Park Drive, Tenafly, N. J.

title: Humphrey ExAide Pleads Not Guilty in Election Case
description: Jack L. Chestnut; formerly Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's campaign manager, pleaded not guilty yesterday in Federal District Court to a charge that he had arranged an illegal corporate contribution from the country's largest milk cooperative.

title: 8% JOBLESS RATE POSSIBLE IN 1975, GREENSPAN SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6Alan Greenspan, chairman of President Ford's Council of Ecor nomic Advisers, said today tliat the nation's economic slump could last longer and be deeper than anticipated and predicted that unemployment would approach 8 per cent of the workforce this year.

title: Cagney Wins Temporary Writ To Halt Inaccurate Biography
description: James Cagney obtained yesterday a temporary restraining order in a fight to prevent publication here of an allegedly unauthorized biography that the retired film star contended was full of inaccuracies, falsities and invented dialogue.

title: Gold Price Weakens Further in Europe
description: LONDON, Jan. 6The price of gold declined again today on the European bullion markets as investors awaited the outcome of the auction of 2 million ounces of the metal by the United States Government.

title: Tass Reports Launching
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6 (UPI) The Salyut 4 space station launched Dec. 26 completed its 180th journey round the earth today and is functioning normally, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported.

title: Monk Simons, Tulane Back, Member of Hall of Fame
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) Claude (Monk) Simons, a halfback who ran 85 yards for a touchdown for Tulane University in the first Sugar Bowl football classic, in 1935, died today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Glean in Eastern Standard Time

title: Fans to Vote 11 Awards to Champions
description: Three nominees in each of 11 sports categories were announced yesterday in the third annual Gillette Cavalcade of Champions Awards. William G. Salatich, president of Gillette North America, announced the selections in a news conference at the Plaza Hotel.

title: Burton K. Wheeler, Isolationist, Dies
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) Burton K. Wheeler, 92 years olds, oilie of the most powerful isolationists in the Senate before World War II, died at his home tonight after an apparent stroke, according to a son.

title: Contract Awards
description: A contract for a $150million oil refinery to be built at Bejaia, formerly known as Bougie, Algiers, has been signed by the Algerian Government's Sonatrach Company with the British company, Procon, Ltd., and the Italian company, Technipetrol. The refinery is expected to have an annual capacity of 7.5 million tons a year of Algerian crude petroleum,

title: Quake Jolts California Area
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Jan. 6 (AP)An earthquake awakened residents and rattled windows this morning in the Paso Robles area along the San Andreas fault. No damage or injury was reported.

title: Advertising
description: Two and a half years ago the principals of Killion, Barnard & Oettinger, a ventine capital company, .ere neophytes in the world of magazine publishing. Now, with one successful and growing publication under their belts, they are looking for new publishing fields to continue in 1975.

title: Captain Reported Drowned
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Jan. 6 (AP)The drug smuggling trial of a Florida charter boat captain ended today when the defense announced that he had drowned off a Honduran island on New Year's Eve. Raymond Gary Stansel, 38 years old, had been free on 8500,000 bond since his indictment last June on a charge of conspiracy to import marijuana. The judge said he would ask the State Department to confirm the death.

title: PANEL TO CHECK ON TV COVERAGE
description: TRENTON, Jan. 6Angered by what was described as continuing poor and inadequate coverage of New Jersey news and events, the State Senate today set up a commission to investigate television news coverage by stations in New York and Philadelphia.

title: Channel 68 Off the Air
description: WBTBTV, Channel 68, licensed to Newark as a future pay television outlet, has gone off the air with its experimental signal. A spokesman for the station, which is owned by Blonder  Tongue Broadcasting, attributed the blackout to technical problems that began Dec. 29. He gave no indication when the station would resume operation. The station's telephone has also been disconnected. WBTBTV for several months had been broadcasting syndicated programs and films.

title: Kickers Expecting to Play Key Roles in Super Bowl
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 6 Both Super Bowl teams, the Minnesota Vikings and Pittsburgh Steelers, began the polishing process today for the game in Tulane Stadium here on Sunday that will decide the championship of the National Football League.

title: Garrison at Phuoc Binh Being Shattered by Tanks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Jan. 7 The beleaguered garrison of the provincial capital of Phuoc Binh began to crumble early this morning under the weight of a North Vietnamese tank assault, the Saigon command announced.

title: Inflation Is Termed Step to Bankruptcy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (Reuters)A member of the Federal Reserve Board, Henry. Wallich, warned today that continuing high rates of inflatiop could lead to bankruptcies among United States corporaItions.

title: OTB Outpays Calder
description: It only seemed as if they were giving away money yesterday at Offtrack Betting Corporation offices. OTB, handling action at Calder in Florida for the first time since the thoroughbreds left town, paid $98.80 for $2 to show on H. R. Boy, a 31 morning line choice in Calder's fourth race. At the track, H. R. Boy, who went off at 5 to 1, returned only $4.40 to show. Moreover, the winning horse, Ess Jay's Hope ($43.60 OTB, $37.20 at the track), returned $40.60 to show at OTB but only $9.40 at the track.

title: Dow Jones Index Up 2.66 As Trading Pace Quickens
description: The stock market advanced broadly yesterday in accelerated trading sparked by the Federal Reserve Board's reduction of its discount rate late Friday.

title: In Memory Gifts Helping To Bring Joy to Neediest
description: The memory of an esteemed colleague and the recent death in a schoolbus accident of the tyearold son of another business associate were recalled by the United States Banknote Corporation in a $250 contribution to The New York Times Neediest CaRe_c Fund.

title: Cross Is Eulogized for His Humility
description: More than 300 people attended a brief funeral service yesterday morning for Milton Cross at All Angels Episcopal Church, 81st Street and West End Avenue.

title: Winners Become Losers
description: TRENTON, Jan. 6 (AP)Unclaimed winnings on New Jersey Lottery and horse racing tickets left the state treasury nearly $6million richer in 1974. The bulk of the money$5.5millionwas from unclaimed daily and weekly lottery prizes. Unclaimed horse betting prizes amounted to $356,000.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Off at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 1SOday maturities.

title: Brennan Termed Undecided On Ambassadorship Offer
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) A spokesman for Secretary of Labor Peter J. Brennan confirmed today that Mr. Brennan was considering an offer from President Ford to become ambassador to Ireland.

title: Investigating the C.I.A.
description: The commission named by President Ford to investigate charges of domestic spying by the Central Intelligence Agency would inspire greater confidence if so many its members did not have clot() ties to the national security establishment.

title: Jury Investigating Reports Of Transit Body Payoffs
description: A special state grand jury is hearing testimony that Transit Authority patrolmen and officials were involved in widespread, systematic payoffs to provide protection for merchants and obtain promotions, for themselves.

title: AMERICAN GAS CO. SHIFTS STRUCTURE
description: The American Natural Gas Company announced yesterday that in a move to reorganize its corporate structure and to qualify for an exemption for the Public Utility Holding Company Act, it would distribute the stock of the Wisconsin Gas Company, one of its subsidiaries, to stockholders of American Natural Gas.
