description: For the last two years, Paula Goldstein has been working with the multihandicapped children of Intermediate School 237 in Queens, cheerfully prodding them through laborious exercises, devising equipment to enable them to get maximum use unresponsive limbs and gently encouraging them to talk from their unresponsive limbs and gently encouraging them to talk about their agonizing problems of social adjust

title: The Threshold Year
description: The turn of the year takes men and nations to the fourthquarter as well as to the final quarterpole of the twentieth century: It's stocktaking time and a wild horse race,

title: Prices for Bonds Show Improvement
description: Prices showed improvement yesterday in the Government, corporate and municipal bond markets, but trading was quiet and the extent of the gains disappointed some participants

title: Nevada Gold Sets Mark
description: RENO; Jan. 6 (UPI)Gold production in Nevada reached a record total of $47.5million in 1974, compared with $25million in 1973. The Nevada Bureau of Mines and Geology said the increase was due to more ounces of gold being mined as operators watched the price of gold climb sharply during the year.

title: Arts Policy Council Is Proposed for State
description: Arts Policy Council Is Propose for State

title: Tax Lien Slapped On W.H.A. Stags
description: DETROIT, Jan. 6 (AP) The Internal Revenue Service said today it had filed a Lein for $177,870 against the Michigan Stags of the World Hockey Association.

title: Jersey's Senate Rejects Surcharge on Income Tax
description: TRENTON, Jan. 6The State Senate rejected a state surcharge on Federal income taxes here tonight. The proposal for a 5 per cent surcharge lost by a vote of 24 to 15.

title: U.S. Allots $787Million To Provide Jobs for Idle
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The Department of Labor allotted today to state and local governments $787million in Federal funds to provide 100,000 more public service jobs, although more than 100,000 similar positions are unfilled.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Du Pont Company Denies Intervening In Papers Policies
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Jan. 6 The Du Pont Company denied today that it has intervened or wishes to intervene in the editorial processes of the Wilmington newspapers  both of which are controlled by the company.

title: 12,000 Black Workers Strike Big South African Gold Mine
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Jan. 6Twelve thousand black mine workers went on strike today at the world's biggest gold mine, Vaal Reefs, after rioting that left a man dead and four critically injured.

title: Pro Basketball Scoring
description: N.B.A. LEADERS

title: Curran Names Potter Aide
description: United States Attorney Paul J. Curran announced yesterday that he had named Gregory J. Potter as his administrative assistant. Mr. Potter, a graduate of Fordham College and Fordham Law School, was a former United States Magistrate and later a special counsel to the State Commission of Investigation. The 43yearold lawyer has been an assistant United States Attorney since last May.

title: Opening Victory To Chris Evert
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 6 (AP)  Chris Evert, seeded first, defeated Ingrid Bentzer of Sweden, 62, 61, tonight in the opening round of the $75,000 Virginia Slims tennis tournament, the first on the winter circuit.

title: 2 Armed Youths Killed, 3d Shot As Bronx Police Halt Their Car
description: Two young armed men were killed and a shotguncarrying member of a Bronx youth gang was seriously wounded last night by police gunfire touched off when the victims attempted to flee during a routine traffic check near the Bronx Zoo.

title: British Soccer Standing
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Nuclear Fuel Plant Disturbs Its Neighbors
description: CIMARRON, Okla., Jan. 6 Many of the people who live in this rural section of Oklahoma drive a little faster when they go up or down State Highway 74 in the vicinity of the Cimmaron River.

title: SCHOOLS WILL LET ATTRITION SHRINK TEACHING STAFFS
description: The Board of Education, which was ordered by Mayor Beame to lay off 995 teachers and other employes as part of an effort to reduce the city's budget deficit, will dismiss no ?mployes, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: CHARLES MEANS, 62, BOY SCOUTS OFFICIAL
description: Charles E. Means, national director of manpower for the Boy Scouts of America, died Sunday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 2400 Johnson Avenue, the Bronx. He was 62 years old.

title: Women Are A Problem To N.C.A.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 Title IX of the Congressional Education Amendments has members of the National Collegiate Athletic Association confused, scared and talking constantly. It's the hottest and also the most unpopular topic at the 69th annual N.C.A.A. convention this week

title: Misconduct Trial Of Camden's Mayor Will Begin Today
description: TRENTON, Jan. 6Mayor Angelo J. Errichetti of Camden, a power in the state Democratic party since he became Camden party chairman in 1965, is scheduled to go on trial here tomorrow before Superior Court Judge George Y. Schoch on charges of conspiracy and misconduct while he was Camden's Director of Public Works.

title: VATICAN DOCUMENT DISAPPOINTS ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 6 (UPI) Yitzhak Raphael, the Israeli Minister of Religious Affairs, said today that a Vatican document espousing CatholicJewish reconciliation had failed to go far enough to mark a significant change in the historic attitude of the Roman Catholic Church toward Judaism.

title: Article 1  No Title
Jersey Votes for Inquiry On Nursing Home lndustry
description: The New Jersey State Senate voted yesteraay to set up a joint legislative committee to investigate the state's nursing home industry. Senator John J. Fay Jr., Democrat of CoIonia, who sponsored the resolution, said he expected the Assembly to approve it next Tuesday.

title: Cambodian Rebels Step Up Pressure Around Capital
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Jan. 6The latest military offensive of the Cambodian insurgents continued today within earshot of Phnom Penh, as the Communistled rebels seemed to be opening a new front south of the capital.

title: South Vietnamese Losing Phuoc Binh, First Provincial Capital to Fall Since 72
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Jan. 7 The beleaguered garrison of the provincial capital of Phuoc Binh began to crumble early this morning under the weight of a North Vietnainese tank assault, the Saigon command announced.

description: A lawsuit was filed yesterday; by the American Film Theater, Inc., charging that major Motionpicture companies had conspired to violate antitrust laws by threatening by boycott or blacklist exhibitors who presented the plaintiff's TheateronFilm series.

description: RADIOWMCA. 8 P.M.

Memorial Service
description: EINFELDS. Charles. Memorial services are being held Wednesday, January Btr, at 11:30 A.M. at Mr. Lebanon Cemetery, Glendale, Queens, Block 17, Section B.

title: Police Defer Date For Salary Higher ThanFire Fighters
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association backed down yesterday from its demand for an immediate salary increase higher than the one the city has agreed to give to 11,000 firemen.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: IOWA CITY, Jan. 6 (AP) Led by the scoring and rebounding of 611 John Garrett, Purdue handed Iowa its first Big Ten Conference loss by a 6354 score tonight.

title: Environmental Report Backs Kennedy Library
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 6 (AP)The environmental impact statement for the proposed John F. Kennedy Presidential Library says that the complex should have a minimal adverse impact on the Harvard Square area.

title: Scott Ranked No. 1
description: For the third consecutive year, Gene Scott of New York has been ranked No. 1 in the men's 35 tennis division, the United States Lawn Tennis Association announced yesterday.

title: Ballet: Fine Baryshnikov And Makarova in `Giselle
description: Natalia Makarova made her first appearance as Giselle, at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, in the summer of 1961 when the Kirov Ballet was paying its first visit to London. Even at this debut it was apparent that Miss Makarova was destined to become one of the great interpreters of the role. That promise has now been made remarkably good. She has become one of the loveliest Giselles of modern times, refined, ethereal, rapt, and totally spiritual.

title: Swiss Bolster Dollar
description: GENEVA, Jan. 6The Swiss National Bank bought dollars in the foreignexchange market today for the first time in two years in an attempt to prop up, the sagging United States currency.

title: APPROVAL IS SEEN ON OILFUND PACT
description: PARIS, Jan. 6A European monetary official said today that the $25billion financial safety net suggested by Secretary of State Kissinger for oilconsuming countries had strong chances of approval in principle at a ministerial meeting in Washington Jan. 14.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Panel Urges Revision of Taxes To Finance Connecticut Schools
description: HARTEORD, Jan. 6A state legislative commission decided tentatively today to propose that an education equalization program be instituted gradually and cautiously, and that the existing tax structure in the state be revamped to spread more equitably the burden of paying for education.

title: Business Briefs
description: F.T.C. Challenged on Disclosure Move

title: 800 Retarded Left Without Services as Strike Begins at 15 Centers
description: Some 800 retarded children and adults were without personal services yesterday when 120 teachers, counselors and training supervisors went on strike in 15 centers in a dispute over wage increases and other issues.

title: Diplomats in Moscow Be Rumors on Brezhnev
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6The first week of the New Year has, brought Moscow flurries of wet snow, influenza and rumors about the medical and political health of the Soviet party leader. Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: HELEN G. DANIELS, 76, CIVIC WORKER, DEAD
description: Helen Green Daniels, civic worker and historian, died Sunday at Danbury Hospital in Connecticut; She was 76 years old and lived at 5 Coulter Avenue, Pawling, N.Y.

title: Successful TruckBill Lobbying Included Campaign Fund Drive
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 6 (AP) The bill allowing heavier trucks on the interstate highway system, signed by President Ford Saturday, passed Congress afH ter a lobbying drive that included lastminute campaign contri1 butions to 117 members of the House.

title: Yonkers Results
Counter Stock Prices Revised by N.A.S.D.
description: Overthecounter stock quotations have been revised effective with prices published today, the National Association of Securities Dealers reported yesterday, in a step taken about every six months to reflect demonstrated investor interest.

title: AID FOR RETARDED HELD MISDIRECTED
description: The State Department of Mental Hygiene underspent its state appropriation by several hundred million dollars a year for the last four years, using the money it saved to reduce the need for new state funds rather than for expansion, a state budget official testified yesterday.

title: U.S.Indian FoodAid Pact Snags on Details of Terms
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 6Indian and United States officials are seeking to resolve a deadlock over the terms of American food shipments.

title: OUTPUT LAG SEEN IN WORLD COFFEE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) World coffee production this season will be down slightly from estimates made last fall, but the harvest still will be the largest in a decade, Agriculture Department figures indicate.

title: COLEMAN B. M'GOVERN
description: Coleman B. McGovern, a member of the New York Stock Exchange from 1916 to 1971, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, while vacationing in Bermuda. He remained a limited partner in the brokerage firm of Prescott, Ball & Turben. He was S3 years old and lived at 1160 Park Avenue.

title: Use of Natural Rubber Seen Rising 3% in 75
description: AKRON, Ohio, Jan. 6 (Reuters)  Worldwide natural rubber consumption should climb 3 per cent to a record total of 7.72 billion pounds in 1975, according to the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company.

title: Singapore Menaced By a Vast Oil Slick As Tanker Grounds
description: SINGAPORE, Tuesday, Jan. 7 A Japanese supertanker carrying 237,000 tons of crude oil from the Persian Gulf to Japan ran aground outside Singapore Harbor early yesterday and spilled oil that formed into slicks three miles wide.

description: When The Ascent of Man has its United States premiere at 8:30 tonight on the Public Broadcasting Service, it will be required viewing for about 25,000 people in all parts of the country. That is the estimated number of students enrolled at more than 200 colleges and junior colleges in credit courses based on the television series created by the late Dr. Jacob Bronowski. The series traces the history of Western culture through science.

title: Burton Wheeler Dies
description: Burton K. Wheeler, leading isolationist in the Senate before World War II, died in Washington at the age of 92. The Montana Democrat served four terms as a Senator, first being elected in 1922. He was active as a lawyer in Washington until his death. Details will be found on Page 36.

title: Italians 1, 2, 3 in Slalom
description: GARMISCH  PARTENKIRCHEN, West Germany, Jan. 6 (AP)  Piero Gros led Italian skiers to the first three places in a men's special slalom today and captured his third event in the present World Cup series.

title: A BOSTON MOTHER PLEADS FOR PEACE

description: The Health Department yesterday cited 15 more food outlets as having failed a second HealthCode inspection and Iwarned that violations found on a final inspection could resuit in closing orders.

title: Douglas Is Shifted To a Private Room; Condition Improved
description: Justice. William O. Douglas, alert and showing signs of further improvement in his strokeweakened left leg and arm, was transferred from an intensive care unit to a private room Sunday, a spokesman for Walter Reed Army Medical Center in Washington said yesterday.

title: TUBA RECITAL GIVEN BY HARVEY PHILLIPS
description: Anyone who chooses to give a tuba concert is a dedicated soul indeed; a man who, like Harvey Phillips, plans a series of five in one month has to be obsessed with doing things in denth. Mr. Phillips out on the second of live concerts Sunday night at. Carnegie Recital Hall, featuring himself as solo tuba player. He offered this one in memory of John Barrows, the Trench horn virtuoso who died not long ago.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Andrew W. Mellon Foundation has awarded $200,000 artistic director's discretionary fund to Nina Vance of the Alley Theater in Houston. The grant, a onetime award, is in recognition of the Alley's importance as a leading American theater. It is to be used during the next three or more years in ways Miss Vance, artistic director of the Texas playhouse, feels will be creatively beneficial.

title: LAW SCHOOL DEAN IS NAMED AT YALE
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 6Harry H. Wellington, a professor of law at Yale specializing in labor and Congtitutional issues, was named today as dean of the Yale Law School.

description: The United States Treasury put up 2,000,000 ounces of gold for auction but it found relatively few takers. Only 750,000 ounces were sold, at prices ranging from $153 to $185 an ounce. Page 43.

title: A DELAY ON JOBS DENIED BY BEAME
description: Mayor Beame yesterday rebutted Federal assertions that the city had been delinquent in administering an emergency jobs program and implied that if the program had been delayed, the blame might rest with the regional office of the United States Department of Labor.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 President Ford has signed bills honoring former Presidents Harry S. Truman and Herbert Hoover.

title: A State Dept. Aide Is Killed In Vietnam, a Second Lost
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 6 (AP)A State Department man is missing aboard an Airl America plane that disappeared, on a flight over the central part of South Vietnam, and a second was killed in an explosion at his residence on the central coast.

title: Few Bidders Flock To U.S. Gold Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The Treasury put up 2 million ounces of gold for auction today but found acceptable bids for well under half that amount.

title: People and Business
description: Frederic V. Malek, former headhunter for President Nixon, is in the market for a job for himself. The 37yearold Mr. Malek was the last of the H. R. Haldeman management team at the White House to leave after President Ford took over last August.

title: F.A.A., UNDER FIRE, TO BE EVALUATED
description: Aroused by a recent House, committee report assailing the Federal Aviation Administration's record on air safety, thel Transportation Department announced yesterday that it had called an F.A.A. management Meeting for Jan. 15 to take an indepth look at the agency's operations.

title: BIAS RULING OUSTS P.S. 171 PRINCIPAL
description: The State Division of Human Rights has overturned the appointment of a native Puertc Rican woman as principal of an East Harlem public school and ordered her replacement by a white mainlandborn male after ruling that the man had been discriminated against because of his Mace of oriain.

title: GUNMAN SHOOTS 3 IN A GROCERY
description: The manager and two young clerks of an upper West Side grocery store were gravely wounded last night by a gunman who had apparently argued with his victims earlier in the day, the police said.

title: Major Soviet Oil Field Said to Lag in Output
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6 (UPI) One of the biggest oil fields En the Soviet Union has failed to reach its production target and reported a loss in 1974 of $40million, the Communist party newspaper, Pravda, said today.

title: Motorist on the Sidewalk Cuts Wide Swath of Havoc
description: PHILLIPSBURG, Jan. 6 (AP) An Easton, Pa., motorist drove his car onto the sidewalk along South Main Street early today, and according to the police, did the following:

title: Bowie ovens. McCarron wins
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 6All was in order at the Bowie race track today as its meeting got off to a belated start. Originally listed to begin last Thursday, the opening of the 60day session was delayed because of a strike by the Independent Association of Race Track Employes, a strike that also closed down the final program of the Laurel race track card on New Year's Day.

title: Hanoi Defends Drive
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Jan. 6 (Agence FrancePresse)The operations recently launched in South Vietnam by the armed forces of liberation constitute a legitimate right of riposte in defense of the Paris peace agreements of 1973, the Communist party newspaper Nhan Dan said today.

title: Rockefeller Keeps LongTime Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6Several of Vice President Rockefeller's staff members, veterans of his years as Governor of New York who remained on his staff during his year as a private citizen, have taken substantial pay cuts to join his Washington staff, Mr. Rockefeller's press secretary said today.

title: Sakharov's SoninLaw Is Said To Get Threat on Moscow Street
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6Andrei D. Sakharov, the nuclear physicist and dissident, demanded today that the security police cease what he regards as persecution of members of his family.

title: 1798 Wreck Found Off Britain May Yield Ancients Treasures
description: LONDON, Jan. 6  Priceless treasures from a collection of ancient marble vases and sculpture of an 18thcentury archeologirt and diplomat may come to light as a result of the discovery of remains of a wrecked warship in which they sank nearly 180 years ago.

title: In Memoriam
description: CHAPLOWITZJennie. In memory of my dear Jennie. You will always oe in our hearts.

title: Steel Production Off 12% as Year Begins
description: Steel production got off to a slow start this year, with output last week dropping 12 per cent from the yearago level to 2.483,000 tons.

title: Santa Fe Outlays Up
description: Santa Fe industries, Inc., the holding company that owns the Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe Railway, announced yesterday that it plans to spend $255million this year for capital improvements. This compares with expenditures of $250million in 1974. Of this year's spending, about $215million will be for the railway, compared with $160million in 1974.

title: Yesterday's Results at Calder
HOPEFULS SWAMP U.S. RECRUITERS
description: About 500 jobseekers overwhelmed a team of State Department recruiters in the Federal Building yesterday as the recruiters began their annual search for clerks and secretaries to work in Washington and overseas.

title: Black Picture Show, a Tale of Corruption
description: Have no doubt about it, Bill Gunn who wrote Black Picture Show, which opened last night at the Vivian Beaumont Theater for the New York Shakespeare Festival, is a splendid dramatic writer a real Joseph Papp discovery. However, I take leave to question whether in Black Picture Show he has really come to terms with his material. But this is worth discussing.

title: TRUSTEE APPOINTED ON I.T.T. AVIS STAKE
description: Richard Joyce Smith, trustee of the New Haven Railroad, was named yesterday as trustee for the 52 per cent interest in Avis, Inc., of which the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation must divest itself.

title: Germans Intervene Agair
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 6 (UPI) The United States dollar declined today in Europe's foreignexchange markets.

title: BRITISH CAR MAKERS HIT BY CUTBACKS
description: LONDON, Jan. 6 (Reuters) The troubled British car industry was plunged into further gloom today as Chrysler (U.K.), Ltd., Co. announced that it was putting thousands of workers on a threeday week.

title: Together, Spartans Triumph
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Jan. 6 (AP)Lindsay Hairston, who led a player walkout Saturday, led Michigan State with 26 points tonight as the Spartans beat Ohio State 8884, in Big Ten basketball.

title: Carey Names Reid Environmental Chief
description: Governor Carey announced yesterday that Ogden R. Reid the former Republican Representative, Rockefeller administration appointee and Democratic bugernatorial aspirant who threw his support to Mr. Carey three days before the primary was being appointed Commissioner of Environmental Conservation.

title: ISRAEL SAYS SYRIANS BOLSTER GUERRILLAS
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 6 (AP) Defense Minister Shimon Peres of Israel said today that Palestinian guerrillas in Lebanon had been reinforced by Palestinian troops frm Syria armed with missiles.

title: State of the World
description: In recent years, the President of the United States annually, has sent two major messages to the Congress, one on the state of the nation, the other on the state the world. This year, only one is needed. Not since the postwar Marshall Plan days has the free world been so despbrately in need of American help. In a way that has rarely been experienced in the past, the nation and the world confront the same problems. And both look to the President for leadership.

title: Altar Girl Ban Opposed
description: BALTIMORE, San. 6 (AP) The council of a Roman Catholic parish has voted to ask Jor an end to the prohibition against altar girls. Twentythree girls have been serving mass at the church for two years. The vote to forward the request to the Most Rev. William J. Borders, Archbishop of

title: 6 SINGERS TEAM FOR PERIOD PIECES
description: A company of six young singers who call themselves Get Out of My House began yesterday a second engagement of their program of songs of the nineteentwenties, thirties and forties at TheateratNoon in St. Peter's Center, 16 East 56th Street. The 40minute revue will be presented at 12:15 P.M. and 1:15 P.M. through Friday, and it is a performance that is far too good to be passed off as a transient lunchtime tidbit.

title: Changed Discipline Hearings Are Sought by Prison Inmates
description: TRENTON, Jan. 6 (UPI)A group of inmates accused of taking part in a 1971 riot at Rahway State Prison asked the State Supreme Court today to abolish the practice of allowing guards to sit in judgment of prisoners. at disciplinary hearines.

title: New State Mental Health Chief Supports Community Aftercare
description: Dr. Lawrence C. Kolb, in his first official remarks after being sworn in yesterday as the State Commissioner of Mental Hygiene, strongly supported the release of mental patients for rehabilitation in community facilities, but stressed the !Iced for aftercare for such natients.

title: An Open Legislature?
description: An early test of party support for Governor Carey's strong call for integrity in government will be found the response of tle incoming Democratic majority in the State Assembly to proposals for legislative reform.

title: New Yale Law Dean
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 6The wellwishers were on the telephone  former students, highly placed legal experts, judges and government officialsand there was a steady

title: NIXON SEEKS RULING TO KEEP HIS PAPERS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (UPI) Richard M. Nixon's lawyer charging that Congress wanted to inflict a measure of punishment on the former President, asked the United States District Court today for a preliminary injunction against a new law giving the Government control of Mr, Nixon's tapes and papers.

title: C.I.A. TOLD TO CURB ACTIVITIES ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The Central Intelligence Agency was told by a Senate committee today. that it must heed new legislation calling for an immediate stop to most foreign O.I.A. operations not solely aimed at the gathering of intelligence.

title: Kissinger Remark on Force Sparks Wide Speculation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6Military action to solve the oil problem, once a matter for cocktailparty conversation in Washington, has become the subject of serious speculation here and abroad as a result of remarks by Secretary of State Kissinger.

title: Balloon Accident Blocks Ocean Trip
description: SANTA ANA, Calif., Jan. 6 The plans of Malcolm S. Forbes, the publisher, to make the first manned balloon flight across the Atlantic Ocean were dramatically set back today by a predawn launching accident that briefly imperiled his life.

title: Expert Finds Hazards on City Roads
description: In November, 1972, Joe Linko was making one of his periodic unofficial inspection tours of the highways in New York City. Mr. Linko makes his living repairing TV sets in the Bronx.

title: Personal Loans Drop
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6Consumer credit showed a record decline of $402million in November, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: If the Objective Is Good Food, Try Brooklyn
description: Gage and Toliner is to Brooklyn what the Statue of Liberty is to New York Harbor, a 1930 restaurant guide declared, while another guide called it Brooklyn's main contribution to civilization.

title: P.U.C. Allows a 2.8% PhoneRate Rise
description: The Board of Public Utilities Commissioners authorized the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company yesterday to put into effect a 2.8 per cent rate increase amounting to 819.4million under a controversial costadjustment clause.

title: MERRILL RESCUES WEAK TIGOLETTO
description: Robert Merrill has saved many a show in his 30Year career, and at Newark's Symphony Hall on Sunday night, he strode to the rescue of the New Jersey State Opera's uneven production of Verdi's Rigoletto. With smallish hump and minimal limp, Mr. Merrill hardly looked the grotesquely misshapen jester, yet his presence filled the stage, his vocal authority dominated every scene he was in.

title: Committee Considers Questions for Ronan Hearings
description: NEWARK, Jan. 6The New Jersey legislative committee looking into William J. Ronan's fitness to continue to serve as chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey met here today to decide what to ask Dr. Ronan when he testified before the panel, possibly later this month.

title: CLARENCE B. PLANTZ, SAVINGS FUND HEAD
description: Clarence B. Plantz, who retired in 1964 as president of the Savings Banks Life Insurance Fund, died Friday in Long Branch, N.J., where he lived. His age was 75.

title: Brown, Stressing Change From Reagan Era, Sworn In as California Governor
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 6 Edmund G. Brown Jr. was sworn in today as California's 34th Governor, and in a brief inaugural address he presented himself as the opposite of Ronald Reagan, his conservative Republican predecessor.

title: Today's Entries at Bowie
description: BOWIE, MO.

title: MORE COMPANIES SHIFTING TO LIFO
description: Changes to the last in, firstout (LIFO) method of inventory valuation, or extension to other lines, were announced yesterday by a growing list of companies.

title: Hockey, Basketball Standings
description: Nat'l Hockey League

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 7, 1975

title: Woman Is Managing Editor
description: DOVER, Jan. 6 (UPI)Carol Palley, 37 years old, of Newton today was named managing editor of The Daily Advance, a 23,000circulation newspaper based in this Morris County suburb. Rod Odell, the paper's editor, said Mrs. Palley, who first joined the paper in 1966, is the only woman managing editor of any daily newspaper in New Jersey. Mrs. Palley became the paper's chief reporter in 1970 and its city editor in 1974.

title: A Patricia Hearst Seized
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 6 (UPI)A woman arrested on shoplifting charges yesterday had a Social Security card bearing the name of Patricia Campbell Hearst. the missing newspaper heiress. The Federal Bureau of Investigation said that the woman, identified as Helen Castoni, 26 years old, had simply gone to a local Social Security office several months ago and made an application for a card in the name of Miss Hearst.

title: CITICORP REPORTS A 20% RE IN NET
description: Citicorp, the nation's secondlargest banking concern and parent of the First National City Bank, reported yesterday a 20 per cent gain in fourthquarter operating earnings.

title: PRESCOTT COLLEGE BARS REOPENING
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 6Financially beleaguered Prescott College will not reopen for its spring semester, according to a college statement that was sent yesterday to all students and parents.

title: Insurer Will Not Triple Its Malpractice Premiums
description: The Argonaut Insurance Company, which carries medical malpractice insurance for most of New York State's physicians, agreed yesterday to drop its plan to triple malpractice premiums and to keep its nresent rates.

title: Borrowing to Pay Expenses Of Willimantic Ruled Legal
description: WILLIMANTIC, Conn., Jan. 6 (AP)The lawyer for this financially troubled city ruled today that the city might borrow money to pay necessary expenses through March 2.

title: Extended Benefits Set For State Unemployed
description: People who have used up their regular unemployment insurance payments and 13 weeks of extended benefits may be eligible for up to 13 additional weeks of emergency benefits under terms of an agreement between the New York State and United States Department of Labor.

title: Fall Biggest Since 58
description: DETROIT, Jan 6A dismal December sales record was reported today by automobile manufacturers, capping a year that brought a sales decline of 23 per cent, the sharpest yearly drop since the 1958 recession.

title: TWO GENERALS DIE IN ARGENTINE CRASH
description: TUCUMAN, Argentina, Jan. 6 (AP)  Two Argentine army generals and 11 other military officers died when their twinengine plane crashed and burst into flames about 35 miles from Tucuman in northwest Argentina during a heavy rainstorm, the authorities said today.

title: Notes on People
description: Former Mayor Robert F. Wagner and Phyllis Fraser Cerf, the author, are planning to be married at the end of the month, according to friends, who say tjiey will honeymoon in the Caribbean.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: A Blue Ribbon Goat
description: The blue ribbon commission appointed by President Ford to protect the public against dothestic spying by the C.I.A. looks suspiciously like a goat set to guard a cabbage patch. Having the C.I.A. investigated by such a group is like having the Mafia audited by its own accountants.

title: EDUCATION BOARD SEEKS COURT HELP
description: TRENTON, Jan. 6 (UPI)The New Jersey School Boards Association asked the State Supreme Court today to come to the rescue of 123 districts threatened with the loss of state aid under a plan proposed by Governor Byrne.

title: Amex Lists Stocks Slated for a Start In Option Dealings
description: The American Stock Exchangepreparing for the start of trading in stock options next Monday  released yesterday the names of the first six stocks in which trading will begin.

title: George Best Is Due Tomorrow For Negotiations With Cosmos
description: When it comes to George Best, the man with the good looks and great soccer abilities, no one can tell what his next move will be.

title: SKYLAB ROCKET DUE TO RETURN TO EARTH
description: The 83,500pound Saturn upIperstage rocket that thrust the Skylab space station into orbit in May, 1973, is expected to reenter the atmosphere late this week and break up, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said yesterday.

title: DisclosureLaw Exemption Approved by State Senate
description: TRENTON, Jan. 6 (AP) The State Senate approved legislation today to exempt most schoolboard candidates from the reporting requirement of the state campaign disclosure law.

title: Wilson's Death: Monoxide
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 6 (AP) Don Wilson, the Houston Astros 29yearold pitcher, and his 5yearold son, Alexander, died of carbon monoxide poisoning, Dr. Joseph Jachimcyzk, Harris County medical examiner, found today.

title: Indiana Beats Michigan
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 6 (UPI)  James Silas and Rich Jones scored a combined total of 67 points and the San Antonio Spurs defeated the Utah Stars, 11392, in tonight's only game in the American Basketball Associatinn

title: Mace Keeps the Vikings Relaxed
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 6  Perhaps the warm sun thawed the Minnesota Vikings today as they posed for photographers in the annual initial rite of Super Bowl week. The Vikings pose well. Offense over here! a man shouted. Defense over there! And they obliged, like so many purple seals. But up to now, posing has been the extent of the Vikings contribution to Super Bowl history. They are the only team that hasn't won the Super Bowl on at least its second try. They were here four

title: TV: Ascent of Man, a Milestone in Programing
description: B.13:C.'s 13Part Series Is Massive in Scope

title: Article 2  No Title
Soviet Calls Response To Kissinger Stormy
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6 (AP) The Soviet press reported today that Secretary of State Kissinger's refusal to rule out force in dealing with Middle East oil problems had caused a stormy reaction in the world.

title: Tanzanian Leader And Briton Discuss A Rhodesia Accord
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Jan. 6 (Reuters)Foreign Secretary James Callaghan of Britain conferred today with President Julius K. Nyerere of Tanzania, winding up his consultations with African leaders directly involved in the latest search for a Rhodesia settlement.

title: Retailers Map AntiInflation Tactics
description: After a year in which department store volume apparently rose at about the same rate as the 10 per cent inflation rate for general merchandise, many merchants are basing their plans on smaller sales increases in 1975.

title: O.A.S. Meeting Is Sought On Aggression by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (Reuters)Venezuela and Ecuador today called for a special session of the Organization of American States to discuss United States economic aggression against Latin America.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Tax Plan: Heavier on Gas, Easier on Income

title: Three or None
description: Midafternoon on a recent holiday. A dejected group of wouldbe passengers has been waiting, in a cold and penetrating drizzle, for an 86th Street crosstown bus for well over fifteen minutes. At last a bus arrives, instantly followed by a second and an empty third.

title: 40 Reported Drowned In Heavy Thai Rain
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Tuesday, Jan. 7 (AP)Forty people were reported drowned and six missing in three southern provinces of Thailand as torrential rains continued today for the fifth day.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: POETS CORNER When winter tightens its grip on the city, there are some who turn to spirits to warm their flesh and others who turn to poetry to warm their souls. For the poetry fanciers, the attraction tonight at 7 o'clock is the Donnell Library Center, 20 West 53d Street, where not one but four poets will be on hand to read from their works.

title: SIMON SAYS PLAN OF FORD IS TOUGH
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 6 (AP)Treasury Secretary William E. Simon predicted that President Ford would announce a tough, comprehensive and effective new economic program later this month that would require personal sacrifices in energy consumption.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 7, 1975

title: Manoff Agency Gains Second SCM Account
description: Richard K. Manoff, Inc., must really be plugged in with the SCM Corporation. It has just gotten an additional assignment: the ProctorSilex Group of the consumer products division. The billings are about $2million a year, whcih is something to perk about.

title: Gage and ToLiner: A Quiet Elegance
description: The restaurant business, by its very nature, is transient. And the landmarks business, by its nature, is intended to be rather permanent. So it is rare when the two coincide, as they do at Gage & Tollnerthe 95yearold Brooklyn seafood house that is only the second restaurant in New York to be named a city landmark. (The first was Fraunces Tavern, which isactually newerit is a 1907 reconstruction of a !Georgian building.)

title: Deaths
description: ABRAHAMRobert. The Supervisors of District No, 30, Queens, records with profound sorrow the death of our Chairman of the Council of Supervisors Assn. Mr. Robert Abraham's devoted work touched the lives of every child and teacher in the district. His integrity left us a legacy of faith and compassion. We otter our sincere condolences to his family.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. Jan. 6 (UPI)  Charles Russell pumped in 28 points tonight to lead sixthranked Alabama over Tennessee, 8278, for its second Southeastern Conference victory.

title: Hot Winds Ruffle No Oil
description: The Ford Government's verbal blitzkrieg on the oil problem recalls the story a Middle Western Congressman once told me about addressing a soured group of his constituents who were of Central European extraction.

title: CAREY TO PROPOSE CAMPAIGN CREDITS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6Governor Carey, in his first message to the Legislature on Wednesday, will propose an incometax credit of up to $10 a year for political contributions as a way of stimulating public support for nolitical camoaiens.

title: Ford's Critical Slip
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)With a slip of the tongue, President Ford criticized his performance on the job today.

title: CLARENCE E. FICKEN
description: Clarence E. Ficken, former dean at Ohio Wesleyan University and Macalester College, died Saturday at a nursing home in Sandy Spring, Md., at the age of 80.

title: Asia Society Plans to Build on Church Site
description: The Asia Society, the cultural and publicaffairs organization, plans to buy and demolish the Central Presbyterian Church at Park Avenue and 64th Street and build new quarters to house the $10million collection of Asian art given to the institution last year by John D. Rockefeller 3d, the society's founder.

title: TRUST VIOLATORS ASKED TO CONFESS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Al highranking Justice Depart1 ment offciial has urged businessmen who have engaged in pricefixing conspiracies or other criminal violations of the antitrust laws to confess to the Government. If they do so, he said, they have a chance of receiving lenient treatment under the new law providing harsher penalties for criminal antitrust violations.

title: Signal Raises Dividend
description: The Signal Companies, Inc., announced yesterday that it was raising its regular quarterly dividend to 221/2 cents per share of common stock from 20 cents share. The dividend is payable March 10 to shareholders of record Feb. 10.

title: Troops at Abbey That Indians Seized
description: SHAWANO. Wis., Jan. 7About 250 Wisconsin National Guardsmen arrived in this farming and dairy region today and positioned themselves on the wooded periphery of an abandoned Roman Catholic novitiate that was seized on New Year's Day by a group of armed Menominee Indians demanding that the facility be deeded to them.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Jan. 7 (AP)The Japan Airlines Company said today it had decided to purchase fewer Boeing 747 jumbo jets than originally expected because of a large deficit expected for the year ending March 31, 1975. JAL officials said the company had scrapped a plan to purchase three Boeing 747 jetliners for domestic and international routes during the year beginning April 1, 1976. They noted that JAL had not placed the orders with the Boeing Company for the three planes.

title: Brazil Joins Wave Of Latin Protests On U.S. Trade Act
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 7Brazil joined other LatinAmerican countries today in attacking import restrictions in the view United States foreign trade act.

title: Controversy Is Stirred Anew Over Tiebreakers in Tennis
description: With the winter circuits just starting, angry voices are being raised again in tennis. The controversy this time has to do with the tiebreaker, invented several years ago by Jimmy Van Alen, longtime devotee of the game, to avoid prolonged matches, which he considered a bore. Now the issue is: Should the tiebreaker take the form of sudden death or lingering death?

title: People and Business
description: Franklin A. Lindsay, the 58yearold president and chief executive officer of the Itek Corporation, is giving up that dual job to become chairman, a newly created post. As chairman, he will be responsible for longrange planning.

title: McAdoo Scores 44 As Braves Triumph
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 7 (AP)The Buffalo Braves blew a 17point lead in the first quarter, then came back to defeat the Los Angeles Lakers, 115107, behind Bob McAdoo's 44 points and 18 rebounds in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Carey Calls OH Naming 2 For Nursing Home Inquiry
description: Governor Carey abruptly called off the appointment yesterday of two prominent lawyers to investigate the nursinghome industry because one of them decided not to take the job and the other appeared to have an indirect link to the industry.

title: Lebanese and Syrian Chiefs Confer on Defense
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 7The Presidents of Syria and Lebanon met near their common border today and reportedly agreed to cooperate militarily to block any Israeli attempt to occupy southern Lebanon.

title: U.S. Reports Basic Accord On Food Shipments to India
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The State Department said today that the United States and India had resolved in principle problems that had arisen over the terms of American food shipments to India.

title: Indianapolis Trials Back Up to 4 Days
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 7 (UPI)The Indianapolis Motor Speedway said today it was returning to the traditional four days of qualifying to determine the 33car starting field for the Indianapolis 500. Time trials were restricted to two days in 1974 because of the energy crisis. However, a speedway statement said practice hours, similar to last year's, would be curtailed about 50 per cent. Time trials will be held the weekends of May 1011 and May 1718. The race is scheduled May 25.

title: HOSPITAL UNIONIST WINS APPEAL HERE
description: A union leader's conviction on charges of aiding the embezzlement of union funds was reversed here yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: Deputy Police Chief of Kearny Sues for Right to Take Bar Exam
description: NEWARK, Jan, 7 (AP)The deputy chief of police of Kearny, an aspiring lawyer. who %Vas prevented from taking the New Jersey bar examination, filed Federal suit today challenging the American Bar Association's right to set standards for admission to the legal profession in New Jersey.

title: Hediing in South Jersey Gets Proposals to Spur Mental Care
description: VOORHLIES TOWNSHIP, Jan. 7WitneSses at a regional hearing held here today by the State Mental Health Planning Committee offered suggestions for: improving mental health services in New Jersey.

title: FORD SETS CUTBACKS AT PARTS DIVISION
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 7 (AP)The Ford Motor Company has announced that 2,800 workers at its transmission division pl4nt in Sharonville, Ohio, will be laid off for a twoweek peridd beginning next Monday.

title: City Hospitals Set to Open Doors to Private Doctors
description: The city's Health and Hospitals Corporation plans, for the tfirst time, to invite private docors to admit their own patients to the city's 19 municipal hospitals, using these hospital facilities in their practice in an effort to bring new money and talent into the ailing system.

title: DEMOCRATS UNIT TO URGE TAX CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)A multibilliondollar tax cut is the keystone of the antirecession effort being planned by a House Democratic emergency economic study group, Representative Richard H. Fulton, Democrat of Tennessee, said today.

title: Seals Rally to Win
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 7 (UPI)Fred Ahern scored with 4:51 to play tonight, giving the California Golden Seals a 32 victory over the St. Louis Blues.

title: PARENTS HONORED IN AID TO NEEDIEST
description: A family tradition of supporting the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund for the last 35 years was recalled yesterday by Robert S. Greene, who sent $100 and wrote the following:

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM: Sunrise Symphony. Sinfonia in G, Richter; Piano Concerto No. 14 in E flat, Mozart; Don Quichotte Suite, Telemann,

title: About New York
description: I know how busy you are, and how important it is for you to get back, the Mayor said, although the real problem was that nobody was busy enough. The Mayor was having breakfast at Grade Mansion with the captains and kings of the garment industry, and they were all saying that things were bad. They were always saying that things are bad, only this time they looked unhappy enough to mean it.

description: To the Editor:

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: No Title

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Major motionpicture com. panies and theater operators will join to celebrate National Film Day on Feb. 4, which will focus attention on the importance of movies to American culture and provide funds for the American Film Institute.

title: Meskill, Reviewing Term, Cites Frustration Over Bureaucracy
description: HARTFORD, Jan, 7The worst frustratons of office came from his inability to do the things he had the legal and political authority to do, Gov. Thomas J. Meskill said today in a farewell news conference.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Eugenie Ouroussow, Director Of City Ballet's School, Dead
description: Eugenie Ouroussow Lehovich, executive director of the School of American Ballet, the official school of the New York City Ballet, died here yesterday of cancer. She was 66 years old.

title: Gunsmoke Star Challenged for Breeding Cheetahs
description: Amanda Blake, the Miss Kitty of Gunsmoke fame on television, is having some reallife problems these days as a nrotector of wildlife

title: FUTURES IN GOLD SHOW WEAKNESS
description: Expected weakness developed in gold futures prices yesterday, reflecting traders disappointment at the low level of many bids at the Government's gold auction Monday. After a recovery late in the day, closing prices on the Commodity Ex change for the spot January delivery were $172 4/10 an ounce, down $1.

title: Carey Calls Off Naming 2 For Nursing Home Inquiry
description: Governor Carey abruptly called off the appointment yesterday of two prominent lawyers to investigate the nursinghome industry because one of them decided not to take the job and the other appeared to have an indirect link to the industry.

title: EUROPEANS AGREE ON PLAN TO INVEST EXCESS OIL FUNDS
description: LONDON, Jan. 7The nine members of the European Economic Community adopted a united front here tonight in favor of a plan to invest surplus revenues of oilproducing countries through the International Monetary Fund.

title: Rangers LineUp
description: AT KANSAS CITY

title: Article 2  No Title
description: No Title

title: Former C.I.A. Official Asserts That the Postal Authorities Helped Agency Open Mail
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 7A former official of the Central Intelligence Agency said today that when he resigned in 1959 the Post Office Department was covertly assisting the C.I.A. in intercepting and copying the mail of American citizens.

title: CITY STORE SALES DECLINE IN MONTH
description: New York department stores fell behind in their sales in stores within the city but managed a slight gain in suburban branches in the area during December, a survey by The New York Times showed yesterday.

title: Judge in Ohio Refuses To Halt Teacher Strike

title: BOSTON JUDGE BACKS ABORTION CASE JURY
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7 (UPI)An objection that women had not been equally considered for the grand jury that indicted a doctor for manslaughter in the death of an aborted fetus was overruled today.

title: Sid Terris, Prizefighter, Dies; Colorful Lightweight of 1920's
description: Sid Terris, a colorful and speedy lightweight boxer of the nineteentwenties, died Dec. 30 of Parkinson's disease at a nursing home in Miami Beach. He was 70 years old.

title: COMPLAINTS SEEN DUE ON GAS DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI) Federal investigators have moved a step closer to filing complaints against natural gas producers accusing them of holding back information on their gas supplies, sources close to the inauiry said today.

title: NADJARI AIDE SAYS GOLDMAN TOLD LIE
description: The special state prosecutor's office charged yesterday that Irving Goldman, the city's Commissioner of Cultural Affairs, lied when he denied being the president of a dummy candy company, that was set up to funnel thousands of dollars in payoffs to Transit Authority policemen and officials.

title: Stocks Rise Again; Dow Climbs by 3.99
description: The stock market registered its sixth consecutive advance yesterday in a session marred by a trading interruption of 35 minutes shortly after the opening because of mechanical problems.

title: Firestone Plans Layoffs
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., Jan. 7 (UPI)The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company said today it would lay off 230 employes at its plant in nearby lower Potts grove Township, Montgomery Country.

description: British Football

title: Japanese Fear Reaction to Big Oil Leaks
description: TOKYO, Jan. 7  Japanese Government officials and industrialists struggled today with the political and economic consequences of two vast oil slicks, one in the Strait of Malacca near Singapore and the other in the Inland Sea of central Japan.

title: PLAN MTHORIZED FOR BOSTON PUPILS
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7On the deadline for contemptofcourt penalties, the Boston School Committee voted today to authorize the preparation of a desegregation plan without forced busing.

title: THIRD MAN SEIZED IN SWINDLE PLAN
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 7A former convict with a record of two felony convictions became today the third person arrested in an alleged swindle plan aimed at defrauding the city treasury of several million dollars through a complicated checkcashing scheme.

title: Continental Mortgage Sets New Debt Pacts
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7 (UPI)Continental Mortgage Investors, a real estate investment trust, said today it had worked out new agreements for repayment of more than a half billion dollars of debt.

title: BANKRUPTCY SEEN AS INFLATION CURB
description: Movie stars do it, professional football players do it. A du Pont of Delaware has done it, and so has the Penn Central Railroad.

title: Some Aides Fear Ford's Policy On Energy Will Hurt Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Some Administration energy planners say that they fear President Ford's emerging energy policycalling for a $3abarrel tax on crude oilwill send inflationary shocks through the depressed economy, aggravate the recession and possibly provoke new increases in the price of foreign crude oil.

title: Schoenke Has Surgery
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) An offensive, lineman for the Washington Redskins, Ray Schoenke, underwent surgery for removal of cartilage from tne left knee today.

title: SINAI WITHDRAWAL IS OFFERED BY RABIN
description: PARIS, Wednesday, Jan. 8 (Reuters)Israel would be pre. pared to give back most of Sinai, including the oil fields, to Egypt in return for a true peace, Premier Yitzhak Rabin said in an interview published here today in the conservative newspaper Le Figaro.

title: Official Estimates Drop Of 2% in 1974 G.N.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)The output of the nation's economy may have declined overall by 2 per cent last year, which would be one of the worst economic performances in postwar history, a Commerce Department official said today.

title: 900 Prisoners Strike
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind., Jan. 7 (UPI)  Nearly 900 inmates at the United States penitentiary near here staged a work stoppage today, but 400 of them later returned to their jobs. There were no acts of violence. Prison officials said that the strike had apparently stemmed from the death yesterday of an inmate, William Lowe of Detroit. He died of pneumonia.

title: Sinead de Valera, 96, Wife of Irish President
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 7 (Reuters)Sinead de Valera, wife of the retired Irish President, died in a hospital here tonight. She was 96 years old.

title: Music Hath Charms for Children and Others
description: The musically inclined have a midwinter treat awaiting them Saturday and Sunday with programs for children, two of which will include performances by the youngsters themselves.

title: Neighborhood: SurprisedRosedale Lays Bombing to a Couple of Nuts
description: It was never like this in London. That's what Ormistan and Glenda Spencer tell each other as they keep watch in their home in Rosedale, Queens, where a pipe botnb did heavy damage on Dec. 31.

title: Bridge
description: A major scandal erupted on the world bridge scene this week when formal charges of illegal communication were made against members of the Indonesian team that captured the Far East championship in Manila a month ago. The targets of the allegations were the brothers M.F. and F.E. Manoppo, who have been controversial figures since Australian players made similar charges against them two years ago.

title: State Senate's Chief Holds Veto Role
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7On the night of last Nov. 5, as Gov. Malcolm Wilson went down to defeat and the Democrats won control of the State Assembly, a trim, grayhaired man whose name few people outside the world of politics would recognize suddenly became the most powerful Republican in the State of New York.

title: A Deaf Child Finds His Better World in a Normal School
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y.Steven Bock's parents have long forgotten the name of the doctor who first diagnosed his deafness. They call him Dr. Clicker because of the sound made by the instrument he held the baby's ears.

title: Angolan Breakthrough
description: With help from President Kenyatta in Kenya, three Angolan African liberation movements long at bitter odds have finally hammered out a common platform for negotiating the territory's political future with Portugal. If adhered to the agreement will immeasurably improve the chances for Angola's orderly transition to independence, probably before the end of 1975, and enhance prospects for peaceful political evolution elsewhere in southern Africa.

title: 2 Workers Killed in Clash At South African Gold Mine
description: ORKNEY, South Africa, Jan. 7 (Reuters)Two black African workers died in disturbances at a gold mine here last night, bringing the death toll since trouble started last Sunday to Four, a mine spokesman said today.

title: 3,000 AT FUNERAL FOR SLAIN OFFICER
description: HICKSVILLE, L.I., Jan. 7Michael W. Mc Connon. the New York City police officer who was shot and killed last Friday while attempting tc thwart a holdup, was buried today after services attended by Mayor Beame, City Council President Paul O'Dwyer and 3,000 policemen.

title: Average Set at Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 7The General Services Administration estimated today that the weighted average price of the gold sold by the Government at auction yesterday was $165.65 an ouncenot far below the

title: Single Taxpayers Renew Their Fight To Equalize Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)A campaign to end the difference in the incometax rate of the single and the married will be renewed when Congress returns next week.

title: Wheeling Steel Is Selling Unit to a German Concern
description: The Wheeling  Pittsburgh Steel Corporation announced in Pittsburgh yesterday that it had signed an agreement to sell its Thomas Strip division in Warren, Ohio, to Hille & Muller of Diisseldorf, West Germany. Terms of the transaction, which is expected to be closed next June, were not disclosed.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: Blazer Stock Bought
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 7 (AP)Larry Weinberg has become principal owner of the Portland Trail Blazers by buying some of the stock held by Herman Sarkowsky, the former president of the National Basketball Association team. A spokesman for the team said today that formal approval of the change was expected next week at the N.B.A. meeting in Phoenix, Ariz.

title: Yonkers Raceway Results
description: Yonkers Raceway Results

title: Cautious Economists
description: Professors of the Dismal Science, wrote Thomas Carlyle. in 1850, I perceive that the length of your tether is now pretty well run; and that I must request you to

title: MUSLIM SENTENCED TO 140 YEARS IN JAIL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)A minimum sentence of 140 years has been imposed against a reputed leader of a band of Philadelphia Black Muslims convicted of slaying seven Hanafi Orthodox Muslims here two years ago.

title: Capitals Play 33 Tie With Bruins
description: LANDOVER, Md., Jan. 7 (UPI)  Pete Laframboise scored at 3:50 of the third period to give the Washington Capitals a 33 tie with the Boston Bruins in the N.H.L. tonight.

title: The `Ice Capades at 35.
description: Like C. hardy perennial blooming somewhere between The Nutcracker and the circus on the seasonal calendar of entertainment, the Ice Capades burst into full flower last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: District 4 Board Sees State Biasin Principal's Ouster
description: The Community School Board for District 4 accused the State Division of Human Rights yesterday of a new form of discrimination and of exceeding its authority in ordering the removal of a Puerto Rican woman principal in the district.

title: Commission Authorized By 1907 Moreland Act
description: The Moreland Act of 1907 gave the Governor the authority to appoint one or more commissioners to investigate and report to him on any situation involving a New York State agency. The act was named after its sponsor, Sherman Moreland, a Chemung County Assemblyman from 1903 to 1907.

title: Jose Duran Keeps Title
description: VIENNA, Jan. 7 (UPI)Jose Duran of Spain retained his European junior middleweight title tonight by a unanimous decision in a 15round bout against Franz Csandl of Austria. The highlight of the bout, which was seen by 4,000 fans, came in the 14th round when Duran, with a series of rights and lefts, floored Csandl for a count of eight.

title: BRITAIN REJECTS TALKS WITH I.R.A.
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 7Prospects for a further extension of the Irish Republican Army's ceasefire in Northern Ireland faded slightly today when the British Government refused to consider talks with representatives of the illegal guerrilla army.

title: Broken Foot Sidelines Cays Chones 4 Weeks
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 7 (AP)The Cleveland Cavaliers, who will be missing Austin Carr for six more weeks, announced late today that Jim Chones, their center, would be out of action for at least four weeks because of a hairline fracture in his right foot.

title: Ammons's Sphere Wins Bollingen Poetry Prize
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 7The Bollingen Prize in Poetry of the Yale University Library has been awarded to A. R. Ammons, a 48yearold professor of English at Cornell University.

title: Kissinger to Ask Congress Not to Limit His Flexibility
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Secretary of State Kissinger has told his closest aides that he wants to make a massive effort to persuade Congress to give him more flexibility and end what he regards as unwarranted interference in the Ford Administration's daytoday conduct of foreign affairs.

title: Hockey, Basketball Standings
description: Nat'l Hockey League

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY JANUARY 8, 1975

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: STAR BOUND Tonight begins a new filmlecture series, Beyond Science Fiction, at the American MuseumHayden Planetarium, Central Park West at 81st Street. Here, scimovie fans can watch appropriate movies in the tingling, skylike darkness of the dome and hear authoritative spokesmen on the world of fantasy founded on fact. The programthere are four successive Wednesday features at 7, with short subjectsis a2. result of last summer's popular sciencefiction movie festival at the planetarium.

title: Notes on People
description: Ronald L. Ziegler, press secretary throughout the Nixon Presidency, will soon wrap up his work with the former President's transition team at San Clemente, Calif., and begin a lecture tour for W. Colston Leigh, Inc., one of the country's oldest and largest lecture bureaus.

title: Byrne Seeks State Control Of Atlantic Oil Resources
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 7 Governor Byrne called today fort a program that would result in having states control the potentially oilrich resources of the Atlantic Continental Shelf.

title: Nursing Home Inspectors Tell Hearing of Suppressed Reports
description: Four former nursinghome inspectors for the City Health Department testified yesterday that their highly critical reports on substandard nursing homes had been suppressed by superiors, who renewed the homes licenses over the objections of the inspectors,

title: PointofSale Systems Draw Interest of Merchants
description: Pointofsale systems which one retail executive called the hottest thing going'attracted some of the greatest interest yesterday at the convention here of the National Retail Merchants Association.

description: All Hours Given In Eastem Standaninme

title: 2 Rejects Bounce Back to Super Bowl
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 71f it had been suggested at the beginning of the pro football season last Sept. 15 that Dave Osborn and Rocky Bleier would be starting running backs in the Super Bowl, there could have been only one reaction: preposterous. The odds? 1,0001.

title: A.C.L.U. Official Criticizes Ford on Privacy Bills
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The executive director of the American Civil Liberties Union charged today that President Ford had broken his promise to press for strict laws to protect the privacy of citizens.

title: Lebanese Live in Fear Near the Israeli Border
description: BINT JBAIL, Lebanon, Jan. 7The lonely, potholed road that runs along Lebanon's southern border is a trail of fear and bloodshed for the villagers and farmers who live here within sight of Israel.

title: 10 Catholic TV Stations To Form Instructional Net
description: Ten instructional tielevisior stations licensed to Romer. Catholic institutions in the United States have agreed to form a network for the exchange of programing of cornmon interest. All are stations broadcasting on a special frequency, higher than ultra high frequency, which can be picked up with special receiving equipment at parishes and schools. The special frequency is designated as Instructional Television Fixed Service.

title: Support Offered Abroad
description: PARIS, Jan. 7Despite a re mewed decline in gold prices brought on by the evident reluctance of Americans to snap up the metal. as was expected of them by European speculators, the dollar continued dropping toward new lows today ini Europe.

title: TV: 3 Fine PrimeTime Drama Specials Tonight
description: Perhaps it's as it should be. Tonight CBSTV devotes its three hours of prime time to drama specials. At 8 o'clock there is Antonio and the Mayor, at 9:30 o'clock, Miles to Go Before I Sleep. Both are well produced, competently acted, superior to most commercialTV fare and, ultimately, soothing.

title: Books of The Times
description: The 1974 elections were described by Frances T. (Sissy) Farenthold, chairman of the National Women's Political Caucus, as a breakthrough for women. There were indeed some notable firsts for women politicians: the first woman governor elected in her own right (Connecticut's Ella T. Grasso), the first woman mayor of a city with a population of more than 500,000 (Janet Gray Hayes of San Jose, Calif.), the first woman elected chief justice of a state supreme court (Susie Sharp in North Carolina) and New York's first woman lieutenant governor, Mary Anne Krupsak. Eighteen women were elected to the House of Representativesa recordand 587 to state legislatures, compared to 470 serving before the election.

title: Issue and Debate
description: The investigation that Irving Anker, the city's School Chancellor, has ordered into possible cheating in connection with the annual reading tests adds one more dimension to the controversy that already surrounded the tests.

title: KARYL VAN
description: Karyl Van, a magazine industry consultant, died, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in White Plains on Monday. He was 60 years old,

title: Dr. John F. Oliven, 60, Dies; Psychiatrist and Teacher
description: Dr. John F. Oliven, a psychiatrist, died Monday at Montefiore Hospital, the Bronx. He was 60 years old and lived in CrotononHudson, N.Y.

title: SAIGON'S FORCES LOSE PIE BINH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 7  After a weeklong siege, North Vietnamese forces today overran and captured Phuoc Binh, the encircled capital of Phuoc Long Province.

title: In Danish Elections, High Tax to Pay for the Welfare State Is a Major Issue
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmeriz, Jan. 7Seventeen years ago, as a teenager, Jern Porst went to work for the Danish Distilleries Company as a junior clerk, rose through the ranks in accounts and advertising and won promotion to a major job now paying him about $23,000 a year.

title: Recital: Tobias, Cellist
description: When Paul Tobias made his debut here three seasons ago, his playing was notable for temperament and a highly romantic style. As a drawback there were problems of pitch in the young cellist's technique. In his recital Monday night at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the plus factor remained and the minus factor was considerably diminished. In fact, except where he occasionally slid a tone, the cellist's pitch was seldom flawed.

title: Shenandoah Is Musical of Civil War
description: The traditional American musical, full of high principles and strong ballads, simple truth and simpler sentiments, seem to have passed out of favor in recent seasons. Well, Shenandoah, which opened at the Alvin Theater last night, is an attempt to bring it, back into style. in some respects it succeeds, such as the fine cast, with the superlative acting and singing of John Cullum in the leading role, and in other respects it is less fortunate. But the aspirations are brave and the results, despite a distressing sentimentality, remain lusty.

title: ALBANY HOSPITAL GIVEN $2MILLION
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7Officials at Albany Medical Center today announced the receipt of a gift of more than $2million, the largest single contribution ever received by the 135yearold institution.

title: SAIGON'S FORCES LOSE PHUOC BINH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 7  After a weeklong siege, North Vietnamese forces today overran and captured Phuoc Binh, the encircled capital of Phuoc Long Province.

title: Byrne Wants States to Control Offshore Oil. Resources in Atlantic
description: PRINCETON, Jan. 7Governor Byrne called today for a program that would result in having states control the potentially oilrich resources of the Atlantic Continental Shelf.

title: Beame Acts to Curb Construction Industry Graft
description: In an attempt to eliminate opportunities for bribery and graft in the construction industry, Mayer Beame yesterday directed the Buildings Department to make two administrativs procedural changes.

title: Wilderness Pipeline Route Held Peril to Environment
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)A Sierra Club spokesman said today that a natural gas pipeline across the Alaskan wilderness could cause irreversible and irreparable damage to the environment.

title: Open Interest
Carey, in Message Today, Will Ask Judicial Reform
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7Governor Carey will propose in his State of the State message tomorrow that added funds be devoted to the court system. He will also ask that the Governor, eventually appoint all judges down to the county level and that in the meantime the law, be changed to prevent statewide judicial primary chal. lenges of the sort that saw Jacob Fuchsberg elected as and insurgent to the Court of Appeals this year.

title: Bankruptcy Is Filed For American Beef
description: OMAHA, Jan. 7 (UPI)One of the nation's leading meatprocessing companies, American Beef Packers, Inc., filed bankruptcy proceedings today in United States District Court.

title: Dr. Edward McCormick Dies; President of A.M. A. 195354
description: Dr. Edward J. McCormick of Toledo, Ohio, who was president of the American Medical Association in 1953.54, died there yesterday in St. Vincent Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived in Toledo.

title: Phillips, Dow Jones President, To Be Named Chief in March
description: Warren H. Phillips, president of Dow Jones & Co., Inc., which publishes The Wall Street Journal, will be elected chief executive of the company in March, succeeding William F. Kerby, Dow Jones announced yesterday.

title: In Memorian
description: BENSONEdwin. Always in my thoughts,

title: Led Zeppelin Ticket Sales Stir Crowds and Disorder
description: Inspector Ernest Tucillo of the Third Precinct of The Nassau County Police Department in Williston Park, L. I., said yesterday that it was just a miracle no one was seriously injured among the thousands of unruly fails of the British rock group Led Zeppelin who overran a Ticketron outlet at Roosevelt Field on Long Island trying to get tickets for February concerts.

title: 2 ShortHanded Goals Help Islanders Win, 53
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan. 7 It was a disaster area that Jean  Paul (J.P.) Parise left behind in Minnesota, so it was no wonder that the newest Islander enjoyed the New Yorkers halfhearted 53 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs so much tonight.

title: or Work With Her
description: Up in Boston where the racial atmosphere has been bleak and violent for months, simple, decent human conduct has cast up the first real beacon of hope outside the Federal courthouse.

title: Market Place
description: New York City officials, of course, weren't very happy yesterday afternoon about paying 9.40 per cent to borrow $620million for a year, but the bad news for the city's taxpayers was good news for city investors.

title: Mexican Chief Sees Threat of a New War
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7President Luis Echeverria Alvarez of Mexico says the military and economic policies of the United States and the Soviet Union are dividiing the world and leading to war.

title: New Lawmakers Listen to the Jobless And Union Heads at Trenton Session
description: TRENTON, Jan. 7 (UPI)Anthony and Elizabeth Luca of Mount Ephraim, furloughed from their jobs at an electrical plant in an economy move, today gaVe, their new, Representative On Assemblyline view of life on the unemployment rolls.

title: When Albany Legislature Convenes Today, the Feminists Will be There
description: When the New York State Legislature convenes today, it will find a group of activists waiting to remind it that it has many tasks ahead to better the lot of women.

title: Dividends
description: Dividends

title: A.E. C. Finds Evidence Supporting Charges of Health Hazards at Plutonium Processing Plant in Oklahoma
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The Atomic Energy Commission said today that it had uncovered evidence supporting some of the allegations that there were health hazards at a plutonium fuel processing plant in Oklahoma and that records had been falsified.

title: EUROPEANS AGREE ON PLAN TO INVEST EXCESS OIL FUNDS
description: LONDON, Jan. 7The nine members of the European Ean nomic Community adopted a united front here tonight in favor of a plan to invest surpluS revenues of oilproducing countries through the International Monetary Fund.

title: Opponents of Oil Drilling In California Win Ruling
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 7 (AP) Opponents of new oil drilling in the Santa Barbara Channel have won a major victory with Superior Court Judge Ira Brown Jr.'s decision against oil companies with platforms in the channel.

title: Dumpson Says Recession Will Swell Welfare Rolls
description: The city's welfare rolls, now increasing by 5,000 people a month, will rise by an average of 12,000 a month later this year When the full impact of the current economic recession is felt, Human Resources Administrator James R. Dumpson predicted yesterday.

title: NOMINATIONS MADE FOR LEVITT TRUSTEE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) The Justice Department has submitted two nominations to the judge who will choose a trustee to oversee the divestiture of ITT Levitt and Sons, Inc., from the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Article 1  No Title
description: No Title

title: Odyssey's Founder Ends All Work Here in Protest
description: The founder of Odyssey House, Dr. Judianne DensenGerber, abruptly resigned yesterday as head of all cityfinance, Odyssey House operations in New York City and issued a sharply worded statement against Commissioner Jerome Hornblass of the Addiction Services Agency.
