description: It was never like this in London. That's what Ormistan and Glenda Spencer tell each other as they keep watch in their home in Rosedale, Queens, where a pipe bomb did heavy damage on Dec. 31.

title: Pacers Directors Put Off Sale Again
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 7, (AP)The Indiana Pacers board of directors again put off sale today of the Amencan Basketball Association team. The board and it would make a counter offer to groups bidding to buy the team.

title: PARENTS HONORED IN AID TO REEDIEST
description: A family tradition of supporting the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund for the last 35 years was recalled yesterday by Robert S. Greene, who sent $100 and wrote the following:

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Forward Pass on Madison Avenue
description: For those of you who thought that Alex S. Kroll, Madison Avenue's favorite former football hero, reached a plateau when he was named executive vice president and chief of creativity worldwide of Young & Rubicam International, think again. The 1961 Rutgers AllAmerican is on the move once more.

title: Carey, in Message Today, Will Ask Judicial Reform
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7Governor Carey will propose in his State of the State message tomorrow that added funds be devoted to the court system. He will also ask that the Governor eventually appoint all judges down to the county level and that in the meantime the law be changed to prevent statewide judicial primary challenges of the sort that saw Jacob Fuchsberg elected as an insurgent to the Cburt of Appeals this year.

title: Haden in Phi Beta Kappa
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 7 (AP)Pat Haden, the quarterback who led Southern California to a Rose Bowl victory, was one of 52 students at U.S.C. named today to, Phi Beta Kappa.

title: Computer Failure Halts Trading on Big Board
description: The New York Stock Exchange suffered a computer breakdown yesterday that contributed in part to a sharp drop in trading volume.

title: LyleFoster Bout Off
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 7 (AP)Pete Ashlock, the promoter, announced today the cancellation of the scheduled Jan. 28 heavyweight fight between Ron Lyle and Mac Foster. Ashlock said he was calling off the scheduled 12round bout because Lyle had not returned a signed cohtract.

title: West German Steel Gains
description: DUESSELDORF, West Germany, Jan. 7 (AP)West German companies produced record high amounts of crude steel and pig iron in 1974, the Federal Statistics Office said today. Steel output rose 7 per cent to 53.2 million tens, and iron production gained 9.2 per cent to 40.2 million tons.

title: NEW PHONE. DEVICE SHOWN BY A.T.
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company showed here yesterday a new private branch exchange that features a miniaturized computer with its own memory to perform a variety of new functions for business customers.

title: Deaths of Wilson, Son Still Being Investigated
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 7 (UPI)Homicide detectives said today that they were keeping open the investigation of the deaths of the Houston Astro pitcher, Don Wilson, and his 5yearo1d son because of unanswered questions.

title: Nursing Home Inspectors Tell of Canceled Reports
description: Four former nursinghome inspectors for the City Health Department testified yesterday that their highly critical reports on substandard nursing homes had been suppressed by superiors, who renewed the homes licenses over the objections of the inspectors.

title: Brezhnev's Mother Is Dead; News Is Prominent in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7The Soviet press tonight announced the death of Natalya Brezhnev, the mother of the Soviet party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: Music: Adele Marcus, Teacher, Brings Piano Artistry to Recital
description: Adele Marcus is better known as a teacher of pianists nowadays than as pianist, but her recital at Alice Tully Hall on Monday night showed that her absence from our stages since 1963 has been dictated by choice, not necessity. Miss Marcus is, of course, one of the more successful pedagogues of the day, her former students including Byron Janis, Agustin Anievas and Horacio Gutierrez. She also continues to be a poised, elegant recitalist whose interpretations always sound meticulously worked out and authoritative even when they fail

title: Pentagon Says Congress Must Widen Cambodia Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Without an emergency increase in military aid by Congress, the Defense Department probably will run out of funds to buy ammunition for Cambodia this April, Pentagon officials said today.

title: EgyptianU.S. Ties Assailed by Arabs
description: CAIRO, Jan. 7Secretary of State Kissinger's statement on the possibility of military action against the oilproducing countries has embarrassed the Government of President Anwar elSadat and made the Secretary's mediation efforts in the Middle East more difficult, in the view of the Egyptian Government.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article in The New York Times of Dec. 28, Michael Krinsky, an attorney with the New York law firm of Rabinowitz, Boudin & Standard, was incorrectly identified as an assistant to the firm which represents Representative Michael Harrington, Democrat of Massachusetts, in a suit against the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Central & South West Corporation yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for an offering of 4.3 million common shares. The offering, from the underwriters headed by Morgan Stanley & Co., is expected on Feb. 4. Proceeds will be used to repay shortterm bank or commercialpaper borrowings.

title: The New History': From Top to Bottom
description: BALTIMOREOnly, a decade ago wellsocialized historians in the United States had no doubt what the most importantand prestigioussubjects of study were. Here, as in Britain, history was preeminently the study of great public events (national elections, wars, civil strife, revolutions), largescale transformations (the Renaissance, the Enlightenment, the Industrial Revolution), or great figures in politics, economic life, or the worlds of art and ideas.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: George Best, the English soccer star, has postponed until next Monday his arrival here to discuss a contract with the New York Cosmos of the North American Soccer League. The Cosmos said that Best, scheduled to arrive today, had been delayed by conferences with his publishers in London. Best and his English League team, Manchester United, have not been getting along since his numerous offfield scrapes. Although still on the United payroll, Best has not appeared regularly in the team's lineup and the club is prepared to listen to offers for him. There have been no bidders in England, but the Cosmos, last in their division last year, are interested.

title: Builder With Vision
description: A builder who is also a committed conservationist seems the answer to a Good Fairy wish. It is hard believe in a profitmaking developer who respects nature enough to create both sensitive site plans and successful sales. But the evidence exists that there is at least one such builder in Suffolk County, as reported in a recent Times story.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY JANUARY 8, 1975

title: Mrs. Gandhi Links Killing of Key Aide To Plot Against Her
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 7Prime Minister Indira Gandhi said today that the assassination of her former aide, Railroad Minister Lalit Narayan Mishra, was part of a dangerous plan of which she was the real target.

title: Knicks Beaten, 106 to 92
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 7A sixgame, crosscountry trip started badly for the New York Knicks tonight as they lost to the Portland Trail Blazers, 10692  their fifth straight loss here in the Memorial Coliseum over a span of three seasons.

title: Excerpted Affidavit In Goldman Inquiry
description: Following are excerpts from the affidavit filed by the office of Maurice II. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, in which arguments are advanced to Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh to direct Irving Goldman to comply with a subpoena to turn over financial records and to grant Mr. Nadjari permission to resume his grandjury inquiry into Mr. Goldman's companies:

title: Pearl Lang's Possessed Has World Premiere at Y
description: Rerely nas a cnoreographer exhibited such feeling for her material as has Pearl Lang in the threnody of a ballet that she has lust based upon the play The Dybbuk. The Possessed, as she calls her fullevening moderndance work, was given its premiere on Mon day night at the Kaufmann Concert Hall by Miss Lang's dance company.

title: Brooklyn Democrat Takes Over Vowing to Reduce Dominant Role of Speaker
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7The occasional butt of Perry B. Duryea's frosty hauteur when the Republicans ran the Assembly, Stanley Steingut says he sees no need to wield autocratic authority as Speaker now that the Democrats are in charge.

title: The StripedPants Girls
description: NICE, France  One littlenoticed revolution in American bureaucratic life has been the swift emergence of the United States female diplomat. Within the brief period 19711974 the number of women Foreign Service officers enrolled in the State Department and the U.S. Information Agency has tripled, rising from 4.9 per cent to 15 per cent.

title: Yesterday's Results at Calder
description: Yesterday's Results at Calder

title: New Orleans Game Plan Offers Super Party and All That Jazz
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 7For those with pull, the Super Bowl Party has become as important as the Super Bowl Game. The Party is held every year on Friday night preceding Sunday's game, and its popularity has brought logistical problems to the sponsor, the National Football League, and the ostensible host and hostess, Commissioner Pete Rozelle and his wife, Carrie. The problem is to find a hall large enough to contain the guests, which this year will number about 2,000.

title: Camden Mort gage Concern and 3 Aides Charged in $1.4111 illion Federal Fraud
description: NEWARK, Jan. 7The Asso ciated East Mortgage Company of Camden and three of its em ployees were indicted here today on charges of submitting false and forved documents to defraud the Federal Govern ment of $1.4million.

title: Roadrunners Beat Toros, 32
description: TORONTO, Jan. 7 (UPI)John Migneault's breakaway goal at 11:16 of the third period tonight proved to be the winner as the Phoenix Roadrunners defeated the Toronto Toros, 32.

title: N.C.A.A.'s Plan Draws Criticism
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 7 (AP)The Association for Intercollegiate Athletics for Women accused the National Collegiate Athletic Association of athletic piracy today because of the N.C.A.A. plan to establish a national championships program for women.

title: Burton K. Wheeler, Isolationist Senator, Dead at 92
description: Burton K. Wheeler, a powerful voice in the Senate against intervention in World War II, died late Monday night, apparently of a stroke, in his home in Washington. He was 92 years old.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A civil rights bill for mental patients that is intended to guarantee adequate care and training and protect their right to vote has cleared the Legislature and gone to Governor Byrne. The Senate approved the bill 370.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: 5 Murders Are Admitted By Accomplice of Campisi
description: TRENTON, Jan. 7John P. Tully, accused of being a gangland killer and drug smuggler, pleaded guilty in state and Federal courts today to all charges against him and agreed to turn state's evidence in the trial of members and associates of the Campisi family.

title: Fracas at Boston Garden
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7 (AP)More than 2,000 young people waiting to buy tickets to a rock concert staged a beerdrinking bottlethrowing spree early today that caused $50,000 to $75,000 damage at Boston Garden, officials reported. The police were summoned and put down the trouble, confiscating a number of knives. No arrests were reported. Injuries were confined to cuts and scratches.

title: LIFO ACCOUNTING SET BY MORE COMPANIES
description: Several more companies announced yesterday changes to lastin, firstout (LIFO) inventory accounting, a method that reduces earnings, at least in the short term. but also cuts the concern's income tax liability.

title: Gas Complaints Due
description: Federal investigators have moved a step closer to filing complaints against natural gas producers accusing them of holding back information on their gas supplies, according to sources close to the inquiry. Details on Page 54.

title: Guards in Rahway Queried On Visit by 2 Slain Girls
description: WOODBRIDGE, Jan. 7 (AP)Detectives here were checking a report today that two Colonia teenagers whose bodies were found on Dec. 27 had visited Rahway State Prison shortly before they disappeared.

title: U.S. DROPS CHANGES IN PEANUT PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) The Agriculture Department has dropped 11 tentative plan to make administrative changes in the 1975 peanut program, including a ban on the transfer of farm acreage allotments, a spokesman for the department said today.

title: Today's Entries at Bowie
description: Today's Entries at Bowie

title: CITY TO PAY 9.4%, 1HIGHEST RATE, ON 1YEAR NOTES
description: The city reluctantly accepted a 9.4 per cent interest rate yesterday on $620million worth of shortterm notes, the second highest interest rate it has ever had to pay to borrow money. Mayor Beame and Controller Harrison J. Goldin denounced it as unfair, unwarranted and outrageously high.

title: 2 JERSEY OFFICIALS VISIT NURSING HOMES
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Jan. 7The state's Director of Criminal Justice, Mathew Boylan, and a health department official made the first surprise inspection of a nursing home here today as part of a widening investigation of the industry in New Jersey and after the tour Mr. Boylan said lie was satisfied with conditions at the home.

title: MRS. C. N. SMITH DIES; GOLF CHAMPION, 83
description: Mrs. Courtland N. Smith, golfer and bridge player, died Monday at Mountainside Hospital, Montclair, N.J. She was 83 years old and lived in Glen Ridge. N.J.

title: A SIENA BANK CLOSED BY SWISS; Losses in Currency Trading at Banque de Financement Disclosed by Authorities;
description: GENEVA, Jan. 7 (AP)Swiss authorities today ordered the immediate closing of the Genevabased Banque de Financement, contrRolled by Michele Sindona, the Italian financier.

title: Bayern 10 Soccer Victor
description: TOKYO, Jan. 7 (AP)The Bayern Munich team of West Germany defeated the Japan Nationals, 10, in an exhibition soccer match today before a crowd of 45,000 at the National Stadium.

title: Griswold, C.I.A. Panel Member, Called ATarget of 74 Watergate I.T.T. Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Er win N. Griswold, the former So licitor General who was named this week to the Presidentia commission on alleged domestic spying by the Central Intel. ligence Agency, was warned by the special Watergate prosecutor's office last year that he was a target of a grand jury in. quiry, highly reliable source; said today.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAHAMRobert S. The Faculty of P.S. 76 Queens (SUTEC), mourns with a profoum sense of loss the sudden and untimeh Passing of Ifs esteemed principal ant friend, Robert S. Abraham. We shall re member him as a vital, outgoing person a dedicated educator and humanitarian whi tried to be cognizant of and responsive the needs of his students, staff and parents All who knew him will find it difficult fill the void he has left. Our heartfelt sympathies are extended to his wife, Sylvia, their children, Lynn and Steven ant family.

description: Today's Emries at Calder

title: Advertising
description: The Ford Motor Company probably because of the depressed economy in Detroit, is moving its business out of Grey Advertising.

title: Yesterday's Results at Bowie
description: Yesterday's Results at Bowie

title: Catholics and Jews Initiate Rome Meeting on Relations
description: ROME, Jan. 7Roman Catholic and Jewish experts met in the Vatican today for a fourday conference on relations and collaboration between the two faiths.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Gas Spill of 1,000 Gallons Is Cleaned Up in Brooklyn
description: The Fire Department and a private pumping company worked for more than 10 hours yesterday to clean 1,000 gallons of gasoline that spilled into Newtown Creek when a storage tank overflowed as it was being filled at the Gulf Oil Company storage terminal at 364 Maspeth Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: NADJAM AIDE SAYS GOLDMAN TO LIE
description: The special state prosecutor's office charged yesterday that Irving Goldman, the city's Commissioner of Cultural Affairs, lied when he denied being the president of', a dummy candy company that was set up to funnel thousands of dollars in payoffs to Transit. Authority oolicemen and officials.

title: Antwerp's Mood Is Somber as the Demand for Diamonds Slumps
description: ANTWERP, Belguim, Jan. 3The general economic downturn has brought a slump to the diamond business, and it is a somber period for the 16,000 diamond traders and cutters in this rich old port city.

title: FASHION TALK
description: There are some basic changes brewing in sportswear, which is a category of clothes that everybody wears, even nobody can define. It runs from golf and tennis styles to evening dresses, and what they all have in common is a relaxed, informal air.

title: Park's Shining Korean Camelot
description: LANHAM, Md.In the past, United States financing has generously aided South Korea. Now that aid is, in a sense, coming back to us from the Republic of Korea in support for some segments of the faltering United States economy.

title: Julie Heldman 63, 64 Victor
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 7 (AP)Julie Heldman, after a morning at a local playground conducting a clinic, defeated Pam Teeguarden, 63, 64, and advanced to the quarterfinals of the $75,000 opening tournament of the Virginia Slims women's tennis tour today.

title: TEXASGULF REDUCES COPPERITEM PRICES
description: Texasgulf, Inc., announced yesterday reduced prices for copper products sold here and in Canada. The price for Canadian wirebar copper of 68.25 cents a pound is down from 73 cents and the United States price of 69.25 cents a pound is down from 74 cents. The prices for full plate cathodes become 68 cents a pound in the United States, down from 72 cents and in Canada 67.125 cents a pound, down from 71.75 cents.

title: River of Money
description: The Federal Campaign Reform Law that went into effect last week opens a new era in the nation's politics. For the first time, the public will take the chief responsibility out of private hands for financing Presidential elections, primaries and national party conventions.

title: Campisi Aide Admits 5 Murders And Will Testify for the State
description: TRENTON, Jan. 7John P. Tully, accused of being a gangland killer and drug smuggler, pleaded guilty'in state and Federal courts today to all charges against him and agreed to turn state's evidence in the trial of members and associates of the.Campisi family.

title: CIA. PANEL SETS MEETING MONDAY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The first meeting of the eightmember Commission on Central Intelligence Activities Within the United States, headed by Vice President Rockefeller, will be held Monday, with the Director of Central Intelligence, William E. Colby, among those scheduled to appear during the daylong closed session.

title: Bomb Thy Neighbor
description: Rosedale is a pleasant community of one and twofamily homes in the southeastern corner of Queens where cars are still handpolished on weekends, lawns are carefully kept, and residents wait together for buses to take them to work in the city. It sits unseen between Southern State Parkway and Rockaway Boulevard, except to motorists lost on the way to Kennedy Airport.

title: Sick Hospitals
description: No chronic disease the city's municipal hospitals have been trying to cure seems more intractable than their own administrative and fiscal problems. Despite endless studies and reorganizations, reforms regularly give way to new laxity and inefficiency.

title: Chrysler Plans Rebates To Stimulate Auto Sales
description: DETROIT, Jan. 7In the first significant attempt to reduce prices to stimulate car sales since the automobile industry went into its deep decline, the Chrysler Corporation plans to announce a system of rebates next Sunday that will save buyers of certain new Chrsyler cars from $200 to $400.

title: People in Sports
description: Ken Stabler, the Oakland Raider quarterback, was named the Associated Press offensive player of the year yesterday in a nationwide poll of sports writers. He received 29 votes and easily beat out Otis Armstrong, the National Football League's rushing leader, who got 14 as runnerup. Joe Greene, Pittsburgh's defensive tackle, won, defensiveplayeroftheyear honors by only a narrow margin  13 to 11 from Bill Bergey, Philadelphia linebacker.

title: Meskill Terms Bureaucracy Baffling
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 7  The worst frustrations of office came from his inability to do the things he had the legal and political authority to do, Gov. Thomas J. Meskill said today in a farewell news conference.

title: College Football Keeps 2Platoon
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI)The American Football Coaches Association has voted heavily against returning to oneplatoon football as an economy measure.

title: PRICES ARE HIGHER ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market rose again yesterday for the fourth consecutive session.

title: Ford C.I.A. Panel. Departure From Tradition
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7President Ford, in naming his first major study commission, the panel to investigate reports of illegal domestic spying by the Central Intelligence Agency,

title: RUSE BY BRITISH FOILS A HIJACKER
description: LONDON, Jan. 7A bizarre and tensely conducted attempt to frustrate an air hijacking succeeded dramatically tonight.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: The ton 20 with points figured on a 70,1810141210.9.8.7.6.54321 basis for first through 15th1 places (1 irstplace votes In oarentheses) end wonlost records through games of last Saturday.

title: DEADLINE EXPIRES WITHOUT OIL STRIKE
description: DENVER, Jan. 7 (AP)  The president of the oil workers union said tonight that he would not call a strike as contracts with the nation's oil companies expired at midnight.

title: Triple at Bowie Pays $37,595 to 2 Bettors
description: Two ticketholders in the crowd of 8264 at Bowie yesterday won $37,595.70 each when the numbers 5, 3 and 11 finished in that order in the ninthrace triple. Nanse

description: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article in The New York Times of Dec. 28, Michael Krinsky, an attorney with the New York law firm of Rabinowitz, Boudin Standard, was incorrectly identified as an assistant to the firm which represents Representative Michael Harrington, Democrat of Massachusetts, in a suit against the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Chrysler Plans Rebates To Stimulate Auto Sales
description: DETROIT, Jan. 7In the first significant attempt to reduce prices to stimulate car sales since the automobile industry went into its deep decline, the Chrysler Corporation plans tol announce a system of rebates next Sunday that will save buyers of certain new Chrsyler cars from $200 to $400.

title: Red Smith
description: Michael Grant Marshall, who pitched in 106 major league baseball games last summer, 198 in the last two seasons and 263 in the last threenot counting two games in the last National League pennant playoff and all five in the World Seriesis resting his remarkable right arm these days by pitching to undergraduates Michigan State when he isn't teaching there or working for his Ph.D. I enjoy throwing a baseball, he explains. I get pleasure from competing with skilled hitters.

title: Soviet Says the. West Resorts to Military Blackmail Against the Oil Producers
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7The Communist party newspaper Pravda charged today that defenders of monopoly interests in the West were resorting to military blackmail against the Arab oilproducing countries by hinting at armed action to bring oil prices into line.

title: VIINICN Listeners Guild Starting Own Program
description: The WNCN Listeners Guild, which is fighting to have the former classical music station returned to the air, has started its own radio program, Guilding the Listener, which will be heard Thursday afternoons from 4 to 6 on WBAI radio, starting next week.

title: CITY TO PAY 9.4%, 2DRICHEST RATE, ON 1YEAR NOTES
description: The city reluctantly accepted a 9.4 per cent interest rate yesterday on $620million worth of shortterm notes, the second highest interest rate it has ever had to pay to borrow money. Mayor Beame and Controller Harrison J. Goldin denounced it as unfair, unwarranted and outrageously high.

title: Louisville Conquers Cincinnati
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 7 (AP)  Junior Bridgeman scored 24 points  including the 1,000th of his careerto help unbeaten Louisville defeat Cincinnati, 8274, in college basketball tonight.

title: I.B.M. Introduces Smallest Computer In a Bid for DataProcessing Markets
description: The International Business Machines Corporation, seeking new markets for data processing, introduced yesterday its smallestsize computer.

title: Governors Inaugurals: A $65,000 Celebration in Virgin islands, Canned Goods for the Poor in Vermont
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V.I., Jan. 7In a carnival atmosphere, Virgin Islanders danced in the streets in homemade costumes, heard speeches, watched parades and danced in ballrooms through the night after witnessing the swearingin yesterday of the islands second elected Governnr, Cyril E. King.

title: Reid Sworn In as Chief Of Environmental Unit
description: ALABANY, Jan. 7Former Representative Ogden R. Reid of Westchester County was sworn in tonight as the new Commissioner of Environmental Conservation.

title: PAUL SAMPLINER, LED INDEPENDENT NEWS
description: Paul H. Sampliner, a founder and former president of the Independent News Company, Inc., a distribution organization, died yesterday at Doctors Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 150 Central Park South.

title: Kissinger to Ask Congress Not to Limit His Flexibility
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Secretary of State Kissinger has told his closest aides that he wants to make a massive effort to persuade Congress to give him more flexibility and end what he regards as unwarranted interference in the Ford Administration's daytoday conduct of foreigner affairs.

title: BELL'S FINANCING PROVIDES A SELL OUT
description: The corporate bond market. faced with an estimated $3.8billion in new financings this month, moved off to a good start yesterday with a firstday sellout of $250million of Southi

title: Republican Wins Seat in House In Rerun of Louisiana Election
description: BATON ROUGE, Jan. 7 (AP) Henson Moore, a Republican, defeated Jeff LaCaze, a Democrat, tonight in their rerun of Louisiana's 6th Congressional District election.

title: Freeing of Allende Kin Gains
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan, 7 (UPI)The Chilean military government today offered to free from prison Laura Allende, sister of the late president, Salvadore Allende Gossens, and allow her to fly to Mexico. Her name was on a, list of 200 prisoners Mbxico has been asIced to accept. Mexico has not yet responded.

title: Card of Thanks
description: SAXON(Dec. 17, 1974) The family or Irving Saxon wishes to thank their friends and relatives for their Lind eirressions of sympathy during their recent bereavement,

title: MANILA PLEDGES PRISON REFORMS
description: MANILA, Jan. 7The martial law Government has assured Roman Catholic and Protestant leaders that it will take steps to prevent the torture of political prisoners. It has also promised to restore to these prisoners the right to counsel.

title: KOLTON SEES PROFIT FOR AMEX THIS YEAR
description: Paul Kolton, board chairman of the American Stock Exchange, forecast yesterday that the Amex would move into the black this year after a smallas yet undeterminedloss durine 1974.

title: St. John's Defeats iofstra Five, 7450
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Jan. 8  Glen Williams scored 19 points and pulled down 10 rebounds tonight as St. John's quintet defeated Hofstra, 7450, at the loser's gymnasium

title: State Board Drafts Plan for Education On Byrne's Order
description: TRENTON, Jan. 8 (UPI)Th State Board of Education an nounced today that it. had finished drafting a plan to provide what would constitute a thorough and efficient education.

title: Alabama Educational TV Denied License Renewal
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The Federal Communications Commission issued today a formal opinion denying a broadcast re newal license to the state agency that operates the educational television network in Alabama on the ground that the network discriminated against blacks.

title: Health Department Reports Violations In 13 Food Outlets
description: The Health Department has listed 13 more foodhandling businesses that failed a second health  code inspection and warned that violations persisting upon a final inspection could lead to closing orders. Nineteen other establishnients had their third visit from health inspectors. The businesses and inspection results were given as follows:

title: SPANISH INSTRUCTOR IS TEACHER OF YEAR'
description: TRENTON, Jan, 8 (AP)Rutli D. Campopiano of Rockaway, a Spanishlanguage teacher at West Morris Central High School, was named New Jersey teacher of the year today.

title: Higher London Bullion Prices Spur Advance in Gold Futures
description: Prices of gold futures rose yesterday in what traders called a technical upswing. The spot January delivery closed at S176.50 an ounce, up from S172.40, on the Commodity Exchange here.

title: Heart Attack Compensation
description: ST. PAUL, Jan. 8 (AP)Clint Grose, a lawyer who contends that a heart attack was a result of the emotional and physical stress of his profession has been awarded $4,000 in workmen's compensation. Mr. Grose, a member of an Edina law firm, earnsabout $40,000 a year. He said the heart attack he suffered Nov. 7, 1973, had reduced his weekly income by $175.

title: Man and Boy Slay a Woman in Leonia After Invading Home and Terrorizing
description: LEONIA, N.J., Jan. 8A 21yearold nurse visiting the home of a friend here to help care for an invalid grandmother was stabbed to death today by a Masked intruded and a boy.

title: Text of Carey's State of the State Message as He Delivered It to the Legislature
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8Following is the text of Governor Carey's State of the State message as delivered to the Legis lature. A longer written version was given to the Legislature and the press.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose for the fifth session yesterday. The overthecounter market closed mixed.

title: Fodor Denies Being Agent But Says He Helped C.I.A.
description: Eugene Fodor, president of Fodor's Travel Guides, Inc., conceded yesterday that he had cooperated with the Central Intelligence Agency but denied his portrayal by E. Howard Hunt Jr. as a former agent for the C.I.A. in Austria.

title: Tornado Injuries Sailor
description: KAPLAN, La., Jan. 8 (UPI) One of several funnel clouds that whipped across the skies of Southwest Louisiana yesterday touched down on an oil rig in White Lake smashing a tank into a tugboat injuring a crewman. The injured man is in good condition.

title: Pran Tarkenton Sore Arm Isn't Serious
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8Francis Tarkenton has a sore arm. So Bob Berry, Tarkenton's backup at quarterback for the Minnesota Vikings, did most of the passing in the team's practice today for the Super Bowl game here Sunday against the Pittsburgh Steelers. Bud Grant, the coach, is not worried, and neither is Tarkenton.

title: Detroit Gunman Killed
description: DETROIT, Jan. 8 (AP)A gunman was shot and killed by the police today after he barricaded himself in a thirdfloor apartment overlooking the eastlwest Ford freeway and forced, the closing of the artery for half an hour. There were no reports of injuries other than to the gunman.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, JANUARY 9, 1975

title: Brezhnev Report In Boston Globe Explained by Editor
description: BOSTON, Jan. 8Editors of The Boston Globe said today that what they considered solid tips from several sources had led them to publish an apparently erroneous article in today's editions that Leonid I. Brezhnev would arrive this morning in Boston for cancer treatment.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: CITY BARS ACTION IN TUNNEL DISPUTE
description: The Board of Estimate has put off once again a decision on how to proceed in the city's money dispute with contractors who suspended work five weeks ago on the Third Water Tunnel from Yonkers to the city, idling more than 1,100 sand hogs and other construction workers.

title: Shrinkage in Business Spending Plans F or 75 Found in Latest Official Survey
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8A Government survey, made public today, shows further deterioration in another key sector of the economybusiness plans to spend money this year on new plants and equipment.

title: L.I.U. Overtime Victor
description: Jerry Hartz scored 8 of his 10 points in overtime last night to spark Long Island University to a 90  83 victory, over Bonaventure at the winner's court in Brooklyn. A 30  foot jumper by Ernie Douse with two seconds remaining in regulation time knotted the game, 7676.

title: CYPRIOTES AGREE TO RESUME TALKS
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Jan. 8The Greek and Turkish Cypriotes agreed today to resume negotiations for a settlement. of the Cyprus problem.

title: P. B. A. Challenge To NameTag Order Dismissed by Court
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday dismissed a Patrolmen Benevolent Association's challenge of a departmental order requiring the city's 27,000 police officers to wear name tags on their uniforms.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Despite overwhelming community opposition, the Dover Town Board in Dutchess County, New York, voted late Tuesday night to permit a 420acre site to be used as a landfill and resource recovery area for garbage from nine counties.

title: Final Vote Was 2415 In Senate on Tax Plan
description: TRENTON, Jan. 8 (UPI)The final tally last Tuesday when the New Jersey Senate rejected a proposed 5 per cent surcharge on the Federal income tax was 24 to 15 because Senator'Matthew Feldman, Democrat of Bergen County, changed his vote to no in a parliamentary move.

title: PARKER PEWS NET ADVANCES BY 9.5%
description: The Parker Pen Company, the nation's largest producer of writing instruments in terms of revenues, reported yesterday a 9.5 per cent sales increase on a 3.9 per cent sales rise for the third fiscal quarter ended Nov. 30.

title: Notes on People
description: Gilbert A. Harrison resigned yesterday as editor of The New Republic, the weekly journal of arts and politics that he had owned for 20 years before selling it last spring to Martin Peretz, a lecturer at Harvard University. Mr. Peretz said that

description: MOSCOW, Jan. 8Following are excerpts in unofficial translation from Volume 18 of the Great Soviet Encyclopedia, published this week:

title: Students Fast for a Day to. Aid Neediest
description: The plight of people facing famine throughout the world, as well as the poor and destiJute in the United States, led to an unusual remembrance by students at the Wilton (Conn.) High School.

title: New Glory for an Ancient Breed
description: An interior designer from Philadelphia, whose specialty is putting together cultural situations that are a reflection of the past, has come up with an Italian greyhound

title: $610,000 REFUND SET IN S.E.C. CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The president of a Baltimore softdrink and vending machine distributer consented in Federal court here today to restore to the company and its stockholders $610,000 realized in violation of Federal securities laws.

title: London Level Is $180
description: LONDON, Jan. 8 (Reuters)The price of gold on bullion markets here rose to $180 an ounce at the afternoon fixing$3 up from the morning price fixing, and $9 from the close yesterday.

title: MOOD IS RESTLESS AS DANES BALLOT
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Jan. 8A popular image of the Dane is that he is funloving, likable, well off, the most contented person, in Scandinavia. Now, however, he is worried, and with reason.

title: CAREY URGES LESS LOCALITIES AID, BUDGET CUT, 10c GASOLINE TAX RISE; BEAMS JOINS STATEWIDE PROTESTS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8In a grim overture to his administration, Governor Carey today proposed cutting state aid to localities,yaising taxes and reducing the state budget and payroll as leis initial assault on what he termed the lavish style of government he said he had inherited.

title: Dumas Malone Is Completing Last Volume of the Biography
description: A celebrated historian once said that the Jefferson records were like a labyrinth: anyone who chose to write about Jefferson would enter the labyrinth and never emerge.

title: Nagy Reveals a Facet of At Midnight
description: The, dense, dramatic At Midnight has been a favored Eliot Feld work since its American Ballet Theater premiere several seasons ago. Its dark, moody atmosphere has ordinarily been interpreted with a logical weightiness of movement, but Ivan Nagy, on Tuesday evening at the City Center 55th Street Theater, revealed another facet of the piece.

title: Post for Abram Still Considered; Times Reports on Rifkind Erred
description: Morris B. Abram, former pres ident of Brandeis University, is back in active consideration for appointment as a special state commissioner to investigate the nursinghome industry, sources close to Governor Carey said yesterday.

title: Is Bradshaw Too Dumb to Be Super?
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8The symbolism is almost scary. Five years ago, before Super Bowl IV, the Pittsburgh Steelers won a coin toss here with the Chicago Bears for the first choice in the National Football League's 1970 draft of college players. And on Sunday in Super Bowl IX here, the prize of that coin toss, Terry Bradshaw, will be the Steelers quarterback. Not that it has been easy for the 26yearofd owner of a 400acre cattle ranch up near Shreveport, La., where he grew up. As a rookie he was too

title: Survivor of Plane Crash Tells of 50 Hours Spent in Wreckage
description: RENTON. Wash. Jan. 8 (AP) We never lost faith, Marilyn Foos recalled from her hospital bed. Only hours earlier she lay injured in the wreckage of a singleengine plane.

title: ABC, Too, Adds 89 P.M. Family Hour
description: ABCTV yesterday fell into line with the other television networks in announcing it would reserve the first hour of prime time, S to 9 P.M. in the zones, and western time Izones, for programs suitable to general audiences.

title: INDIA BUYS FOOD AT RECORD PACE
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 8The Inldian Government, seeking to avert a major crisis this year, has quietly bought more than five million tons of food abroad.

title: Richard Tucker, the Met Tenor, Is Dead
description: Richard Tucker, for 30 years a leading tenor with the Metropolitan Opera Company, died of a heart attack yesterday afternoon in Kalamazoo, Mich., where he was to have appeared in an evening concert. He was 60 years old.

title: Park's 3 Goals Help Rangers Triumph, 61
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 8The New York Rangers made their first foray into. Kansas City's new Kemper Arena a successful one tonight. By scoring six goals in the first 26%2 minutes, three by Brad Park, they defeated the Scouts, 61, for their seventh National Hockey League victory in a row.

title: Phone Rise Scored as Burden on Poor
description: The New York Telephone Company was accused yesterday of placing unduly heavy burdens on the homebound, the elderly and the poor in its proposals for a recordhigh rate increase of $488.8million.

title: Market Place
description: A speculative boomlet in real estate investment trust stocks began this week on the Big Board.

title: OILNATION LOANS OPPOSED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The Treasury officially confirmed today that the United States opposes any further loans to the newly rich oil  producing countries by the international lending agencies, such as the World Bank.

title: joy in Hartford Led By Her Excellency
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 8For those in this state who make the, practice of politics their life and livelihood, today was one of those times that mark, like milestones, the success and failure of their ambitions.

title: Dumas Malone Is Completing Last Volume of the Biography
description: A celebrated historian once said that the Jefferson records were like a labyrinth: anyone who chose to write about Jefferson would enter the labyrinth and never emerge.

title: BONN ACTS TO CUT ECONOMIC CRIMES
description: BONN, Jan. 8  The West German Government today proposed a strong tightening of the laws on socalled whitecollar crimes. A new bill, submitted to Parliament today, aims specifically at stopping fraud in getting state subsidies, obtaining credit from banks and declaring for bankruptcy.

title: TV Review
description: For three hours tonight, from 8 to 11, NBC News again gets one of its rare opportunities to take over the network's primetime schedule. This time the subject, under the capable supervision of Eliot Frankel as executive producer, is Of Women and Men, a title intentionally echoing Steinbeck's Of Mice and Men.

title: Kennedy'sPrepSchool Chair Sold
description: The chair that the late President John F. Kennedy used when he was a preppy at the Choate School in Wallingford, Conn., brought $300 at auction yesterday.

title: CAREY URGES LESS LOCALITIES AID, BUDGET CUT, 10c GASOLINE TAX RISE; BERME JOINS STATEWIDE PROTESTS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8In a grim overture to his administration, Governor Carey today proposed cutting state aid to localities, raising taxes and reducing the state budget and payroll as his initial assault on what he termed the lavish style of government he said he had inherited.

title: U.S. INVESTING PLAN STIRS RESERVATIONS
description: LONDON, Jan. 8 (Reuters) West German Finance Minister Hans Apel confirmed today German reservations about an American proposal for reinvesting the new riches of the oilproducing nations in the industrialized West.

title: JOHN HASTINGS, 53, OF COLUMBIA DIES
description: John J. Hastings, assistant vice president of Columbia University for public information, died at work yesterday. He was 53 years old.

title: Students Fast for a Day to Aid Neediest
description: The plight of people facing famine throughout the world, as well as the poor and destitute in the United States, led to an unusual remembrance by students at the Wilton (Conn.) High School.

title: Hijacking in Britain Sours a Tightening Of Airport Security
description: LONDON, Jan. 8  snurity precautions are to be tightened on internal flights in Britain as a result of yesterday's attempted hijacking of an airliner on a ManchestertoLondon flight.

title: Cold SloWs 1975 Growth. Of the. Winter Wheat Crop
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) Bitter cold weather slowed growth of the 1975 winter wheat crop in many parts of the Southern great plains and Western states last week, the Agriculture Department said yesterday.

title: A Tough Message
description: Governor Carey's State of the State message is an unusually tough and generally admirable elaboration on the twin theMes of his inaugural addiesspolitical integrity and fiscal austerity. Unfortunately, in pursuing the essential goal of fiscal. responsibility at this time of acute economic crisis, the new Democratic Governor, appears to retreat from social responsibility in a number of humanitarian areas where increased state support for local efforts has become more vital than ever.

title: MEDICAID BILLED FOR TRIP ABROAD
description: A draft report of the State Welfare Inspector General's office says that Charles E. Sigety, owner of the Florence Nightingale Nursing Homes, billed Medicaid in 1972 for $40,571 for his foreign travel, club dues, opera tickets, wine and liquor and other personal items.

title: Bank Manager in Tel Aviv Convicted of Embezzlement
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 8 (Reuters)A district court here today convicted the former manager of Israel's sixth largest bank of embezzling $43million.

title: Tapes Denied Networks
description: A Federal judge denied, at least temporarily, requests by television and radio networks to broadcast the tapes of White House conversations played, at the. Wategate coverup trial. Page 18.

title: Chrysler Confirms Plans For Rebates on Autos
description: DETROIT, Jan. 8 (Reuters)  The chairman of the Chrysler Corporation Lynn Townsend, confirmed today that the company and its dealers would make a $10million nationwide effort to halt the slide of auto sales.

title: Louis ep, Lochner, 87, Is Dead; Correspondent Won 39 Pulitzer
description: WIESBADEN, West Germany, Jan. 8 (AP)Lonis P. Lochner, Pulitzer Prize7winning correspondent for The Associated Press, died hgre today:He was 87 years old.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made pay able to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and for. warded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N. Y 10249, or to any of the following eight organizations that certify these eases:

title: Swiss Measures Cited
description: LONDON, Jan. 8 (AP)The beleaguered dollar rose sharply in Europe today after Swiss auIthorities introduced measures to prevent speculative purchases of Swiss francs.

title: Indochina Again
description: One of the first uncomfortable decisicins likely to be thrust before the new 94th Congress will be the extent of United States responsibility or shoring Op the hardpressed military forces of allied gOVernments in Indochina. President Thieu's regime in South Vietnam has suttered a psychological reversal in tne loss of a remote provincial capital to the North Vietnamese; and continuing combat in Cambodia is leading Pentagon experts to fear that, Government forces there will run out Americansupplied ammunition by April without a new interim military aid appropriation.

title: BRAZIL REFUSES TO PUNISH INDIANS
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 8Brazil's national Indian agency has rejected suggestions that force be used to pacify Amazon Indians who have reacted with increasing violence to the penetration of their area by settlers and road builders.

title: Sadat Says Soviet Refused to Resume Weapons Deliveries
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan 8President Anwar elSadat of Egypt was quoted here today as having expressed dissatisfaction over a refusal by the Soviet Union to replace arms lost by the Egyptians in the 1973 Middle East war.

title: 4 Die in Marine Helicopter
description: WHALEYSVILLE, Md., Jan. 8 (UPI)Four persons were killed today when a United States Marine Corps helicopter on a routine training flight crashed into a home near this Maryland Eastern Shore Community. A military spokesman said that all four of the victims were military personnel. bittentification was withheld pending notification of relatives. Witnesses said two parachutes were seen shortly before the helicopter crashed. Six persons were believed to be on the craft.

title: I.R.A. LEADER SEIZED IN DUBLIN SUBURB
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 8 (UPI)Policemen arrested today the Irish Republican Army leader said to have directed the preChristmas bombings in London and other British cities. The I.R.A. responded with a warning that the arrest could endanger the current ceasefire.

title: Japanese Exports Up 53%
description: TOKYO, Jan. 8 (AP)Japanese exports totaled 559.19billion in 1974, up 53.5 per cent from a year earlier, the Ministry of International Trade and Industry announced.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Ever hear of a durrie? Prob ably not, unless you're a rug fancier, an interior decorator or a student of Indian art.

title: Boston Allowed to Draft New Pupil Plan
description: BOSTON, Jan. 8Dropping threatened contempt of court penalties, Federal District Judge W. Arthur Garrity Jr. gave the Boston School Committee another chance today to draw up a citywide school desegregation plan without forced busing.SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Jan. 8 (AP) The city of Springfield said today that it would ask the United States Supreme Court to overturn a state court order requiring busing for racial balance in public schools.

title: BREZHNEV RUMORS ANNOY U.S. AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Senior Ford Administration officials expressed annoyance today over published reports, which they said were totally unfounded, that Leonid I. Brezhnev was suffering from leukemia.

title: Hunter Mt. Is Target For Key Ski Events
description: News of Skiing

title: Advertising
description: Beginning with its February issue, the Reader's Digest will begin a year long $1.2million series of articles on the American economic system editorially processed by the magazine but paid for and controlled by big business. Each monthly installment will be abeled Advertisement.

title: Chess:
description: SimonPure Pawn End Game Is Not Necessarily Simple

title: RentAgency Chief Named
description: Mayor Beame yesterday appointed Daniel W. Joy as Commissioner of the Department of Rent and Housing Maintenance.

title: Sparkman Plans inquiry on C.I.A. Activities Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 8Senator John J. Sparkman, acting chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, said today he was planning hearings to discuss what he termed reports and rumors that the Central Intelligence Agency is actively intervening in the internal affairs of other countries.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Albert Bermel, 47yearold associate professor of theater at Lehman College of the City University of New York, ras been named winner of the 197374 George Jean Nathan. award for drama criticism. The award, richest in the American theater, carries a cash prize of $5,000.

title: Democratic Return to Power Marked By Faint Reminder of Kennedy Years
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8There was a hint of the Kennedy Years in Governor Carey's speechwhich was written with the help of former aides of President John F. Kennedy. There was an air of festivity among Democrats, formally back in power, as they sent BrooklYn's Stanley Steingut to the Assembly rostrum to take control as Speaker.

title: FORD SAID TO SEEK EXTRA SAIGON AID
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Administration officials said today that President Ford had decided to ask Congress for at least $300million in military aid for South Vietnam in the current fiscal year in addition to $700million already appropriated.

title: Second Buyer Seeking Washington Star
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8A Michigan newspaper publisher, John P. McGoff, said today that he had not given up his $25million bid to take over The Washington StarNews and was ready to reopen negotiations with owners of the newspaper.

title: PLAN AT LOCKHEED MEETS NEW DELAY
description: A new delay was announced yesterday in the scheme for financially overhauling the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation with funds from Textron, Inc. The action raised the strongest doubts to date about whether the deal could be consummated,

title: Judge Denies Networks Request To Broadcast Watergate Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) A Federal judge denied today, at least temporarily, requests by the major networks to broadcast copies of White House tapes played at the Watergate coverup trial.

title: Jersey City Mayor Asks Tax to Close Budget Gap
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 8Mayor Paul T. Jordan said today he would push for legislative approval of a temporary 2 per cent tax on payrolls here and expanded state aid to education in the hope of closing a projected $15.7million deficit in his 1975 budget.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (Reuters)The Treasury Department will shortly announce an investigation into charges that West European governments are subsidizing exports steel to the United States, according to informed sources.

title: U.S. SEES NO CLASH ON OILFIND PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Both the State Department and the Treasury stressed today that there is no conflict between European ideas for using the International Monetary Fund to help meet the world oilfinancing problem this year and the complementary United States proposal for a $25billion safety net for the industrial countries.

title: A. M. C. Unveils Its Wide Small Pacer
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Jan. 8The American Motors Corporation introduced a new model todaythe Pacer, which it predicted would sell well despite the auto industry's slump because it is uniquethe first wide small car.

title: F.B.I. FREES LAWYER KIDNAPPED ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 8 (UPI) Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation freed an attorney today who had been kidnapped and held captive in motor home for four days, reportedly as revenge because his father had foreclosed a mortsage.

title: MEDICAID BILLED FOR TRIP ABROAD
description: A draft report of the State Welfare Inspector General's office says that Charles E. Sigety, owner of the Florence Nightingale Nursing Homes, billed Medicaid in 1972 for $40,571 for his foreign travel, club dues, opera tickets, wine and liquor and other personal items.

title: TRIAL OF DRAFTEES IN FRANCE IS OVER
description: PARIS, Jan. 8Three draftees whose arrest had become a focus for widespread debate on conditions in French military service went on trial yesterday in Marseilles on charges of having organized a protest demonstration against the army. Today one was acquitted, and the two others received light prison sentences.

title: Hubcap Thief Slain
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 8 (UPI)  Melvin Prophet of North Philadelphia was shot to death last night by a 70yearold woman who saw him stealing hubcaps from a car outside her home, the police said.

title: but What of Transit?
description: Governor Carey's brief reference to transportation his State of the State message is disturbingly ambiguous. This is another area where a cooperative effort by levels of eovernment is required. But though he promises to build an efficient and economical system of mass transportation, both in the metropolitan area and linking the far:flung communities of upstate New York, the Governor makes no reference to the urgent need of this and other cities for additional state operating aid. Instead, he speaks vaguely of making full use of available Federal assistance.

title: MAPCO EXERCISING COALMINE OPTION
description: Robert E. Thomas, chairman and president of Mapco, Inc., announced yesterday that the company had exercised its option to buy local mining rights on 14,000 acres of undeveloped coal land in Martin County in Kentucky. The land is owned by the Pocahontas Land Corporation, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Norfolk & Western Railway Company.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, JANUARY 19; 1975

title: Lippmann Memorial Held in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Walter Lippmann's friends in government and the newspaper world held a memorial service this afternoon at the Washington Cathedral for the author1 and columnist who died in New York last Dec. 14.

title: M. HZEISEIVHARTI 90, LED BAUSCH
description: M. Herbert Eisenhart, former president and chairman of Bausch & Lomb, Inc., the optical goods manufacturer in ROchester, died there Tuesday in Genesee Hospital: He was 90 years old and lived, in Rochester.

title: Polaroid Is Deferring Pay Rises Until April
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 8 (AP)The Polaroid Corporation announced today, that it was deferring all salary increases for its employes until at least April because it was uncertain about its firstquarter financial position.

title: War and Peace in the Middle East
description: TEL AVIVWhat characterizes the situation in the Middle East is the dispute over predictions rather than positions. There are some who predict that war is about to erupt. And there are some who say the contrarythat chances have increased for a dialogue, however gradual and prolonged, that will lead to peace, after all.

title: Music: Sturdy Pianism
description: Andrzej Wasowski, a Polishborn pianist who gave a recital in Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday night, proved to be a conscientious artist with sturdy, though not unflawed, keyboard technique. While unlikely ever to carve himself a niche in the pantheon of great pianists. he gave his highly respectable performances in a demanding program that opened with Schumann's formidable Symphonic Etudes and closed with Chopin's Four Ballades.

title: Cutbacks on Natural Gas Will Continue for Summer
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP)Naturalgas cutbacks to industrial consumers will continue through next summer because of severe gas shortages, a Tennessee Gas Pipeline Company official said today.

title: CORPORATE BONDS CLIMB IN PRICE
description: Corporate bond prices continued to move ahead yesterday in the wake of the successful Southwestern Bell Telephone offering. The upturn provided a good climate for additional new financings, all of which were reportedly sold out by the end of the day.

title: Richard Tucker the Met Tenor, Is Dead
description: Richard Tucker, for 30 years a leading tenor with the Metropolitan Opera Company, died of a heart attack yesterday afternoon in Kalamazoo, Mich., where he was to have appeared in an evening concert. He was 60 years old.

title: Beame and Goldin Meet Bankers Today Over Interest Cost
description: Mayor Beame and Controller Harrison J. Goldin will meet today at Gracie Mansion with the city's leading bankers in an attempt to get better interest rates for the city on its borrowings.

title: Landfill Approved Upstate Despite Residents Protest
description: DOVER PLAINS, N.Y., Jan. 8 Despite overwhelming community opposition, the Dover Town Board voted late last night to permit a 420acre site to be used as a landfill and resource recovery area for garbage from nine counties.

title: DAIRYbEA ACCUSED ON UPSTATE SALES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8The Dairylea Cooperative, Inc., was accused by the State Department of Agriculture and Markets today of violating its license to sell and distribute milk In New York State.

title: World Copper Stocks Rise
description: World refined copper stocks during November rose some 40,000 short tons, the gain centered in the United States, according to the latest figures released by the copper institute. World stocks rose to 550.000 short tons.

title: TOUGH FORD PLAN ON ECONOMY DUE WIN 2 WEEKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8President Ford will announce within the next two weeks an economic program considerably different from the conservative, handsoff policies he offered three months ago, the White House indicated today.

title: High Rubber Price Is Goal of Malaysia
description: The Malaysian Government recently announced a plan to increase the price of natural rubber, which accounts for about 40 per cent of its export earnings each year.

title: Three Sculptors Win $40,000 in Contest Prizes
description: At a ceremony last evening at the New York Cultural Center, prizes totaling $40,000 were awarded to three American sculptors, the winners of a competition held by the Society of Four Arts in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: 14 in Religious Groups Defend U.N. Assembly Against Attacks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 8Fourteen representatives of prominent religious organizations today upheld the positive accomplishments of the recent General Assembly.

title: He Used to Write Soap Operas, Now He's Great in the Kitchen
description: Julia Child has eaten and admired Alfredo's cooking, James Beard who, earlyon, had a stage career, is frequently with Alfredo and his wife, Jane White, the actress, discussing theater and dining on the likes of carpaccio alla veneto and macaroni shells with fresh sardine sauce. When Gael Greene entertained Paul Bocuse and three other of the finest and bestknown chefs of France, she selected one of Alfredo's restaurantsand Alfredo did the cooking.

title: Books of The Times
description: Hold it now. You may thinkas you contemplate the dustjacket of Thomas Harris's thriller, Black Sundaythat this is about another monumental disaster in the face of which it's impossible to do anything but yawn. Only this time, instead of the crippling of a giant airliner, or the conflagration of a towering office building, or the hijacking of a subway car, it's a blimp somehow threatening a crowded stadium with a football game in progress. But hold it. If you feel the advance guard of a yawn stealing over your glottis, you have failed to reckon with the resourcefulness of Thomas Harris, who quit his job as an Associated Press reporter to commit this novel not to mention the inventiveness of Sam Maull and Dick Riley, who helped Mr. Harris conceive and research Black Sunday.

title: Knicks Defeat Sonics
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 8Despite a poor start, the Knicks got a brilliant secondhalf performance from their allstar backcourt tonight and scored a muchneeded 113102 victory over Seattle, their 13th straight over the Sonics over a fourseason span.

title: Four More Killed As Unrest Cripples South Africa Mine
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Jan. 8 (AP)Four men were killed and eight were injured in rioting at the Vaal Reefs gold mines early today, a company spokesman reported.

title: Sadat Says Soviet Refused to Resume Weapons Deliveries
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan 8President Anwar elSadat of Egypt was quoted here today as having expressed dissatisfaction over a refusal by the Soviet Union to replace arms lost by the Egyptians in the 1973 Middle East war.

title: Dean, Kalmbach, Magruder Freed From Prison by Sirica
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Judge John J. Sirica ordered three major Watergate figures freed today, and reduced the sentences of the threeJohn W. Dean 3d, Herbert W. Kalmbach and Jeb Stuart Magruderto the time they had already served.

title: DR. HARRY SELDIN, 79, ORAL SURGEON, DIES
description: Dr. Harry M. Seldin, an oral surgeon, died yesterday at the Community Hospital, Peekskill, N. Y. He was 79 years old and lived in Putnam Valley, N. Y.

title: Jesuit Chief Says Pope Is Hurt By Criticism by Some Members
description: ROME, Jan. 8Pope Paul VI is dissatisfied with the way the Society of JeSus,the strongest religious order of the Roman Catholic Church, is being run, and he is wounded by criticism and protests. from some of its members, the Order's Superior General said today.

title: BIAS POST SET UP FOR STATE COURTS
description: State Supreme Court Justice Jawn A. Sandifer was appointed yesterday to see that everyone seeking a job in the court system was given an equal opportunity.

title: L'Oreal Sponsors Network Show
description: L'Oreal, which makes hair coloring for women, will be a sponsor of a network television special for the first time tonight.

title: Post for Abram Still Considered; Times Reports on Rifkind Erred
description: Morris B. Abram, former president of Brandeis University, is back in active consideration for appointment as a special state commissioner to investigate the nursinghome industry, sources close to Governor Carey said yesterday.

title: Article 1  No Title
Spain HardHit by Drought, Names, 20 Disaster Areas
description: MADRID, Jan. 8 (Reuters)Droughtstricken areas of 201 Spanish provinces have been declared disaster areas, any Agriculture Ministry spokesman said today.

title: Mrs. Gunter Is Upset by Youngster
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 8 (AP)  Martina Navratilova of Czechoslovakia upset Nancy Gunter tonight to advance along with topseeded Chris Evert to the semifinals of the opening tournament of the women's professional indoor tennis tour.

title: World of the Third President Is Being Discovered Anew
description: The Jefferson landscape is a perpetually rediscovered country from which no traveler returns without profit, as yisitors by the thousands are discovering. There is the Jefferson of scholarship, the Jefferson who lived in a particular house, drew inspiration from a specific vista and left his imprint,in designs for certain buildings and artifacts.

title: SOVIET APPRAISAL OF NIXON IS GENTLE
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 8The latest volume of the Great Soviet Encyclopedia, that sometimes cloudy mirror of history, makes it perfectly clear that Richard M. Nixon is still held in higher official esteem here than such Soviet notables as Nikita S. Khrushchev, Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn and Rudolf Nureyev.

title: Schreiber Is Named to Supreme Court
description: TRENTON, Jan. 8Governor Byrne today nominated State Superior Court Judge Sidney M. Schreiber to replace Associate Supreme Court Justice Nathan L. Jacobs, who will retire on Feb. 28. Justice Jacobs has. been considered one of the most activemembers of the court since his appointment in 1948.

title: 18,000 Said to Emigrate From Israel Last Year
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 8An estimated 18,000 Israelis about onehalf of 1 per cent of the country's populationemigrated last year, according to official statistics made public tonight.

title: MOSCOW DENIES POWER STRUGGLE
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 8The official press agency, Tass, sought today to refute Western speculation about a power struggle in the Kremlin.

title: Personal Finance
description: The major credit card cornpanies, all of which derive most of their revenue from a percentage of the charges its cardholders ring up, are in a violent battle for patronage.

title: Hunter Salary Only $150,000
description: The New York Yankees, it turns out, got a bargain when they won Jim (Catfish) Hunter in the biggest auction this side of the ParkeBernet Galleries.

title: REVALUING PUSHED FOR FRENCH GOLD
description: PARIS, Jan. 8 (UPI)President Valery Giscard d'Estaing reaffirmed today plans to revalue France's gold reserves in spite of opposition by some major oilproducing nations to such a move.

title: 2 Rob Queens Bank After Armored Car Makes Its Delivery
description: Two gunmen robbed the Kew Gardens Hills branch of the Long Island City Savings Bank of $202,000 yesterday, five minutes after an armored car delivered the cash.

title: Mrs. Grasso Takes Oath; Sees Need for Austerity
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 8  Ella Tambussi Grass was sworn in today as Governor of Connecticut, and she promised a government that would keep within the fiscal restraints of the times, yet be more responsive to the people than governments before her's were.

title: Syracuse Woman Likely To Head Consumer Unit
description: Officials of consumer groups in the state reported last night that Governor Carey would appoint Rosemary Pooler, a Syracuse Councilwoman, as executive director of the state's Consumer Protection Board.

title: Platt Paces Post
description: GREENVALE, L. I., Jan. 8 Bert Platt led C. W. Post to an 82 71 basketball triumph over Hartwick College tonight. Platt scored 26 points with 12 for 18 from the floor. The 6foot2inch senior guard had 6 rebounds and 5 assists as he led Post from a 3834 deficit to its seventh consecutive victory.

title: OneYear Bills Decline At the Treasury Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 8Yields on oneyear Treasury bills dropped to the lowest level since February, 1974 in the Government's sale today of $2billion of these shortterm securities.

title: DA IRYLEA ACCUSED ON UPSTATE SALES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8The Dairylea Cooperative, Inc., was accused by the State Department of Agriculture and Markets today of violating its license to sell and distribute milk In New York State.

title: Music: PIanistic Rigidity
description: Spine pianists insist that no amount of practice is ever enough, but Alan Weiss's debut recital at Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night showed. what can happen when pieces are worked over to the point that no detail of execution remains uncalculated.

title: Nassau Class Tackles Injuries
description: The increased incidence of serious injuries among high school athletes has led the Nassau County Medical Center in East Meadow, L.I., to establish a seminar program

title: BERNARD MOORE, 93, POLICE INSPECTOR
description: Bernard J. Moore, who served the New York Police. Department from 1905 until his retirement in 1950, died yesterday in a nursing home in the Bronx, where he had lived for the last 10 years. He was 93 years old.

title: The New McCarthyism
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Erwin N. Griswold, former dean of the Harvard Law SChocil and. former Solicitor General of the United States, was victimized today by a leak from the Watergate grand jury room.

title: FORBES SAYS FLIGHT IS OFF FOR A YEAR
description: Malcolm Forbes said yesterday that he would not be able to stage a second attempt to cross the Atlantic Ocean in his balloon Windborne until December, United Press International reported.

title: A Prosecutor's Bid Could Have Denied Dean His Freedom
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Judge John J. Sirica's decision to release John W. Dean 3d from prison today, along with Jeb Stuart Magruder and. Herbert W, Kalmbach, could have gone the other way for strictly techacal reasons.

title: Radio
description: 6.7 A.M., WNYCFM: Sunrise Symphony. Two Minuets, Mozart; Thamar, Balakirev; Triple Concerto in A minor, Bach.

title: SENTENCE BACKED BY AGNEW'S JUDGE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The Federal judge who gave former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew, three years probation instead! of a jail sentence for income tax: evasion said today that he would do it again in the same circumstances.

title: Sweetness and Power
description: When Richard Tucker made his Metropolitan Opera debut, during the 194445 season, it was apparent to all that a major tenor voice was in the offing. The young singer was, of

title: Britain Settles Pay Dispute With 17,000 Hospital Doctors
description: LONDON, Jan. 8 (UPI)More than 17,000 hospital resident doctors settled a pay dispute with the Government today and called off a threatened slowdown that could have crippled Britain's already hardpressed National Health Service.

title: lIAROLD KELLER, 68, FORMER STATE AIDE
description: Harold Keller, a former commissioner of the NeW York State Department of Commerce, died Monday at his winter home in Hollywood, Fla. He was 68 and lived in the Salisbury Manor Apartments, South Nyack, N. Y.

title: COMPANY REPORTS
description: For periods ended Nov. 30 unless otherwise Indicated.

title: Son Burns His Father
description: COATESVILLE, Pa., Jan. 8 (UPI)Robert N. Wike was in critical condition today with burns suffered when his 19doused him with gasoline yesterday and set him on fire. The police said Mr. Wike and his son had a dispute on Monday night. The son is being held on $10,000 bail.

title: on Criminal Justice
description: The most sophisticated observers of, the criminal justice process in this state agree that it is not a system, that its record in protecting the public ishad and deteriorating and that, by and large, nobody takes responsibility for anything that goes wrong. In addressing that set problems, the Governor adopted the sophisticated view wholeheartedly and struck the right notes.

title: Ban on Principal Ended During Inquiry
description: A principal who was suspended last week on charges of falsifying firedrill records at his public school on the Lower East Side was told yesterday to return to his job until the District 1 community board acted on the allegations.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Democratic Reformers Lose Quorum Before Tackling Key Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Another of the long succession of Democratic reform commissions took its first toddling steps today, then fell down in a heap just as It was about to reach the most controversial issue before it.

title: Tough PublicDisclosure Bill Is Signed Into Law by Beame
description: Mayor Beame signed into law yesterday a bill considered by, its sponsors as the toughest publicdisclosure legislation in,, the country for elected and appointed city officials earning more than $25,000 a year.

title: LEDA V. BAUER
description: Leda V. Bauer, a retired motionpicture story editor, died Tuesday at Yonkers General Hospital. She was 77 years old and lived at 400 East 52d Street.

title: City in Travail
description: Tucked in with all the gloomy tidings for New York City. in Governor Carey's austerity mandate is one proposal that could be of great help in freeing the metropolis from its expensive bondage to the financial community.

title: Phone Rise Scored as Burden on Poor
description: The New York Telephone Company was accused yesterday of. placing unduly heavy burdens on the homeb9und, the elderly and the poor in its proposals for a recordhigh rate increase of $488.8million.

title: 4 Pacers Help End Net Skein
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan. 8 The show tonight at the Nassau Coliseum featured George McGinnis, the Indiana Pacer strongmen, and a supporting cast of Kevin Joyce, who grew up a few miles from here; John Neumann, the vagabond Southerner; and Bill Knight, a rookie who specializes in defense.

title: Character Actor Accents Ballet Roles
description: Shaun O'Brien turns up nearly every night at the New York City Ballet these days, butrarely as the same man twice in a row.

title: Joy in Hartford Led By Her Excellency

title: Film: 'Brother of Wind':About Wildlife in the Canadian Rockies
description: "Brother of the Wind," which opened at four Manhattan theaters yesterday, is perfect escapist entertainment for those aminal-loving, city-bound children who count themselves lucky if they can own a hamster. It's about wildlife in the Canadian Rockies, particularly about the growing pains of four timber-wolf puppies that are raised (and then returned to the forest) by Sam Monroe (Dick Robinson), a fine, stanch, white-bearded mountain man who looks a good deal the way Santa Claus might if he got more exercise.Mr. Robinson, who directed and co-produced the movie, is the only character in a film that is concerned with introducing us to nature's various systems of checks and balances. The film's style is direct, simple, often beautiful and mostly free of the sort of anamorphosizing clichs that one usually finds in such movies.The wolves share the camera's attention with, among other things, deer, bear (black, grizzly), salmon (going upstream), coyote, elk, weasel, muskrat, duck, mountain lion and raccoon. The animals are terrific, the landscapes spectacular and the photography first-rate. More important is the way that "Brother of the Wind" demonstrates the survival-of-the-fittest law with such gentle tact.Leon Ames provides the soundtrack narration that is meant to be the old man's musing monologue.4 Abstract Shorts"Color Sound Frames," the collective title of this week's film program at the Whitney Museum of American Art, is devoted to the "flicker-film" explorations of Paul Sharits. The program is composed of four short abstract films, beginning with "Ray Gun Virus" (14 minutes), made in 1966, and concluding with "Color Sound Frames" (20 minutes), made last year. The effect of the Sharits compositionspulsating lights and colors at various speeds and combinationsis almost hallucinogenic.

title: Egyptians Welcome Shah; Hope Visit Will Raise Aid
description: CAIRO, Jan. 8Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi of Iran and Empress Farah arrived to a warm welcome in Cairo today for a fiveday state visit. Egypt hopes the visit will produce further Iranian financial assistance as well as a strengthening of Islamic unity against Israel.

Robert Black, 29 years old, the pilot, of Cherry Hill, N. J., Julie Johnson, 24, and Martha Marigold;. 18, both of Niles, Mich., were identified as victims. title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ALL ABOARD! The enterprising South Street Theater, always up to something innovatii/e, is offering its latest entertainment package tonight through Sunday  a twoperformer series of wellknown dramatic love scenes, presented as cocktail theater aboard the Robert Fulton at Pier 16, on the East River. Titled Man and Woman, the program features Jean Sullivan and Michael Fischetti, two players of proven excellence who, five years ago originated the theater program of the South Sea Seaport Museum and have piloted such onthepier dramas as the picturesque Spoon River Anthology and last summer's superb Moby Dick.

title: Boston High School Closed After Racial Fighting
description: BOSTON, Jan. 9Hyde Park High School, a scene of tension in this city's courtordered busing for desegregation controversy, was closed today after racial fighting broke out among students.

title: Peter C. McBean Is Dead; Davis Polk Partner Was 54
description: Peter C. McBean, a partner in the law firm of Davis Polk & Wardwell, died here Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 54 years old and lived in Bronxville, N. Y.

title: Celtics Subdue Braves
description: TORONTO, Jan. 9 (UPI)Dave Cowens's 28 points and John Havlicek's 21 offset a 30point performance by Bob McAdoo as the Boston Celtics defeated the Buffalo Braves 108100 tonight. The game was witnessed by the largest crowd ever to see a National Basketball Association game in Toronto13,544as the Celtics stretched their Atlantic Division lead to two games.

title: Nassau to Choose Again On Form of Government
description: HEMPSTEAD, Jan. 9Nassau County residents will be offered a choice in June of retaining the present Board of Supervisors or voting to replace Francis T. Purcell, vice chairman of the beard, said today.

title: Sickest of Sick Jokes Undeniably a Joke
description: Stage: Our Late Night, at the Public Theater

title: The Face Is Familiar Have We Met?
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y.There's a question that nags wherever I go. Again and again I am asked, Where did Alfred Neuman come from? For those of you who didn't hear a bell ring at the mention of Alfred N., he is the face you see on the covers of Mad magazine. And for those of you who ring, let me put the eternal question to rest, once and for all.

title: A.B.A. Is Stepping Up Search For Talent Among Schoolboys

title: Police Press Hunt for Man and Boy In Stabbing Death of jersey Nurse
description: More than 50 detectives from the local, county and New Jersey police forces were assigned yesterday to hunt for a 40yearold man and a 12yearold boy sought in the brutal slaying of a 21yearold practical nurse who was stabbed to death Wednesday after being held hostage at the home of a friend in Leonia. N.J.
