description: The nation's state utility regulators have won a temporary restraining order against the Federal Railroad Administration preventing the agency from eliminating state railroad accident reporting requirements.

title: 15 Freight Cars Derailed
description: PARADIS, La., Jan. 12 (UPI) A Southern Pacific freight train carrying liquid petroleum gas and a form of hydrochloric acid derailed 25 miles west of New Orleans today. Officials closed one highway and evacuated families living near the track. Tony Aleman, a Southern Pacific spokesman, said 15 of the train's 31 cars derailed but posed no threat to residents.

title: Pollution Warning
description: After a year of procrastination and outright obstruction from City Hall and Albany, the Federal Government has issued a clear warning to the city and state to get moving on a longdelayed plan to curb motorvehicle pollution New York City's air. It is a warning that needs to be heeded promptly, not just for the sake of the law but because a growing body of scientific evidence points air pollution, much of it from the internal combustion engine, as a serious threat to the health of New Yorkers especially their children.

title: TV: Smothers Brothers Return in an NBC Series
description: The television game goes on. The Smothers Brothers Show, beginning on NBC at 8 this evening, brings blond Tom and darkhaired Dick back to a regular weekly series after their banishment by CBS in 1969. Back in those good old uptight days they became the enfants terribles of entertainment almost by default. Their transgressions were minor almost invisible by today's standards, but they decided to fight the network censors. A kind of heroic martyrdom and a large cash settlementfollowed as surely as the Tomorrow show would eventually follow the Tonight show.

title: ON NURSING HOMES C.P.A. INQUIRY DUE
description: The New York State Society of Certified Public Accountants will examine allegations of improprieties in accounting in the nursinghome industry, according to the society's president Arthur J. Dixon.

title: An Old Gambler Finally Collects
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 12 When the Pittsburgh Steelers won the National Football League championship today for the first time in their 42year history, Andy Russell

title: Study Warns Farm Output Trails Growth in Demand
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The National Academy of Sciences warned in a report to the nation today that the upward trend of farm production was faltering at a time of increasing international concern over food supplies.

title: 13eatneOrdered Job Cuts Found to Be Postdated
description: A substantial number of the city employes who were ordered dismissed by Mayor Beame on Nov. 22 had already left the city payroll before that date, according to an analysis of payroll records.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: East Side Parking Fees Rise Today

title: 20th for Canadiens
description: LANDOVER, Md., Jan. 12 (AP)The Montreal Canadiens extended their unbeaten streak to 20 straight games tonight, breezing past the Washington Capitals, 72. Mario Tremblay, a rookie scored two goals.

title: The Paper Chase
description: Reports from the nation's campuses that students are engaged in cutthroat competition and all but obsessed with grades show how swiftly and violently the pendulum can swing from one undesirable extreme to the other.

title: F.B.I Fills Criminal Post Here
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Jan. 12 (UN)  The Federal Bureau of investigation's Special Agent in Charge of Puerto Rico, William F. Beane, has been named head of the F.B.I.'s criminal division for New York City and its neighboring counties. lit a statement released here today Clarence M. Kelley, director of the bureau, said that Mr. Beane would be transferred later this month.

title: Body of Missing. L.I. Girl Found Near Her Home
description: A 14yearold Long Island girl who had been reported missing after she failed to return from a neighborhood party fast Friday night was found dead yesterday afternoon in deserted area a few blocks from her North Belloort home.

title: Israelis at Oil Wells in Sinai Believe Days There Are Numbered
description: ABU RUDEIS, IsraeliOccupied Egypt, Jan. 9The workers in the oil fields of Abu Rudeis, Israel's richest trophy from the 1967 war believe they are operating on borrowed time.

title: Bitter Cold Follows Midwest Blizzard That Left 25 Dead
description: Bitter cold settled over the Upper Middle West yesterday following a blizzard that left snow piled in 10foot drifts and claimed at least 25 lives. New snow moved through the South from Texas to Mississippi.

title: Cramer Gets Offer
description: The president of the United States Soccer Federation confirmed last night th.at Dettmar Cramer, coach of thenational team, had been talking with Bayern Munich, but refuted earlier wire service reports from Munich that Cramer had committed himself to work for the West German team.

title: Governor and Some of 12 Young Careys Greet 3,600 at Albany Executive Mansion
description: ALBANY, Jan. 121t was a cold, bleak afternoon here but the executive mansion was invitingly ablaze with lights and Hugh L. Carey and some of his children were at the door with smiles handshakes and words of welcome for 3,600 visitors at the Governor's traditional open house.

title: GREECE SEES Z AND GETS EXCITED
description: ATHENS, Jan. 12When the film Z was released in 1969 it was banned by the military junta then ruling Greece. It is now playing here for the first time and its showing has become one of the most popular and controversialevents since the restoration of democracy almost six months ago.

title: Pay or No Pay, Actors Find the Play's the Thing
description: In the back room of the storefront annex the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater, Al Pacinofresh from his triumph The Godfather Part IIwas rehearsing The Resistible Rise of Arturo Ui. Just as this is no ordinary playit is Brecht's classic transformation of Hitler and his cronies into Chicago gangstersthis was no ordinary rehearsal.

title: Air Force Panel Recommends Discharge of Major Who Challenged Tailsafe System
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., Jan. 12 A Board of Inquiry ruled yesterday that an Air Force major be discharged because he said he would be morally obligated to seek some assurance that any order he received for a nuclear missile launching be valid.

title: M'CARTHY DECLARES OFFICIAL CANDIDACY
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 12 (AP) Eugene J. McCarthy, the former Democratic Senator from Minnesota, charging that the Democratic party had begun to hedge and compromise too much, officially announced tonight his candidacy as an independent for the presidency of the United States.

title: ExAgent Says C.I.A. Screened Oil Staff
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 12A former agent of the Central Intelligence Agency said here today that the Creole Petroleum Corporation, a subsidiary of the Exxon Corporation, used the C.I.A. in 1960 to screen employes in Venezuela.

title: Siege Continues at Vital Cambodia Town
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia Jan. 12The battle for the vital Mekong River town of Neak Loung continued today with the Cambodian Government rushing in more reinforcements by helicopter.

title: MARION M'PARTLAND HEARD AT CARLYLE
description: The promise of an attractive new jazz room in New York was dissipated last week when Marion McF:artland, who was scheduled to inaugurate a live music program in the Bemelmans Bar of the Hotel Carlyle was switched instead to the hotel's Cafe Carlyle, where she is now sharing a small stage with Manhattan Transfer, a singing quartet.

title: Brenda Barnett Is Wed to Carl J. Bodenstein
description: Brenda Diane Barnett daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Elliott C. Barnett of Sands Point, L.I., was married there yesterday afternoon in the Community Synagogue to Carl Jay Bodenstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Bodenstein of Maspeth, Queens. Rabbi Martin S. Rozenberg performed the ceremony.

title: Crusaders Triumph, 42
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 12 (AP) Finalperiod goals by Skip Krake and Terry Holbrook broke a tie and gave the Cleveland Crusaders a 42 W.H.A. victory tonight over the Phoenix Roadrunners.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Thanks for letting us live in your house. It's nice to be your neighbor in Albany.Governor Carey at an open house at the Governor's mansion. [17:3.]

title: Julius Weiss Weds Anna Weil Mendes
description: Anna Weil Mendes, widow of Jesse deSola Mendes, was married yesterday at noon to Julius Weiss, a senior member of the law firm of Weiss Rosenthal Heller & Schwartzman here. The couple reside in New Rochelle, N.Y.

title: Braves Set Back Celtics
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 12 (AP) Bob McAdoo of the Braves scored 41 points today and led Buffalo to a 114101 triumph over the Boston Celtics in a National Basketball Association game.

title: American Symphony Led In Pair of 4's by Akiyama
description: A pair of fours was the winning hand at yesterday afternoon's Carnegie Hall program by: the American Symphony Orchestra, with Kazuyoshi Aidyarba leading strongly etched performances of the Beethoven and Bruckner Fourth Symphoniei. Mr. Akiyama is not a flamboyant conductor, but he can stir up his orchestra to a high pitch of musical excitement, even as he attends to many niceties of balance and color.

title: A Time of Choices
description: When Aristotle Onassis was trying to build an oil port and refinery on the New Hampshire coast last year much of the local resistance centered in the beautiful little town of Durham. At one point the Onassis agent on the scene, Constantine Gratsos, wrote to a woman in Durham:

title: Libya Seeks Arab Experts To Become Nuclear Power
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 13 (AP)Col. Muammar elQaddafi plans to entice Arab scientists away from the United States and other Western countries to make Libya a nuclear power, a Beirut newspaper reported today.

title: Suspension of Trading In Javelin Continued
description: Trading in all securities of Canadian Javelin, Ltd., which had been scheduled for resumption on the American Stock Exchange yesterday, has been suspended through Jan. 22 by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Miss Harshbarger Heads Swim Team
description: Jo Harshbarger of Bellevue, Wash., and Andy Coan. of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., head a swimming team named yesterday to represent the United States in the New Zealand Games at Christc.hurch, Jan. 23 through 26.

title: Byrne Marks First Year in Office
description: TRENTON, Jan. 13Governor Byrne concludes his first year in office tomorrow, his political stature clearly diminished and his Democratic administration stymied by the fail

title: AllStars Play in Phoenix
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 13 The 24th annual EastWest AllStar Game of the National Basketball Association, in streamlined format, will take place tomorrow night in Phoenix for the first time, as the climax of what has become this league's only true annual convention.

title: RHODESIA TIES TALKS TO HOSTILITIES END
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 13The Rhodesian Government will not hold constitutional talks with the black nationalist leaders until the guerrillas stop fighting or the conflict shows unmistakable signs of ending, a source close to the Rhodesian government said today.

title: Treasury Bills Decline At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Briton Who Fled to Australia Quits the House of Commons
description: LONDON, Jan. 13John Stonehouse, the former Cabinet Minister and Member of Parliament who staged his own disappearance last year, resigned from the House of Commons tonight.

title: Books of The Times
description: I wish I could believe that ordinary people are capable of the passions Patrick White attributes to them in The Cockatoos. One gets tired of hearing about the horror of average, uninflected lives, those histories without heroism that allegedly make up the greater part of. humanity. It would be pleasant to think that the man and woman in the streetwhat a lovely, condescending expressionlare capable of occasional personal revolutions, just as they rise up en masse from time to time to change the face of history.

title: U.S. OFFERS FUNDS TO BRITISH TROUPE
description: The National Endowment for the Humanities has offered matching grant of $250,000 in Federal fund in support of a project under which Britain's Royal Shakespeare Company will conduct special educational programs at New York University, the University of Denver and the University of Nebraska at Omaha beginning in February.

title: Partial Rebate Is Planned On Incomes Over $40,000
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13Individuals with incomes in excess of $40,000 a year would receive only a partial share of the 12 per cent rebate of 1974 taxes that was proposed by President Ford tonight, and. those at the bottom of the income scale would get nothing.

title: 4 Women Charge Newsday Is Biased In Hiring Practices
description: Four women filed a classacion suit against Newsday in Federal District Court in Brooklyn yesterday, charging that the Long Island newspaper had violated the civil rights of its women employes and of job applicants.

title: Calder Results
description: MIAMI

title: Liddy's Bail Revoked By the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 (AP)The Supreme Conitreyoked bail today for G. Got. don Liddy, an original Watergate defendknt.

title: Pacers Set Back Squires, 105 to 88
description: HAMPTON, Va., Jan. 13 (AP)  George McGinnis scored 14 of his gamehigh 36 points in the fourth period tonight as the Indiana Pacers posted a 10588 American: Basketball Association victory over the Virginia Squires.

title: People and Business
description: The LTV Corporation, the Dallasbased diversified manufacturing company, has reached into the senior ranks of the Xerox Corporation for a new president and chief operating officerRaymond A. Hay. Mr. Hay, who has been executive vice president in charge of United States operations and a director of Xerox, has also joined the LTV board of directors. He is 46 years old.

title: Jane Alpert Is Sentenced Here to 27 Months for Bombing Conspiracy and Jumping Bail in 1970
description: Jane L. Alpert received a 27month prison sentence yesterday for conspiracy to bomb buildings and for bailjumping five years ago when she was a militant radical opposed to the war In Vietnam.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Warner Bros. is proceeding with plans for the national distribution of Hearts and 4 Minds, the documentary film about American involvement in Vietnam, it was announced in Hollywood by Frank Wells, chief executive officer of the company. Walt W. Rostow, who was national security adviser to President Lyndon B. Johnson, recently obtained a ternporary court order in Los Angeles barring the use of an interview with him in the film on the ground that he had not been allowed to approve the interview.

title: Savings Bonds Sales Climb to a Record
description: A record total of $1.56billion of Series E and H Say ings Bonds were sold in the fourth quarter, up from $1.31billion in the 1973 final quarter, but down from $1.62billion in last year's third quarter, the Treasury reported yesterday.

title: Amtrak Extends Family Fares To Apply to LowerCost Runs
description: Amtrak, the National Railroad Passenger Corporation, announced yesterday the extension of family plan fares, effective Feb. 1, to many mediumdistance runs., not previously covered, such as New YorkMontreal and New YorkPittsburgh.

title: Alabama Edges Ole Miss
description: OXFORD, Miss., Jan. 13 (AP)  Alabama, ranked No. 7, pulled through on the clutch freethrow shooting of Leon Douglas, Charles Russell and a substitute, Johnny Dill, to beat Mississippi, 7471, tonight.

title: New NA.A.C.P. Head
description: While Margaret Bush Wilson was working as acting director for Model Cities in St. Louis, she was puzzled when associates openly referred to her as Mary Pop

title: Governor Asks Northeast To Unite on Reply to Ford
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13Governor Carey said today that he was asking the Governors of the Northeastern states to present a unified response to President Ford's tax and economic proposals to prevent undue hardship to the region.

title: IRANKOFNEW YORKCO. LIFTS PROFIT 10.3%
description: The Bank of New York Company, Inc., parent of the Bank of New York, yesterday reported fourth  quarter operating earnings of $10.4million, or $1.73 per share, up 10.3 per cent from yearearlier levels.

title: Democrats Decision
description: The course of legislation in critical areas can be affected for years ahead by the committee assignments decided in the opening days of each new Congress. Once on a major committee, a member rarely moves unless an even more powerful or prestigious post becomes available. Althoughcommittee chairmen continue to wield considerable power, the democratizing trend in both houses means that the votes of even the most junior members can be important in influencing committee action.

title: CHARLES ALAN DIES; ART DEALER WAS 66
description: Charles Alan, an art dealer here since 1952, died Friday night, apparently of a heart attack. He was 66 years old and lived at 766 Madison. Avenue.

title: AMEX PRICES UP AS VOLUME SLIPS
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose yesterday for the eighth consecutive session.

title: College, School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: Pickets Set Up at 5 Mines; Some Violence Is Reported
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., Jan. 13 (AP)Violence was reported at the Rosebud Coa Sales Company mine near Hanna, Wyo., today as members of the United Mine Workers set up pickets at four coal mines in the state and one in southern Montana.

title: APPEAL TO U.N. ASKS FREE VOTE IN SIKKIM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan, 13The United Nations was asked today to investigate allegations that India had carried out repressive measures in Sikkim.

title: Minister in Philadelphia Will Seek Mayor's Office
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 13 (AP) The Rev. Muhammad Kenyata, a Baptist minister who led a drive. in the early nineteenseventies to exact repara; tion from churches for injustices to blacks, announced today his independent candidacy for Mayor.

title: Cambodian Refugees Tell of Battle for Key River Town
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodiad Jan. 13Ragged refugees from the besieged town of Neak Luong, which commands Cambodia's crucial Mekong River supply line, arrived, in Phnom Penh by boat today and described the town as under steady enemy shellfire and very short of food, with thousands going hungry.,

title: Concert Tonight At Carnegie Hall For Schweitzer
description: A centennial concert in honor of Albert Schweitzer will take place at 8 o'clock this evening in Carnegie Hall.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
KENTON IN ACCORD WITH ITS CREDITORS
description: The Kenton Corporation, the holding company that operates Cartier; Mark Cross, Ltd., and Georg Jensen; said yesterday that a bankruptcy judge has reported that kenton's creditors had accepted a repayment plan as part of the company's proceedings under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: DEFENSE WINS TEST AT ABORTION TRIAL
description: BOSTON, Jan. 13 (AP)The defense lawyer for Dr. Kenneth C. Edelin, charged with an abortionrelated manslaughter, chipped away today at a definition of birth put forward by the first prosecution witness.

title: LONDON METAL MARKET
description: (In pounds sterling per metric Ion)

title: DEMOCRATIC PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13  Congressional Democratic lead ers pledged today to take decisive action to revive the nation's slumping economy, and later gave a mixed review to President Ford's new economic Proposals.

title: FORD TO NOMINATE BLACK TO CABINET
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (UPI) President Ford will nominate William T. Coleman Jr., a Philadelphia lawyer, as Transportation Secretary in his first appointment of a black Cabinet member, the White House announced today.

title: Snow Alert Canceled As Storm Shifts to Sea
description: A heavysnow warning for the metropolitan area was put into effect by the National Weather Service yesterday afternoon but was called off early in the evening when the storm moving up the coast veered out to sea.

title: Buckley Warns of Danger Of Higher Inflation Level
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (UPI) Senator James L. Buckley, Conservative  Republican of New York, predicted that the leconomic plans of the Administration and liberals in Congress would create higher inflation than that experienced last year.

title: Aide of Aston Martin Says Consortium Weighs Rescue,
description: LONDON, Jan. 13 (Reuters) A CanadaiNBritishAmerican consortium has been set up to mount a rescue operation to save Aston Martin, the maker of the luxury British car, the company's marketing director, Fred Hartley, said today.

title: JUDGE REJECTS HALT ON SUBMARINE BASE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) A Federal judge, declaring that it would not be in the interests of national defense to do so, refused today to grant a temporary injunction that would have halted construction at the Navy's Trident submarine base in Bangor, Wash.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: SCHLESINGER SEES FEW C.I.A LAPSES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13The Presidential, commission inves tigaiing alleged dOrnestic siiy 1ing by the Central Intelligence Agency held its first meeting today and was told by Secre tary of Defense James R. Schles inger, a former C.I.A. director, that the number of misde meanors by the agency was quite small.

title: Saigon Tells of Air Strike
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Jan. 14 Heavy air strikes yesterday knocked out half of a convoy of 400 North Vietnamese trucks in the Central Highlands, the Saigon command reported today.

title: Indonesia Threatens to Quit Vietnam Truce Commission
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Jan. 13 (Reuters)  Indonesia will withdraw her troops from the International Commission for Control and Supervision in South Vietnam if the situation there puts them in danger, according to Foreign Minister Adam Malik.

title: Mar et Place
description: New York City went to the money market last Tuesday to borrow $620million by Selling oneyear notes at competitive bidding, but it received only one bida bid that resulted in an interest cost of 9.40 per cent.

title: Music: The La Salle String Quartet
description: The La Salle String Quartet, which has been concentrating on contemporary music ever since its four members came together in 1954, started a fourconcert series last night in Tully Hall. In these concerts the entire oeuvre of Schoenberg, Berg and Webern for string quartet will, be played (the remaining concerts will be given on Jan. 27, April 28 and May 1).

title: House Democrats Vote for Abolition Of AntiRed Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13  Democratic Representatives voted today to abolish the House Internal Security Com mittee, which for 45 years, un der. various names, has been the spearhead of antiCorn munist investigations on.Capitol Hill.

title: Rizzo Expected to Win Philadelphia Primary
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 13  When Frank L. Rizzo ran for Mayor here four years ago, he solemnly declared that he was not then, had never been and would never be a politician and almost everybody in town voted for him.

title: Police Help Keep Girls on the Run
description: Until this year, members of the allgirls. Atoms Track Club of Brooklyn were followed, molested and harassed during the fall months by loiterers while working out at night in Prospect Park.

title: Karl Pretshold, Newsman, 76, Health Department Aide, Dies
description: Karl Pretshold, a former public relations counselor to the city's Health Department, died Saturday in BeekmaNDowntown Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 455 Franklin Delano Roosevelt Drive.

title: Tim St. Lawrence Takes Met. Pole Vault 9th Time
description: Tim St. Lawrence of the New York Athletic Club won his ninth straight Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union senior polevault championship last night in the airdome at Columbia's Baker Field.

title: Near Self Sufficiency in Energy Possible by 85, O.E.C.D. Says
description: PARIS, Jan. 13The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said today that Western industrial, nations may be producing almost as much energy as they consume by 1985 if they take advantage of potentials for conservation of expanded output and if world prices remain about unchanged.

title: Guru's Follower Killed
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Jan. 13, (UPI)Three women followers of the Indian mystic, Guru Maharaj Ji, were shot, ones fatally, today when they refused to allow another member of the sect to spend the night, at their Divine Light Mission, the police said. Diane Ames. Whitley, 22 years old, of Stowe Vt., died at a hospital after the shooting. Carl Swanson, a poice spokesman, said Richard Douglas Briggs Jr., of Denver walked to police headquarters and surrendered. Mr. Briggs, also a follower of the guru, was charged with firstdegree murder and two counts of attempt

title: No Retreat Needed
description: A recent memorandum from the Office of Civil Rights of they Departmelit bf Health ducaticut and Welfare declared that the Federal Government's affirmative action requirements for college faculty hiring must not operate to restrict consideration to minorities and women only. Rather, the memo continued, the affirmative action program was intended to forbid differential standards based on race, color, sex, religion or national origin.

title: F.D.U. Beaten, 5552
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 13 Georgia State University utilized a stall for the last 5 minutes 30 seconds tonight and defeated Fairleigh Dickinson University, 55.52.

title: Kentucky Beats Tennessee
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 13 (AP)Jack Givens, a substitute, led a eKntucky surge midway in the second half tonight and helped beat Tennessee, 8882, in the Southeastern Conference. Givens scored 6 of his 18 points in a twominute span after Kentucky had lost a 14point lead.

title: ONE SENATE SEAT REMAINS UNFILLED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13The Senate Rules Committee was unable to agree today on what the full Senate should do about the contested New Hampshire Senate seat when the 94th Congress convenes tomorrow.

title: Theater: The Rivals
description: Some have greatness thrust upon themand that can be the unkindest cut of all. The Roundabout Theater, now ensconced in two theaters and, primarily devoted to the classic dramatic repertory, is carrying a burden.

description: ABRAMSMina. Beloved wife of Harry Devoted mother of Matthew and Linda Dear sister of Jack, Shirley, Helen am adored grandmother of David. Service Jeffers Funeral Homes 188th Street am Hillside Avenue, Jamaica, Tuesday Januar) 14 at 12:30 P.M.

title: MORGAN GUARANTY CUTS RATE TO 9
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company yesterday became the first major bank since last April to lower its prime lending rate below the doubledigit level that has been blamed in part for hobbling business exnansion.

title: Met. Fives: BrightHopes Prove Dim
description: This was to have been one of the finest basketball seasons for colleges in the New York area, but with only one exception, the wonlost records are disappointing. The only consolation is that some teams may have been well paid for their losses.

title: Mayor Gets Huge Raise
description: MENDON, Utah (AP)The city council in Mendon recently gave the mayor a raise from $15 a year to $300. It was the first chan'ge in, mayoal fialary here since the town was incorporated in 1870.

title: Statement by Northrup
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) The Northrop. Corporation issued a statement today indicating that it would try to sell its plane to other countries.

title: General Dynamics Wins Order To Build New Air Force Fighter
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13The lair Force announced today that the General Dynamics Corporation had been selected as the winner in a multibillion dollar competition to develop and produce a new generation of fighter planes for the United States and possibly its allies,

description: The lop 20, with points figured on a 10i9,8. 7.65.4.3.2.1 basis for first through 10th Place (firstplace votes in parentheses) and wonlost records through games of last Saturday.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on earthquakes in., The New York Times yesterday, it was incorrectly stated that an earthquake in China in 1956 took as many as a million lives. The year was 1556.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ROOM AT THE TOP Now's the time, today and tomorrow, for a free sampling of the glamorous world of hairstylingthat is, if you pass an initial interview test. Phone 4774910 and find out. Aspirants approved for participation will be given a free haircut by an expert, chosen from the latest styles, a free permanent wave if desired, souvenir photographs by a professional photographer and finally a chance to model in fashion show.

title: Jane Alpert Sentenced
description: Jane L. Alpert, the farther militant radical, was sen tenced in Federal Ditrict Court here to a 27monthterm. for conspiracy to bomb buildings and bail jumping five years ago. Page 15.

title: 3 Jersey Bell Aides Ordered To Explain Layoffs to State Unit
description: NEWARK, Jan. 13 (UPI) Three New Jersey Bell Telephone Company executives involved in a controversy surrounding the layoff of 335 employes were ordered today to appear before the Board of Public Utilities Commissioners Wednesday.

title: Diamond Shamrock Net Up
description: The Diamond Shamrock Corporation reported yesterday increases of 105 per cent in earnings for the fourth quarter and 87 per cent for last year on sales gains of 49 and 48 per I cent, respectively. All 1974 results set records for the chemicals, oil and natural gas Producer based in Cleveland.

title: Oil Impact Is Weighed For Common Market
description: BRUSSELS, Jan 13 (UPI) The payments deficit of the European Economic Community countries caused by high oil prices will reach $60to $90billion for the 197478 period, an analysis by the Common Market's Executive Commission said today.

title: Plane Wreckage Found
description: COEBURN, Va., Jan. 13 (UPI) The wreckage of a twinengine airplane believed carrying seven persons and missing since last night was found today in the snowcovered mountains of southwest Virginia. Reports from rescue workers indicated that there were no

title: ExHead of South Korean Navy Urges the Military to Oust Park
description: TOKYO, Jan. 13A former South Korean chief of naval operations urged the Korean military services today to overthrow President Park Chung Hee.

title: Two Rockets Fired at Israeli Jet in Paris
description: PARIS, Jan. 13Two men armed with bazookas fired rockets today as an Israeli air liner with 136 passengers was about to take off for New York from Orly airport. The rockets missed that plane but hit a parked Yugoslav aircraft and a storage building.

title: Supreme Court Expands Curbs on States Rights to Prohibit Abortiom
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13The Supreme Court indicated strongly today that it would not permit states to punish physicians for performing abortions before the Justices legalized most abortions in January of 1973.

title: Files Detail Political Help In Bergman Medicaid Rise
description: Files of the State Health Department show how the Bernard Bergman interests, with political support, won a contested increase of $132,000 a year in Medicaid rates for a Bronx nursing home.

title: THE GRASSO HOME IS BURGLARIZED
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 13Gov. Ella T. Grasso of Connecticut said today that she was as outraged as any citizen would be that her home in Windsor Locks had been broken into, but that she would not order the state police to post a regular,watch on the place.

title: Healey Confident of OilFinancing Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 Denis Healey, the British Chancellor of the Exchequer, expressed confidence today that world finance ministers would reach a package agreement later this week aimed at coping with the oil financing problem in 1975 and possibly other monetary issues as well.

title: Beall Quits Maryland Post
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 13 (AP) United States Attorney George Beall confirmed today that he had submitted his resignation to the Justice Department and will leave office and enter private practice when a successor is elected. Mr. Beall attained prominence in 1973 as he headed the Federal investigation of Maryland political corruption with culminated in Vice President Spiro T. Agnew's resignation and plea of no contest to one count of income tax evasion. Mr, Beall, whose resignation had been expected, became United States Attorney for Maryland in 1970.

title: Chess
description: It is not the greater num ber of moves that determines the quality of a game but the lesser number of errors by the loser, or the inobviousness or minuteness of those errors. A long game may be produced by a gross pawnlosing blunder on the loser's part that nevertheless requires spunout technique in a routine end game by the winner. A short game, on the other hand, may come about through the triumph of extraordinarily imaginative play over spirited resistance.

title: Book by ExC.I.A. Man Links Latins to Spying
description: LONDON, Jan. 13A former employe of the Central Intelligence Agency has published what he describes as a detailed, almost daybyday account of his work and that of his colleagues in three LatinAmerican countries.

title: in Connecticut and N. J
description: Connecticut has just joined a growing list of states which includes New Jersey and may soon add New Yorkthat have come under court orders to revise their systems of public school financing in order to provide more equitable educational opportunities for all children. As in Trenton, where the State Senate has virtually killed hope for an adequate legislative response to this challenge, the prospects that Hartford will act constructively are bleak.

title: 20 Moors Urge Meeting With Byrne on City Needs
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 13 Twenty of New Jersey's Mayors restated their support for a state income tax today and Called for an Pimmediate meeting with theGovernor and legislative leaders to discuss the financial nlixht of the cities.

title: U.S. JOB PROGRAM IS STARTED HERE
description: With public pronouncements of cooperation and mutual congratulations, Mayor Beame, Senator Jacob K. Javits and a group of local and Federal officials met yesterday morning to mark the start of a federally financed program to provide publicservice jobs for 5,500 employed people here.

title: Slain Nurse Buried in Ft. Lee in Rain; Euloges Recall Her Charity to Others
description: LEONIA, N.J., Jan. 13A dismal, cold rain beat down today on a church and cemetery where mourners, gathered for the funeral of Marie Fasching, a nurse who had gone to a friend's home to help care for an invalid grandmother and was stabbed to death by robbers who terrorized the family.

title: Corporate Profile
description: The General Dynamics Corporation, which has been smarting for eight years over attacks on its role in the most widely criticized weapons project in the nation's historythe F111 fighter planewas given a multibillion  dollar second chance yesterday. title: Philippines Curbs, An American Priest But Won't Oust Him

title: Boston Editor Promoted

Mr. Phelps moved to The Globe last May from Washington, where he was news editor of The New York Times's Washington bureau.

title: Man Fined in Wife's Suicide
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Jan. 13 (AP) A retired high school principal, convicted of helping his ailing wife commit suicide, was placed on 30 months probation and fined $3,750 today by an Oakland County Circuit Court judge. Robert Waters, 65 years old, of Clarkston, pleaded no contest late last year to a manslaughter charge in connection with the carbon monoxide death of his wife, Kathleen, 65.

The session will take place at the Twin Bridges Marriott in Washington. title: Rockefeller's Ruling
description: When the new Senate meets today, it faces once again the old but fundamental issue whether majority rule, to guide its own proceedings. At stake is, reform Senate Rule 22, which requires at least twothirds those members present and voting to shut off a protracted debate. The effect of this profilibuster rule is that determined minorities can tie up the Senate for weeks, sometimes killing outright a bill favored by majority and in other situations delaying action while haggling for concessions off the floor.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) Richard M. Nixon, reported earlier as having spent a quiet 62d birthday last Thursday, actually was feted at a surprise party at his San Clemente, Calif., estate, one of the participants said tonight.

title: Noll Rates Greene as Super Defender
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 13  Franco Harris won the hearts of the press box, whose occupants voted him the most important player in yesterday's Super Bowl game. But it was Joe Greene who won the heart of the Steeler coach, Chuck Noll. Harris and his 46 Pittsburgh teammates were each $15,000 richer today after the 166 victory.

title: Navajos Reject Goldwater's Conspiracy Charge
description: PHOENIX Ariz.,. Jan. 12 Navajo officials have angrily rejected a charge by Senator Barry Goldwater that labor union funds were responsible for the extraordinarily high turnout of Navajo voters in the November general election.

description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Jan. 13 (AP)Topranked Indiana, led by Scott May's 19 points, solved Minnesota's zone defense in the second half tonight and rolled to its 18th consecutive victorya 7959 decision over the 16thranked Gophers in a Big Ten Conference basketball game.

title: How the Ford Policies Changed In 5 Months of Deepening Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 President Fortl, under enormous political pressure to act decisively to restore the nation's nosediving economy, has now turned sharply away from the policies he embraced after taking the oath of office just five months ago.

title: Woman Artist Challenges Frick Library Over Pants
description: Can a pair of trousers stand in the way. of art research? Yes, if a woman is Wearing them, says the Frick Art Reference Library, a private research facility for art scholars.

title: Toledo Refinery Still Struck
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Jan. 13 (UPI) Members of striking Local 7346 of the Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers Union stayed off the job for the third day today at the Standard Oil of Ohio refinery here. A company spokesman said that any further negotiations on a new contract with the 388member local would be called by a Federal mediator.

title: General Dynamics Wins Order To Build New Air Force Fighter
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13The Air Force announced today that the General Dynamics Corporation had been selected as the winner in a multibillion dollar competition to develop and produce a new generation of fighter planes for the United States and possibly its allies.

title: Chrysler, GlumonFuture, Cuts Back for Long Term
description: DETROIT, Jan. 13Lynn a Townsend chairman of the Chrysler Corporation, said today that the company had embarked on a longrange restructuring that would leave it considerably smaller and leaner but able to operate profitably in a smaller market.

title: Enterprise Jet Crashes
description: MANILA, Jan. 13 (AP)  An American naval Officer was killed and a second seriously injured today when their jet aircraft crashed into the eastern Indian Ocean shortly after takeoff from the carrier Enterprise, a United States Seventh Fleet spokesman said. Lieut. Lee Penderson, 36 years old, of Anacortes, Wash., was killed, and Lieut. Comdr. Roger Newman, 37, of Oak Harbor, Wash., was hurt.

title: Liquor Stores to Close
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 13 (AP)About 98 per cent of the state liquor stores in Philadelphia are expected to be closed tomorrow in observance of Martin Luther King Day.

title: Slain Jersey Nurse Is Buried in Rain; Eulogies Recall Her Charity to Others
description: LEONIA, N.J., Jan. 13A dismal, cold rain beat down today on a church and cemetery where mourners gathered for the funeral of Marie Fasching, a nurse who had gone to a friend's home to help care for an invalid grandmother and was stabbed to death by rob, bers who terrorized the family.

title: Malaysian Envoy in Peking
description: PEKING, Jan. 13 (Agence, FrancePresse)  Ambassador Hashim Sultan of Malaysia arrived here today and was greeted at the airport by the, director of protocol at the Foreign Ministry, Chu ChuanHsien. China and Malaysia established diplomatic relations at the end, of May, 1974.

title: Doctors Take Their Malpractice Protest to Albany
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13Doctors, some of them a little bit uneasy over engaging in group action for the first time, took their case against the soaring cost of medical malpractice insurance to the Capitol today.

title: MIGUS ALSTON, 60, PHONE EXECUTIVEi
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 13 (AP) Angus S. Alston, who rose from a telephone coin box collector to head the giant Southwestern Bell Telephone Company, died here yesterday at the age of 60. A company spokesman said he had been suffering from cancer.

title: Draft Constitution Is Criticized in Greece
description: AllIHNS, Jan. 13A arm constitution proposed by the Greek Government has evoked furious criticism from opposition leaders, who say it represents a bid for authoritarian control by Premier Constantine Caramanlis.

title: Ashe, Ailing, Beats Riessen in 3 Sets
description: HUMACAO, Puerto Rico, Jan. 13 (AP)Arthur Ashe overcame a leg injury to beat Marty Riessen, 62, 36, 63, in the $60,000 CBS classic tennis tournament today.

title: Marvin M. Karpatkin, 48, Dies; Lawyer in Civil Rights Cases
description: Marvin M. Karpatkin, a prominent civil rights advdcate, died here yesterday of a heart attack at the age of 48. He was stricken while joggMg outside his home, 280 Riverside Drive.

title: Pravda Says C.I.A. Spurs Activities in Middle East
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 13 (UPI) The Communist party newspaper Pravda said today that the Central Intelligence Agency was increasing its activities in the Middle East.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 14, 1975

title: U.S. STEEL REQUEST DENIED BY BURGER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (UPI) Chief Justice Warren E. Burger denied today a request by the United States Steel Corporation to block a shutoff at 5 P.M. Eastern standard time of natural gas to the company's Monongahela Valley plants.

title: Patty Cake to Share Limelight In the ZooWith a Baby Brother
description: Patty Cake, the baby gorilla who has reigned for two years as the darling of the Central Park Zoo, may have to learn to share the limelight.

title: WagePrice Controls Backed by McCarthy
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 13 (AP) Former Senator Eugene McCarthy, seeking the Presidency for the third time, proposed several measures today to help solve the nation's economic problems.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: The Ion 20 teams with points figured on a 20181614t210987654321 basis (firstplace votes in parentheses). Wonlost recoras through games of last Saturday.

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, Jan. 13, 1975

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Holiday for State Workers Refused

title: $500,000 Awarded in Building Collapse
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Jan. 12 A Federal jury here has awarded a $500,000 judgment to a worker who was disabled in a 1973 apartment building collapse in which 14 workers were killed and 34 were injured.

title: Extra DiVidend for Johnson
description: Johnson & Johnson announced yesterday that it would pay an extra dividend of 5 cents a share of common stock as well as its regular quarterly dividend of 20 cents. Both dividends are payable March 10 to shareholders of record Feb. 21.

title: Procedure to Be Eased In Uncontested Divorces,
description: Frank A. Gulotta, presiding justice of the Appellate Division, Second Department, announced yesterday that effective March 1 transcripts of hearings in uncontested divorce cases would no longer have to be provided before final judgment was rendered.

title: EXMANAGER TO LET PANOVS MAKE DEBUT
description: Maxim Gershunoff, who was dismissed as manager of Valery Panov and his wife, Galina Ragozina, the Russian emigre ballet dancers, moved in State Suprerne Court here yesterday to withdraw his suit for a temporary injunction to bar them from performing except under his management.

title: Institutions Chief Rejects Proposal for 4Day Week
description: Ann Klein, New Jersey commissioner of Institutions and agencies, ruled out a 4 day week in her department as a means of helping to narrow the state's projected $400million budget gap. Mrs. Klein said yesterday that the shorter work week, proposed last week by Governor Byrne was not being considered by her department because we have to cover everything 24 hours a day.

title: Volume I Issued Here Of MarxEngels Works
description: The first volume of the projected 50volume edition of the complete Works of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels has just been issued in the United. States by International Publishers. This complete first Englishlanguage edition of their writings parallels the publication of. the same works in Britain by Lawrence and Wishart.

title: MET. TEAMS RECORDS
Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern StandardTime

title: New Hearing in California Sought by Sirhan Lawyer
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 13An attorney for Sirhan Bishara Sirhan, the convicted killer of Senator Robert F. Kennedy, asked the California Supreme Court today for a new hearing for his client on the basis of evidence not disclosed at the trial.

title: ASSERY ADOPTS CHANGES IN RULES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13The Assembly formally adopted the Democratic majority's sweeping changes in rules and procedures today, with the Republicans, in their new role as the mitnarity, calling the proposals routine housekeeping changes and offering their own amendments.

title: MRS. JOHN THATCHER
description: Mary Barton Thatcher, wife of John M. P. Thatcher, a lawyer, died Sunday at her home, 770 Park Avenue, at the age of 92.

title: President Cites Rationing as an Alternative to New Taxes on Fuels
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 President Ford told the American people tonight that he would ask Congress to enact new energy conservation taxes on petroleum and natural gas. The alternative, he indicated, would be compulsory rationing or long waiting lines at the service station.

title: U.S. Says Hanoi Commits Flagrant Truce Violation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13The United States charged North Vietnam today with flagrant violation of the Vietnam agreements and urged the Soviet Union, China and others to persuade Hanoi to resume the political talks with the Saigon Government that were broken off last year.

title: Notes on People
description: For her first postoperative evaluation since her surgery Sept. 28 for breast cancer, Betty Ford went to Bethesda Naval Hospital yesterday for a fourhbur session that included laboratory tests and an examination by her snrgeon, Dr. William Fouty. They produced no evidence of a recurrence of malignancy.

title: London Papers Report Plan to Kidnap Prince
description: LONDON, Jan. 13 (AP) The Provisional Irish Republican Army made plans to kidnap the heir to the British throne, Prince Charles, last year, three London newspapers renorted today.

title: Jane Alpeit Sentenced
description: Jane L. Alpert, the former militant radical, was sentenced in Federal District Court here to a 27month term for conspiracy to bomb buildings and bail jumping five years ago. Page 15.

title: SLAVE LABOR RATES ALLEGED IN 2 CAMPS
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 13 (AP)A suit filed today charges that boys adjudged delinquent are forced to work at state camps at slave labor rates.

title: Boy Loses Both Leas
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 13 (AP) A 9yearold boy from the city's Kinsington section lost both his legs yesterday when he apparently was drawn beneath the wheels of a Reading Railroad freight train, the pol lice report. The authorities identified the victim as David Cintron.

title: State Congressmen Switch Committees
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13The New York State Congressional, delegation preserved its reputation for committeehopping as members received their committee assignments for the 94th Congress, which convenes tomorrow.

title: F.T.C. Aide Rules Britannica Concern Used Sales Ruses
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13A Federal Trade Commission judge ruled today that Encyclopaedia Britannica, Inc., had been deceiving its salesmen.and its customers with numerous ruses designed to sell expensive sets of books.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: School for Fly Fishermen
description: There is no better time for dwellers of the snow belt to learn the intricacies and delights of fly fishing than in the dead of winter, for they must concentrate on casting and equipment until the trout season opens.

title: SOME OF CAMPISIS NOW PLEAD GUILTY
description: MOUNT HOLLY, Jan. 13  After a day of plea bargaining, an undisclosed number of the remaining defendants in the longdelayed Campisi murder and racketeering case reportedly changed their pleas today to guilty.

title: Texas Faces the Happy Prospect Of Spending 1.4Billion Surplus
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 13The Texas Legislature that convenes here tomorrow for its 20week biennial session will have $1.4billion more to spend than it had two years ago. As could be expected, there are all kinds of ideas on how to get rid of the surplus.

title: Steelers Welcome Super
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 13 The journey that began in New Orleans with the first exhibition game last Aug. 3 catne to a tumultuous conclusion for the Pittsburgh Steelers today in this city's Golden as 120,000 fans welcomed their idols home.

title: On Homosexuality
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J.  Ameris cans generally debate an issue with a certain degree of intelligence and calm. It is disconcerting, therefore, to find critics of homosexuality discoursing heatedly from a plateau of ignorance and bewilderment. And yet it is understandable.

title: Coach Changes Jobs
description: TEMPE, Ariz., Jan. 13 (AP)  Al Tanara, offensive line coach at Arizona State since 1970, resigned today to accept a job at Texas Tech under Steve Sloan, new head football coach,

title: The Illegal Immigrants
description: Immigration officials estimate that there are six to seven million aliens in this country who entered unlawfully, including 1.3 million in the metropolitan area. Stated differently, those who have come illegally equal the total of all those who have entered legally over the last 25 years. Lawless entry of this magnitude mocks the nation's immigration law and makes reform imperative.

title: SHOP TALK
description: If the bright aprons worn by Herman W. Phynes 3d and his sales staff at Fabrications appeal to you, it's possible to run one up yourself out of the same Stromma cotton with its undulating wave design In a variety of color combinations. A yard of the 60inch Swedish fabric at $11 is sufficient for two aprons (a pattern costs 25 cents).

title: CHIRAC BOLSTERED AS GAULLIST CHIEF
description: PARIS, Jan. 13When Valery Gisca rd d'Estaing, the head of the Independent Republican party, was elected President last spring, many French pollticians thought the longdominant Gaullist party was falling apart. Today, however, the Gaullist leader, Premier Jacques Chirac, is being viewed as almost as influential as the President.

title: Purdue Triumphs, 7372
description: WEST LAFAYETTE, Ind., Jan. 13 (AP)Walter Jordan scored 5 of Purdue's last 6 points tonight as the Boilermakers took a 7372 overtime victory from Northwestern in a Big Ten game.

title: His Gabon Hospital Is Busy and Growing
description: LAMBARENE, Gabon, Jan. 11A week ago, after a 30mile ride in a crowded bus along unpaved jungle roads, MarieAntoinette N'zau, with her mother and two young children, piled food, clothing and cooking pots into a dugout canoe that brought them to the white sand beach of the Dr. Albert Schweitzer Hospital here in western Gabon. His Gabon Hospital Is Busy and Growing

title: Accord Reached on 76 Fete Guidelines
description: Alexander H. Cohen, executive producer of the World Theater Festival, and the Council Of A.F.L.C.I.O. Unions for Professional Employes have reached an agreement on guidelines govt;erning the Festival, which will bring to America 12 of the world's leading theater companies.

title: Two Rockets Fired at Israeli Jet in Paris
description: PARIS, Jan. 13Two men armed with bazookas fired rockets today as an Israeli airliner with 136 passengers was about to take off for New York from Orly airport. The rockets missed that plane but hit a parked Yugoslav aircraft and a storage building.

title: Inquiry on Nursing Homes Begun by U.S. in Jersey
description: A Federal, task force has begun an investigation into possible Medicare and Medicaid fraud by nursing homes, physicians and medical laboratories in New Jersey, Jonathan L. Goldstein, United States Attorney for the state, said in Newark yesterday.

title: New Spanish Party Sought
description: MADRID, Jan. 13 (UPI)A lawyer in the northern town of Vitoria today became the first Spaniard to apply for permission to form a political group under a law, passed last month that ended the political monopoly of Generalissimo Francisco Franco's National Movement. The lawyer,. Manuel Maysounave, applied for permission to form an association that he said would represent the interests of small shopkeepers and artisans.

title: Undefeated Soviet Boxing Team Lands Jab at Garden Ring Prices
description: The Soviet national boxing team, undefeated in international competition but still feeling the effects of jet lag, worked out yesterday at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum in preparation for a fourmatch tour of the United States.

title: DEMOCRATIC PUN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13  1Congresilorial Democratic leaders pledged today to take de'cisive action to revive the nation's slumping economy, and later gaiie a mixed review to President Ford's new economic proposals.

title: WALDHEIM SEES U.N. STAFF FAULTS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 13  Secretary General Waldheim said today that there was plenty of room for improvement in the competence of the United Nations staff and in the procedures for hiring them.

title: Nassau, Democrats Offer 20Point Economy Plan
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 13A program designed to save Nassau County taxpayers money through economies and efficiencies was presented to the Republican county administration today by Stanley Harwood, the Nassau Democratic county chairman.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 13. 7 President Ford, announcing a drastic turn in his economic, policies in a nationally vised address, proposed tonight a $16billion income tax cut that would include a rebate: to individuals of up to $1,000 from their payments on 1974 income.

description: ENGLISH F.A. CUP ad Round, 2d Replay Bury 7, Millwall 0. Fulham 1, Hull City 0/

title: Production of Steel Rose 4.3% in Week
description: Steel production in the second week of this year increased over the first four days of 1975 but remained well behind the total for the first 11 days of 1974, according to statistics released yesterday by the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: Action on the Economy
description: The eagerness both President Ford and the Democratic majority in Congress are currently showing to persuade the nation of their commitment to a sizable tax cut the interest of economic recovery is all to the good, provided the momentum does not run out with televised speeches and press releases.

title: Italian is Kidnapped
description: MILAN, Italy, Jan. 13 (AP) An industrialist was kidnapped today as he was leaving his chewinggum factory at Lainate near Milan. The police said that Lombardo Perfetti was seized by three men who sped away, with him in an automobile.

title: Beulah Livingstone Dies; Agent for Screen Figures
description: Beulah Livingstone, personal representative of Rudolph Valentino and other film stars in the nineteentwenties and thirties, died here Sunday night. She was 88 years old and lived at 330 West 58th Street.

description: Dividends

title: Concert: Weisberg's Art
description: The newmusic impresario is like a strip miner, though one hopes more benign. He needs to plow his way diligently through mountains of shale and dust in order to come up with something even potentially worthwhile. Arthur Weisberg, whose Contemporary Chamber Ensemble presented one of its famously meticulous programs at Carnegie Recital Hall on Sunday night, is a seemingly tireless laborer in this valuable kind of mining.

title: Denmark Bank Rate Cut
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Jan. 13 (Reuters)Denmark cut its bank rate to 9 per cent from 10 per cent, effective;, tomorrow, the central bank said today. The bank rate had held at 10 per cent since Jan. 23, 1974, when it was raised by one percentage Point.

title: Dance: A Rococo Finale
description: It is amazing that Jerome Robbins's Goldberg Variations is now nearly four years old. In a sense, it still seems a new work. The reason for this is probably its aural and visual complexities. Not only does it demand great concentration from its audience, but the vastness, evenness and yet subtle varieties of its landscape also guarantee that however often it is seen, something new, some different aspect or unusual detail emerges with the fresh shock of an only halfremembered surprise.

title: People in Sports
description: Press Maravich, whose wife, Helen, died in an apparent suicide last fall, submitted his resignation yesterday as head Coach at Appalachian State.University, effective at the end of the season. He said in a letter to the athletic director, Jimmy Jones, I do this with the view that this is the best move for my future, the future of my family and the basketball program here at ASU.

title: Business Records
description: MONDAY, JAN. 13, 1975

title: U.S. Population Placed At 300 Million in 2000
description: PARIS, Jan. 13 (AP)The population of the United States will increase from 202 million in 1970 to 248 million by 1985 and 300 million by the year 2000, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development predicts.

title: Gilbert Picked for AllStars
description: If Rod Gilbert of the New York Rangers couldn't make it one way, he was certain to get in another way, and that's how he qualified yesterday to appear in the 28th annual AllStar Game of the National Hockey League next Tuesday in Montreal. With a record of 22 goals. and 31 assists, Gilbert made the team as a coach's choice.

title: Huntington Gilchrist, 83, Dies; International Relations Expert
description: Huntington Gilchrist, an authority on international relations and a retired executive of the American Cynamid Company, died Monday at his home in Ridgefield, Conn. He was 83 years old.

title: M'GOVERN TO QUIT AS REGENTS HEM
description: Chancellor Joseph W. McGovern announced yesterday his forthcoming resignation from the State Board of Regents after seven years as its head. He gave his reasons as purely personal.

title: A Man and a Boy Assault Womanin Margate Home
description: A woman in Margate said yesterday that she had been attacked in her home by a welldressed man and a young boy, and the police are investigating the possibility that the intruders are the same pair sought for nine attacks and sexual assaults on the East Coast, including last Wednesday's murder of a nurse in Leonia.

title: Stephens College Faculty Asks That New President Withdraw
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Jan. 14 (AP) Faculty members at Stephens College have voted to ask Dr. Atiand ChristSaner to remove himself as the next president of the private school.

title: U.S. Says It Is Now Free To Breach Vietnam Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14The State Department said today that the United States was free to breach the Vietnam ceasefire agreements because the North Vietnamese had violated them.

title: Gloria Drew Is Wed to T. D. Starr
description: The marriage of Gloria Willard Drew of New York and Southampton,. L. I., to Theodore D. Starr, a widower, of New York and Waccabuc, N. Y., took place in the chapel of St. James's Episcopal Church here yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Frederick Hill performed the ceremony. A small reception followed at the St. Anthony Club, of which the bridegroom is a member.

title: Group of 10 Near Pact on Financing of Oil Problems
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14The 10 leading industrial nations announced tonight that they were close to agreement on a, financial package aimed mainly at dealing with the problems, caused by higher world oil prices.

title: Broodmare Draws Top Price of $81,000.
description: LEXINGTON, Ky. Jan. 14 (AP) .E. A. CoX. Jr. of Hill Brook III paid the top price of $81,000 for Ideal Day a broodmare offering of Ogden Mills Phipps, in the second day of the Horses of All Ages Sale at Keeneland today.

title: Foundations Stock Goes Up As Their Stocks Decline

Now, in the midseventies, fear that foundations were growing too big and powerful is rapidly giving way to concern that they may soon be too small and impotent.

title: Beame Sees Threat to City
description: Criticizing President Ford's new economic policies, Mayor Beame yesterday said that tariff on imported oil would threaten the economy of the Northeast and that a moratorium on new Federal spending would worsen the city's budget crisis.

title: Javits Is Defeated By Curtis, 23 to 14, For Key Party Post
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14Voting by secret ballot, apparently along ideological lines, Senate Republicans rejected today a leadership bid by Jacob K. Javits, a New York liberal, and elected Carl T. Curtis, Nebraska conservative, chairman of the Senate Republican Conference.

description: ALBANY, Jan. 14  Lieut. Gov. Mary Anne Krupsak ruled today that attempts by the Senate's Republican majority to truncate some of her power as presiding officer were a nullity and have no effect at all.

title: Byrne Asks New Taxes to Meet Deficit
description: TRENTON, Jan. 14Governor Byrne warned the New Jersey Legislature today that it would have to approve new taxes to bridge what one highly placed state official said would be a state budget deficit of approximately $600million.

description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 14 (AP)  Kip McLane tallied 20 points tonight to lead Duquesne to a 9691 victory over St. Bonaventure.

title: Brewers Sign Money
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 14 (AP) Don Money, who set three fielding records for third basemen last ,season, signed his 1975 contract with the Milweukee Brewers today.

title: Health Aide Who Tied 3 to NursingHome Study Quits
description: Dr. Andrew C. Fleck Jr., State Health Department official who last ,month made public a controversial 1971 office memoran,dum linking three top elected state officials with a key figure in the current investigation of state nursinghome abuses, has resigned. his job and taken a Civil Service job with a paycut of sveeral thousand dollars following ,Governor Carey's appointment of another man as department head.

title: Newsweek Names New President
description: Robert D. Campbell, publisher of Newsweek, has been named to the additional post of president of Newsweek, Ine., effective June 1. He will succeed Gibson McCabe, who Previously announced his retirement and will become a consultant to the magazine, a subsidiary of the Washington Post COMEnIV.

title: U.S. Health Aide Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (UPI) President Ford accepted today the resignation of Dr. Robert S. Stone, director of the National Institute of Health, effective Jan. 31. Also accepted was the resignation of, J. Owen Zurhellen Jr., deputy director of the United States Arms Control and Disarmament Agency, effective Jan. 13.

title: Advertising
description: The Chrysler Corporation way have tried to keep the lid on the advertising plans for its car clearance carnival that Vegan this week, but the Ford Motor Cornpany was waiting With a counter cornpaign.

title: `NoGrowth Now Subject of Study
description: Educators today are not only encountering problems of nogrowth, they're also studying it.

title: New York A.C. Captures Met. Senior Track Akain
description: They held the 85th armual Metropolitan Amateur Athletic, Union senior indoor track, championships at the 102d Engineers Armory last night and it might as well have been the first as far as official organization was concerned.

title: HIGH COURT BACKS A CURB ON DIVORCE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14States can require a year of residence to qualify for a divorce in their courts, the Supreme Court ruled today.

title: Music: Soviet Conductor
description: It is probably only fair that if the Soviet Union sends up topnotch musicians such as Yuri Temirkanov, who made his New York debut Monday night by conducting the Thiladelphia Orchestra at Avery Fisher Hill, that it balance the scales by letting us hear its bottomnotch new music.

title: Teachers Now Lions In Political Arena
description: The post  Watergate na tional election of 1974 saw teachers move out in front of doctors, milk producers and all the rest of the traditional big spenders as possessors of political clout. In money, campaign manpower and votecoralling effectiveness, organized teachersonly a few years ago strangers to politicsoutdid every other interest group.

title: Liddy to Start Term
description: (UPI)One of the convicted Watergate burglars, G. Gordon Liddy, is scheduled to report to the Federal prison in Danbury not later than 2 P.M. Jan. 22. bentencea to a sixtozuyear term for his role in the 1972 breakin at Democratic headquarters at the Watergate come plea in Washington, he had been free on bail pending an appeal.

title: G.M. HINTS AT CUT IN PRICES OF CARS
description: DETROIT, Jan. 14The General Motors Corporation hinted today that it might soon cut prices on its cars. in a letter to dealers, the company said that any customer buying is car between Jan. 13 and March would get a refund should G.M. decide to reduce prices or offer rebates during that period.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE GREAT INDOORS A sudden onslaught of raw winter might not set many people to planning outdoor recreational activities for spring and summer. Practically speaking, it might be a good time, with a lavish exhibition titled The Long Island Recreational Vehicle and Outdoor Living Show snugly ensconced under the dome of the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L. I., today through Sunday.

title: Penn Central Cancels Big Employe Furloughs
description: The Penn Central Railroad's trustees said.yesterday that they had canceled extensive employe furloughs and other cashsaving measures they had contemplated because of Administration assurances that it would send Congress a proposed plan this week for $250million of financing, including $100million in outright grants, to be made available to keep the Penn Central and other bankrupt railroads operating through March.

title: Post Posts No. 9
description: LAKELAND, Fla., Jan. 14 C. W. Post College opened its quest to win a third consecutive tournament by defeating Florida Southern University, 8163, tonight in the Citrus invitation. The Pio. neers, 112 and winners of their last nine in a row, will meet Florida Tech in the final tomorrow night. Florida Tech defeated Valdosta State of Georgia, 6959.

title: 13 DEFENDENTS DENY CHARGEOFSWINDUIVG
description: LOS ANGELES (AP)Thirteen principal defendants have pleaded, not guilty to Federal charges of. using their defunct oil drilling company to swindle $109;thillion from prominent investors.

title: Hynes Meets Stein and Abram On NursingHome Investigation
description: The special state prosecutor investigating alleged fraudulent practices in nursing homes, Charles J. Hynes, met for an hour yesterday with Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein, chairman of the Temporary State Commission on Living Costs, and Morris B. Abram, the head of special state commission on reform in the nursinghome industry.

description: OSHOTO, Wyo.There is a radical educational experiment under way here. It's called the oneroom schoolhouse. And it works like this:

title: Stocks Finish Day Lower Despite Proposals by Ford
description: The stock market gave President Ford's new economic and energy proposals an indifferent reception yesterday as prices finished lower in slower trading.

title: WKCR Expands Music Fare
description: WKCR, the noncommercial FM radio station licensed to Columbia University, will revamp its schedule on Monday to include a new classical music program. It will be offered Monday through Friday, from 7:30 to 10:30 A.M. An afternoon program of classical fare, which has run from 1 to 5:55 P.M., will begin instead at 3 P.M.

title: Princeton Conquers Temple Five, $948
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 14 (AP)Mickey Steuerer and Barnes Hauptfuhrer hit short jump shots early and often tonight as Princeton sank 11 of its first 15 shots en route to a 5948 basketball victory over Temple.

title: Ford Seeks $2aBarrel Domestic Oil Tax
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14President Ford will ask Congress tomorrow to put a tax of $2 a barrel on all domestic crude oil and a comparable levY on all natural gas, the White House said today.

title: Infant Girl Killed by Dog
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 14 (UPI) A pet African hunting dog mauled an infant girl to death today while her mother napped in another room, the police said. Tracy Wax, 5monthold daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Wax of Kansas City, was pronounced dead on arrival at Childrens Mercy Hosnital.

title: Schools for Privilege? Britain's Class Question
description: LONDONEducation is an intensely political subject everywhere, but in few countries are arguments over education as closely tied to opposing views about the shape of society as they are in Britain.

title: Consensus Emerges On the Federal Role
description: WASHINGTONOn March 26, 1965, Congressman Gerald R. Ford voted against the Johnson Administration's $1.3billion school aid bill.

title: Tax Collector Advises Citizens to File Early; WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (AP)The nation': top tax collector advised citizens today not to wait for action on President Ford's proposed tax rebate before filing their 1974 returns.
description: Donald C. Alexander, commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service, said in a statement that the size of any possible rebate could be determined only after the agency received and proc. essed the taxpayer's return.

title: FOREIGN WORKERS FACEBONN CURBS
description: BONN, Jan. 14The West German Government, in the face of rising Unemployment that is expected to reach one million this month, is putting into effect a series of measures to reduce the number of foreigners working in this country from the present level of 2.5 million and give preference to GerMan job seekers.

title: Musk: Ewald's Quintet No. 3 Revived
description: Victor Ewald is a name that has only recently turned up in, Englishlanguage music encyclopedias, although he lived from 1860 to 1935. He was a Russian composer, who, like many of his kind, followed a profession and had music as an avocation. He was a civil engineer. He played the cello and the French horn and was an avid chambermusic participant in St. Petersburg circles before the Revolution.

title: Connors Declines Berth on up Team
description: Still the maverick, Jimmy Connors has declined an invitation to join the. Davis Cup team. His reasons are personal, he told the United States Lawn Tennis Association, which is eager to win back the cup this year, and regain prestige for the nation in the world competition.

title: ANTHONY CORNACHIO
description: Anthony W. Cornachio, owner of Chester House, a cabaret and bowling alley in the Parkchester development ih the Bronx, died Sunday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 57 years old and lived at 100 15th Street, Garden City, L. I.

title: 19th Club Put Off By N.B.A.
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 14The National Basketball Association's club owners and Players Asociation held separate meetings today that amounted to clearing the decks for serious conflicts ahead.

title: A Basis For Compromise
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14President Ford has not turned the economy around with his new energy and economic proposals, but at least he has turned himself around. He was on collision course with the new Democratic Congress, but they are now proceeding on parallel tracks in the same direction.

title: Not Me, Not Now
description: Teacher, physician, insurance actuarywe all assume it won't happen to us. Intellectually we concede that death is inevitable, that disease is probable. But not for us. Not now, not yet.

Schlesinger said today that American military intervention in the Middle East would be feasible but that the United States would consider a resort to force. only, in the gravest emergency and that he doubted the likelihood of such an event.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14Happy. Rockefeller went on a tour today of what will someday be her Washington home, with an escort of one admiral, a number of Secret Service agents, a harried press secretary and a crowd of reporters, photographers and equipment carriers.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 26yearold Queens gasoline station attendant and his 19yearold wife were charged with homocide yesterday morning for allegedly starving and beating their monthold daughter to death. The suspects, Arthur and Veronica Sudol of 3727 Crescent Street, Long Island City, were arrested Sunday night for allegedly killing their daughter, Veronica, whose death was caused by malnutrition and a skull fracture, according to a medical examiner's report.

description: A woman from Portland, Ore., says she will buy shoes for her children; a man from New. Orleans plans to bet on a horse, and a couple on Long. Island says the money will go to pay bills at the country club.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan 13While much attention is being paid to middleincome families and college students applications for food stamps, a recently released Congressional survey shows that participants in the food assistance program are poor people who obtain most of their income from the Government.

description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 14 (UPI) The third mild earthquake since Sunday shook parts of southern California just before midnight yesterday. The gentle quake rolled through southwestern Los Angeles County and northwestern Orange county. There were no reports of injury or damages.

title: Cocaine Seizure Reported

Air France Raising Capital
description: PARIS, Jan. 14 (Reuters)Air France said today it was increasing its capital by $83.8million this year to a total or $387.3million to help meet its current financial situation. The French National airline had previously forecasted a deficit for 1974 of some $113.2million compared with a 1973 profit of $2.7million.

title: Burger Denied Gas Plea
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 14 (UPI) The United States Steel Corporation began shutting down, operations at four district plants today, less than 24 hours after the Chief Justice of the United States, Warren E. Burger, refused to halt a cutback in natural gas supplies to the plants. A spokesman for the nation's largest steel producer said the shutdowns would result iniitially in the layoff of 1.300 employes. Mr. Burger denied U. S. Steel's effort to block a Federal Power Commission order requiring the Carnegie Natural Gas Company to curtail supplies to the plants. The F.P.C. order said residential gas customers might recieve top priority.

title: Ball to Head Board Of International House
description: George W. Ball, former Under Secretary of State in the Kennedy and Johnson Ad ministrations, was elected chairman of the board of trustees of International House yesterday, the organization's president, Howard A. Cook, announced.

title: E. JUDSON WARLOW
description: E. Judson Warlow, who was chief of foreign building opera. tions for the State Department at his retirement in 1973, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at Suburban Hospital, Bethesda, Md. He was 67 years old and lived in Montgomery Village, Gaithersburg, Md.

title: Narcotics Agents Scored by Hefner In Assistant's Death
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 14 (UPI)Hugh Hefner, the publisher of Playboy magazine, contended today that his executive secretary, Bobbie Arnstein, was driven to suicide by narcotics agents and Federal officers he said were out to get him.

title: Schools, Colleges Closed Today in Honor of King
description: Today is the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s birthday. City schools and colleges are, closed. City offices are open, but employes may take the day off as a holiday. Regular parking regulations are in effect.

title: PIANO RECITAL GIVEN BY MISS KEPALAITE
description: Aldona Kepalaite has been giving piano recitals here since 1962, and her latest, in Town Hall yesterday afternoon, pretty much followed the pattern of its predecessors in its mixture of fine and awkward playing. The opening work, for example, Bach's Partita in B flat, was unsettled in rhythm and tempo and even had memory lapses.

description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 14County Executive Alfred B. DelBello acknowledged today at a news conference that Westchester County's new $33million courthouse was incomplete, inadequate, insecure and, in some ways. unsafe.

title: Urban Development `Solution In February Is Seen by Carey
description: ALBANY, Jan. 14Six days after Governor Carey announced that all of the current projects of the Urban Development Corporation would grind to a halt within four or five days unless we take immediate action, the Governor said today that he now hoped to have a lasting solution to the agency's problems by the last week in February.

title: MARGIN DEBT IS CUT AT BIG BOARD IN 74
description: Stock margin customers of New York Stock Exchange member firms reduced their debt in December by $120million to a yearend total of $3.8billion, the lowest since August, 1970, the exchange reported yesterday. title: 80,000 March in Lisbon

Some 600 people, mostly representatives of stores such as Berg dorf Goodman, Bloomingdale's, Sakowitz of Houston and Abraham & Strauss, sat quietly sipping drinks at tables flanking the long runway set up in the center of the promenade at the New York State Theater in.Lincoln Center. The show went on at 6:15 P. M. Monday night, as scheduled. In a half hour, it was all. over and everyone went home. description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (UPI) Some congressional leaders talk about applying the income tax refund to low and middleincome families, but there is no consensus on what middle income is. A level usually used by the House Ways and Means. Committee puts middle income at about $15,000 a year.

description: Barrie Sommerfield, vice president of Saks Fifth Vienne, and Leonard Hankin, executive vice president of Bergdorf Goodman, filed motions yesterday for dismissal of charges in a pricefixing case in which both were indicted Oct. 7 last year.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 14 (AP)Heavy fighting continued along the Cambodian border west of Saigon and on South Vietnam's central coastal plane near Bong Son, the South Vietnamese command reported today.
