What made the Government market jittery during the trading season was the prospect of the Treasury's February refunding operation, details of which are to be disclosed tomorrow.

title: U.A.W.Urges Suspension Of State Auto Sales Tax
description: MAHWAH, Jan. 20As more than 7,000 assemblyline workers returned to work at Ford Motor Company plants here and in Metuchen today, officials of the United Auto Workers Union petitioned officials in New York State and New Jersey to suspend the state sales taxes on autos and major appliances.

title: Chess:
description: The first thing you look for in a game with Mikhail Tal is the possibility of his getting off a stupendous sacrifice for a mating attack. As Bobby Fischer pointed out years ago, Tal wants to win every game with one move.

title: City Again Escapes Full Fury of Winter
description: Winter again, but only lightly, struck in the metropolitan area yesterday, as the city escaped with only a dusting of snow.

title: Opinions of Bergman as Diverse as His Background
description: Only God in heaven knows that I am not guilty, Bernard Bergman told the editor of a Yiddish weekly the other day. He said that two months ago, as major investigations of nursing homes were getting under way, he left the country on the advice of his lawyers, of the Metropolitan New York Nursing Home Association, and of his children, hoping that the tumult would subside.

title: Dr. Leonard S. Friedman, Founder of Abbe Institute
description: Dr. Leonard S. Friedman, founder and president of the Abbe Institute School of Adult Education at 100 Fifth Avenue, died Friday in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 151 West 86th Street.

title: CLUB WITHDRAWS BOOK ON DU PONTS
description: A sober but unflattering book on the du Pont enterprises and the du Pont family has been withdrawn by the Fortune Book Club after a telephone call from a du Pont company executive.

title: Advertising
description: Mutual of New York is going to take an unusual step for a life insurance company that advertises on television. It's going to talk about death.

title: Bad Loans Helped Rush Security National TakeOver
description: A large number of bad loans many in real estateand a drain on deposits caused the swift, imposed takeover Sunday afternoon of the Security National Bank, the second big Long Island bank to go out of existence in little more than three months.

title: DEMOCRATS VOTE WIDE C.I.A. STUDY BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The Senate Democratic Caucus voted 45 to 7 today to set up a bipartisan select committee, sLmilar to the one established after the Watergate breakin, to investigate all aspects of foreign and domestic operations of the Central Intelligence Agency and other Government intelligence units.

title: How Nursing Homes Are Reimbursed
General Motors to Rebate $200$500 on Small Cars
description: DETROIT, Jan. 20The General Motors Corporation, the giant of the automobile industry, yesterday became the last of the Big Three auto makers to announce hefty rebates to customers in an attempt to spur sales of new cars and lift the industry out of one of its worst slumps since World War II.

title: Fellow Offcers Mourn Victim After Vain Efforts to Save Him
description: Slipping black mourning bands over their shields, police officers of the Sixth Precinct last night, at 8:55 P.M., quietly began to observe thte death of their fellow officer, Joseph R. Garcia, who died at Bellevue Hospital after being fatally wounded in a gun battle with a holdup suspect.

title: WAR IS INEVITABLE, CHOU SAYS IN TALK
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 20Premier Chou Enlai held out a vision of inevitable world war to the National People's Congress in a keynote speech delivered last week and made public tonight. He also predicted the complete modernization of a stable, orderly China by the century's end.

title: DEMOCRATS VOTE HE C.I.A. STUDY BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The Senate Democratic Caucus voted 45 to 7 today to set up a bipartisan select committee, similar to the one established after the Watergate breakin, to investigate all aspects of foreign and domestic operations of the Central Intelligence Agency and other Government intelligence units.

title: The DeSentimentalist
description: Thomas Hart Benton died with his boots on, and he would not have minded the use of that clich. He was always vehemently devoted to supporting the legitimacy of anything familiar and directly understandable, especially if it had any connection with folklore or folk expression.

title: Southwestern Bell Investigation By S .E.C Reported Under Way
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Jan. 20 An investigation of Southwestern Bell Telephone Company by the Securities and Exchange Commission is under way and may spread to other divisions of the Bell Telephone system, sources here said today.

title: In Memorian
description: CEHANBernard. In loving memory. DORA.

title: SEAMEN'S UNION ASKS PACT WITH COST CURB
description: The National Maritime Union, representing 25,000 deepsea sailors aboard 300 United States merchant ships, yesterday told ship owners that it wanted a new threeyear contract that would protect members against inflation.

title: Cullen Moore, Columnist, Dies; Wrote Features on Astrology
description: Cullen S. Moore, a newspaper columnist and stanch advocate of freedom of the press, died last night in Memorial Hospital. She was the wife of Wickliffe B. Moore, retired president, chairman and chief executive officer of Price Paper Corporation, and lived at 775 Park Avenue.

title: Squeezing the City
description: New York City is in the worst fiscal crisis since the metropolis had to mortgage itself to the banks in the Great Depression of the nineteenthirties. Yet each day brings new reports of unjustified demands on the municipal treasury at the very time that the city is planning to fire thousands of civil service employes in its desperate effort to close a monumental budget gap.

title: U.S. Charges 25 State Colleges In Mississippi Are Segregated
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The Department of Justice charged today that the students and faculties of Mississippi's 25 state college and universities were racially segregated illegally.

title: Wood, Field & Stream
description: Millions of acres of spruce and balsam fir are being destroyed by the spruce budworm in the forests of northern Maine, but DDT, the pesticide that lingers for years in the environment with deleterious effects on many forms of life should not be used, says Nathaniel P. Reed, assistant secretary for fish, wildlife and parks in the Interior Department.

title: Stein Subpoena Quashed; Bergman Testifies Today
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday quashed subpoenas that had been served on Bernard Bergman and others in the nursinghome industry by the Temporary State Commission on Living Costs, headed by Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein. The justice, Hyman Korn, said the commission had exceeded its authority to investigate economic matters and had moved into criminal matters.

title: People in Sports
description: The sports world is losing one of its most eligible bachelors. Johnny Bench, the 27yearold catcher for the Cincinnati Reds who has twice been named the National League's most valuable player, announced yesterday in Cincinnati that he will marry Vickie Chesser, a New York model, on Feb. 21 in Cincinnati.

title: Seattle Emergency Plan Is Saving Heart Victims
description: MARCO ISLAND, Fla., Jan. 20 A wellorganized emergency care system involving firemen, policemen, laymen and even high school students in the city of Seattle is saving the lives of one in four persons whose hearts stop during a heart attack, a physician reported here today.

title: PRICE CHANGES SET ON ALLOY MATERIALS
description: Price changes were announced yesterday by lending producers for two alloy materials, antimony and beryllium.

title: Books of The Times
description: FREUD AND HIS FOLLOWERS. By Paul Roazen. 602 pages. Illustrated. Knopf. $15.

title: Abrams and Griswold Ending 2Year LinkUp
description: George J. Abrams and GriswoldEshleman, after just a little more than two years together, have decided to go their separate ways. George J. Abrams & Associates had been half owned by the Clevelandbased agency and was in effect its New York office.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Democrats in the New Jersey Senate voted yesterday to exclude Senator Alene S. Ammond of Camden county from their majority party caucus following her renewed charges that Senators were guilty of conflicts of interest and that the Senate was trying to kill a State Commission of Investigation inquiry into alleged political corruption in South Jersey.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP)Mutual fund investors purchased more shares than they redeemed last year for the first time in three years, the industry's trade association said today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 21, 1975

title: Syria Frees U.S. Newsman After Holding Him 3 Days
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 20 (AP)Syrian security agents released Nicholas Ludington, an Associated Press correspondent, today after holding him for three days. He was driven to the Lebanese border in a Government vehicle and releasd ernment vehicle and released there.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
POLICEMAN KILLED IN GUN DUEL HERE
description: A 35yearold police officer, shot in the heart yesterday afternoon during a gun battle with a robbery suspect in a Greenwich Village subway station, died last night at Bellevue Hospital after a team of surgeons labored seven and onehalf hours to save his life. The suspect was killed in the duel.

title: No. 1 Indiana Takes 20th Straight
description: MADISON, Wis. Jan. 20 (AP)Quinn Buckner scored 26 points and led topranked Indiana to an 89.69 Big Ten Conference basketball victory over Wisconsin tonight.

title: World Rice Output Lags
description: ROME, Jan 20 (Reuters)World production of rice dropped by 3 million tons in 1974 to 319 million tons, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization said today. F.A.O. said the decline in rice production was mainly due to bad weather in the Far East, the world's major riceproducing region.

title: Cosmos And Best: Close
description: George Best flew back to England yesterday evening, but he said he would be back here in two weeks. The English soccer star added he was very close to an agreement with the Cosmos of the North American Soccer League.

title: East Chicago, Ind., Enjoys Full Employment as Steel Plant Furnaces Roar
description: EAST CHICAGO, Ind.Manuel Tellez, ownermanager of the Supermercado Mexico, the supermarket that sells almost entirely to MexicanAmerican steelworkers and their wives, was surprised that anyone should think his business had been hurt by the recession.

title: Israel Assails P.L.O.
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Harold Lewis Nash Dies; ExMayor of Norwalk, 82
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 20Harold Lewis Nash, former Mayor of this city and former secretary of the Nash Engineer. ing Company, pump manufacturers, died Saturday at the age of 82. He made his home at Pratt Island, Norton.

title: FAISAL TRIP ENDS IN CAIRO ACCORD
description: CAIRO, Jan. 20King Faisal of Saudi Arabia flew home today after a weeklong tour of Syria, Jordan and Egypt, during which he gave large amounts of financial aid to all three countries as well as to the Palestinian movement. King Faisal also supported Egypt's policy of accepting the American stepbystep approach to peace moves for a while longer.

title: Some Recipes to Whet the Appetite for Cod
description: COD FLORENTINE

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 22, 1975

title: Cambridge Merchants Adapt to Recession: Net Ample if Narrower
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  The roof fell in n Gordon Yarlott's leathergoods business last year. It collapsed in a storm, ruining $10,000 worth of expensive suitcases and hand bags in his handshop in Harvard some one  story Square. Then he got hit by the sagging economy, which has inflicted further damage on his chronically underfinanced business with tight money and sluggish sales. So, after 18 years in the square, the genial, graying Mr. Yarlott faces an uncertain future.

title: Role in Selection Of Drugs Is Urged for Pharmacists
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Doctors prescribing drugs should be required to specify the brand or to authorize a pharmacist to decide which brand to provide for the patient, a panel of the National Research Council said today.

title: Volman and Kaylan Turn Bottom Line To Profit for Rock
description: Mark Volman and Howard Kaylan, who are holding forth through tonight at the Bottom Line under the names of Flo and Eddie, have had a varied career indeed.

title: Workers Still Idle At Olympics Site
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 21 (UPI) The leader of the ironworkers union, upset because his men have not been allowed to begin work at the Olympic stadium site following settlement of their costofliving dispute last week, advised union members today to work at other construction jobs in the city.

title: 2 OIL STRIKES CALLED, ONE DISPUTE SETTLED
description: DENVER, Jan. 21 (UPI)The Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers Union and the Champlin Petroleum Company agreed on a twoyear contract today, but the union ordered members to strike at a Phillips Petroleum plant in Texas and three Husky Oil refineries in the Rockies.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HORIZONS Two new events attest to the alert, widening activities pertaining to film at New York University, not only in homegrown, campus  sponsored production but also in screen developments from afar.

title: C. Arnholt Smith Pleads Not Guilty on Nixon Gifts
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 21 (UPI)C. Arnholt Smith, already charged with 25 counts of fraud, pleaded not guilty yesterday to five counts of unlawful corporate political contributions.

title: Haker Takes Giant Slalom In Austria
description: FULPMES, Austria, Jan. 21 (AP)Erik Haier of Norway, combining confidence with luck, skied to his first World Cup victory in two years today by capturing the giant slalom with a total time of 2 minutes 55.66 seconds at this Tyrolean mountain resort.

title: Man Slain in Hallway Of East Side Building
description: The body of a young man who had been shot six times was found at 8:30 last night in the fourthfloor hallway of an upper East Side apartment building.

title: P.B.A. CASE GOES TO IMPASSE PANEL
description: The counsel for the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, Frederick R. Livingston, told an impasse panel yesterday that the duties and responsibilities of police officers justified payment of hgher salaires to them than to firemen and sanitationmen.

title: FORD DENOUNCES HANOI OFFENSIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Ford, strongly supporting the Saigon Government, today denounced North Vietnam for violating the Paris ceasefire accords and confirmed that he would ask Congress for $300million in additional military aid for South Vietnam.

title: ALLEGHENY LUDLUM CHANGING PRICES
description: The company said that prices on grades 200 and 300 stainless steel sheet would be decreased approximately 5 per cent, effective with today's shipments. Allegheny also announced price advances averaging slightly more than 6 per cent on flatrolled electrical, hightemperature and tool steel product lines. In other price actions, the American Cyanamid Company said it was increasing the price on aluminum sulphate by, 6.9 per cent on liquid and 6.5 per cent on dry.

title: Recital
description: The piano recital repertory seems to be governed by sun spots or the phases of the moon. Each season finds one work leaping into popularity, and suddenly everyone wants to play it: This season's favorite is Schumann's Symphonic Etudes, a test of technique and endurance as well as a musically poetic score.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Oil: The New Money Lords Quandary

title: City Warned School Cuts May Cost It Federal Help
Intelligence in Review
Guides Given to Cut Complaints
description: Stanley Tannenbaum, chairman of Kenyon & Eckhardt, has studied the decisions of the 23 National Advertising Review Board panels dealing with complaints about advertising claims and has come up with some guidelines for other ad makers.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Zero for Central Park
description: The 18th century loved romantic ruins; the 20th century is getting them whether it likes them or not. Central Park is in a state of galloping decay, horticulturally and architecturally, but there is no poetry of pathos intended. It is a simple case of vandalism and no cash.

title: RAIL SNARL DELAYS 15,000 COMMUTERS
description: More than 15,000 rushhour rail commuters were delayed, for up to two hours last night when a grounded feeder cable at Mount Vernon forced a halt in service in and out of Grand Central Terminal on the Penn Central's New Haven Division.

title: The Screen:'Men's Lives' Looks at Male Mystique
description: "Men's Lives," the documentary that opened yesterday at the Bleecker Street Cinema's Filmmakers Showcase, explores the masculine mystique in a competitive society.The film was made in their native Midwest by Will Roberts and Josh Hanig, who worked two years on this first venture, starting when they were students in Antioch. It is an interesting, even entertaining look at how males grow into men, mostly aggressive - minded men, and what values rub off on them as they do so. The thesis is formed by interviews with men, boys, some women, too. And the ones who are doing the speaking are not psychologists or professional social observers. They are factory workers, teachers, coaches, athletes, students, and each presents his perspective articulately.A town barber, with the sensitivity of a good analyst, describes what his customers tell him and makes sage comment. Girls describe how they feel in relationship to the role of men. The result of all this is to give you a new view of yourself and your world.Because so much of masculine behavior seems to hinge so much on competition, there is some confusion, perhaps, about which, if either, led to which. It would be worthwhile to follow up "Men's Lives" with a look at masculinity in noncompetitive societies, wherever they are.Also on the bill is "Janie's Janie," about a welfare mother in New Jersey, white and separated from her husband. In her own words, this working-class woman tells how, after being dominated by father and husband, she was able to develop her own personality. It's an absorbing account, filmed by Geri Ashur and Peter Barton.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The ninemember Jersey City Council voted unanimously to refuse to accept recently approved $2,000ayear pay increases in the face of a $15.7million budget gap. The Council instructed the city's Finance Director, Jerome Lazarus, to withhold the raises approved last November and deposit the funds in the city's general revenue fund.

title: Text of Bergman's Statement to U. S. Senate Panel on LongTerm Care of the Aging
description: Distinguished Chairman, Congressman Koch, Assemblyman Stein and members of the committee. You will excuse me, I hope, if I say to you at the outset that it is rather hard for me to believe that my appearance before you today is not a result of an incredible nightmare that must soon come to an end.

title: Chance Encounter Leads to Art Journal
description: LUGANO, SwitzerlandI followed the lady to Zurich. That is James Fitzsimmons's simple explanation of how he, an American born in China, happens to be established in Switzerland as editor and publisher of a magazine known in art circles the world over.

title: OIL VALUE SHIFTS SET IN VENEZUELA
Ways and Means Takes Up Tax Cuts Before Oil Levy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The House Ways and Means Committee, with the concurrence of President Ford, has decided to postpone consideration of increased taxes on oil and concentrate on drafting a taxcut bill to counteract the recession.

title: VATICAN'S STAND ON ISRAEL SCORED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The American Orthodox rabbinate today deplored the failure of recent Vatican guidelines on CatholicJewish relations to forthrightly acknowledge that the land of Israel is central in the theology of Judaism.

title: Bus Hijacked in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 21 (AP)Two bandits hijacked a Continental Trailways bus leaving Baltimore early today and robbed its passengers of more than $900. No one was injured in the holdup, but the police said that one of the two robbers threatened to shoot both the driver and a 15yearold Baltimore girl.

title: Milwaukee School Strike In 2d Day as Talks Go On
Rites for Pineda Attended by 1,000
description: GLENDALE, Calif., Jan. 21 (AP)With fellow jockeys as pallbearers, Alvaro Pineda was buried today in a long and moving ceremony attended by more than 1,000 mourners.

title: Cheating in Science
description: DENVERTwo incidents of unethical conduct in medical research laboratoriesone at the SloanKettering Institute for Cancer Research, one at Harvardhave recently come to the attention of the public. Unfortunately, those of us in the biological sciences know that these two cases are but the tip of the iceberg. Increasing numbers of faked data or, less flagrantly, data with body English put on them, make their way into the scientific journals.

title: Roy Shipstad Is Dead on Coast; Founder of Ice Follies Was 64
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Jan. 21 (AP)Roy Shipstad, the former parkinglot attendant who helped found the Shipstads & Johnson Ice Follies, died yesterday at Stanford Medical Center. He was 64 years old.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Decolonialism Amok?
description: PARIS  The twentieth century's strongest political force is not the ideological revolution produced by Communism, the implications of nuclear weapons, nor even the sudden discovery by developing nations of the immense value of raw materials they possess.

title: A.M.C. Joins the NewCar Rebate Move
description: DETROIT, Jan. 21The American Motors Corporation today followed the Big Three auto makers in offering cash rebates to buyers of new cars.

title: West Beats East In W.H.A., 6 to 4
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Jan. 21 (AP) Bobby Hull and Gordie Howe tallied during a fourgoal outburst in the second period that carried the West to a 64 triumph over the East in the World Hockey Association AllStar game tonight.

title: 2 Heart Experts Dispute PersonalityType of Risk
description: MARCO ISLAND, Fla., Jan. 21 Two leading experts in heart disease challenged today the widely publicized theory of a fellow cardiologist that an aggressive, competitive, impatient personality pattern is the main cause of heart attacks in this country.

title: A Night of Firsts in Music Series
description: It was a night of firsts Monday at Carnegie Recital Hall. There was the first New York appearance of the Lyric Arts Trio and other core members of an organization called New Music Concerts of Toronto, offering the first United States performances of six works by Canadian composers.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: WRITERS POLL By The Associated Press

title: Article 3  No Title
13 Killed in Montreal Bar, Apparently Gang Victims
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 21Thirteen people were murdered early today in a tavern here, and the police said that the slayings appeared to be the work of gangsters.

title: Housing Industry Dropping Costly Extras
description: DALLAS, Jan. 21A turn away from extravagant extras in housing construction is evident across the country in response to the combined effects of inflation and recession.

title: Increased City Power Is Urged Over PublicBenefit Agencies
description: To increase the city's influence over the virtually autonomous public benefit corporations, a report to the State Charter Revision Commission recommended that the Mayor be given the power to appoint the chairmen of all boards of public authorities that operate exclusively within the city.

title: Dressed and Ready, Exercise Instructor Makes House Calls
description: Most weekday mornings, Barbara Pearlman gets up early, prepares the family breakfast and then sees her husband off to his plastics business and her 6yearold son off to school. It's a normal family scene, except that mother is wearing a black leotard and tights under her shirt and pants, ready to leave for her job.

title: HOME HUMIDITY NEEDS
description: (In gallons per 24 hours)

title: Seaver Takes 20% Pay Cut
description: Tom Seaver, conceding that he had endured a very, long season, signed his 1975 contract with the New York Mets yesterday and quietly accepted a $34,000 drop in salary  representing the maximum 20 per cent cut allowed in baseball.

title: High Goals of Detroit's Black Mayor Foiled by Recession
description: DETROIT, Jan. 21It was a watershed, a rare Interlude of optimistic good feeling during which many shellshocked Detroiters sensed new beginnings and seemed united, for once, against the dangers and difficulties besetting their city.

title: Ford, Assailing Rationing, Sees 9GallonaWeek Top
description: WASHINGTON Jan. 21 In defending his energy program for the nation today, President Ford said that the use of gasoline rationing alone to achieve his 1975 goal for a reduction of oil imports would limit each driver to fewer than nine gallons a week.

title: Recipes With Eye On the Grocery Bill
description: Here are some of Miss Sherwin's favorite recipes that she uses when meat prices are high.

title: 5TH AVENUE UNIT VOICES OPTIMISM
description: The Fifth Avenue Association, the official keeper of the faith in the Fifth Avenue area, held its annual meeting yesterday elected a new president and announced that in the midst of these shaky times, the great avenue was holding it own.

title: People in Sports
description: Calvin Hill, running back of the Dallas Cowboys in the National Football League, said yesterday he would quit the sport if his deal with Honolulu of the struggling World Football League didn't work out. I am tired and I would like to get out before I get hurt, Hill said. But I wouldn't mind going to a place like Hawaiiamong new people and in fresh surroundings. I hope the W.F.L. works out. If not, I probably will retire. The 27yearold 230pounder, who played out his option with Dallas last season, said he was considering attending law school or enrolling in a seminary. He has studied for the ministry.

title: Campaign for Neediest Passes Midpoint and Nears $1Million
description: The 63d annual New York Times Neediest Cases Fund neared the $1million mark as it passed the midpoint in the campaign, which will end March 1.

title: Spurs Down Pacers
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Jan. 21 (UPI)Rich Jones, George Gervin and Swen Nater each scored more than 20 points tonight as the San Antonio Spurs beat the Indiana Pacers, 11091, in an American Basketball Association game.

title: Market Summary
description: Tuesday, January 21. 1975

title: State Grand Jury to Hear Six Passaic Freeholders
description: PATERSON, Jan. 21Six of the seven members of the Passaic County Board of Freeholders are expected to testify tomorrow before a state grand jury in Trenton concerning property purchases made by the county in the last two years.

title: BUILDING AGENCY GETS 30DAY LOAN
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21The Urban Development Corporation has obtained a $30million shortterm loan to maintain its construction projects while Governor Carey pursues the delicate task of seeking bipartisan support for his emergency plan to shore up the troubled agency.

title: City's Naming of Grand Central As a Landmark Voided by Court
description: State Supreme Court justice Irving H. Saypol yesterday invalidated the landmarks designation of Grand Central Terminal, a symbol of the city for decades.

title: High Court Backs Women's Jury Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Supreme Court ruled today that shifting economic and social patterns of the last dozen years have made it constitutionally unacceptable for states to deny women equal opportunity to serve on juries.

title: Bolivian ExPresident Held In a Plot to Install Leftists
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Jan. 21 (AP)  Former President Hernan Siles Zuazo has been arrested for plotting to replace President Hugo Banzer Suarez's military regime with a leftish civilian government, the Government announced.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Domestic and Foreign Matters
Revenues Up Slightly
description: The E. F. Hutton Group, Inc., parent of the brokerage house of E. F. Hutton & Co., reported a decline in preliminary fourthquarter earnings yesterday, from $4.2million, or 90 cents per share, in 1973 to $3.3million, or 71 cents per share in the final quarter last year.

title: UNIONS GIVE PLAN TO CUT CITY LAYOFF
description: The leaders of the city's labor unions presented to Mayor Beame yesterday a sevenpoint program that they contend would mean savings of $8.5million and preclude the layoffs of any Civil Service employes.

title: Father and Son Are Suspects In 74 BreakIn in Lindenwold
description: The possibility that Joseph Kallinger and his son Michael were the manandboy team involved in a case of breaking and entering and attempted rape last Nov. 22 in Lindenwold, N. J., was under investigation yesterday by the Camden County Prosecutor's Office.

title: Appeals Court Clerk Named
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21 (UPI)Joseph W. Bellacosa, 37 years old, of Syosset, L. I., has been named chief clerk of the State Court of Appeals, Chief Judge Charles D. Breitel announced today. Mr. Bellacosa succeeds James W. Flavin in the $46,000ayear job.

title: SAFEGUARD URGED IN GENE TRANSFER
description: Biologists advising British Government research agencies yesterday warned that rigorous safeguards would be needed to control studies of potentially beneficial new techniques for socalled genetic engineeringtransferring genes, units of heredity, into and among singlecell bacteria.

title: HighCourt Ruling On Jury Selection May Affect State
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 21Today's Supreme Court ruling on jury selection in Louisiana may have profound impact on the criminal justice system in New York.

title: 13 Killed in Montreal Bar, Apparently Gang Victims
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 21Thirteen people were murdered early today in a tavern here, and the police said that the slayings appeared to be the work of gangsters.

title: Bulls Subdue Knicks, 9794
description: Chet Walker bulled his way to the basket with 32 seconds remaining last night, then completed the 3point play after he was fouled by Bill Bradley as the Chicago Bulls defeated the Knicks, 9794, at Madison Square Garden.

title: State School Aides Gloomy on Integration
WIFE CHARGES BIAS IN SOVIET VERDICT
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 21 Sofia Leviyev, a heavyset woman of 49, sat in her family's wellfurnished apartment here today and said that her husband, Mikhail, had been sentenced to death not because he may be guilty of economic crimes against the Soviet Union, but because he is a Jew.

title: Tasty Winter Gift From the Sea
description: Although Boston is celebrated as the home of (the bean and) cod, that most delectable of winter fish is generally availableparticularly at this time of the yearup and down the Eastern seaboard.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Music: James Dick
description: James Dick, a pianist from Texas who has placed high in such prestigious competitions as the Leventritt and Tchaikovsky, gave his first New York recital last night in Carnegie Hall. What with about 10 years of public performances behind him, and with his imposing credentials, it would have been expected that Mr. Dick would play with confidence and expertise. And he did.

title: Nader Says Study Given Ford Backs Car Pollution Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, said today that a Ford Administration analysis showed automobile fuel economy could be raised 40 per cent by 1980 without relaxing tighter auto emission standards set for 1977 and 1978.

title: 1,500 Lebanese Abandon IsraeliDamaged Village
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 21The village of Shuba, where Palestinian guerrillas decided to make a stand against Israeli raiders last week, is abandoned now. Most of the stone and concrete houses have been damaged by Israeli artillery.

title: SOUTH KOREA PLANS A VOTE ON CHARTER
description: SEOUL, South Korea,Wednesday, Jan. 22 (AP)President Park Chung Hee promised today to hold a referendum soon on the Constitution that his authoritarian regime imposed on the country in 1972.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The prosecution in the trial of Mayor Angelo J. Errichetti of Camden charged that the defendant took a $500 cash payoff in 1969 from a painting contractor he had helped to get city contracts. At the time, Mr. Errichetti was Camden's Public Works Director. The allegation was made by Deputy Attorney General David J. Foley in the opening statement at the Mayor's trial on conspiracy and misconduct charges. Conviction on both charges would carry a maximum sentence of six years in prison.

title: Oppenheimer Sets Deal With British
description: Oppenheimer & Co., a member of the New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that an agreement in principle had been reached with Electra House, Ltd., of London for the sale for $7million of an interest in three Oppenheimer operations. Leon Levy, an Oppenheimer partner, said the transaction, which is subject to approval by the Bank of England, would give Electra House a 10 per cent voting interest in the Oppenheimer Management Company, which advises the Oppenheimer group of mutual funds; the Oppenheimer Investment Management Company, a money management company, and Oppenheimer & Co., a member firm of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: PAN AM WIDENS MERGER SEARCH
description: The list of possible merger partners for the financially strained Pan American World Airways grew to at least three yesterday when it and American Airlines announced they were studying the possibility of combining their operations.

title: Market Place
description: There is a theory in Wall Street that when groups of officers and directors of a particular company sell shares during the same period they may be doing so because they expect the stock to weaken and they want to get out at the highest possible price before the public begins to act.

title: $150,000 for Filly
description: OCALA, Fla., Jana. 21 (AP) A chestnut filly by Raise A Native out of Scotch Verdict sold for $150,000 late today, the highest price paid in the twoday auctions held by the Ocala Breeders Sales Company.

title: Tax Cut Gives Legality a Chance Against Illegality in Nevada Betting
description: Until three weeks ago, sports bettors and horseplayers had to pay a 10 per cent Federal excise tax every time they made a legal wager with Nevada's licensed bookmakers.

title: LONG BRANCH FIRE KILLS 2 CHILDREN
description: LONG BRANCH, Jan. 21A seriously burned 5yearold boy was listed in critical condition in Monmouth Medical Center here today after being rescued from a fire in Which two other children were killed.

title: Rev. John L. Bonn, 68, Dies; Taught English at Fairfield
description: The Rev. John L. Bonn, a Roman Catholic educator and a member of the Society of Jesus, died Saturday at Loyola University Medical Center, Maywood, Ill. He was 68 years old and lived in Franklin Park, Ill.

title: BERGMAN SEEKS TO REBUT FILES
description: In testimony yesterday before the Senate Subcommittee on LongTerm Care, Bernard Bergman undertook a linebyline rebuttal of two documents from the files of the State Health Department.

title: No Creole Comment
description: A spokesman for the Creole Petroleum Company, the Venezuelan affiliate of the Exxon Corporation and the largest producer in Venezula, said the company had not yet been officially informed of the changes in laws and thus was unable to comment.

title: World SST Fleets Said Not to Damage The Ozone Blanket
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) A threeyear study dispels fear that the present fleet of supersonic transports will damage the earth's protective blanket of ozone, the Department of Transportation said today.

title: Notes on People
State Budget Game: Surpluses Pop Up and Disappear
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21There is no law on the books in New York State that says the outs have to find a budget surplus and the ins have to deny that a surplus exists.

title: FORD ACTS TO BALK DRIVE IN CONGRESS for GAS RATIONING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Ford moved today to head off a drive in Congress and elsewhere for gasoline rationing, saying in a news conference that he would veto mandatory rationing of that fuel alone as a superficial answer to the need to cut energy consumption.

title: Swiss Bank Corp. Expects No SindonaRelated Losses
description: GENEVA, Jan. 21The Swiss Bank Corporation disputed today a report from Geneva in the New York Times yesterday that it stood to suffer substantial losses from the collapse of Michele Sindona's financial empire because of the refusal of the society Generale Immobilaire to pay the bank's claims against it.

title: Badische Cutting Output
description: The Dow Badische Company, Williamsburg, Va., announced yesterday that it would stop production of double knit fabrics immediately at its Dentex Mills subsidiary in East Rutherford, N. J. Some of the 250 employes of the plant will be given an opportunity to transfer to other company locations.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 21 (UPI)The police turned over to the commissioner's office of the National Football League today a report from a 19yearold woman who said she had delivered narcotics to players throughout the country. Investigators said they believed the report had some merit because she had given details and names. The woman, Roxie Ann Rice, was arrested Jan. 6 for defrauding a motel operator here.

title: American Beef Order Set
description: OMAHA, Jan. 21 (UPI)A Federal bankruptcy judge signed an order today allowing American Beef Packers, Inc. of Omaha, to conduct a custom slaughtering operation at its Fort Morgan, Colo., plant. The order requested by American Beef and signed by United States Bankruptcy Judge David L. Crawford, permitted the first reopening of an American Beef plant since the company filed bankruptcy proceedings Jan. 7.

title: Israelis Intensify Antiguerrilla Tactics in Lebanon
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 21Israeli Army units on the Lebanese border have intensified a campaign in recent weeks to carry their battle against the Palestinian guerrillas to the Lebanese side of the frontier.

title: Burton Browne, 69, Dead; Founder of Gaslight Clubs
description: Burton Browne, founder and chairman of Gaslight Clubs, Inc., died Monday in Chicago, where he lived. He was 69 years old.

title: Sports Betting: States Plan No Risk Future
description: Legal sports gambling will develop its own customers without seriously threatening the multibilliondollar market for illegal bets.

title: Col. Napoleon D. Valeriano, Counterinsurgency Expert
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) Col. Napoleon Diestro Valeriano, who was decorated by the United States and Philippine Governments for valor and gallantry in counterinsurgency warfare, died yesterday of a cerebral hemorrhage at Holy Cross Hospital in suburban Silver Spring, Md. He was 58 years old.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE AS VOLUME SLIPS
description: Prices rose yesterday on the American Stock Exchange but closed mixed in the overthecounter market as the Amex showed a moderate drop in trading while the counter market had a slight increase.

title: P.L.O. Seeks to Be a Party To Treaties on War Victims
description: GENEVA, Jan. 21The Swiss Foreign Ministry said today that it had under study a bid by the Palestine Liberation Organization to be recognized as a party to the four 1949 Geneva conventions on the protection of war victims.

title: Artist's Plan on Fence Hits Stone Wall
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Jan. 21 Christo's Running Fence has run into a stone wallat least for the moment.

title: 3 Girls Terrorize Man In Brooklyn Apartment
description: Albert Santangelo answered the doorbell at his Brooklyn apartment Monday evening to find a small teenaged girl who said she was looking for a friend.

title: High Court Backs Women's Jury Rights
AllStars Of Wales Win, 71
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 21The National Hockey League's answer to the Academy Awards, the 28th AllStar game, was staged tonight in the Montreal Forum with nary a rehearsal. It was the Prince of Wales Conference team that proved best at the improvisation, trouncing the team from the Clarence Campbell Conference, 71.

title: Economic Iceberg Vexes N.H.L.
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 21 While it has been a lot of fun and just one game for the National Hockey League's AllStar players, the past two days in Montreal have been no vacation for the league's owners and general managers.

title: Women Reporters Break the Ice
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 21History was made tonight at the National Hockey League AllStar game, but it had nothing to do with the outcome. Two women reporters entered the hockey players' dressing room for postgame interviews in what was probably the first time at a professional sports event.

title: HOME FACING CUTOFF PLANNING TO COMPLY
description: Threatened with the cutoff of Federal funds, a New Jersey nursing home said yesterday that it would take all possible steps to comply with firesafety regulations to prevent a cutoff.

title: Article 2  No Title
DR. HAROLD A.BOSLEY OF CHRIST CHURCH, 67
description: The Rev. Dr. Harold A. Bosley, retired senior minister of Christ Church, Methodist, Park Avenue and 60th Street, died Monday at his home. He was 67 years old and lived in Beach Haven Terrace, N.J.

title: WADE ARNOLD DEAD; RADIOTV PRODUCER
description: Wade Arnold, a freelance writer who edited and produced many radio and television documentaries, died Monday in St. Luke's Hospital. He lived at 125 West 56th Street.

title: Displaced Farm Workers Lose Industrial jobs in Rural South
description: MADISON, Ark., Jan. 18Even though he is 49 years old and hardened in the body, B. B. Williams's eyes are bright with innocence. Maybe that explains why he is not so much disillusioned as simply puzzled.

title: Top Lawyers Clash at Hearing After a Question About Politics
description: Gary P. Naftalis, a special assistant to the Senate Subcommittee on LongTerm Care, sat quietly through six hours of the hearing on the nursinghome industry yesterday. Then he asked the only question of the day that sparked a clash between lawyers.

title: Dollar Drops to 14Month Low Against the Franc in Europe
description: PARIS, Jan. 21The dollar reached a 14month low against the French franc today, was near its record low against the West German mark and the Swiss franc and even dropped against Europe's socalled weak currencies, the British pound and the Italian lira.

title: Goolagong's Status
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 21 (AP)Evonne Goolagong will not be out three months because of a wrist injury, Vic Edwards, her managercoach, said today.

title: Advertising
description: Joe Namath, Mickey Mouse. W. C. Fields. George M. Cohan. Hugh B. Exnicios. How's that for a little name dropping?

title: MAN AND A YOUTH VANISH IN ESSEX
description: MONTCLAIR, Jan. 21The Essex County Prosecutor said today that two men who left on Jan. 13 in a car from a bowling alley where they worked apparently are being held against their will.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Bowie Races Still Off
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 21 (AP) Today's scheduled card at Bowie Race Course was canceled because of bad track conditions, and officials announced that tomorrow's races also had been scrapped.

title: Activity in Exports Is Spur to Demand for Corn Futures
description: Improved weekly export figures spurred a rush to buy grain and soybean futures yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. Many of the buyers were shorts who bought to even out their positions.

title: 51 SENATORS OPPOSE SOCIAL SECURITY CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI) A bipartisan majority of the Senate today declared its opposition to President Ford's proposal to limit to 5 per cent a Social Security costofliving increase.

title: PRICES OP BONDS RISE MODERATELY
description: Bond prices were bid up moderately yesterday, as expected, in response to the Federal Reserve's easing of bank reserve requirements late Monday. Although the Fed's action is expected to make $1.1billion more available for bank loans next month, buyers of fixed  interest securities were encouraged by this latest sign of easier credit.

title: Grand Central Landmark Status Voided
description: State Supreme Court justice Irving H. Saypol yesterday invalidated the landmarks designation of Grand Central Terminal, a symbol of the city for decades.

title: OLD TEST LEADS TO NEW DIAGNOSIS
description: Two doctors reported yesterday to the New York Heart Association that a test for detection of antibodies could be applied to help diagnose a common, painful disorder that often complicates heart surgery.

title: FORD DENOUNCES HANOI OFFENSIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Ford, strongly supporting the Saigon Government, today denounced North Vietnam for violating the Paris ceasefire accords and confirmed that he would ask Congress for $300million in additional military aid for South Vietnam.

title: Trenton Deficit Up $ 50Million; Budget Gap Put at $600Million
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21  The Byrne administration reported today that the anticipated deficit in the state's current $2,75billion budget had risen by nearly $50million and that the next budget being prepared for the Legislature would have a deficit of approximately $600million.

title: Indiana Gunmen Hold Four After Robbery Bid Fails
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Jan. 21 (AP)Two gunmen took two policemen and two women hostages and headed out of town in an unmarked police van tonight, the police said. A state police helicopter followed the van, the authorities said.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: FOUNDATIONS GIVE WNET $2.8MILLION
description: Five private foundations have contributed $2.85million toward the construction of a permanent home for television station WNET/13 on six floors of the Henry Hudson Hotel.

title: Yastrzemski Signs Pact at $175,000
description: BOSTON, Jan. 21 (AP)The Boston Red Sox announced today the signing of Carl Yastrzemski and 16 other players for the 1975 baseball season.

title: THOMAS M. WARNER
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 21 (AP) Thomas M. Warner, athletic director of Butler University, died last night. He was 48 years old.

title: and the Money Men
description: The chairmen of the Appropriations subcommittees are among the most powerful persons in Congress and least known outside. Because they determine the level of spending for specific programs and their decisions are rarely overturned, they are in a position to wield definitive and sometimes arbitrary power over the Federal agencies whose budgets they review.

title: People in Sports
description: Calvin Hill, running back of the Dallas Cowboys in the National Football League, said yesterday he would quit the sport if his deal with Honolulu of the struggling World Football League didn't work out. I am tired and I would like to get out before I get hurt, Hill said. But I wouldn't mind going to a place like Hawaiiamong new people and in fresh surroundings. I hope the W.F.L. works out. If not, I probably will retire. The 27yearold 230pounder, who played out his option with Dallas last season, said he was considering attending law school or enrolling in a seminary. He has studied for the ministry.

title: Article 1  No Title
Sperry Rand Posts Record Profit of $1.10 a Share
description: The Sperry Rand Corporation reported yesterday a net income of $38million, or $1.10 a share, for the third fiscal quarter ended Dec. 31.

title: Jersey Budget Deficit Put At $600Million '75'76
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21  The Byrne administration reported today that the anticipated deficit in the state's current $2.75billion budget had risen by nearly $50million and that the next budget being prepared for the Legislature would have a deficit of approximately $600million.

title: People and Business
description: Peter M. Flanigan, who played a controversial role in the settlement of the Government's antitrust case against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, has been appointed managing director of Dillon, Read & Co., Inc., a New York investment banking house. He was a partner in the company before he went to Washington in April, 1969.

title: Canadian Found Guilty In DrugSmuggling Case
description: Santos Cotroni of Montreal was found guilty of conspiracy last night in a $3million cocainesmuggling case. The jury in United States District Court in Brooklyn, deliberated for 10 hours before bringing in the guilty verdict against Mr. Cotroni and a codefendant, Frank D'Asti.

title: HELMS REJECTED C.I.A. ACTION IN U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Richard Helms assured the Senate Foreign Relations Committee two years ago that the domestic surveillance of antiwar activists was not a proper function for the Central Intelligence Agency, a review of previously published testimony shows.

title: New Books
description: Guernica Night, by Barry N. Malzberg (BobbsMerrill, $6.95). Life in a psychotic world of the future.

title: Byrne Is Ready to Hear Problems of the People
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21 (AP)Governor Byrne has decided to give New Jersey citizens the opportunity to meet with him facetoface to discuss their problems.

title: Press Freedom: Legal Threats
description: WASHINGTONA body of law is developing that poses a serious threat to our traditional view of the First Amendment. Yet this development has received little attention not only by those most directly affectedthe press but by the ultimate beneficiaries of the First Amendment, the public. It is known as the Dickinson doctrine.

title: FRANCE TO PRESS OIL EXPLORATION
description: PARIS, Jan. 21The French Government announced today that it would be increasing the hunt for oil in France and French overseas territories with a view to lessening dependence on imports. The Government also decided to establish a national stockpile of raw materials.

title: American Electric Is Planning Coal Projects at $100Million
description: The American Electric Power Company has said that it is investing more than $100million in projects involving more than 80,000 acres of land in Eastern Kentucky containing some of the last undeveloped deposits of lowsulphur highheat coal East of the Mississippi River.

title: Highs Also Set in Revenues of '74 and 4th Period
description: The Republic Steel Corporation and the Armco Steel Corporation reported yesterday that both revenues and net income for their fourth quarters and for 1974 were new highs.

title: 2 Women Found Knifed to Death In Their Apartment in Elmhurst
description: Two Queens women were stabbed to death yesterday afternoon in their apartment in Elmhurst. The infant child of one harmed in the bed where his mother had died.

title: About New York
description: For those who cared to look on yesterday at the Fort Tryon Nursing Home in Washington Heights, the televised hearings of the Senate subcommittee into the nursinghome industry touched off poignant and personal responses that went further than the questioners and witnesses on the small screen might have imagined.

title: MARVIN E. HOLDERNESS
description: Marvin Early Holderness, who was the founder in 1913 and first president of the Financial Advertisers Association, now the Bank Marketing Association, died yesterday at a convalescent home in Columbia, Tenn. He was 97 years old.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: GAS PIPELINE TAPS UNEXPECTED SUPPLY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) A gas pipeline whose winter gas cutbacks to cities and industries threatened thousands of layoffs has unexpectedly come up with an extra 2 billion cubic feet of gas.

title: Books of The Times
description: Rex Harrison must indeed be a good actor, for he certainly had me fooled all these years. On the basis of his performances, I have always imagined him to be a most sophisticated personworldly, articulate, ironical, perhaps even a bit cynical. But now, after reading Rex: An Autobiography, I find he is nothing or the sort. He seems to have kept intact a personality that has very little resemblance to his professional image. One of his favorite words, for example, is fun and what he means by it is not very different from the dictionary definition. Even acting, he says, is fun and I wonder how Marlon Brando or Jane Fonda would feel about that.

title: Borg and Smith Are Upset in Pro Tennis
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 21Two more top figures, Bjorn Borg and Stan Smith, joined Rod Laver, the defender, and Alex Metreveli on the sidelines today as upsets continued to riddle the seeded list in the $115,000 United States indoor tennis championships at the Spectrum.

title: French Order Tighter Security at Orly Airport to Thwart Attacks
description: PARIS, Jan. 21  Interior Minister Michel Poniatowski announced a further reinforcement of security measures at Orly airport today in the hope of thwarting terrorist attacks like the one last Sunday.

title: Support Your Local Bookmaker
description: Now that The Times is keeping us all entertained with a lively and informative series on betting, this seems a good time to remind the clients of a duty that every good citizen owes to his community: Support your local bookmaker. Most Americans deplore dishonesty in games, even though they may be accustomed to it in government, and it has been pointed out here in the past that one of the most effective safeguards against hankypanky in sports is the illegal bookie. Because he is invariably the intended victim in any attempted betting coup, he must be constantly on the alert in order to survive. He is usually the first to detect the odor of suspicion, like an unexpectedly heavy play on some event or an illogical shift in the odds. When that happens, he takes the game off the board, defeating the purpose of the fix.

title: Moss Heads Senate Unit On NursingHome Care
description: Following is a list of Senators on the subcommittee on longterm care of the Special Senate Committee on Aging:

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Eastern Air Pares Loss; Hutton Group Prof it off
Persian Gulf Emerging as Military Focus
description: The Strait of Hormuz, leading to the Persian Gulf and the world's richest oilfields, is becoming the focus for global strategy involving the United States, the Soviet Union and their allies east of Suez.

title: If You're Tired of the Usual Snowman
description: If you think virtually every medium in the world has already been bent to the uses of handcrafts, look again. You forgot about the great outdoors in winter.

title: Father and Son Are Suspects In '74 BreakIn in South Jersey
description: The possibility that Joseph Kallinger and his son Michael were the manandboy team involved in a case of breaking and entering and attempted rape last Nov. 22 in Lindenwold, N. J., was under investigation yesterday by the Camden County Prosecutor's Office.

title: Dissent of 3 Lines Holds Up Atlantic AirFare Accord
description: GENEVA, Jan. 21 Agreement on a new North Atlantic airfare package was held up today because of the dissent of 3 of the 30 airlines that met here under the auspices of the International AirTransport Association.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: An offering of 7 million shares of common stock of Middle South Utilities, Inc. at $14 a share was made yesterday by underwriters headed by Kidder, Peabody & Co. Proceeds will be used to reduce outstanding bank loans due June 30, 1975.

title: Ellsworth's Horses Are Starved
description: CHINO, Calif., Jan. 21 (UPI) The famous thoroughbred ranch of Rex C. Ellsworththe onetime home of legendary Kentucky Derby winner swapshas been taken over by state health authorities who found more than 100 horses near starvation.

title: Museum of 300 Picassos To Open in Paris in 1976
description: PARIS, Jan. 21A major Picasso museum is to be opened here late next year, it was announced today by the Secretary of State for Culture, Michel Guy.

title: Grief Grips CoWorkers Of Slain Police Officer
description: Police officers with black armbands went about their work silently yesterday at the West 10th Street station house as a citywide search continued for the woman accomplice of the robbery suspect who killed Patrolman Joseph R. Garcia in a gun battle at a BMT subway station. The suspect also died in the duel.

title: Top Income Limit Raised InPublicHousing Projects
description: The City Housing Authority announced yesterday that it was raising the maximum income a family can have and still be admitted to lowrent public housing here. The move is an attempt to broaden the economic mixture of its tenants and also to keep pace with inflation.

title: Shapp Promises to Persevere as Liberal
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 21Milton J. Shapp, the only Pennsylvania Governor to succeed himself in more than a century, began his second term today with a pledge to persevere in the liberalism that brought both acrimony and acclaim to his first four years in office.

title: PRESIDENT HOPES for HOUSE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Ford took a hard line today in calling for enactment of his legislative program, but appeared conciliatory toward the drastically revamped House Democratic structure.

title: Amendment on Rights Defeated in Oklahoma
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Jan. 21 (UPI)The Oklahoma House rejected the Equal Rights Amendment today amid assertions that it would take women off a pedestal and fears of future United States Supreme rulings.

title: F.B.I. Chief Says Bureau Keeps Files on Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Clarence M. Kelley, Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, said today that the bureau keeps files on members of Congress, but he denied any impropriety.

title: NESTLE MERGER FOUGHT BY F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commission filed an antitrust complaint today against the giant Nestl organization, charging that its acquisition of the Stouf fer Corporation threatened to create a monopoly in some parts of the frozenfood business.

title: Business Briefs
description: Special to The New York Times

title: EXJUDGE B. J. KELLEY OF PHILADELPHIA, 77
description: Judge Bernard J. Kelley, retired senior judge of the Common Pleas Court of Philadelphia, died Monday at his home there. He was 77 years old.

title: Mr. Ford Defines Partnership
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 In his State of the Union Message on Jan. 15, President Ford was given an enthusiastic reception by his former colleagues in the Congress. He recognized that the state of the nation's economy was not good, and in one of the best speeches he has ever delivered, he struck just the right note for a divided Government and nation.

title: Soviet Says NATO's Demands Delay European Security Talks
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 21Pravda charged today that the Atlantic alliance countries were dragging out the European security conference by making excessive demands for measures aimed at increasing confidence in East and West about the military intentions of the other side.

title: Absorbing More Debt
Ways and Means Takes Up Tax Cuts Before Oil Levy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The House Ways and Means Committee, with the concurrence of President Ford, has decided to postpone consideration of increased taxes on oil and concentrate on drafting a taxcut bill to counteract the recession.

title: Fleeting Moment of Solemnity in Albany
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21As the first three members of the public ever to attend a meeting of the Senate Finance committee, you ought to get some kind of certificate, Senator John J. Marchi, Republican of Staten Island and the panel's chairman, said today to three Buffalo high school students sitting along a wall of the spacious committee room. History should note that you were here.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: WRITERS POLL

title: Belfast Blast Kills 2 Believed on Way To Plant Explosive
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 21Two men believed by the police to have been on their way to plant a bomb were killed in an explosion in their car near the center of Belfast tonight.

title: A.M.C. Offers Rebates
description: The American Motors Corporation has followed the Big Three auto makers in offering cash rebates to customers who buy new cars. A.M.C.'s rebates will range from $200 to $600 a car. Page 53.

title: Head of Senate Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Senator Frank E. Moss, chairman of the Subcommittee on Nursing Homes of the Special Committee on Aging, first began looking into the nursinghome operations of Bernand Bergman in 1966, during a hearing in New York City. He was one of the names of people whose operations were somewhat in question, and that we wanted to examine, recalled the Utah Democrat, whose committee returned to New York today for a new hearing on alleged abuses by nursinghome operators.

title: PARENT OF A BANK IN CHICAGO GAINS
description: The Continental Illinois Corporation, parent company of Chicago's biggest bank, reported yesterday that its fourthquarter earnings rose 6 per cent from a year earlier. Earnings for the full year were up 12 per cent.

title: Pakistan's Leader Worried by India's Intentions
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 21Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto said today that India was in an expansionist mood and that there was anxiety among Pakistanis about her intentions.

title: Oberlin Choir Keeps to Winning Ways
description: The years 1948 to 1970 might well be called the Golden Age of the Oberlin College Choir. That was the period when Robert Fountain was its director. Any time he came with his ensemble to New York, and it was often, it was an event to look forward to. He turned out a choir that was as good as, and probably better than, any other similar college group in the country.

title: Caucus: Second Round
description: When the House Democrats meet in caucus today, they will have a second chance to vote down Representative Wayne Hays of Ohio as chairman, of the House Administration Committee. They ought not bungle this opportunity again.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Mr. Ford's Flawed Plan
description: For a man who has just executed a 179degree turn in economic policy, President Ford is exhibiting surprising assurance that he has come up with just the right mix of programs for combating the complex triple challenge of recession, inflation and the energy crisis.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 21 (UPI)The police turned over to the commissioner's office of the National Football League today a report from a 19yearold woman who said she had delivered marijuana to players throughout the country. Investigators said they believed the report had some merit because she had given details and names. The woman, Roxie Ann Rice, was arrested Jan. 6 for defrauding a motel operator here.

title: Cunningham Called Carey's Top Political and Governmental Adviser
description: The Democratic State Chairman, Patrick J. Cunningham, who a couple of months ago had only the shrinking Bronx Democratic organization to call his own, is emerging as Governor Carey's top political aide and a key governmental adviser as well.

title: Stretching the Food Dollar Without Punishing the Palate
Atom Worker Death Inquiry Disputed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The atomic workers union challenged today important aspects of Federal and state investigations into the death of an Oklahoma laboratory technician and the charges she made about the plutonium plant where she worked.

title: Prices Here Rose 0.4% in December
description: The prices of consumer goods and services in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area rose 0.4 per cent last month, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics announced yesterday.

title: ACCORD REPORTED ON DAIRYLEA DEBT
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21 Dissident dairy farmers and Dairylea Cooperative, Inc., have reached a tentative agreement whereby the farmers will pay an assessment of $13.5million instead of $18.6million to help wipe out the cooperatIve's accumulated debt.

title: FORD ACTS TO BALK DRIVE IN CONGRESS for GAS RATIONING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Ford moved today to head off a drive in Congress and elsewhere for gasoline retioning, saying In a news conference that he would veto mandatory rationing of that fuel alone as a superficial answer to the need to cut energy consumption.

title: CONSUMER PRICES ROSE 12.2% IN '74, WORST SINCE '46
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The rise in consumer prices abated a little in December, but for 1974 as a whole consumer price inflation was the worst since 1946, the Labor Department reported today.

title: DOW OFF BY 5.55 IN MIXED MARKET
description: A morning attempt at a modest upturn on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday gave way by midday and the list closed mixed in selective trading.

title: NEW SOVIET BOMBER REPORTED IN SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) United States intelligence sources report that the Soviet Union has started to put into service a new longranbe supersonic bomber that may become an issue of controversy in the next stage of United StatesSoviet negotiations on limiting nuclear weapons.

title: State Court Official Urges Appointment of All Judges
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21Richard Bartlett, the state's chief administrative judge, called today for the appointment of all judges, rather than selecting them in elections.

title: Lebanon Complains at U.N. Of Israeli Raids on Village
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 21Lebanon accused Israel today of carrying out a series of attacks against the village of Shuba in which 11 villagers were wounded. Six others were kidnapped by Israeli soldiers, Lebanon charged in a letter to Secretary General Waldheim.

title: New Bond Issues
description: UTILITY BONDS

title: Consumer Notes
description: About half the tax returns filed in the New York area are not prepared by the taxpayers, but by someone else an accountant, a lawyer, an agent of the Internal Revenue Service or others.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Lawyer Who Won Busing Case Heads Legal Fund
description: A Southern civil rights lawyer who won the first case for busing to desegregate schools before the United States Supreme Court, was elected yesterday as the president of the NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund Inc.

title: Heavy Psychological Toll Is HalfHidden but Shattering Result of the Long Vietnam War
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 21An outsider in South Vietnam is forcefully struck by the appearance of normality almost everywhere. In the bustling cities, in the beautiful, expansive countryside, people conduct their lives in seeming obliviousness to the war.

title: Liquidation Is Planned for Arlan's Stores, Inc
description: Arlan's Department Stores, Inc., a discount chain that has had large losses, will be liquidated within two to three months, its Federally appointed trustee said yesterday. Arlan's has been operating under the provisions of the Federal Bankruptcy Act since May, 1973.

title: Peking Meetings: Transition Leadership Set
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 21The communiqus and proclamations that have come out of Peking in the last week never put it so crudely, but the basic task facing the Chinese leadership at its momentous meetings this month was to piece together a transitional leadership that could see the country through the impending successions to Chairman Mao Tsetung and Premier Chou Enlai.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 22, 1975

title: FOUNDATIONS GIVE WNET $2.8MILLION
description: Five private foundations have contributed $2.85million toward the construction of a permanent home for television station WNET/13 on six floors of the Henry Hudson Hotel.

title: Hebert Gives Up Fight To Keep Chairman Post
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP)Accusing House leaders of undercutting him, the former House Armed Services chairman, F. Edward Hebert, announced today that he had given up his fight to keep that job.

title: N.H.L. AllStars
description: FIRST PERIOD1, Wales Conference, Apps (1) (Johnston, Vadnals), 9:38. 2, Wales Conference, Luce (1) (O'Reilly, Dupere), 12:02, 3, Wales Conference, SINler (1) (Lafleur), 14:22. 4, Campbell Conference, Pelvis (11 (Unger), 19:41. No penalties.

title: TV: ABC Picks Breezy Format for AM America
description: One approach to AM America, ABC's new entry in the early morning TV sweepstakes, is simply to consider the physical image projected by the program's set.

title: MRS. MORRIS SCHRIER
description: Margie Rocamora Schrier, the wife of Morris M. Schrier, vice president and secretary of MCA, Inc., the talent agency, died Monday at Memorial SloanKettering Hospital. She was 58 years old and lived at 9 Cooper Road, Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: COALCON COMPANY GETS U.S. CONTRACT
description: The Department of the Interior's Office of Coal Research has awarded a $237.2million contract to the Coalcon Company for a demonstration plant that would produce clean synthetic fuels from coal.

title: BERGMAN LABELS ALL ALLEGATIONS AS TOTALLY FALSE
description: Bernard Bergman testified yesterday that the allegations against him in recent investigations of nursing homes were totally unfounded, baseless and false.

title: 2 Other Tracks Closed
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 21 (AP)Keystone Race Track in suburban Bucks County and Garden State Park in nearby Cherry Hill, N. J., canceled today's racing programs because of yesterday's snowstorm.

title: Chou Reportedly Tells Visitor of Heart Illness
description: TOKYO, Wednesday Jan. 22 (Reuters)Premier Chou Enlai of China told a Japanese visitor that he was suffering from heart trouble, the newspaper YomiuriShimbun reported today.

title: Ceiling Fall Aids HospitalSpace Hunt
description: The workers performing psychiatric services at Coney Island Hospital really hit the ceiling when the ceiling hit the floornot once but twice, according to District Council 37, State, County and Municipal Employes.

title: P.S.C. Acts on Carey Bid To Expand Panel to 7
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21The Public Service Commission, acting at Governor Carey's request, today unanimously certified the need to increase the number of commissioners from five to seven.

title: Bridge:
description: In the last two contests for the Bermuda Bowl, the emblem of world team supremacy, Brazil has earned a most creditable third position. It is unlikely that the South American representatives will improve on this ranking when the championship returns to its original home in Bermuda next week, and they might do worse.

title: CAROLINE NEWTON
description: Caroline Newton, a psychoanalyst and the first woman member of the International Psychoanalytical Society, died Monday at Bryn Mawr (Pa.) Hospital. She was 83 years old and lived at Berwyn, Pa.

title: BERGMAN LABELS ALL ALLEGATIONS AS TOTALLY FALSE
Text of Aide's Questioning of Bergman
description: NAFTALIS: You mentioned some conversations with Mr. [Stanley] Steingut [Speaker of the Assembly] regarding problems that you were having regarding your nursing homes, is that right?

title: Bergman Certified Worth Was Almost $24Million
description: Bernard Bergman, who testified before, a United States Senate subcommittee here on Tuesday that the nursinghome business was not very profitable, considering the responsibility involved, has in recent years certified his net worth as climbing from $6million to nearly S24million.

title: Market Basket Declines Slightly After a Month of Stable Prices
description: With a fractional decline in the cost of food following a month of fairly stable prices, the City Consumer Affairs Commissioner, Elinor C. Guggenheimer, said yesterday that we may have seen the end of the sudden, drastic advances in food prices that caused so much havoc with everybody's budget.

title: Pulcinella Is Failing the Test of Time
description: Contrary to popular belief, critics love to admit they were wrong. That needs some qualification. They love to admit they were wrong if they can say: This work was far better than I first imagined. I am sorry, I goofed, I was imperceptive, etc., etc. and etc. Then you come out like a good guy on a white horse. It is when the opinion goes the other way that the trouble begins. No one likes to admit that he has ever overpraised something.

title: How Much for Pollution?
description: If the United States were to address itself wholeheartedly to the task of improving the environment, one of the best of the sideeffects would be a significant drop in the rolls of the unemployed.

title: Rate Increase on Electricity Is in Effect on Long Island
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Jan. 22The average monthly cost of electricity for residential customers of the Long Island Lighting Company went up $2.36 today as the result of the authorization by the Public Service Commission 13 days ago of a $35.6million rate increase.

title: Sealyham Breeders Owe Success to Early Luck
description: Some people work for years on breeding programs and, with good fortune, produce a champion or two. Then others, with no experience, come up with successful resuits, such as Dr. and Mrs. Richard L. Etter. We've just been plain lucky, said Mrs. Etter. When I married, said the physician, who is chief of allergy and immunology at the University of Texas Medical School in Houston, my wife had a Sealyham terrier. She had shown him on occasions and he actually had a point.

title: Bullets Triumph By 9788
House in Order
description: The upheaval in the House of Representatives subsided yesterday as the majority Democrats at their latest caucus reelected Wayne Hays of Ohio as chairman of the House Administration Committee and confirmed all of the incumbent chairmen of the Appropriations subcommittees. But the anticlimactic ending to this political drama cannot diminish the historic significance of what has been achieved in reforming the House.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: An offering of 1.2 million common shares of Columbus and Southern Ohio Electric Company at $16 a share was made yesterday by underwriters headed by Dillon, Read & Co., Inc., and the Ohio Company.

title: RALPH MUNN, LED CARNEGIE LIBRARY
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 22 Ralph Munn, director of the Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh from 1928 until his retirement in 1964, died today at West Penn Hospital. He was 80 years old.

title: Chess
description: It might be a good idea to regard any pin as a catastrophe unless proven otherwise. There is no denying that there are harmless pins where the pinned piece is so solidly protected that no real pressure can be put on it, nor that some, pins can be turned against the pinner by spectacular pinbreaking combinations.

title: U.S. Aide Was Briefed on Assassination Equipment
Obscenity and Liquor: License Case Raises Constitutional Issue
description: Does liquor in the audience mix with simulated sex on stage Can a liquor licensing authority have its own standards on obscenity? And can a musical that respected producers, critics, authors and educators regard as legitimate art conforming to community standards be considered disorderly, lewd and indecent?

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in early editions of The New York Times on Jan. 14 incorrectly stated that Harvey Stuart is a law partner of Jack S. Hoffinger. That partnership was ended in 1973, Mr. Hoffinger said.

title: Dollar Falls Abroad
description: PARIS, Jan. 22The dollar plunged again today in heavy selling on European currency markets, causing Switzerland to take drastic action to check an influx of the unwanted American currency. The Swiss lifted the annual tax on new money from abroad deposited in Swiss francs to 40 per cent from 12 per cent.

title: Excerpts From Sadat's Interview in Le Monde
description: PARIS, Jan. 22Following are excerpts from an interview with President Anwar elSadat of Egypt published in Le Monde and translated by The New York Times:

title: Weiskopf Absolved Of Tucson Charge
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 22Tom Weiskopf's performance in last week's Tucson open did not violate tournament regulations about best efforts, Commissioner Deane Beman of the Tournament Players Division of the Professional Golfers Association announced here today.

title: 3 Volunteer Firemen Held As Connecticut Arsonists
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 22 (AP)Three youths identified by authorities as members of the Sound Beach volunteer fire department have been charged in seven recent fires in Greenwich, including a blaze at the Riverside railroad station that caused $30,000 damage.

title: BYRNE DOUBTS NEED for PERSONAL GUARD
description: TRENTON, Jan. 22 (UPI)Governor Byrne said today a state police security force to guard him might not be necessary. At the same time, a state trooper assigned to guard the Governor disclosed that between midnight and 8 A.M. there was only, one bodyguard assigned to Morven, the mansion where Mr. Byrne, his wife and seven children live.

title: Legislation May Save Job of City Policeman Who Lost Eye in BoobyTrap Blast
description: A rookie policeman who lost an eye in a boobytrap explosion and is scheduled to be dismissed from his job and deprived of all medical coverage as a result of the city's budget crisis, was told yesterday that he might not he discharged after all.

title: Getman Honored for Theory on Species
description: It may be hard to believe that whales are more closely related to horses than to seals, that crocodiles are closer to bird than to lizards, or that gorillas are closer to man than to their fellow apes the orangutans.

title: BOY'S KILLER ENDS HIS POLICE CAREER
The Miller Machine Runs on Confidence
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 22'When I'm standing over the ball, says Johnny Miller, serenity is knowing my worst shot is going to be pretty good.

title: Penguins Set Back Seals, 75
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 22 (AP) Jean Pronovost scored two goals and Ron Stackhouse helped set up three more to lead the Pittsburgh Penguins to a 75 National Hockey League victory over the California Golden Seals tonight.

title: CRANGLE'S $43,000 TOPS ALBANY LIST
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22The Democratic majority in the Assembly today issued a list of some of the spoils of victory. The list showed hefty salary increases for for many of the party faithful, including a $9,000ayear increase for Joseph F. Crangle, former Democratic state chairman.

title: To Gina Harris, Franco Always a Most Valuable Son
description: Franco Harris, Super Bowl IX's hero, was complaining to his mother yesterday.

title: SADAT CONDEMNS MOSCOW ON ARMS
