description: PARIS, Jan. 22  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt, who is to begin a visit to France next Monday, was quoted here today as having denounced the unfriendly attitude of the Soviet Union toward his country.

title: Chess:
description: It might be a good idea to regard any pin as a catastrophe unless proven otherwise. There is no denying that there are harmless pins where the pinned piece is so solidly protected that no real pressure can be put on it, nor that some pins can be turned against the pinner by spectacular pinbreaking combinations.

title: Bridge
description: A superficial observer might be forgiven for supposing that Italy's chances of winning the world team title for the fourth straight year in Bermuda next week are not good.

title: Moss Is Pleased by Progress at Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 Senator Frank E. Moss, Democrat of Utah, said today that he was pleased with the progress made at yesterday's nursinghome hearings In New York City.

title: 5 GOVERNORS SEEK TO BLOCK OIL LEVY
description: BOSTON, Jan. 22Five of the six New England Governors voted today to begin legal action to attempt to block President Ford's $3abarrel oil import tax.

title: People in Sports
Television
description: Morning

title: Heater Kills Three
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 22 (AP)  A boy and two adults died after apparently inhaling carbon monoxide fumes from space heater in their North Philadelphia aparement. The three were found yesterday in their apartment.

title: Pacts on Chemical And Biological War Signed by President
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (Reuters)  President Ford today signed two international agreements barring chemical and biological warfare, including one originally sponsored by the United States in 1925.

title: PRESIDENT BARS DELAY IN RAISING OIL IMPORT LEVY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 President Ford rejected outright today a request from a key Congressional committee chairman that he postpone, temporarily, his plan to impose an additional $1abarrel fee on imported oil.

title: People and Business
description: A New York banker wants the Federal Reserve Board to give a clearer signal that lending is back in fashion. John F. McGillicuddy, president of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust and its parent, the Manufacturers Hanover Corporation, yesterday termed the Fed's two reductions in the discount rate, the lowering of Reserve requirements and the easier tone in the money markets welcome steps in the right direction.

title: Chevron to Control Oil Field
description: Chevron Petroleum, Ltd. will take over responsibilities as the operator of the Ninian oil field in the North Sea from the Burmall Oil Company, Burmah said yesterday. Chevron is a unit of the Standard Oil Company of California. Burmah recently has experienced financial difficulties.

title: India's Opposition Scores Upset Victory
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 22  For the second time in three weeks, Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Congress party has been defeated in a byelection by opposition political parties backing an anticorruption movement led by Jayaprakash Narayan.

title: Salaries of Albany's Legislative Aides
News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, JANUARY 23, 1975

title: Minnesota Mining Enters Guilty Plea On Political Gifts
description: ST. PAUL, Jan. 22 (AP)The Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company pleaded guilty today to five counts of making illegal corporate contributions to political campaigns in violation or Minnesota law.

title: Racer Gets to Lift In Rented Truck
description: When 23yearold Judy Crawford, the Canadian champion, arrived at Hunter Mountain last week to tune up for the women's professional races, she tooled into the resort's parking lot in a twoton truck.

title: Planet Earth, a WhollyOwned Subsidiary
description: WASHINGTONThe power to shape our daily lives lies increasingly in the hands of the executives of global corporations. There is every reason to believe that these corporations will supplant the nationstate as the most powerful force in our lives and as the major actor in the international system.

title: 30 Cars Crash in Fog
description: SOUTH CHARLESTON, W. Va., Jan. 22 (UPI)A 30vehicle chain collision in a fog bank laced with chlorine, gas caused injuries and major damage on interestate 64.

title: 248 to Be Laid Off By Bell Telephone, Not 334, as Planned
description: NEWARK, Jan. 22The New Jersey Bell Telephone Company announced today that it would lay off 248 employes on Feb. 1, nstead of 334, as originally planned.

title: Friends Recall Benton at Memorial
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Jan. 22 Thomas Hart Benton, among the most American of American painters, was given a final memorial today in a chapel here in the heart of the country he portrayed on a heroic scale.

title: Chase Bank Clears Way for 2d Egyptian Facility
Ascent of Man Installment Cut Short by Power failure
description: The Ascent of Man was halted Tuesday night because of a power failure. Channel 13's third installment of the 13part series on the development of science went off the air at 8:59 31 minutes too soon.

title: Ellsworth Faces Court Charge
description: BENTON, La., Jan. 22 (AP)  Rex Ellsworth's thoroughbred racing empire appeared to fall apart today as California officials contemplated criminal charges against the former Arizona cowboy for alleged cruelty to animals.

title: Seatrain, Builder of Tankers, Lays Off 1,800 at Brooklyn Yard
description: Seatrain, the largest employer in the old Brooklyn Navy Yard, yesterday announced a fourweek layoff of virtually all its employes because of what it called hardships brought on by the international oil situation.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Soviet, Protesting Shooting Here, Charges Laxity
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22The Soviet Union protested angrily to the United States today over a shooting incident last weekend in New York at the Soviet mission to the United Nations.

title: Passage Seen for a ClassAction Bill
2 HeartAid Drugs Discounted by Study
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 Two drugs widely used to prolong the lives of men who have recovered from heart attacks have proved useless for that purpose in a massive nationwide study.

title: Friend of Ford Is New G.O.P. Committee Counsel
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 William C. Cramer, who once was under investigation for possible campaign contribution irregularities, was named general counsel to the Republican National Committee today.

title: City Councilman Monroe Cohen Dies in Brooklyn at the Age of 48
description: City Councilman Monroe Cohen, Democrat of Brooklyn, died last night, apparently of a heart attack at the Seaview Bagel store, Rockaway Parkway and Avenue J in the Canarsie section. He was 48 years old and lived at 10558 Avenue M., Brooklyn.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (Reuters)The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, known as the World Bank, decided to raise its lending rate to 8.5 per cent from 8 per cent, wellinformed sources said today.

title: Drab Soviet Schoolboys Uniforms to Get Modish Look
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22  Russian schoolboys, who for years have trudged through classes in stifling slategray wool uniforms, are at last acquiring a modish blue look that runs from widelapel jackets to bell  bottom trousers.

title: Humphrey Urges A Smaller Tax Cut Than Ford Seeks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (AP) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey called tonight for a personal income tax cut $10billion smaller than that advocated by President Ford, but with more emphasis on helping low and middleincome families.

title: DENIAL BY HELMS ON SPYING IS TOLD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22Richard Helms, the former Director of Central Intelligence, was reported today to have told a Senate committee that any C.I.A. infiltration of American dissident groups had been done without his knowledge.

title: BAGHDAD WILL BAR HIJACKERS IN FUTURE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 22 (AP) Iraq has vowed that never again will she allow a plane carrying armed Arab terrorists to land on her territory.

title: Gerulaitis Upsets Okker
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 22The spree of upsets in the $115,000 United States pro indoor tennis championships engulfed fourthseeded Tom OKker and 12thseeded Cliff Drysdale in the third round today at the Spectrum.

title: POLICE IN MONTREAL THEORIZE ON DEATHS
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 22 (AP)Policemen investigating the murder of 13 people in a Montreal nightclub say that they think an escaped convict named Richard Blass might have been involved, but they apparently have no concrete evidence.

title: Chief Witness Balks At Conspiracy Trial Of Camden Mayor
description: TRENTON, Jan. 22  The state's star witness in the trial of Mayor Angelo J. Errichetti of Camden cited the Fifth Amendment against selfincrimination today and refused to testify until Judge George Y. Schoch offered him immunity and ordered him to answer questions or face immediate jailing without hail.

title: Trade Group Chief Calls Soviet Setback Temporary
description: Donald M. Kendall, cochairman of the U.S.U.S.S.R. Trade and Economic Council, said yesterday that the group would continue efforts to expand business between the two countries despite obstacles raised by the nullification of the SovietAmerican trade agreement Jan. 14.

title: Regents Ban Race Quotas As integration Guideline
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22The State Board of Regents adopted a new policy today disavowing the use of racial enrollment quotas or ratios in judging a school district's degree of integration.

title: Market Place
German Honored for Theory on Species
Bill Walton and the Professional Attitude
description: In basketball the Big Man is supposed to have an advantage. He performs up there in the clouds, above the mountains, above the mortals. But that advantage exists only on the court. For the Big Man the game might be easy but the life isn't, especially when he's a rookie. Bill Walton of the Portland Trail Blazers is discovering that now. But long before him, others struggled.

title: SINWORMS DOCK AGAIN IN HARBOR
description: Efforts to clean up the polluted waters of New York harbor have met with enough success to pose a new threat to the wellbeing of the porta return of the shipworm, a marine pest that eats into the underwater pilings of the city's piers.

title: Parents Irate as School Board Puts Off Purchase of a Yeshiva
description: Despite the protest, of more than 100 angry Orthodox Jewish parents, the Board of Education voted last night to table a controversial resolution to purchase an East Flatbush yeshiva for use as an annex to a nubile high school.

title: Polaroid President Appointed by Land
description: Edwin H. Land, the engineerentrepreneur who invented the instant developing camera and built the Polaroid Corporation around It, yesterday appointed his probable successor, William J. McCune Jr., 59.

title: Amex Up and Counter Mixed; Trading Slow in Both Markets
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose yesterday but those in the overthecounter market closed mixed as volume continued sluggish in both markets.

title: Podiatric College Picks Chief
description: Dr. Murray Edelstein, a practicing podiatrist for nearly 30 years, has been appointed pres. ident of the New York College of Podiatric Medicine. Dr. Edelstein, also vice chairman of the Council on Podiatry Education, is a former president of the Podiatry Society of the State of New York.

title: The New Clinton Towers Is Step in Right Direction
description: It Is a sad irony that Federal policy and economic reality should drastically curtail publicly assisted housing at just the time when architects are finally learning to create such housing well.

title: Article 3  No Title
Modern Museum Is Celebrating Griffith Birth With Film Show
Metropolitan Briefs
description: A State Supreme Court jury here awarded a verdict of $500,000 against the United States Steel Corporation on behalf of the widow and two children of a construction worker who was killed when he was struck by a load of steel sheets in the collapse of a crane owned by the corporation on May 25, 1971. The victim was 41yearold Donald Fenley of Old Bridge, N. J., an elevator operator on the job site of the New York Telephone Company building at 42d Street and Avenue of the Americas.

title: GERMANS TO REVEAL FOREIGN TRANSFERS
description: BONN, Jan. 22Top West German business leaders, after a special meeting in Dsseldorf today, offered to inform the West German Government voluntarily about transfers of large shares in German companies to foreigners.

title: Strike Closes Italy's Press
description: ROME, Jan. 22 (AP)Journalists and printers staged a 24hour strike today that will leave Italy without daily newspapers tomorrow, when a general strike for wages, pensions and other demands is scheduled. It will be the fourth general strike in Italy in four months.

title: BRITISH OFFICIALS MEET WITH I.R.A.
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 22 (Reuters)British Government officials met with representatives of the Provisional Sinn Fein, the political arm of the Provisional Irish Republican Army, at a secret location tonight, reviving hopes for another ceasefire in Northern Ireland.

title: $95 Billion for Defense?
description: The Ford Administration's decision to seek a $10to$11billion increase in the defense budget, lifting spending close to $95 billion in the fiscal year beginning July 1, should assure the first serious Congressional debate in years on the nation's overseas interests and its military force structure.

title: Bonds Accepts $100,000 Pact
description: Bobby Bonds made his second trip to New York as a Yankee yesterday and this time announced the signing of his 1975 contract. The new Yankee right fielder reasserted that he would enjoy playing in New York, like batting third in the lineup and feel a rapport with the people of New York.

title: Bergman Certified Worth Was Almost $24Million
description: Bernard Bergman, who testified before a United States Senate subcommittee here on Tuesday that the nursinghome business was not very profitable, considering the responsibility involved, has in recent years certified his net worth as climbing from $6million to nearly $24million.

title: Retrospective Opens This Evening at 5:30
description: The D. W. Griffith retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art will open at 5:30 P.M. today with movies of 1908, Adventures of Doll, The Greaser's Gauntlet, The Barbarian Ingomar, Call of the Wild, After Many Years and Money Mad. This program will be repeated at 2 P.M. tomorrow.

title: Penn Central's Trustees Back Prompt U.S. Grant
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Railroad testified with Administration support at a hearing in Washington yesterday that they needed an additional $100million grant promptly from the Federal Treasury to keep the system's 2,500 freight and passenger trains operating until early summer.

title: Amtrak Studies Routes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (AP) Amtrak and private railroad inspectors have completed about 20 per cent of the trackandfacilities studies for the experimental passengertrain route that will run from Washington, D. C. to Kansas City and Denver, the National Rail Passenger Service Corporation said yesterday.

title: FRANK BERRY, 44, TRANSIT OFFICIAL
description: Frank T. Berry, executive officer for operations and maintenance of the New York City Transit Authority in charge of the entire subway system, died stroke, in Morristown (N.J.) Memorial Hospital. He was 44 years old and lived in Basking Ridge N. J.

title: Vocal Capabilities Are Put on Display By Sarah V aughan
Notes on People
MARCOS PROMISES TO RESPECT VOTE
description: MANILA, Jan. 22 (UPI) President Ferdinand E. Marcos said today that he would return the country to parliamentary government immediately if the Filipino people should vote no in the national plebiscite next month on his martiallaw regime.

title: U.S. Stamp Will Honor Film Genius
description: Lillian Gish, who was featured in many D. W. Griffith films, yesterday unveiled an enlarged reproduction of a commemorative stamp honoring the director in a brief ceremony that drew a number of film figures to the Museum of Modern Art.

title: F.T.C. Limiting Korvette Deal To 2 of 6 S. Klein Store Sites
description: The Arlen Realty and Development Corporation, which operates the Korvette department stores, yesterday received approval from the Federal Trade Commission to acquire only two of six store sites it is seeking from the S. Klein chain.

title: BRONX DISTRICT 9 FACES 170 LAYOFFS
description: Close to 170 employes of Community School District 9 in the Bronx, including 125 teachers, will probably be laid off by Feb. 3 because of a district budget deficit, Alfredo Mathew Jr., the district's newly appointed trustee, said last night.

title: Keystone Races Canceled
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 22 (AP)Keystone Race Track canceled today's thoroughbred racing program because of a frozen track. The track, closed Monday and yesterday because of snow, is closed Thursdays. Racing Is scheduled to resume Friday.

title: RESERVE BANK HERE LIFTS NET EARNINGS
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York has reported that net earnings available for distribution almost entirely to the United States Treasury exceeded $1.56billion last year, an increase of 27 per cent from 1973. The report was made public yesterday.

title: Vorster and Chiefs Discuss Future of Urban Africans
description: CAPE TOWN, Jan. 22 (UPI) Prime Minister John Vorster today met with eight leaders of the country's tribal homelands, or selfgoverning areas.

title: Central Park on Thin Ice
Attica Witness, Citing Coercion, Says He Lied About 2 Murders
25,000 in Capital Call for Amendment To Outlaw Abortion
description: WASHINGTON, Ja. 22 (UPI) Antiabortionists rallied on the icy steps of the Capitol today and urged Congress to establish a constitutional amendment banning abortion. Police estimates of the crowd ranged up to 25,000.

title: Rate Increase on Electricity Is in Effect on Long Island
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Jan. 22The average monthly cost of electricity for residential customers of the Long Island Lighting Company went up $2.36 today as the result of the authorization by the Public Service Commission 13 days ago of a $35.6million rate increase.

title: Jersey Track Upheld in Court Case
description: TRENTON, Jan. 22 (AP)The New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority has withstood the latest challenge to its operations. The State Supreme Court declined today to review a lower court's decision that the authority has the right to conduct horse race meetings at other tracks while its own track in the Hackensack River meadowlands is under construction.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in early editions of The New York Times on Jan. 14 incorrectly stated that Harvey Stuart is a law partner of Jack S. Hoffinger. That partnership was ended in 1973, Mr. Hoffinger said.

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS OUST 3 CHAIRMEN, BUT RETAIN HAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 House Democrats formally swept three Southern committee chairmen from their posts today, inflicting the biggest setback on the Congressional seniority system in more than half a century.

title: General Tire Gains
5 Killed as Farm Blaze Ignites Vietnam Rockets
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 22 (UPI)  Mountain tribesmen burning rice stalks to use as fertilizer yesterday accidentally launched a rocket attack on the city of Kontum, 260 miles north of Saigon.

title: 2 HeartAid Drugs Discounted by Study
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 Two drugs widely used to prolong the lives of men who have recovered from heart attacks have proved useless for that purpose in a massive nationwide study.

title: VATICAN'S BUDGET IS VETOED BY POPE
Contract Awards
description: The Tennessee Valley Authority announced yesterday that it would purchase two additional turbogenerators under option from the Brown Boveri Corporation of Baden, Switzerland, for $108million. In addition, design modificationsincreasing capacity and efficiencyhave been made to these and the original order of four units, increasing the total price by about $113million.

title: National's Net Slumps
Energy SelfSufficiency Favored as Boycott Policy
description: A Gallup poll on what the United States should do if confronted with another Arab oil boycott has found 35 per cent of the Americans questioned favoring moves to become selfsufficient in energy.

title: TRANSPORT POOL IN MERGER DEAL
description: The GelcoFeld Corporation of Minneapolis announced yesterday that it had agreed to acquire the Transport Pool Corporation of Bala Cynwyd, Pa., for about $30million in cash and debentures. GelcoFeld is engaged in the leasing of cars and trucks to large corporate fleet users.

title: Credit Markets Reflect Narrow Changes
description: Credit markets mostly showed small changes yesterday, while Wall Street waited for the United States Treasury to release details of its February refunding after the close of trading.

title: Runaway Awkward As Drama
Department of Defense Planning a Promotion
description: If you thought of the Department of Defense as a giant multiproduct corporation, then each branch of service might be considered a brand line. Each of those brands has an advertising budget for repruiting so, like General Motors or General Foods, why shouldn't Defense have a corporate promotion.

title: Museum's Visitors Find Gamso Dance In Midst of the Art
description: Marjorie Gamso and her company, called the Energy Crisis, infiltrated a noontime crowd at the Whitney Museum Downtown yesterday to perform Miss Gamso's As Blood Runs in the Veins. It was intriguing to be in such intimate proximity to the dancers, and that alone seemed more important than what was performed.

title: Power Wins With Less Power
PRECOLOR TV ERA ENJOYING REVIVAL
description: Old television programs of the blackandwhite era had been virtually unmarketable ever since the entire industry began to adopt color in 1985. But the extraordinary success of a few recent revivals, scheduled by several local stations strictly on intuition, is expected by many broadcasters to prompt a major recycling of programs that, were made as long as 20 Years ago.

title: U.S. Stamp Will Honor Film Genius
description: Lillian Gish, who was featured in many D. W. Griffith films, yesterday unveiled an enlarged reproduction of a commemorative stamp honoring the director in a brief ceremony that drew a number of film figures to the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Advertising
description: A number of marketing people have notedsometimes in tones of amazement that sales of quality products, products aimed at the affluent, are holding up very nicely despite the present pinch.

title: Lawrence Blochman, 74, Dead; Correspondent, Mystery Writer
description: Lawrence G. Blochman, a foreign correspondent and a wellknown author of mystery and detective stories, died, apparently of a stroke, at St. Luke's Hospital yesterday. He was 74 years old and lived at 370 Riverside Drive.

title: New Head of Banking Committee
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22Representative Henry S. Reuss, the Wisconsin Democrat who was elected today to head the House Banking and Currency Committee is a dignified (some would say stuffy) patrician who has sometimes campaigned in le derhosen; he is a multilingual intellectual who loves skiing, tennis, duck  hunting and troutfishing; he is a respected economic theorist who tries to apply his ideas to his daily life, sometimes with unexpected consequences (he has been trying, for example, to do his part to meet the energy crisis by setting up a windmill at his summer house west of Milwaukee, but the local authorities have insisted that it is too tall).

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS OUST 3 CHAIRMEN, Biff RETAIN HAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22House Democrats formally swept three Southern committee chairmen from their posts today, inflicting the biggest setback on the Congressional seniority system in more than half a century.

title: OTB Halts Bowie Bets Indefinitely
description: Offtrack bettors were spared another day of indecision yesterday when OTB canceled betting for Bowie Race Course indefinitely.

title: Too Big a Majority
Press and Politicians
description: BOSTON, Jan. 22In the wake of Watergate the American press has acquired the image of a tigera remorseless antagonist of official deceit, probing for the truth. In this vision, journalists are no longer coopted by officials or overcome by awe of them; if anything, the poor officials are intimidated by the powerful press.

title: ANTITRUST CHIEF TAKES FIRM STAND
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 Assistant Attorney General Thomas E. Kauper, head of the Justice Department's Antitrust Division, said today that the recession was no excuse far relaxing antitrust standards, either those that apply to pricefixing or those that apply to mergers.

title: Orders Off for Durables
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (Reuters)New orders for durable goods fell $4.78billion, or 11.1 per cent, in December, the biggest decline in 20 years, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Weekly Council Meetings Vetoed by Committee, 72
description: Let's face it, gentlemen, threequarters of the stuff we put in is garbage that we really hope won't get passed.

title: Attica Witness Cites Coercion and Says He Lied on Killings
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 22A prosecution witness testified here today that he had lied to a grand jury investigating the killing of two Attica prison inmates because he had been beaten and coerced and had feared for his life.

title: Fraternity in Hazing Death Loses Its College Privileges
description: Donald Norton, the Monmouth College dean of students yesterday revoked privileges of the Delta Rho Chapter of the Zeta Beta Tau fraternity for its participation in a hazing incident that resulted in the accidental death of William E. Flowers, a pledgee.

title: Woman Seized in Hotel Is Held As Suspect in Slaying of Officer
description: A 27yearold woman whom the police described as a heroine addict who robbed to support her habit was arrested last night as the accomplice of the armed robber who fatally shot Police Officer Joseph R. Garcia last Monday.

title: GIRL, 14, CHARGES POLICE BEAT HER
description: Mayor Paul T. Jordan Jr. of Jersey City said yesterday that he had ordered an investigation into a complaint by the daughter of the city's top black police officer who said she was beaten by a policeman after a basketball game on Friday night.

title: Democratic Senate Will Let Newsmen Sit in on Sessions
Zukerman in SoloistConductor Role
PRESIDENT BARS DELAY IN RAISING OIL IMPORT LEVY
Consumer Agency Fears Budget Cuts Drain Power
description: The latest round of budget cuts imposed on the City Department of Consumer Affairs will drastically curtail the ability of the agency to conduct investigations of consumer fraud, enforce existing regulations or enact new ones, according to members of the Consumer Advisory Council to the department.

title: Legislation May Save Job of City Policeman Who Lost Eye in BoobyTray Blast
description: A rookie policeman who lost an eye in a boobytrap explosion and is scheduled to be dismissed from his job and deprived of all medical coverage as a result of the city's budget crisis was told yesterday that he might not be discharged after all.

title: Treasury Plans to Borrow $28Billion in Six Months
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The Treasury estimated today that it would have to borrow a record $28billion in the first half of this year to finance the rapidly rising budget deficit.

title: Gurney Indictment Upheld
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 22 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit has refused to dismiss an indictment against Edward J. Gurney, former Republican Senator from Florida, who is charged with bribery and perjury.

title: Texas Instruments Cutback
description: DALLAS, Jan. 22 (Reuters)Texas Instruments, Inc., said today it permanently closed its Fort Walton Beach, Fla. manufacturing plant on Jan. 10, because of economic conditions. The concern said 800 workers were affected.

title: Burroughs Raises Dividend
description: DETROIT, Jan. 22 (Reuters)  The Burroughs Corporation said today it would raise its quarterly dividend to 15 cents a share from 12 cents. The dividend is payable May 7 to shareholders of record April 9.

title: Penguins Set Back Seals, 75
FORD IS REASSURED ABOUT F. B. I. FILES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22A spokesman for the White House said today that President Ford had been assured that information in the files of the Federal Bureau of Investigation is never used to influence the judgment or action of any member of Congress or anybody else.

title: Aetna Life Reports Lag In Some Underwritings
description: The Aetna Life and Casualty Company announced yesterday that its casualty property business showed a greater than expected downturn in fourthquarter underwriting results in contrast to favorable results through the first nine months.

title: Fiscal Scandal Imperils Future Of a Major Educational Institute
description: A major educational agency is on the brink of bankruptcy, one college has gone out of existence and another is foundering, several foundations are unable to trace hundreds of thousands of dollars in grants, and dozens of educators have received worthless checks in the biggest scandal in the academic world in years.

title: U.S. Is Davis Cup Host if It Plays South Africa
description: The United States Lawn Tennis Association has decided to play its Davis Cup match against South Africa in this country if the Americans defeat Mexico next weekend in Palm Springs, Calif.

title: 30 Cars Crash in Fog
description: SOUTH CHARLESTON, W. Va., Jan. 22 (UPI)A 30vehicle chain collision in a fog bank laced with chlorine gas caused injuries and major damage on Interstate 64. The police asked some residents of the area near the wreck to evacuate their homes because of chlorine gas that had leaked from a tank car at a nearby chemical plant.

title: At Least 51 Killed By Fire in Factory In Manila Suburb
description: MANILA, Jan. 22 (AP)Flames raced through a fivestory commercial building in suburban Manila today, killing at least 51 people in the worst Philippine fire on record. The authorities reported at least 79 others seriously injured.

title: Supreme Court, 54, Backs Rights of Suspended Pupils
Seton Hall Five Ends St. John's Streak at 11
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Jan. 22Seton Hall University upset St. John's University tonight, 7267, to break the Redmen's 11game winning streak over the Hall. The Pirates had not beaten St John's since the series was reactivated in 196364.

title: BRITAIN WEIGHING RATIONING OF GAS
description: LONDON, Jan. 22The British Government is considering gasoline rationing to save energy.

title: Ford to Unveil Bobcat, Subcompact, March 21
description: DETROIT, Jan. 22The Ford Motor Company announced today that it would introduce a new subcompactsize car called the Mercury Bobcat on March 21. The car will be sold by the LincolnMercury division and is a variation of the present Ford Pinto model.

title: Books of The Times
description: How do you like your blueeyed boy/ Mister Death, asks the epigraph of Jerome Charyn's eighth novel, Blue Eyes. Only it isn't E. E. Cummings's defunct Buffalo Bill who's being referred to now; it's a hunter on the urban frontier, Manfred Shotgun Coen, detective first grade, New York City Police Departmentblueeyed Jew from the Bronx, whose parents ran a tiny egg store on Boston Road until they ended it all by going into the oven of their walkup. Whose best friends from childhood are the owners of the neighborhood candy store, a Peruvian family with citywide interests in gambling, prostitution, and pornographic films. Whose suits are herringbone and socks magenta. Whose favorite restaurants are Cuban. Whose sidekick and buff is Arnold the Spie, a clubfooted Puerto Rican with a fetish for handcuffs and sirens. Whose duty hours are spent hunting down a ChineseCreole pimp named Chino Reyes (except when Manfred and Chino join forces to rescue the daughter of a wealthy theatrical producer from a Mexican whiteslave ring). And whose offduty hours are spent hitting PingPong balls with his trusty Mark V at Schiller's club.

title: Fair Is Dreadful
description: If the government of the world's richest nation were deliberately to set about to save money in the most unfair way imaginable, one of the Most obvious solutions would be to make food more expensive for the poorest segment of the population. That is exactly what the Ford Administration, inspired by the social vision of Agriculture Secretary Earl Butz, has reaffirmed its intention to do.

title: Gregg to Be New Coach Of Browns
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 22 (AP) Forrest Gregg was named head coach of the Cleveland Browns today, receiving a threeyear contract. He succeeds Nick Skorich, who was discharged shortly after the National Football League team completed a 410 wonlost season, the worst in the club's 28year history.

title: New Administration in U.S. Virgin islands Is Greeted With Enthusiastic Expectancy
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V.I.Black school children and white school children in uniformsgirls in white blouses and miniskirts, boys in white shirts and dark pantsmix easily here with the tourists lugging their cartons of dutyfree liquor.

title: Treasury Plans to Borrow $28Billion in Six Months
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22Thei Treasury estimated today that it would have to borrow a record $28billion in the first half of this year to finance the rapidly rising budget deficit.

title: Personal Finance: Condominium Rules and Rights
description: Many housing economists predict that about 50 per cent of the population of the United States will live in some type of condominium development within the next 20 years.

title: Retrospective Opens This Evening at 5:30
description: The D. W. Griffith retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art will open at 5:30 P.M. today with movies of 1908, Adventures of Doll, The Greaser's Gauntlet, The Barbarian Ingomar, Call of the Wild, After Many Years and Money Mad. This program will be repeated at 2 P.M. tomorrow.

title: 3 Volunteer Firemen Held As Connecticut Arsonists
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 22 (AP)Three youths identified by authorities as members of the Sound Beach volunteer fire department have been charged in seven recent fires in Greenwich, including a blaze at the Riverside railroad station that caused $30,000 damage.

title: Brezhnev Case Typifies Moscow's Secrecy
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22The Soviet obsession with secrecywhich once prompted the late American Ambassador, Charles E. Bohlen, to remark that the Kremlin was not a mystery, just a secrethas seldom been as conspicuous as in the last month.

title: Recital: Loud and Fast
description: There may be male pianists who can play louder and faster than Susan Starr, but no mature artist among them would want to. In her recital in Town Hall's Encore Series on Tuesday, her playing in Beethoven's Sonata in C (Op. 53), Schumann's Papillons and Griffes's Sonata was so often harsh, strident and outandout belligerent that one wondered if Miss Starr had become a kind of female Don Quixote tilting at threatening compositions, pianos or audiences.

title: Drugs With Other Uses Found to Cut Blood Clots
description: MARCO ISLAND, Fla., Jan. 22 Several drugs were described here today that may prove useful in preventing blood clotsthe direct or indirect cause of hundreds of thousands of deaths in this country each year.

title: Tuesday's Fights
description: Miami Beach  Elisha Obed, 150 pounds, the Bahamas, knocked out Fernand Marcotte, 153, Quebec City, 11th round.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BACK WHEN If you look hard enough, the golden days of Old New York and its architectural remnants are continually being displayed in unexpected quarters with little or no fanfare. Even banks, especially in the Greenwich Village area, often display collections of photographs, paintings or artifacts as reminders of the past.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Stewart Pollock, a Public Utilities Commissioner, and Leo Motiuk, assistant counsel to the Governor, reported Governor Byrne that there was no shortage of electric power in New Jersey. But the men said consideration should be given to forming a public authority to help the private utilities build more generating facilities to meet future needs. They asked for an enlarged study of future needs by a bigger committee.

title: Drapeau Offers Olympic Cost View
description: QUEBEC, Jan. 22 (AP)Mayor Jean Drapeau of Montreal told a Quebec provincial government committee today that his city could stage the 1976 Summer Olympics for $583million and still make them pay for themselves.

title: Regents Ban Race Quotas As Integration Guideline
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22The State Board of Regents adopted a new policy today disavowing the use of racial enrollment quotas or ratios in judging a school district's degree of integration.

title: Turkish Workers in Germany Uneasy About Future
CROP RISE SLATED for FEED GRAINS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22Farmers are planning to increase their crops of the principal grains for livestock feed, the Department of Agriculture reported today. The result could be reduction in prices of the grains, and such developments could lead eventually to lower meat prices experts say.

title: NEW SALE OF ARMS TO TURKEY SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The Defense Department has notified Congress that it intends to sell Turkey $230million in arms to modernize her tank forces.

title: BROKERS ORDERED TO END FIXED FEES
Sports News Briefs
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, Jan. 22 (UPI)Sandro Munari and Mario Manucci of Italy, driving a Lancia Stratos, held off a threecar challenge by Fiat today to end the second stage of the Monte Carlo rally with a comfortable lead.

title: Rhode Island 18th in Taxes
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I. (UPI)Rhode Island ranks 18th among the 50 states in the total average tax burden its citizens paid in fiscal 1972, according to the Commerce Clearing House, Inc. Rhode Islanders paid an average $514 in state and Federal taxes, compared to the nationwide average of $522.

title: Mayor Is Urged to Expedite 2d Ave. Subway Completion
description: The Women's City Club of New York urged Mayor Beame and the Board of Estimate yesterday to take immediate action to complete the Second Avenue subway.

title: DOW STOCK INDEX RISES 10.71 POINTS
description: Stock prices finished higher yesterday in increased trading after a late recovery erased most of the earlier weakness.

title: March 1 Rise in Cost of Food Stamps Opposed in Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22A New Yorkbased public interest law firm filed suit today in United States District Court here seeking to block an increase in the cost of buying food stamps.

title: Medical Center Chief Named
NEW SALE OF ARMS TO TURKEY SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The Defense Department has notifled Congress that it intends to sell Turkey $230million in arms to modernize her tank forces.

title: The Screen
description: Four experimental works by Sidney Peterson, made in San Francisco between 1946, when he began film making, and 1949, when he retired, constitute the Whitney Museum of American Art's current film program, titled The Lead Shoes. The program, which opened yesterday, will run through Tuesday.

title: Amin Plans to Visit Britain To Advise Liberation Units
description: LONDON, Jan. 22 (Reuters) President Idi Amin has told Queen Elizabeth he is coming to Britain in August to give advice to its liberation movements, according to Radio Uganda monitored here.

title: Inquiries Pressed in Drug Case
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 22 (AP)Commissioners of the National Football League and American Basketball Association acknowledged today that an investigation was under way on allegations that a drug ring supplied narcotics to players from both leagues.

title: 3 U.S. Agencies Held Lax on Civil Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The United States Civil Rights Commission charged today that three Federal agencies were not fulfilling their requirement to promote equal educational opportunity for women and minorities.

title: Bridge:
description: A superficial observer might be forgiven for supposing that Italy's chances of winning the world team title for the fourth straight year in Bermuda next week are not good.

title: Flyers Get Fleeced
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 22 (UPI)while four Philadelphia Flyers were practicing at a University of Pennsylvania ice rink today, a total of $400 was stolen from their wallets in the locker room. The four were Rick MacLeish, Andre Dupont, Tom Bladon and Orest Kindrachuk.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eistern Standerd Time

title: Body of Scottish Woman Found In Court of Apartment Building
OffDuty Correction Officer Shot Trying to Balk Holdup
description: An offduty correction officer was shot last night after he and his partner tried to stop a robbery of the Parsons Lounge and Legion Bar, of 7525 Parsons Boulevard, in Flushing, Queens.

title: 4 KEY RAM UNIONS ACCEPT CONTRACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 22Negotiators for the nation's railroads reported today that they have reached tentative agreements with four key unions, averting a possible railroad strike on Friday. According to union sources, the agreements call for wage and benefit increases totaling 40.5 per cent over three years.

title: Calls Station, Shoots Self
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 22 (UPI) Benjamin Powell, 32 years old, telephoned a local radio talk show on station KDKA today, announced he was going to take his own life and then shot himself in the arm with a highpowered rifle. He is listed in good condition at PresbyterianUniversity Hospital with a superficial wound.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Rev. Oscar Huber, 81, Gave John Kennedy Last Rites

title: Ammunition Ships Reported Near Cambodian Capital
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Thursday, Jan. 23 (AP) An American shipping company official said that two tugs towing ammunition barges had run the gantlet of insurgent fire along the Mekong River and arrived at the outskirts of Phnom Penh early today.

title: 2 Men Flee With a Girl Hostage After Freeing 5 in Store Holdup
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Jan. 22 (UPI)Two gunmen vanished with a 17yearold girl prisoner today after freeing five other hostages in a deal with the police for two getaway vehicles and a promise that they would not be pursued.

title: SOUTH JERSEY GETS BIGGER GAS SUPPLY
description: NEWARK, Jan. 22 (AP)  A spokesman for the Transcontinental Gas Pipeline Company said today the company expected to be able to increase its supplies to the South Jersey Gas Company by about 308 million cubic feet during the heating season.

title: Technically, Their Home Is Called a Nonsecure Detention Facility
description: RYE, N.Y.At first, it seems like a typical Friday evening service in a Jewish home. Katherine Levine lights the candles at sundown. Her husband, David, and their 2yearold son, Zachary, don yarmulkas. Then, before making the prayer over wine, Mr. Levine makes an announcement: This is a Jewish religious service we are about to say. It takes a couple of minutes. Anybody who doesn't want to be here can walk out of the room and come back when it's finished.

title: Modern Museum Is Celebrating Griffith Birth With Film Show
description: Today, to mark the 100th anniversary of the birth of David Wark Griffith, still the most spectacular and innovative figure in the history of the American cinema, the Museum of Modern Art begins the first part of its twopart Griffith Centennial Retrospective. It will include a number of films that have not been seen publicly in 60 years.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: STEWART W. RICHARDS

title: J.D.L. DEMONSTRATES IN FRONT OF TEMPLE
description: Rabbi Meir Kahane and members of the Jewish Defense League demonstrated yesterday outside Temple Emanuel, protesting what they called American pressure to compel Israel to make territorial concessions to the Arabs.

title: NEW HAMPSHIRE SETS SENATE VOTE
Slain Student Found in Car Pushed Over Embankment
New Administration in U.S. Virgin Islands Is Greeted With Enthusiastic Expectancy
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V.I.Black school children and white school children in uniformsgirls in white blouses and miniskirts, boys in white shirts and dark pantsmix easily here with the tourists lugging their cartons of dutyfree liquor.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Shaklee Raising Prices By Average of 4% Feb. 5
description: The Shaklee Corporation said yesterday that it was increasing prices on its food supplements, cosmetics and bath products by an average of 4 per cent, effective Feb. 5.

title: Washington Star Brief Urges Paper Get Control of Stations
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 When John Hay Whitney, the multimillionaire, bought The New York Herald Tribune, now deceased, someone supposedly said, Well, if Jock was looking for a way to get rid of his money he has found it.

title: Athletics on Upswing at Oratory
description: Athletics have been on the upswing since Ed McDonnell returned to Oratory Prep School in Summit, his high school alma mater, as athletic director and basketball coach.

title: GUNMAN IN CANADA FREES LAST CAPTIVE
Dollar Falls Abroad
description: The dollar plunged in value on European currency markets, causing Switzerland to take drastic action to check an influx of American currency. The Swiss increased an annual tax on deposits by foreigners in Swiss francs to 40 per cent. Page 47.

title: Ford Rules Out Rationing Of Any Petroleum Product
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 President Ford took his opposition to petroleum rationing a step further today, saying through a spokesman he was prepared to veto any mandatory rationing program involving petroleum products, not simply one applying to gasoline.

title: WITNESS Al TRIAL IN TRENTON BALKS
description: TRENTON, Jan. 22  The state's star witness in the trial of Mayor Angelo J. Errichetti of Camden cited the Fifth Amendment against selfincrimination today and refused to testify until Judge George Y. Schoch offered him immunity and ordered him to answer questions or face immediate jailnig, without bail.

title: Mushroom Deal Ended By the Common Market
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 22 (UPI)The European Common Market announced today that it had broken up a cartel of French and Taiwanese mushroom canners who were sharing the West German market.

title: Miki Cites Watergate in Urging Reform of His Party
description: TOKYO, Jan. 22Premier Tateo Miki evoked an image of Watergate today as he exhorted his troubled LiberalDemocratic party to reform itself.

title: FRENCH BISHOP DIES IN LES HALLES AREA
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Connecticut Plans to Investigate The State's 209 Nursing Homes
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 22Moved by allegations of abuses in nursing homes in Connecticut, New York and elsewhere in the country, the Connecticut General Assembly will investigate the 209 nursing homes in this state.

title: Snowbound Metroliners Are Pulled by Old Electrics
description: Fifty Metroliners, which ordinarily speed under their own power in the New YorkWashington corridor, had to be pulled this week by 35to40yearold Penn Central electric locomotives because of snowy weather.

title: Both Jobs and Jobless Wait in State Placement Offices
description: There is a mood of gloomsometimes desperationamong the job hunters in placement centers of the New York State Employment Service in these days of rising unemployment. But, paradoxically, there are still thousands of job opportunities if applicants and jobs can be matched.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Greek Students Protest

title: The Major Events of the Day
description: News Summary and Index

title: Bangladesh Party Gives Mujib Authority to Widen His Powers
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 22The Prime Minister of Bangladesh, Sheik Mujibur Rahman, has been authorized by his Awami League party to take such steps as may be necessary to solve the outstanding problems of the country.

title: For a Grieving Mrs. Kallinger, Long Days and Nights
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 22 A long, long, time ago, a little girl named Betty Baumgard rode a train from Philadelphia for a visit here with her favorite aunt and uncle and a sunny summer's afternoon feeding squirrels in the Park.

title: Ford Rules Out Rationing Of Any Petroleum Product
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 President Ford took his opposition to petroleum rationing a step further today, saying through a spokesman he was prepared to veto any mandatory rationing program involving petroleum products, not simply one applying to gasoline.

title: On Argentina's Fertile Pampas, The Bitter Harvest of Neglect
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 22As soon as the plane ascends from the sprawling capital on the Rfo de la Plata, the pampa comes into view, stretching in a semicircle for hundreds of flat, green, treeless and fertile miles.

title: HIGHWAY AGENCY TO BE ENLARGED
description: TRENTON, Jan. 22Governor Byrne signed legislation today increasing the membership of the New Jersey Highway Authority from five members to seven, a move that was bitterly attacked by Republicans. They compared it to the move by President Franklin D. Roosevelt 40 years ago to pack the United States Supreme Court.

title: ITALY IS TRACING A EUROPEAN PLOT
description: ROME, Jan. 22 Italian authorities are investigating a network of ultrarightists who are said to be engaged in subversion here and abroad with the ultimate aim of establishing a federation of authoritarian states.

title: Reports on Skiing Conditions
description: (Reports are supplied by resort owners.)

title: Dr. Henry Smith Leiper Is Dead; Church Official and Ecumenicist
description: Dr. Henry Smith Leiper, church official and ecumenicist, died yesterday at the Meadow Lakes Retirement Community, Hightown, N. J. He was 83 years old.

title: The Days and Nights Are Long for Anguished Mrs. Kallinger
COCOA EXCHANGE TRADES IN RUBBER
description: The New York Cocoa Exchange, which for about 50 years has been a onecommodity exchange, yesterday began trading in natural rubber futures.

title: SERVICES ARE SET for DR.H.A. BOSLEY
description: A funeral service will be held this morning in Mount Vernon Place Methodist Church in Baltimore for the Rev. Dr. Harold A. Bosley. Dr. Bosley, retired senior minister of Christ Church, Methodist, Park Avenue and 60th Street, died Monday at his home, in Beach Haven Terrace, N. J. He was 67 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Connecticut Senate voted, 32 to 3, to follow the read set by the state's House of Representatives a week ago in opening committee meetings to the public. The three Senators who opposed the rule change did so only because their colleagues would not go as far as the House did and require that their votes in committee meetings be recorded.

title: NEW JOBAID CLAIMS REACH RECORD TOTAL
Flu Is Linked to 29 Deaths In Three Florida Counties
description: ST PETERSBURG, Fla., Jan. 22 (UPI)A virulent strain of influenza, hitting especially hard at retired persons in the Tampa Bay area, was linked today to at least 29 deaths.

title: Penn Still Ivy Pick, but Must Shuffle Five
description: Pennsylvania remains the favorite to win the Ivy League basketball title again, although the Quakers have been forced to make some major changes after losing

title: FASHION TALK
description: The dress that everybody's buying at Henri Bendel's is a cotton wraparound affair with no back and a ruffle around the top. It's as simple as an apron and it's what women are picking up to tie over bathing suits or just plain skin on their trips to Southern resorts.

title: People in Sports
description: The California Golden Seals of the National Hockey League, a franchise in turmoil since it was founded for the 196768 season, changed coaches yesterday. Marshall Johnston, at 33 years old the youngest coach in the N.H.L., was dismissed and replaced by Bill McCreary, the club's director of operations.

title: Landsat 2 Joins Sister Ship in Orbit Scanning the Earth
description: VANDENBERG AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Jan. 22 (UPI)An Earth Resources Technology Satellite, hailed as the prototype of the most useful spacecraft yet devised, was launched today tojoin a sister ship scanning every portion of the globe with cameras and sensors.

title: MISUSE OF MEDICAID IS ALLEGED UPSTATE
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 22 (AP)The Rochester TimesUnion reported today that state auditors had found that nine nursing homes in Monroe County charged nearly $300,000 in nonMedicaid expenses to Medicaid.

title: Filming TV Documentaries Abroad Faces Serious Difficulties
description: For several months last year, it appeared that Dick Hubert would not gain permission to film parts of a television documentary in India on terms a serious journalist could accept. His experience points up the difficulties that documentary makers often face in a number of countries.

title: Top Danish Star Dies
description: COPENHAGEN, Jan. 23 (Reuters)Clara Pontoppidan, one of Denmark's foremost actresses who performed with the Royal Theater well into her 80's, died here last night. She was 91 years old.

title: Dr. Margaret Morriss, 90, ExDean of PembrokeCollege
description: EAST PROVIDENCE, R. I., Jan. 23 (AP)Dr. Margaret Shove Morriss, former dean of Pembroke College in Providence, died yesterda in an East Providence nursing home. She was 90 years old.

title: A.M.C.'s Rebate Campaign Is Set
description: Just about quitting time Monday, the folks at Cunningham & Walsh got the word from their client, the American Motors Corporation, about that company's plan for rebates. They'll have a spot on network television Saturday night. In national advertising circles, that's mighty speedy.

title: STOLEN PAINTINGS PICKED UP BY F.B.I.
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced last night the recovery of five valuable paintings stolen here more than five years ago and the arrest of a 56yearold Mount Vernon, N. Y., man in connection with the case.

title: LONDON METAL MARKET
description: (In pounds sterling per metric ton)

title: Youth Aides Suspended
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan.23 (UPI)Two Youth Study Center supervisors were suspended yesterday in connection with an investigation by the Juvenile Aid Division into charges of homosexual acts between center employes andjuveniles. Thurmon Lyles, the night supervisor, was suspended with pay, and Jeffrey Brown, a youth supervisor, was suspended without pay.

title: Schlesinger Confident U.S. Can Support Israel in War
description: Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger says that he is confident that the United States can provide the resources to sustain Israeli fighting forces should a fifth Middle East war begin.

title: FORD PLAN SEEN CUTTING INCOMES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23The Federal Energy Administration said today that President Ford's energy and taxcut proposals, if enacted by Congress, would probably add to the spendable income of some households and would shrink it for others.

title: F.C.C. APPROVES I.B.M. for SATELLITE FIELD
description: The Federal Communications Commission approved yesterday the International Business Machines Corporation's entry into the domestic satellite field but imposed limitations on a joint venture plan advanced by I.B.M. and the Comsat General Corporation, a subsidiary of the Communications Satellite Corporation.

title: Jersey Given More Time On SchoolFinancing Plan
description: TRENTON, Jan. 23The New Jersey Supreme Court, abandoning a deadline it had established, today gave the State Legislature more time to comply with the court's mandate for a new system of financing public schools in the state.

title: Panel Asks 10Year Extension Of 1965 Act for Voting Rights
Candidates Consult Master of Mail FundRaising
description: MATTHEWS, Ala., Jan. 23Democrats running for President make pilgrimages to Morris Dees's house these days much as they will later call on Mayor Richard J. Daley in Chicago or visit the bigstate delegations at the 1976 convention.

title: Pearls and Swine
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.Almost all skills worth learning are learned by doing. The introduction of doing deacademizes a subject, mcitivates the student by giving him responsibility, and eliminates early those who should never have been there in the first place.

title: Notes on People
description: Nice to he back, said the former Sir Alec DouglasHomewho, before he was the 14th Earl of Homeas he returned to the British House of Lords yesterday for the first time since Queen Elizabeth II made him a peer again. nounced the earldom he had inherited so that he could continue to sit in Commons and become Prime Minister, he simply signed his name and took an oath. Yesterday, to take up his lifetime, noninheritable baronetcy (the lowest order of peerage), the 71  year  old Conservative went through an elaborate ritual of formal bows, doffing of hats and perambulation of aisles to become Baron Home of the Hirsel, named for his Scottish residence. For his colleagues, the occasion recalled his reply after Harold Wilson, now the Labor Prime Minister, had made fun of his aristocratic ancestry by consistently calling the Conservative the 14th Earl of Home. Said Lord Home, Well, I suppose, when you come to think of it, he is the 14th Mr.iWlson.

title: View on Nurseries
description: To the Editor:

title: MIRV Madness
description: Defense Secretary Schlesinger's announcement that Moscow has begun to deploy the first of its new MIRV multiple warhead missiles opens a dangerous new stage in the SovietAmerican strategic arms raceone that the FordBrezhnev Vladivostok accords will not constrain.

title: Nassau County Nursing Homes Called Generally Good by Caso
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 23The quality of care and nursing homes in Nassau County is generally good, County Executive Ralph O. Caso said in a report released today.

title: Excerpts From President's Interview
Thais Elect Assembly Sunday In First Vote Since Fall of Junta
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. 23 The Thais will select a new National Assembly Sunday in the first general election since the end of military rule in 1973.

title: Rebates Increasing Sales Of Compacts at Chrysler
description: DETROIT, Jan. 23The Chrysler Corporation reported today that its rebate program had lifted sales of its compact cars, although its overall sales were still running behind yearearlier levels.

title: Aid to Saigon: 2 Views
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23There is every indication that the Ford Administration will seek to make a major political issue of its request to Congress for $300million in supplemental military aid to South Vietnam. And every indication from Congress is that the request will fail.

title: An F.B.I. Inquiry, Too
description: Predictably, the admission by former high officials of the Federal Bureau of Investigation that, during J. Edgar Hoover's tenure, the bureau kept records on personal indiscretions of some members of Congress has turned the Capitol purple with the cries of outraged solons.

title: College Skiing Classes Put Students Out in Cold
description: How to get nonskiers involved in the sport could well have been the theme of Adelphi University's 19day vacation studies program, which is to be concluded today at the Fallsview Hotel in upstate Ellenville, N. Y. Thirtyeight students took advantage of the offcampus program in which five subjectseconomics, education, bioethics, ice skating and skiingwere offered.

title: Muskie and Jackson Lead Rockefeller in Harris Poll
Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: The Program
description: NEW YORK PHILHARMONIC. Pierre Boulez, conductor; Nicanor Zabaieta, harp; JeanPierre Rampal, flute. At Avery Fisher Hall.

title: JAMES J. WALSH
description: James Joseph Walsh, a retired assistant chief inspector of the New York City Police Department, died Saturday at the ace of 65.

title: PATIENT TERMED VICTIM OF FRAUD
description: The owner of a Bronx nursing home and a former Fordham Hospital caseworker were accused yesterday by the Bronx District Attorney's office of having systematically looted thousands of dollars from the bank accounts of an elderly nursinghome patent prior to her death.

title: Ford Would Allocate Oil if Tax Plan Is Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 23President Ford, appearing on a televiSion interview tonight after a busy day of jousting with Congress, said that if his plan for imposing energy taxes was rejected, he would accept arbitrary allocation of petroleum products instead.

title: Civil Rights Units Score Regents Ban On Race Quotas and Request a Review
description: Civilrights groups and others involved in schooldesegregation efforts were sharply critical State Board of Regents to ban the use of racial enrollment quotas in judging a school district's degree of integration.

title: Article 4  No Title
LaidOff Seatrain Workers Angry At Company, Carey, Ford, Union
description: They didn't even say thank you! said Pedro Vidal, a welder, as he read his dismissal notice from the Seatrain Shipbuilding Corporation.

title: Prices of Bonds Are Steady As Treasury Bills Show a Rise
description: Prices of corporate bonds and Government securities held up surprisingly well yesterday following projections of new Treasury cash needs that far exceeded Wall Street estimates.

title: MORE LAYOFFS SET IN KEY INDUSTRIES
description: Layoffs by companies, ranging from a diversified manufacturer of drugs and toiletries to a largerailroadorganization, were announced yesterday. Involved are about1,666 employes, Another company redeuced the work week for 600 empolyes.

title: Robert A. Ford, Publisher Of Press of Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N. J. (AP) Robert A. Ford, publisher of The Press of Atlantic City, died apparently of a heart attack last night. He was 52 years old and lived at 522 Ridgewood Drive, Northfield, N.J.

title: INSURANCECOVERAGE ON DOCTORS SHIFTED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (UPI) Asserting that doctors have become virtually uninsurable, one of the nation's major medical malpractice underwriters said today that it would stop selling the present coverage being provided for 48,000 doctors in 47 states.

title: Beame Reported in Favor Of a New Cultural Agency
description: Mayor Beame was reported yesterday ready to approve details of a new city cultural agency whose creation would clear the way for the departure of Irving Goldman, the Cultural Affairs Commissioner, who is the subject of Federal and state investigations.

title: Ethnic Greeks and Turks Fail to Agree on How to Reopen Facility
description: The Turks have suggested that each community maintain its own customs facilities at the airport, with a joint facility for foreigners. The Greek side does not like this idea.

title: Article 3  No Title
Screen: 'Algerian War':Documentary Captures Conflict's Ugliness
description: France's long war in Algeria, a struggle that nearly brought down the Republic, seems so ancient that it comes as a shock to realize that it only took place from 1954 to 1961: The world has moved too quickly since then."The Algerian War," a 1973 French documentary of what seems to be mostly old news film with special commentary and music, recalls the conflict at lengthtwo hours and 35 minutes, to be exactin its current showing at the First Avenue Screening Room. It does not have the dramatic impact of "Battle of Algiers," but, even in just recounting the bloody history, it fills one with horror, as history always does, when one sees the missed opportunities and the suppression of the sensible to the passions of the purists, on both sides."The Algerian War" traces the inexorable violent path of struggle, showing the extremists, the moderates, the mass of people who were drawn into battles they might rather have remained out of.Made by Yves Courriere and Philippe Monnier, with a commentary in English, the film is a balanced account of brutality, heightened by a blaring background of patriotic songs and frenzied chanting. It is one of a number of films being shown in a series of documentaries at the theater.

title: About New York
description: The imprint of India has been growing more distinct in New York over recent years. The sari and the Sikh, once exotic sights even in the cosmopolis, do not rate a second look these days. You meet Indians who run restaurants and bookstores, who minister to the sick in hospitals and minister to souls in religious movements. The English brogue of India is heard from Times Square out to Main Street, Flushing, one of the centers of the city, where Indians live and work.

title: Israel Market Talks Gain
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 23 (Reuters) Israel and the Common Market today reached the final stage in establishing a new longterm trade agreement. The Israeli Government and the market's Council of Ministers now must set a date for a formal signing. The negotiations were part of the market's policy of establishing a freetrade area with Mediterranean countries.

title: New A .B .A . Head Calls Meskill Unqualified for Appeals Bench
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 23The presidentelect of the American Bar Association said today that the Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit was no place for former Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticut to resume his legal career.

title: Store Sales Steady
description: Special to The New York Times

title: 4 KILLED IN STORE; SUSPECT IS SEIZED
description: BLUFFTON, Ga., Jan. 23 (UPI)The police had one suspect in custody and were seeking another today in the deaths of three men and a 17yearold boy who were lined up on the floor of a rural grocery store and gasoline station and shot to death during a robbery.

title: DEPOSITS URGED ON CANS, BOTTLES
description: A Presidential advisory committee recommended yesterday the passage of controversial Federal legislation mandating a refundable deposit on beer and soft dring containers as a key energy saving measure.

title: Exchanges Ordered By S.E.C. to Unfix Brokerage Charges
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission, in a 44page formal ruling issued last night, ordered all stock exchanges to revise their regulations to enable stockbrokers to eliminate fixed minimum brokerage fees they charge the public after May 1, 1975.

title: About Real Estate
description: DALLASThe builder Aaron Arker is in Florida these days, taking in the sun and waiting. His son Sol, 27 years old, giving the impression of energy coiled is home in Brooklyn also waiting, the business is at a standstill.

title: Homers and Fun on the 47 Pirates
description: With a smile that belonged in the toothpaste hall of fame, Ralph Kiner glanced over to where Hank Greenberg was sitting. Hank Greenberg is the primary factor why I'm here, the New York Mets broadcaster said at the announcement of his election to the Baseball Hall of Fame yesterday. He came over to the Pittsburgh Pirates in 1947, my second year. I had led the league in home runs in 1946 by accident. And in 1947 we had a funtype team. Not too much dedication. He taught me that hard work is the best thing. He changed my stance, got me up on top of the plate. Without his guidance and his approach, I don't think I'd be here. During the 1947 season they almost shipped me out to the minors. I was really struggling. I struck out four times in one game against Hank Borowy of the Chicago Cubs on curveballs. But then all of a sudden I was able to hit the curveball. That season I hit 48 homers from June on, 51 altogether. I think it was just a case of everything that Hank Greenberg told me coming together.

title: Quarter, Half at Peak
Coast Coach Moves Up
description: FULLERTON, Calif., Jan. 23 (AP)Jim Colletto, defensive line coach for three seasons at the University of the Pacific, was appointed head football coach at Fullerton State today.

title: STATE EMPLOYES TO SEEK RAISES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 23Money to make up for inflationeither a lumpsum raise or an escalator clause linking increases to rises in the costoflivingwill be asked by state employes when wage talks with the Carey administration open tomorrow.

title: Canadian Guilty in Slaying
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan. 23 (AP)A District Court jury has found a 26yearold Canadian guilty of firstdegree murder in the knifetorture slaying here of a San Jose, Calif., couple. The verdict against Lloyd, Paulette of Edmonton, Alta., was returned yesterday. The jury also recommended that Mr. Paulette serve a life sentence in the Nevada State Prison without possibility of parole.

title: Dahomey Reports Attempt At TakeOver Is Put Down
description: COTONOU, Dahomey, Jan. 23 (UPI)Authorities in this West African nation have crushed a rebellion led by a Cabinet member who sent troops and tanks into Cotonou, the Government's chief spokesman said today.

title: FORD THINKS TALKS MAY GO TO GENEVA if KISSINGER FAILS
ISRAEL TO RECEIVE 200 U.S. MISSILES
Too Little, Too Late
description: To the extent that President Ford's tax program to stem the recession can be distinguished from his tax program to conserve energy, the former seems to have two major deficiencies as a means of stimulating the economy. And when both programs are taken together, the energy conservation plan seems to offset some of the stimulus of the antirecession tax cut, at the time when that stimulus is most needed.

title: F. Arthur Bickel, Engineer Led Construction Company
description: F. Arthur Bickel, who retired in 1972 as president and chairman of Brown & Matthews, Inc., engineers and constructors with headquarters in Cranford, N.J., died Wednesday in Scottsdale, Ariz., where he lived. He was 64 years old and formerly lived in Westfield. N.J.

title: Court Extends Jersey Deadline for New SchoolFinancing Plan
description: TRENTON, Jan. 23Abandoning a deadline it had established, the New Jersey Supreme Court today gave the State Legislature more time to comply with the court's mandate for a new system of financing public schools in the state.

title: Carey Asks$178Million In Loan for Urban Unit
description: ALBANY, Jan, 23Governor Carey submitted legislation today for an immediate $178million emergency state loan to the sagging Urban Development Corporation to keep its vast construction empire operating through March.

title: Music: A New Moore
description: In line with the newest trend among the younger composers, Carman Moore has given his new work, Wildfires and Field Songs, a title with programatic implications. A dozen years ago it would have been named Pentagram IV or Abstraction IX.

title: DR. MARSHALL ALPERT
description: Dr. Marshall B. Alpert, a research chemist who was responsible for eight patents in electrochemistry, died yesterday in Staten Island Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived at 255 Clawson Street, New Dorp, S.I.

title: Bay State Woman, 104, Dies
description: BILLERICA, Mass., Jan. 23 (AP)Mary S. Hilton, who was 104 years old last September, died here yesterday in a nursing home. Miss Hilton, a dressmaker, was born in Lowell Sept. 4, 1870, and lived in that city until 1953, when she moved to Tewksbury.

title: Labor Chiefs Urge A Curb on Arab Oil; Support Rationing
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23Leaders of the A.F.L.C.I.O. called today for a ban on oil imported from the Arab nations that took part in the 19731974 embargo and for rationing at home.

title: Ashe Gains; 2d Upset by Gerulaitis
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 23Arthur Ashe, Marty Riessen and Cliff Richey are the only surviving members of the original list of 16 seeded players in the United States pro indoor tennis championships. Raul Ramirez and Tom Gorman were added to the fallen in today's action at the Spectrum.

title: JURORS SUBPOENA BERGMAN RECORDS
description: A Federal grand jury here has subpoenaed bank records of the Bernard Bergmans Towers Nursing Home, according to lawyers for Mr. Bergman.

title: Kiner Edges Into Hall of Fame
description: In his last electoral turn at bat, Ralph Kiner was voted into baseball's Hall of Fame yesterday, but Robin Roberts and Bob Lemon were not.

title: BOUND MAN PUSHED TO A 3STORY FALL
description: A 35yearold commercial photographer was critically injured late yesterday afternoon when he was dragged into a vacant Brooklyn apartment, stripped, tied and pushed nut a thirdfloor window.

title: In Mild Moscow, Snowfall's a Windfall
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 23Accustomed as they are to unfilled quotas of many things made on earth, Muscovites are now learning to cope with an insufficiency from the heavens. There is a snow shortage this winter.

title: New Yorkers Played Key Role in House Rebellion
PRODUCER DENIES PLAY HAS SEX ACTS
description: The producer of the show Let My People Come yesterday denied charges that there are acts of simulated sex during the performance, saying that one alleged act was a nude ballet and another a theatrical representation that lasts less than 30 seconds.

title: A.T.T. SUSPENSION IS ASKED ON RATES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (Reuters)The Council on Wage and Price Stability said today it has petitioned the Federal Communications Commission to suspend the $700million interstate rate increase requested by the American Telephone and Telegraph Company pending a formal investigation.

title: PRICE RISE SHARP IN GRAIN FUTURES
description: Grain and soybean future prices closed with substantial gains yesterday, although the Government's report on large acreage planting intentions by farmers had been expected to be a bearish factor on prices. The Government announcement was made after the close of trading Wednesday.

title: The Times Plans Satellite Printing Plant At a Cost of $35Million in New Jersey
description: The New York Times announced yesterday a plan to develop a modern satellite printing plant in Carlstadt, N.J.

title: Library Panel Announces Children's Book Awards
description: Virginia Hamilton of Yellow Springs, Ohio, and Gerald McDermott of New York were announced yesterday as the winners of the John Newbery Medal and the Randolph J. Caldecott Medal: respectively, awarded by the Children's Services Division of the American Library Association for the most distinguished books for children published in the United States in 1974.

title: TV NEWSMEN SCORE A COAST COURT BAN
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 23 (UPI)  Broadcast journalists protested yesterday rules by Federal judges banning courthouse coverage, and the judges made the rules even stricter.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The state's Board of Public Utility Commissioners granted the Elizabethtown Water Company a 12.3 per cent rate increase, raising the average homeowner's monthly water bill by about 65 cents. The $2.6million increase represents about twothirds of the $4.1million rise originally requested. At the same time, the commission, meeting in Newark, refused to allow the company to implement a proposed commodity adjustment clause, which would have allowed the company to pass directly to its customers increases in what it paid for water and electricity used in its operations. Elizabethtown supplies customers in Union, Middlesex, Somerset, Hunterdon, Mercer and Essex Counties. It also supplies water for resale to 11 water supply systems, including Newark's.

title: When a Price Soars, Oil Is Often Reason
description: The supermarket shopper this month paid $1.25 for laundry detergent, 63 cents for dishwasher detergent and 75 cents for a box of plastic garbage bags. Six months ago, the same size, of the same brand, at the same supermarket, was 20 to 25 per cent cheaper.

title: No Major Change of Pace Is Found in Carey's First 100 Days
description: ALBANY, Jan. 23  While Governor Carey has decreed a first 100 days of innovation to bring on the new government, it is hard to sense any breakneck change of pace these days in the Capitol, where countless hopes and promises have vaporized over the decades in the dank stone corridors of power.

title: Ruchell Magee, Once Angela Davis CoDefendant, Gets Life for Kidnapping
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Jan. 23Ruchell Magee, codefendant of Angela Davis in the 1970 Marin County Courthouse shootout, in which four persons were killed, was sentenced here today to life imprisonment for kidnapping.

title: Petrodollar Pressure on Big Three German Banks
description: FRANKFURT, West GermanyThe strong flow of Middle Eastern Petrodollar investment into West Germany, which began this fall, has again focused attention on the issue of the immense power of Frankfurt's financial Big Threethe Deutsche Bank, Dresdner Bank and Commerzbank.

title: SCHMIDT SUPPORTS FORD ON ECONOMY
description: Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany said last night that he was in fill agreement with the antirecession purpose of President Ford's economic proposals, but he said a lack of antiinflation measures of the nineteensixties had aggravated the present international economic crisis.

title: Article 1  No Title
Man Enters Not Guilty Plea In Holding of Manila Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (AP) Napoleon Lechoco, accused of holding the Philippine Ambassador at gunpoint at the embassy last November, pleaded not guilty in United States District Court today.

title: FASHION TALK
description: It's nice to know that taste and elegance haven't vanished from the fashion world. They're both still flourishing at the House of Norell, which is, of course, no surprise. Including its earlier incarnation as TrainaNorell, the house has been around for some 35 years.

title: Beame Among 500 at Funeral for Councilman Monroe Cohen
description: Mayor Beame, members of the Board of Estimate and the City Council and state and city officials were among the more than 500 persons who attended yesterday a funeral service for Councilman Monroe Cohen, Democrat of Brooklyn, who died Wednesday evening, apparently of a heart attack, at the age of 48.

title: Rightists in Argentina Destroy Presses in Raid on Newspaper
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 23About 30 rightwing terrorists raided the printing pliant of the most important newspaper in Crdoba Argentina's second largest city, today and destroyed the presses.

title: FORD RAISES FEES ON IMPORTED OIL; FOES SEEK FREEZE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23President Ford signed today a proclamation increasing the import fee on petroleum amid accusations by Democratic members of Congress that his action constituted an abuse of Presidential power.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Jan. 24, 1975 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Churchill's Cat Dies, But Name Will Go On
description: LONDON, Jan. 23 (UPI)Jock, pet cat of the late Sir Winston Churchill, has died at the age of 13. The name will be carried on by a replacement.

title: Paper Close to l.R.A. Sees a New Truce. In Northern Ireland
description: BELFAST, Jan. 23  The I.R.A. Provisionals have decided to renew their ceasefire in Northern Ireland, a Republican newspaper circulating in parts of Belfast said tonight.

title: Pageantry at Pierre for the Diamond Ball
description: Maria  Jos Pagliai, the daughter of Bruno Pagliai, the Mexican magnate, said she might look like Salome, but she didn't feel like her. Actually, what she felt was naked.
