title: TANKER EXPLODES ON DELAWARE RIVER
description: MARCUS HOOK, Pa. Friday, ripped through a tanker early today as its cargo of crude oil was being unloaded at the British Petroleum plant dock on the Delaware River. The police said there were quite a few injuries.

title: Rangers Lose to Sabres
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 30Buffalo's sharpshooters performed a rattling sabre dance on the Rangers tonight, defeating New York to the tune of 63. For the Sabres, it was victory No. 100 at Memorial Auditorium in five seasons of play.

title: Business Briefs
description: E.E.C. Backs CostSharing Plan

title: EXPERTS QUESTION POLLUTANT LEVELS
description: A panel of scientists seriously questioned yesterday the adequacy of both the scientific and the economic bases for regulatory decisions on allowable levels of environmental pollutants.

title: Argentina Seeking New Auto Price Pact With Cuba
description: BUENOS AIRES A year ago, the Argentine Government sounded the death knell for the United Statesinspired economic blockade of Cuba by announcing a billiondollar trade deal with Havana that included the export of 42,000 motor vehicles, many of them manufactured by American automobile subsidiaries here.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: About 75 private radiodispatched taxi drivers staged an orderly drivepast outside the 46th Precinct police station in the Bronx to protest an eye injury suffered last Tuesday morning by a driver as he was being arrested and to complain of cops filling their quotas on us.

title: Drunken Driving Arrests On Turnpike Set a Record
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Jan. 30 (AP)A record total of 569 drunken driving arrests were made in 1974 by state police units on the New Jersey Turnpike.

title: Police Here Open a Campaign For Stricter Controls on Guns
description: In an attempt to convince the public of the need for stricter gun controls in the city, the Police Department announced yesterday that it would issue a daily list of illegal guns recovered by the police, along with a summary of gunconnected crimes and arraignments.

title: Knicks Winon Gianelli Shot at Buzzer
Man Guilty in Slaying Of Jehovah's Witness
description: MAYS LANDING, Jan. 30 A Vineland man was found guilty of the stabbing death of a Jehovah's Witness even though the victime died because he refused a blood transfusion.

title: Celebrities Throng CerfWagner Wedding
description: Former Mayor Robert F. Wagner and Phyllis Fraser Cerf, widow of the publisher, Bennett Cerf, were married yesterday afternoon at St. Thomas More Roman Catholic Church in a candlelight service attended by 200 people, including Governor Carey, Mayor Beame, celebrities and friends.

title: In Memoriam
description: PROTITCHDr. Dragoslav. A memorial service for the late United Nations UnderSecretary; Dr. Dragoslav Protitch, will be held et 12:00 noon on Friday, 31 January, in the Chapel of The Church Center of the United Nations at 777 United Nations Plaza.

title: Senators Propose Agency To Seek Full Employment
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30 (AP) A bipartisan group of 14 Senators has sponsored a bill to set up an independent Federal agency to push for a full employment policy.

title: Horses &
description: SADDLERY REPAIR

title: Article 4  No Title
Sales Chief Says Slump Is Temporary And Vows No Letup in Production
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Jan. 27The chief executive of Ghana's Cocoa Marketing Board has termed a world slump in the consumption of chocolate an unfortunate but temporary condition and he declared that Ghanaians woudl continue to produce as much cocoa as we can.

title: Fleet of 87 to Start Florida Race Today
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Jan. 30 (UPI)A fleet of 87 vessels is expected to answer the starter's gun tomorrow when the Southern Ocean Racing Conference kicks off its 1975 series with the 103mile St. Petersburgh to Andote Key race.

title: How Windfalls Eased Balancing Last Budget
description: ALBANY, Jan. 30  Even though state revenues, without any tax increase, are expected to grow by $501million in the coming fiscal year, Governor Carey maintains that the actual revenue increase would only be $95million.

title: Gulf Oil Profit Fell in Fourth Quarter
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation, the last major United Statesbased international oil company to report 1974 results, announced yesterday a drop of 19.6 per cent in net income in the fourth quarter but an advance of 33 per cent for the full year.

title: Article 2  No Title
RUTH WOULD HOLD RAW NIXON DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30The Watergate special prosecutor, Henry S. Ruth Jr., and his predecessor, Leon Jaworski, said today that they did not have substantial evidence that had not already been made public of criminal offenses by Richard M. Nixon.

title: People in Sports
description: Alonzo S. (Jake) Gaither,  the former head football coach and athletic director at Florida A. and M., Was named yesterday to the National Football Foundation Hall of Fame It was the third honor of the month for the 71yearold Gaither. Earlier he was voted the Amos Alonzo Stagg Award by the Football Coaches Association and honored by the Walter Camp Foundation at Yale.

title: New School Pact Reached
description: Agreement on a new twoyear contract between the New School for Social Research and 153 clerical, secretarial and Hbrary employes was announced, last night by John R Everett, president of the school, ending a weeklong strike.

title: 5POINT OIL PROGRAM OFFERED BY SENATOR
description: WASHINGTQN, Jan. 30 UPI Senator Frank Church, Democrat of Idaho, today called on Congress to enact an alternative to President Ford's oil program that would include rrovision for emergency rationing and a cutback on oil imports.

title: DRUG DEALS LAID TO VINCENT PAPA
description: A key witness in Federal District Court here yesterday identified Vincent Papa as a major heroin supplier.

title: Samuel Markewich Dies at 93; Lawyer Aided Labor Movement
description: Samuel Markewich, a practicing lawyer here for more than 70 years, died. yesterday on a visit to Los Angeles. He was 93 years old and lived at 23West 73d Street.

title: Judge Upholds Constitutionality Of Kanawha County Textbooks
description: CHARLESTON, .W. Va., Jan. 30 (UPI)Kanawha County's controversial textbooks do not violate the First Amendment guarantees of the United States Constitution, a Federal judge ruled today.

title: Dispute Over Trucks Slows Deliveries of The Times
description: The distribution of some copies of today's Issue of The New York Times was delayed last night by the refusal of drivers of large trailer trucks to back their vehicles into The Time's plant at 229 West 43d Street.
